Watching the students being carried out one after another, the 'Professor's' expression grew increasingly grim.

He said with displeasure, "The quality of this batch is terrible. Can't we recruit some more capable students?"

The assistant explained in a low voice, "Professor, the test subjects from the previous trials were too severely injured. No school is willing to work with us anymore."

The 'Professor' snorted, his face etched with displeasure. 

"They're just a bunch of poor students. Once we successfully refine Technique 113 and the Primordial Magnetism Needles, think of the size of the beginner market. What does it matter if a few batches of them die?"

Meanwhile, only three students were left in the testing room, still persevering with the technique.

Two of them were holding on because they had fewer errors, and thus very little of their mana had gone out of control.

But the third student, pale-faced, surprised even the 'Professor'.

"This kid has made quite a few mistakes. He must be in unbearable pain right now, yet he's still holding on?"

The assistant asked, "Professor, should we stop him?"

The 'Professor' shook his head, a flicker of interest in his eyes.

"Since he wants this money so badly, let's give him the chance."

"Besides, more data on the mistakes made during a complete circulation is clearly beneficial to our research."

...

Inside the testing room, whenever Zhang Yu felt like giving up, he would feel the chill of the ritual's power and see the countdown timer in his mind.

*"This stupid thing! All it knows how to do is pressure me. Why don't you try it if you're so great?"*

As he circulated the technique, Zhang Yu could feel that with every small mistake, mana would spill out of control from the pathway, leaving various parts of his body aching and itching, alternating between hot and cold.

He finally managed to complete the entire circulation path once. Glancing at his Feathered Tome, he saw 'Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method Level 0 (0/1)' change to 'Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method Level 1 (0/20),' and he breathed a small sigh of relief.

Zhang Yu admitted to himself that he had taken a gamble, but luckily, this time it had paid off.

At that moment, the memory of performing this technique hundreds, even thousands of times, flooded his mind, making him feel as if he had been practicing it for months.

In that instant, Zhang Yu felt that with just a thought, he could use the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to rein in all the runaway mana in his body and establish a complex circulatory system.

He did not do so immediately, however. Instead, he endured the aching and itching all over his body and slowly stood up.

The instructor quickly walked over, a look of surprise on his face.

"Young man, are you alright?"

It was the first time he had ever seen someone with such a high error rate manage to persist and complete the entire technique.

Zhang Yu clutched his stomach and said, "I feel like my insides are on fire. It's itchy and painful. My upper body feels like it's burning, and my lower body feels like it's frozen... It's unbearable."

The instructor quickly supported him.

"Let me take you to the medical office to get you checked out."

"No need!" Zhang Yu waved his hand dismissively. "What I mean is... I want more money."

The instructor looked him up and down, taking in Zhang Yu's incessant trembling and increasingly pale face. He said, "One thousand yuan. And you sign another contract stating that whatever happens to you from now on has nothing to do with us."

After some haggling, the Immortal Resonance company finally added another 3,000 yuan for Zhang Yu, on the condition that the company would not be held responsible for any injuries he sustained, no matter how severe.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 12: Valiant Progress

A moment later, Zhang Yu emerged from the Immortal Resonance Group's office building looking pale and hunched over, the very picture of weakness.

However, a few kilometers away from the skyscraper, his complexion gradually began to return to normal after he boarded the subway.

As he began to circulate the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, the mana within him surged forth like countless streams, instantly permeating every fiber of his being.

The once runaway mana was guided back onto its proper course by these surging currents, merging into the intricate circulatory network within his body and resuming its endless, natural flow.

Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method Level 1 (0/20)

A faint smile touched Zhang Yu’s lips as he looked at the technique that had appeared in the Feathered Tome.

_I really can master it._

_If I hadn't mastered this Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, it probably would have taken a week or two for the runaway mana to dissipate._

His confidence in the Feathered Tome was the entire reason he had dared to accept the technique-testing job.

He had been careful, however, not to reveal his ability to master the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method while at the Immortal Resonance Group.

_Although this is just a breathing technique for beginners, once mastered, it can operate on its own twenty-four hours a day, without rest._

_Even without actively circulating it, it has thirty percent of the efficiency of active circulation. After mastering it… doing nothing all day is equivalent to someone else performing breathing exercises for more than seven hours._

_And that's just its effect at Level 1._

_If this technique is successfully developed, it would instantly become one of the best-selling breathing techniques on the market._

Zhang Yu knew that, apart from the various cultivation techniques taught in schools, the techniques from large corporations and major sects were all copyrighted, requiring payment for purchase and representing immense profits.

It was precisely because the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method was so potent—and because he saw it as a development project of extreme importance to the Immortal Resonance Group—that he was unwilling to expose the fact he had mastered it, lest he invite unnecessary trouble.

The technique was also incredibly difficult to cultivate. In Zhang Yu's view, without the guidance of the auxiliary equipment, a first-year high school student could not even dream of mastering it, let alone completing a single full circulation.

This made him even more reluctant to reveal that he had mastered the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

In order to master the technique, Zhang Yu had switched the Feathered Tome's specialization from the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms to this new breathing technique.

Although this meant the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms could no longer be rapidly improved for the time being, the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method was now on the fast track.

_A Level 3 Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms is sufficient for now._

_From now on, I will focus on improving this Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method._

Aside from gaining the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, the biggest reward from this endeavor was the payment from the Immortal Resonance Group.

Ten thousand yuan, plus the additional three thousand, came to a total payment of 13,000.

In that moment, Zhang Yu's savings soared to thirteen thousand seven hundred yuan.

Unfortunately, after he used ten thousand yuan to repay loans on multiple platforms, his savings instantly dropped to three thousand seven hundred.

Fortunately, after paying back the ten thousand, the frequency of collection attempts dropped considerably, and it was unlikely they would escalate their methods anytime soon.

The countdown timer that then sounded in his mind quickly cut short Zhang Yu's reverie, forcing him to refocus his attention and circulate the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

---

A night passed in the blink of an eye.

At the entrance to Songyang High School, Zhang Yu checked the changes on the Feathered Tome as he walked.

Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method Level 1 (0/20) → Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method Level 1 (11/20)

His mana, thanks to his previous hard work and his recent diligence with the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, had also increased.

Mana 7.7 → 7.8

_It really is running passively. Last night, I only completed five celestial cycles before sleeping, counting as five repetitions._

_But when I woke up this morning, it had increased to eight repetitions, and after actively circulating it on my way to school, it rose to the eleventh._

As he did the math, Zhang Yu was secretly overjoyed. Compared to the thirteen thousand yuan, the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method was yesterday's greatest gain.

He now resolved to raise the level of this Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method first.

Naturally, he also decided to keep the Feathered Tome's specialization set on the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

Unfortunately, this morning brought another double period of physical education.

Walking toward the training grounds, Zhang Yu felt a slight sense of regret.

_Sigh, time to practice the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms again._

_My specialization is now the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method; I should be cultivating this breathing technique._

The moment Zhang Yu entered the training ground, he saw several young giants with muscles bulging like marble, injecting themselves one needle at a time.

This was followed by a series of explosive cracks, all kinds of beast-like roars, and the clang of equipment as the students of the model class began to train with fiery enthusiasm.

Just then, a student looked at Wang Hai in shock, "N-no... impossible. My cousin sold this to me..."

Wang Hai shook his head, crushing the syringe in his hand to powder with a _crack_ before tossing it into the trash can.

"Have you seen any change in your body weight these past two weeks? There are no signs of growth in your muscles or organs. Your physical strength has only increased by 0.03 in two weeks—the pathetic results of natural body tempering. It's obvious you bought counterfeit drugs."

Saying this, he turned from the crestfallen student and raised his voice.

"How many times have I told you all? You must buy your drugs through proper channels. The supply from your school teachers is undoubtedly the safest."

"If you buy counterfeit or expired drugs just to save a little money, you'll lose more than you gain. You're only wasting your own time."

After lecturing the students, Wang Hai's gaze swept over to Zhang Yu, who was practicing body tempering in a corner.

As he looked at Zhang Yu, he recalled the results from Zhang Yu's latest test.

"Level 0.85? An increase of 0.02 in three days?"

_Zhang Yu wasn't even this fast back when he was injecting himself daily, was he?_

Based on Wang Hai's years of coaching experience, with such a rapid increase in physical strength, it was impossible that Zhang Yu was progressing naturally without pills or injections as he claimed; he must have been secretly taking something before class.

_Not only is this not natural body tempering, but the drugs he's using must be extremely potent to get these results. The damage to his body must be immense._

The possibility that Zhang Yu had reached the third level of the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms and had undertaken hellish training at his limits all on his own never even crossed Wang Hai's mind.

Regardless, in Wang Hai's eyes, the current Zhang Yu was increasingly challenging his authority in the classroom.

In particular, this raised a question: where was Zhang Yu getting his drugs?

Would other students see his results and seek out the same source?

If that happened, wouldn't it affect his sales figures?

The thought of the cutthroat market for body tempering drugs instantly set Wang Hai's nerves on edge.

_A second-year teacher? A third-year?_

_Or did an off-campus tutor guide him?_

_Are they trying to sell their goods on my turf?_

As for Zhang Yu himself, Wang Hai saw him as just a pawn. What he most wanted to figure out now was who was behind him.

However, the influence in the class still had to be erased.

So, a moment later, Wang Hai gave a few instructions to a student named Zhao Tianxing.

Zhao Tianxing then walked over to Zhang Yu and said, "Zhang Yu, Teacher Wang asked me to check with you, are you sure you're not buying any more drugs?"

After seeing Zhang Yu nod, Zhao Tianxing scratched his head and said sheepishly, "Well... Teacher told me to say that, in order not to disturb the others' training, he'd like you to practice alone in the small room off to the side. Is that okay?"

After being instructed by Wang Hai, Zhao Tianxing understood that Wang Hai wanted to further isolate Zhang Yu.

He looked at Zhang Yu with a trace of pity in his eyes, but his actions showed no hesitation.

As one of Wang Hai's so-called good, obedient students, it was precisely because Zhao Tianxing had completely accepted Wang Hai's guidance, purchased all the recommended drugs, and added his own hard work that he had managed to break through to a physical strength of Level 1.00, becoming one of the top ten students in the class for physical strength.

Therefore, he had always been obedient to the physical education teacher, Wang Hai.

Worried that Zhang Yu might react poorly, however, he spoke very politely, adding after a moment, "Why don't you just buy some? Teacher Wang's supplies are very high quality. Natural body tempering really isn't enough..."

But to Zhao Tianxing's surprise, Zhang Yu agreed to go train elsewhere without the slightest hesitation.

Watching his retreating figure, Zhao Tianxing scratched his head.

_Sigh, Zhang Yu is so stubborn. Couldn't he just apologize to the teacher, admit his mistake, and get on with class? To ruin his future over a moment of impulse._

Meanwhile, Zhang Yu entered the small room, let out a soft laugh, and sat down, immediately beginning to practice the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

Wisps of spiritual energy flowed into the sea of qi in his dantian, where Zhang Yu refined them drop by drop into mana.

Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method Level 1 (11/20) → Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method Level 1 (16/20)

In the blink of an eye, five celestial cycles were completed, and the two physical education periods were over.

But during the following Chinese and math classes, Zhang Yu remained in the classroom, engrossed in circulating the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

The long process of absorbing spiritual energy and refining mana was naturally a tedious affair.

His waist, abdomen, and shoulders would ache, his skin would itch, and his mind would grow weary from the monotony.

Even the old Zhang Yu would have been unable to resist taking a break after one or two hours of breathing exercises, standing up to walk around, or perhaps scratching an itch or his head.

But now, compelled by the ritual's power and encouraged by the changing numbers on the Feathered Tome, Zhang Yu forced himself to endure, finally completing the twentieth repetition of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method in a single stretch.

Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method Level 2 (0/40)

The experience of circulating the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method countless times bloomed in Zhang Yu's mind, and he could feel the mana circulation within him become more complex, intricate, and powerful.

When Zhang Yu stopped, the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method continued to operate, but its speed was now slightly faster than before.

_At Level 1, the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method's passive breathing has only thirty percent of the speed of active breathing._

_But after reaching Level 2, the passive breathing speed has increased to thirty-five percent of the active speed._

_As for actively circulating the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, the breathing efficiency has also improved significantly, far surpassing my original Level 1 Basic Breathing Technique._

Zhang Yu nodded slightly, feeling a sense of satisfaction. This was, after all, a constant, day-and-night improvement.

So after lunch, he redoubled his efforts and continued to improve the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

In the time that followed, he poured nearly every available moment into the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

The study of the Immortal Dao in high school was both boring and difficult, and Zhang Yu, compelled by the ritual's power, had no time for rest. Only by watching the numbers for the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method tick upward and imagining the long-term benefits of its passive effect could he find some small measure of mental comfort.

As the saying goes, if you can't fight it, you might as well enjoy it.

So, he cultivated the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method during physical education class.

He cultivated the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method during Chinese class.

He was still cultivating the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method during his lunch break.

While waiting for work in the square at night, he continued to cultivate the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, though unfortunately, he found no work for three days.

Needless to say, when he went home to sleep, the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method was still operating on its own.

In just three short days, the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method was raised to Level 4 (5/80).

His mana also advanced valiantly with his hard work, increasing from 7.8 to 8.3.

At this point, the passive breathing speed of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method had already reached forty-five percent of the active breathing speed.

# Chapter 13: The Mana Competition

During mana class that day, the students of the model class sat cross-legged in the quiet room, practicing their breathing exercises.

A camera at the front of the room monitored the students' every move, taking note of whether they opened their eyes, scratched an itch, fidgeted with their hands and feet, or shuffled their bottoms... every single slight anomaly was recorded.

And all this data was uniformly recorded as a distraction rate.

Each week, the class with the highest distraction rate was publicly criticised in a school-wide announcement.

The students of the model class were unconcerned by this. After all, no matter the metric, their class was always guaranteed to be first.

Meanwhile, the student with the lowest distraction rate each week would not only be commended in a school-wide announcement but would also be rewarded with 500 yuan and one hour of free rental time with a Heavenly Spiritual Root.

This, however, was enough to make every student in the model class sit up and take notice.

When Zhang Yu first learned of this 'distraction rate' concept, he mused that if such a thing had existed in his previous life, students would have definitely cursed the school out for being complete idiots.

But this world was different. The students of the model class stared at the daily distraction rate like bulls in heat, and the entire classroom was filled with a fiercely competitive air.

At that moment, a bell chimed, and everyone who had been silently cultivating in the quiet room stopped, turning their eyes to the large screen at the front, awaiting the distraction rate data from the class session.

1st Place: Zhang Yu, Distraction Rate 0%, Mana 8.3

2nd Place: Bai Zhenzhen, Distraction Rate 0.03%, Mana 11.2

3rd Place: Qian Shen, Distraction Rate 0.12%, Mana 11.1

...

Looking at the distraction rate rankings, although the students in the classroom made no sound, one could sense a ripple of surprise spreading from the subtle shifts in their eyes and expressions.

The mana instructor on the dais, a female teacher with the surname Yan, wore her hair in a bun and had on black-framed glasses.

This Teacher Yan looked at the results on the screen and said, "For those few students whose distraction rates exceeded 0.3%, I won't name you individually today."

"The semester started three months ago. How many times have I told you to focus your mind and calm your qi?"

"With a distraction rate that high, how could the efficiency of your breathing exercises possibly compare to others?"

"Everyone cultivates twenty-four hours a day; you don't get more time than anyone else. Once the efficiency of your breathing exercises drops, you fall behind a little each day. After three years of high school, the gap in your mana could be ten, twenty, or even thirty points."

"And how many times have I said it? Students who can't lower their distraction rate can come to my office and buy a Calming Agent. I sat in my office for three hours yesterday afternoon, and not a single person came to see me... Do you all think you're completely fine?!"

After her round of criticism, Teacher Yan smiled faintly and looked at the top names on the screen.

"Of course, there were also students who performed very well."

"I want to commend by name the three students with the lowest distraction rates, especially Zhang Yu. He's had a 0% distraction rate for four days straight now, which, compared to before, is a true quantum leap."

"His mana has also increased by a full 0.5 points in the last three days, which proves he must have been putting in tremendous effort outside of class—he either rented a spiritual root or a cultivation room with high spiritual energy. Isn't that right, Zhang Yu?"

All eyes in the class immediately turned toward him.

But they saw that Zhang Yu's eyes were still tightly shut. Looking to be in a state between sleep and wakefulness, he was still silently practicing the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

Teacher Yan said admiringly, "You see? This is the attitude of a true top student. He doesn't stop even when class is over, seizing every single minute and second to cultivate and become stronger."

Zhao Tianxing watched Zhang Yu, who was still diligently performing his breathing exercises, and found himself understanding this classmate less and less.

_He's clearly so diligent, so why did he slack off in gym class and refuse to take his stamina potion?_

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu, whose eyes were still closed, and thought to herself, _These days, Yu-boy is doing his breathing exercises at every moment except when he's eating, shitting, or walking. To be this diligent... could he have been pushed this far by the 700,000-yuan debt collection calls?_

On the dais, Teacher Yan continued, "Of course, you get what you pay for. There's no free lunch on the path of the Immortal Dao. You won't get far if you don't invest money. The school's Heavenly Spiritual Root rentals have some vacancies recently; any interested students can come see me."

But before Teacher Yan left, something she said caught Zhang Yu’s attention.

"That's right, the city's Mana Competition is starting next month. The first-year division will have participants from basically every high school in the city. The prize for first place is 100,000..."

"Registration for the competition is next Friday, so the school plans to select the top ten first-year students by mana level on that day to participate..."

...

That evening, in the cafeteria.

Zhou Tianyi had to rush off to the tutoring center early, leaving just Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen at the table.

Finding the way Bai Zhenzhen was looking him up and down unbearable, Zhang Yu finally spoke.

"Zhen, I know I'm handsome—a crane among chickens here at a school like Songyang High where everyone just studies—but you don't have to stare so hard."

"You're saying you want to enter the Mana Competition?" Bai Zhenzhen asked.

"It's a shame, Zhen," Zhang Yu said, shaking his head. "If you, the peerless genius ranked first in our grade, weren't my friend, this would be the part where you provoke me, only to be repeatedly humiliated by my stunning performance in the arena, leaving you with your pupils quaking in utter shock."

Bai Zhenzhen shook her head. "Yu-boy, this is the city-wide Mana Competition you're talking about."

"Every high school in all of Songyang City will be sending their best, their most powerful in mana, and their wealthiest students to compete. It's a gathering of the filthy rich."

Bai Zhenzhen said with a sigh, "What kind of outcome do you think an ordinary person like you could expect?"

Her eyes seemed to pierce the veil of the future, and she spoke with a sorrowful expression, "You'll be repeatedly humiliated by countless powerful opponents, become a stepping stone for the rich, the laughingstock of Songyang High School, and drag our school's reputation through the mud!"

"It's too tragic! I can already see you being ruthlessly crushed under the feet of the prodigies from other schools, your Dao heart shattered, looking just like a dead dog."

Zhang Yu rolled his eyes. "Don't be so dramatic. The Mana Competition isn't a combat tournament; there's no shame in losing."

"Besides, the prize for first place is a hundred thousand yuan."

"Even making it into the top ten gets you ten thousand."

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu's greedy expression and thought, _Yu-boy really has been pushed to the edge by the debt collectors. He's become so obsessed that he's deluding himself into entering the competition._

Zhang Yu was indeed in dire financial straits. Although he had just earned thirteen thousand yuan from the Immortal Resonance Group a few days ago, he had immediately used ten thousand to repay a loan and another fifteen hundred to cover his rent, leaving him with just over two thousand.

"If you want to compete, you should first figure out how to raise your mana level into the top ten of our grade. You're ranked sixteenth right now, aren't you? How much money will you have to borrow to break into the top ten?"

Zhang Yu quickly did the math in his head.

His current mana level was 8.3, ranking him sixteenth in his grade.

The student currently ranked tenth in the grade had a mana level of 9.5.

To surpass that person, Zhang Yu would have to raise his mana level to 9.5 by next Friday...

_No, I have to account for the fact that everyone else will be improving too._

_To be safe, it would be best to raise my mana to 10.0 by next Friday._

_There are eight days until next Friday. Can I really increase my mana from 8.3 to 10.0 in that time, a full 1.7 points?_

_That's an increase of more than 0.2 per day... is that even possible?_

_Absolutely! Easily!_

In the eyes of his teachers and classmates, Zhang Yu's recent rapid improvement must have been achieved by spending a fortune to rent a high-quality spiritual root and cultivation space.

But Zhang Yu knew that it all stemmed from his own astonishing potential and extreme self-discipline.

A level 4 Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method had allowed him to increase his mana by a full 0.5 in just three days. He believed that as he continued to level up the technique, his mana growth would only become more rapid.

_After all, during the Qi Refinement stage, the highest a skill can be leveled is 10._

_For the vast majority of first-year students, reaching level 4 in a breathing exercise within the first semester is impossible._

_And if I continue to cultivate, I'll probably be able to raise the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to level 8, 9, or even 10 in a short time—a level that many people might not reach even after three years of high school._

Just as Zhang Yu was steeling his resolve with these thoughts, he suddenly noticed Bai Zhenzhen's chopsticks reaching for his bowl.

"The nerve!" Zhang Yu barked, raising his own chopsticks to block.

Amid a clattering of impacts, Bai Zhenzhen easily disarmed him of his chopsticks.

Feeling a sense of familiarity in her movements, Zhang Yu asked in surprise, "Basic High School Swordplay? You've already learned it? And you've even adapted it for use with chopsticks?"

After swiftly plucking a few pieces of meat from his bowl, Bai Zhenzhen chuckled.

"Is this supposed to be difficult, Yu-boy? Anyone with hands can do it."

_Damn it,_ Zhang Yu thought. _She got me with another one of her flexes._

Bai Zhenzhen mixed the stolen meat with her rice and quickly shoveled down a few mouthfuls.

"I didn't expect the pork ribs in the 5-yuan combo to be this tasty," she said, surprised. "I'll get one next time, too."

Patting her slightly full stomach, Bai Zhenzhen burped and said, "Sigh, if I eat any more, it'll affect my tutoring session."

With that, she pushed her tray toward Zhang Yu.

"Here, extra food for you, Yu-boy."

Looking at the perfectly neat, untouched half-portion of 'leftovers' Bai Zhenzhen had left, Zhang Yu knew she had done it on purpose for him.

It seemed that ever since learning of his financial difficulties, Bai Zhenzhen had often taken to feeding him during dinner.

Zhang Yu pulled the tray over and, as he started to eat, said, "Zhen, you don't have to worry about my pride or saving face or any of that. Given our relationship, it'd be fine even if you just gave me the money directly."

Bai Zhenzhen rolled her eyes. "I'm heading to my tutoring session. Take your time."

...

Outside the cafeteria.

A tall figure stood in a nearby corridor, eyes locked on the cafeteria entrance.

A moment later, when Zhang Yu emerged from the cafeteria, the tall figure tensed and immediately began to follow.

He followed Zhang Yu out the school gates, and when he saw him enter a stationery shop across the street, a thought struck Zhao Tianxing.

_Could this be where Zhang Yu gets his supplies?_

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 14: Preparations and a New Job

The stationery shop at the school entrance always sold all sorts of things students needed.

The one at the entrance of Songyang High School was no different.

Beyond the usual stationery, the massive display cabinet behind the owner looked just like a pharmacy, filled with all the drugs a high school student could need, from sedatives and stimulants to focus potions.

Zhang Yu leaned on the counter with both hands and asked, "Boss, do you carry neural fillers?"

The owner, who was scrolling through his phone, replied without looking up, "You want the expensive kind or the cheap kind?"

Zhang Yu said, "I'm a student. Can you give me a discount on the expensive one?"

The owner finally looked up, giving Zhang Yu a sideways glance.

Zhang Yu said nonchalantly, "I'm tenth in my year in Class One, a big name on campus. If your stuff works well for me, my classmates will definitely follow my lead and buy from you."

The corner of the owner's mouth twitched. He pulled a box from the cabinet and placed it in front of Zhang Yu.

"Purple Cloud Company's neural filler. Guarantees you'll only need twenty minutes of sleep a day. Five hundred a box. I'll give it to you for 480 this time."

Zhang Yu picked up the box and examined it.

"Not going to throw anything in for free?"

The owner frowned, then pulled out a few painkillers.

"Here, these are for you."

Zhang Yu gave a sly grin, stuffed the painkillers into his pocket, and said, "Thanks, boss. In that case, maybe I don't need the neural filler after all."

Seeing the owner's face darken, Zhang Yu scanned the payment code at the side of the counter.

"Just kidding. Sending the payment now."

As he picked up the neural filler from the counter, Zhang Yu felt the sharp sting of the expense.

A single box would only last about a week, yet it had cost him a full 480. His account balance instantly dropped to just over seventeen hundred.

But Zhang Yu was certain it was all worth it.

After all, he had already decided to enter the Mana Competition, so he was prepared to give it his all. He wouldn't sleep for the next week, dedicating every moment to cultivating the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

*Heh, my goal isn't just top ten in our year.*

Meanwhile, Zhao Tianxing had followed him into the stationery shop. Watching Zhang Yu leave with his purchase, he wondered, *Is it really neural filler?*

He followed Zhang Yu out of the shop and down the street, until he rounded a corner and was startled to find Zhang Yu already standing there, waiting for him.

"You... uh, hello, Zhang Yu," Zhao Tianxing said awkwardly. "What a coincidence. You take this way too?"

Zhang Yu stared at him and asked, "Why are you following me?"

Zhao Tianxing scratched his head, playing dumb. "Following you? Nah, I always go this way after school."

Zhang Yu said impatiently, "Do me a favor and take a look at yourself."

"You're over two meters tall and weigh more than three hundred pounds. I spotted you the moment I left the cafeteria."

"So what is it you really want?"

Of course, Zhao Tianxing couldn't tell him that his PE teacher, Wang Hai, had asked him to get close to Zhang Yu and find out about his supply channels.

So, Zhao Tianxing scratched his head again and said sheepishly, "Zhang Yu, I just think you're really exceptional. I want to stick with you and learn a thing or two."

Looking at the shy expression on the eighteen-year-old, three-hundred-plus-pound boy before him, Zhang Yu thought, *Seriously... are your social skills stuck at the elementary school level?*

Zhang Yu thought for a moment, then said, "Fine. Just buy me some fried chicken, and you can follow me around all you want."

Feeling a dreadful chill creeping through his body and a relentless countdown ticking in his mind, Zhang Yu knew he couldn't linger.

He started walking again with a sense of resignation, waving a hand over his shoulder.

"Let's talk while we walk."

Zhao Tianxing trailed behind Zhang Yu, hesitating. "You're going to eat fried chicken? That's strictly forbidden for body tempering. Mr. Wang told us not to eat it. Could we get chicken breast instead?"

"Don't worry, I'm not asking you to eat it. You just have to buy it for me."

At the thought of fried chicken, Zhang Yu couldn't help but wipe the drool from the corner of his mouth.

Ever since arriving in this world, his three meals a day had been the 'pauper's health meal' from the high school cafeteria. It had been a long time since he'd eaten anything like fried chicken.

The daily grind of his harsh training had caused stress to build up inside him, leaving him no time to relax and no courage to spend an extra cent.

Now, the thought of eating fried chicken soon made his heart feel much lighter, as if some of that pressure had already melted away.

Zhao Tianxing followed him onto the subway and off again, watching as he stopped in front of a fried chicken shop.

"We came all this way," he asked curiously, "this place must be really good, right?"

Zhang Yu replied, "Because it was on the way."

Unfortunately, the moment Zhang Yu stepped into the fried chicken shop, he heard that damn countdown start up again in his head.

He had no choice but to turn to Zhao Tianxing.

"Buy me a fried chicken combo meal. I'll wait for you here."

Watching Zhang Yu sit down right where he was and begin to meditate, Zhao Tianxing scratched his head, completely baffled.

A moment later, as he watched Zhang Yu happily chewing on a drumstick as they walked, Zhao Tianxing felt things were getting even weirder.

*He's so self-disciplined he uses the time waiting in line for breathing exercises, yet he insists on eating fried chicken... What a strange guy.*

What surprised Zhao Tianxing even more was that after following Zhang Yu, he didn't go to a tutoring center or to buy more medicine, but instead went to a public square to wait for temporary work.

Zhao Tianxing asked, "You're looking for work?"

Zhang Yu rubbed his stomach, found a clean spot on the ground, and sat down comfortably. He waved a dismissive hand. 

"One fried chicken meal doesn't buy you conversation. I'm going to cultivate while I wait for a job. Do whatever you want."

Watching Zhang Yu simply begin his breathing exercises right there on the ground, Zhao Tianxing was stunned once more.

"Breathing exercises?"

He glanced at a puddle of filthy water nearby, listened to the loud music blaring from the barbershop across the street, and then looked at the rough-looking crowd of job seekers around them.

He couldn't help but ask again, "You're doing them *here*?"

But Zhang Yu had already begun to wholeheartedly cultivate the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, and this time, he completely ignored him.

Zhao Tianxing squatted down beside Zhang Yu and watched him carefully for a while. Realizing he was genuinely performing his breathing exercises, even more questions bubbled up in his mind.

*What's the benefit of doing them here?*

*Is he just trying to squeeze in some practice while waiting for a job?*

After waiting a while, it became clear Zhang Yu had no intention of getting up. Just as Zhao Tianxing was wondering if he should leave, his phone vibrated.

Seeing the message from Wang Hai asking for an update, Zhao Tianxing replied that he was getting close to his target. 

After a long hesitation, he finally sat down beside Zhang Yu and began his own breathing exercises.

Half an hour later, Zhao Tianxing couldn't resist opening his eyes; Zhang Yu was still performing his breathing exercises.

An hour later, Zhao Tianxing had to stand up, walk a circle, and stretch his back. When he looked over, Zhang Yu was still at it.

More than two hours later, Zhao Tianxing had long since given up on the breathing exercises and had begun to practice the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms, move by move.

And in all the time he was observing, Zhang Yu remained utterly motionless from start to finish. He didn't make a single small movement—no scratching his head, no shifting his weight—he didn't even so much as twitch an eyelid, and the rhythm of his breathing never changed in the slightest.

Zhao Tianxing couldn't help but marvel internally.

*Such incredible focus. No wonder he's the guy who can go for days with a zero percent distraction rate.*

*But without a spiritual root to draw upon, no high-density spiritual energy in the environment, and no drugs in his system... the efficiency of these breathing exercises has to be abysmal. Is there really any point?*

Meanwhile, under Zhang Yu's focused practice, his progress in the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method advanced once again, reaching Level 4 (12/80).

Just then, another van pulled into the square. Hearing the driver call out for security personnel, Zhang Yu simply retracted his focus for a moment before returning to his cultivation.

A first-year high school student like him had no chance of competing for a security job against the old-timers surrounding him.

But then he heard the man's requirements: young, in good shape, with a clean and fresh appearance, and couldn't be unattractive.

Zhang Yu's eyes snapped open. He strode toward the van with a powerful gait and raised his hand confidently.

"How about me?"

The driver's eyes immediately lit up, and he walked in Zhang Yu's direction.

"Excellent, excellent. You're just what I'm looking for."

Zhang Yu grinned, about to shake the man's hand, only to realize the driver had walked right past him. The man grabbed Zhao Tianxing's hand, praising him.

"Great build, and a handsome face, too."

"Look at this chest!"

"This waist!"

"This back!"

The driver clapped Zhao Tianxing on the body as he spoke in admiration.

"Absolutely perfect proportions! His absolute power might not be there yet, but the fundamental framework is flawless. He's like a piece of uncut jade, full of limitless potential."

"To reach this state without persistent, harsh training, an extremely disciplined lifestyle, the guidance of a master teacher, and pushing his body to the limit with drugs and acupuncture... it would be absolutely impossible."

"You're the one, kid. I'll pay you 800 an hour. Come with me."

At that moment, Zhang Yu, standing off to the side, was stunned.

He never imagined that his own lean, defined physique, his coolly handsome face, and his otherworldly air would lose out to a mountain of muscle like Zhao Tianxing.

"Boss, take a look at me! I can do it, too."

The driver glanced at Zhang Yu and shook his head.

"No skinny guys."

"You don't inspire confidence for a security job. You'd stop half as many flying swords as the next guy."

Zhao Tianxing started to refuse. "Actually, I'm not here to..."

Zhang Yu quickly cut him off. "Boss, we're brothers. We swore an oath that whether it's a one-man job or a group job, we do everything together."

The driver frowned, glancing from Zhang Yu to Zhao Tianxing, and finally back to Zhang Yu.

"Four hundred an hour for you. Four hours total. You in or out?"


Zhang Yu nodded eagerly. "I'm in! I'm in! I'm in!"

Zhang Yu pulled Zhao Tianxing toward the van.

"I'm not here for a job, and my mom will worry if I get back too late. I should go tell the boss..." Zhao Tianxing said to Zhang Yu, his face a mask of embarrassment.

Zhang Yu quickly said, "Didn't you have something you wanted to ask me? We can talk while we work. Ask me anything you want."

Thinking about the task Wang Hai had given him, Zhao Tianxing could only agree reluctantly.

"I need to call my mom first."

The van carried the two of them toward the city center, and on the way, the driver explained the job.

"Ms. Li Xuelian is holding an art exhibition in the Cloudfall Hall on the 999th floor. The main security is already in place."

"However, Ms. Li isn't satisfied with the appearance of her regular security detail. She's worried they'll ruin from the viewing experience, so she asked us to find some handsome young men."

"When you get there, you'll change into security uniforms and follow the security captain's orders."

"And remember this above all else: you absolutely, positively cannot offend Ms. Li."

Zhang Yu asked curiously, "This Ms. Li must be very wealthy, right?"

"Heh, wealthy?" The driver snorted, saying proudly, "She's more than just wealthy. Ms. Li is the daughter of a Golden Core Perfected Master!"

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 15: The Central Tower

Upon hearing the words "Golden Core True Monarch," Zhao Tianxing gave a slight start in the car, then said in disbelief,

"How could the daughter of a Golden Core True Monarch possibly come to Songyang?"

Zhang Yu nodded slightly at his side. He knew that Foundation Establishment came after Qi Refinement, and Golden Core came after Foundation Establishment.

To reach the Golden Core realm, one would have to graduate from a top-tier high school, successfully enroll in one of the Ten Greats, and rise through the ranks of a major sect; who knew how many levels of Kunxu one would have to climb.

The daughter of such a figure would be born on the second level of Kunxu at the very least, so how could she possibly come to a first-level place like Songyang City?

The driver smiled upon hearing this, and as if wanting to show off, he said slowly, "And you think Ms. Li Xuelian is the only one coming to our Songyang City?"

"They say her father, True Monarch Xinghuo, is originally from our Songyang City. He’s retiring now and plans to return to Songyang City to live out his golden years…"

Zhang Yu found this odd. A Golden Core expert retiring to the starter village?

The driver continued, "This art exhibition features more than just Ms. Li’s paintings. I heard there’s also a piece called the ‘Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll,’ personally painted by True Monarch Xinghuo, which is said to hide a peerless martial art."

"Of the people coming to this exhibition, aside from those hoping to connect with Ms. Li, many others want a chance to comprehend the Martial Ascension Scroll and master the peerless martial art hidden within."

...

Songyang Central Tower.

The 999th floor.

Zhang Yu stood before the floor-to-ceiling windows, looking down in awe at the roiling sea of clouds beneath his feet. It was the first time he had ever stood at such a height, gazing down upon the entire city.

He adjusted the new security uniform he was wearing, a wave of emotion washing over him.

Ever since entering the Central Tower, Zhang Yu felt as though he had stepped into another, dreamlike world.

If the suburban district where he lived was somewhat reminiscent of his past life, then the infrastructure of Songyang High School had already surpassed that world in nearly every aspect, and as for the Central Tower before him…

Whether it was the terrifying height of its 999 floors or the various Immortal Dao technologies suffused with flowing mana within, the entire place was like something from a fantasy.

Recalling how he had been pulled up to the 999th floor in seconds by a formation array, empowered by Daoist arts, yet emerging completely unscathed, Zhang Yu couldn't help but be moved once more.

"All part of Songyang City, yet mortals live in the suburbs, cultivators gather in the city center, and this Central Tower… this is the domain of the truly wealthy."

"Three places, all within the same city, yet they feel like three separate, stratified worlds…"

Just then, Zhao Tianxing’s voice sounded from behind him. 

"Zhang Yu, the captain told us to start our patrol. Shouldn't we get going?"

Zhang Yu turned to see Zhao Tianxing standing behind him, also dressed in a security uniform.

But unlike Zhang Yu’s composure, Zhao Tianxing was incredibly awkward and timid… looking utterly pathetic, as if he were in agony.

He felt like a clown in this uniform, and imagined the gazes of everyone around him were filled with disdain, contempt, and scorn.

In truth, Zhao Tianxing was overthinking things. Once he put on the uniform, he was no longer just a commoner, but had become part of the tower's background, his presence in most people's eyes barely more noticeable than the greenery.

Zhang Yu clapped him on the shoulder.

"Chest out, head up. We’re security for the Central Tower now, not delivery boys. What’s there to be afraid of?"

Sensing that the passersby had been drawn by Zhang Yu’s voice, Zhao Tianxing said hurriedly, "I get it, Zhang Yu, just keep your voice down. Don’t bother the other guests."

The art exhibition was quite large, occupying a space of over a thousand square meters and providing drinks and a buffet. To Zhang Yu, it seemed less like an art show and more like a social gala.

The legendary Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll was currently covered by a large cloth, which, according to rumor, would be personally unveiled by Ms. Li Xuelian.

Zhang Yu and Zhao Tianxing were assigned to patrol a section near the edge of the venue.

With the exhibition yet to officially begin, the patrol was incredibly relaxed, and it didn't trigger his ritual’s backlash either.

After all, the ritual’s power was directed toward the fulfillment of a wish.

His method for fulfilling that wish was to study, cultivate, and work hard to get into a university and earn money… all to ultimately grant the evil god’s desire.

A temporary job like this was part of earning money and even of his studies and cultivation, so the ritual’s power wouldn't compel him to do something else.

In fact, this state of aimless wandering was a far, far more relaxing experience for Zhang Yu than the last few days of arduous training had been.

Just then, as the two neared the dining tables, they saw a group of servers arranging plates and setting out table decorations.

Zhang Yu glanced over at the dishes being laid out plate by plate and asked in surprise, "Is that… seafood?"

Zhao Tianxing looked over as well, his eyes falling on the abalone and lobster.

"They’re sea creatures. I saw the one with the shell when I was out with my mom. I think a single pound costs thirty or forty thousand."

"But this is the Central Tower, so having things like this is probably normal."

Zhang Yu had seen and eaten plenty of seafood in his past life.

But here in Kunxu, at least on the first level, sea creatures were an extreme rarity. The original Zhang Yu had only ever seen them online and had certainly never eaten, or even laid eyes on, them in real life.

This was simply because within the twenty-million-plus square kilometers of Kunxu's first level… there were no oceans.

It was said that the sea creatures available on the market were either imported from the upper levels of Kunxu or farmed by organizations in their own artificial marine environments.

Hearing the price of tens of thousands for a single pound from Zhao Tianxing, Zhang Yu was inwardly stunned.

"So expensive?"

"What's the benefit of eating this stuff? Does it increase your mana?"

It was no wonder Zhang Yu thought this way. In the Immortal Dao world he knew, both as his former and current self, everyone was striving to advance by any means necessary, pushing themselves to their limits to improve their mana, martial prowess, Daoist arts, physical bodies, and Dao hearts.

Clothing, food, housing, transportation… every aspect of life was inextricably linked to raising one's cultivation.

"Benefits?" Zhao Tianxing thought for a moment before shaking his head. "I’ve never heard of any benefits. I think it’s just for the taste."

"Just for the taste?" Zhang Yu stared, slightly stunned, at the platters of fine food on the table.

Just as Zhang Yu and Zhao Tianxing were furtively inspecting the dining tables, a cold voice suddenly spoke from behind them.

"You two are security. What are you doing skulking around here instead of patrolling?"

The voice startled Zhao Tianxing, who spun around and hastily explained, "We weren’t doing anything…"

But when he saw who it was, Zhao Tianxing froze on the spot.

Zhang Yu, however, turned around casually, looked at Bai Zhenzhen, and said, "Well, if it isn’t Zhen. Fancy seeing you at an art exhibition."

Meanwhile, upon realizing the newcomer was a classmate, Zhao Tianxing felt the security uniform on his body become unbearably ugly. He squirmed uncomfortably, looking like he might burst at any moment.

He squirmed even more as he imagined what would happen if word got out at school that he was working as a security guard. Labels like ‘poor,’ ‘part-timer,’ and ‘broke’ would be slapped on him by his classmates, and his status and reputation in his social circle would plummet.

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu, her face devoid of expression.

"I didn’t realize you two were so eager to get ahead in life that you’d skip decades of struggle and jump straight to being security guards."

Zhao Tianxing waved his hands frantically.

"No, that’s not it, Classmate Bai Zhenzhen! I just came along with Zhang Yu."

But Zhang Yu clapped a hand firmly on Zhao Tianxing’s shoulder.

"What are you so flustered about? You’re a temporary security guard earning 800 an hour, with enough purchasing power in a single hour to cover a mortal's food and drink for ten days. Do you have any idea how many people would kill for that?"

"Huh?" Zhao Tianxing was taken aback. He had never considered an 800-per-hour wage to be anything special.

But as he looked at Bai Zhenzhen, who had suddenly fallen silent, he felt a distinct chill coming from her.

Zhao Tianxing had never been very familiar with the genius girl who ranked first in their grade, knowing only that she was always cold and unapproachable and exclusively ate lunch with Zhang Yu and Zhou Tianyi.

In fact, Zhao Tianxing’s own social circle had tried inviting her out, but they never received a response.

In his mind, Bai Zhenzhen was a prodigy of immense talent, but also incredibly arrogant and difficult to get close to.

Now, seeing her silent and expressionless, Zhao Tianxing could only assume she was angry.

*Zhang Yu must have angered her with his careless words.*

Just as he was fidgeting and racking his brain for something to say to diffuse the tension, he heard Bai Zhenzhen ask coldly, "You make 800 an hour?"

"Yeah," Zhao Tianxing nodded dumbly, not understanding her point.

At that moment, a voice called out from the other side of the tables, where a server was setting up.

"New girl! Get over here and bring out the dishes! What are you standing around for?"

Bai Zhenzhen said to Zhang Yu and Zhao Tianxing, "I have to go serve the food. We’ll talk later."

Meanwhile, she was thinking, *Damn it! Security guards make 800 an hour? I only make 500! I would’ve signed up for security if I’d known.*

Only then did Zhao Tianxing notice that Bai Zhenzhen was wearing the exact same uniform as the other servers.

"Bai Zhenzhen is working here, too?" he asked, his face a mask of shock.

"Is that so strange? Who in this world isn't working for someone else?" Zhang Yu had recognized her uniform at a glance. Given Bai Zhenzhen's financial situation, he thought it was perfectly normal for her to have a job.

He was, however, secretly amazed that she could still maintain her rank as first in the grade while working a part-time job.

*Zhen’s talent is truly something else. Among all the new disciples of my Songyang Sect, she’s probably second only to me.*

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 16: Patrol

Glancing back at Zhao Tianxing, who was still frozen in place, Zhang Yu urged, "Let's get to work, Little Zhao. You slacking off already?"

Zhao Tianxing quickly hurried to catch up, though he couldn't resist glancing back a few more times at Bai Zhenzhen serving dishes.

*No one at school would ever believe this,* he thought. *Bai Zhenzhen is working a part-time job? Did something happen to her family?*

After another round of patrols, Zhao Tianxing followed Zhang Yu into an empty emergency stairwell, where he watched Zhang Yu suddenly sit down cross-legged.

"You might as well take a break too," Zhang Yu said.

"Huh? But the captain told us to keep patrolling. If he finds out…"

"The exhibition hasn't even started yet. What is there to patrol? Besides, what could possibly happen inside this building?"

With a small laugh, Zhang Yu added, "Anyway, didn't you want to talk to me? This is a perfect chance for me to teach you the true way of the security guard."

Hearing this, Zhao Tianxing remembered Wang Hai's instructions.

Across from him, Zhang Yu then dropped a bombshell.

"The whole point of being a security guard is to slack off!"

"Huh?" Zhao Tianxing asked.

Zhang Yu continued, "Think about it. Whether you patrol a few more times or a few less, does your pay change?"

Zhao Tianxing hesitated for a moment. "I guess... not?"

Zhang Yu asked again, "With or without us here, does the security level of this venue really change?"

Zhao Tianxing scratched his head. "I guess... not either? But…"

Zhang Yu stated, "But the time we steal for ourselves is our own."

"Alright, I'm going to rest for a bit. We'll head back out later when the exhibition officially begins."

Watching Zhang Yu close his eyes and begin his breathing exercise, Zhao Tianxing grew nervous, terrified of being caught slacking off by their superiors.

Glancing again at Zhang Yu, now completely absorbed in his breathing exercise, Zhao Tianxing felt a mix of admiration for his dedication to cultivating at every opportunity and disbelief at how incredibly reckless he was being.

*Wait a minute, wasn't I supposed to ask him about the medicine? How did I get sidetracked into a lecture on slacking off…*

Suddenly, Zhao Tianxing’s eyes flickered as he replayed Zhang Yu’s words in his mind, lost in thought.

Zhao Tianxing was the type of person who wasn't particularly skilled at socializing. He was thoughtful and sensitive, always worried about what others thought and prone to overthinking things.

Now, as he recalled what Zhang Yu had just said, he realized it all seemed to apply to his own situation.

*If I ask him a few more questions, or a few less, will Teacher Wang Hai refuse to guide me?*

*Without me digging up information, will Teacher Wang Hai really be unable to find anything out?*

*Could Zhang Yu have already figured out what I was planning? Was he saying all that to subtly give me a hint—to tell me to slack off on this too?*

At this thought, Zhao Tianxing looked again at Zhang Yu and his steady breathing exercise, and suddenly even the simple act felt profound and inscrutable.

As mana surged through his body, Zhang Yu silently circulated his energy for a full cycle, advancing his Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to (13/80) just as the art exhibition finally, officially began.

…

"It's just as you'd expect from an exhibition hosted by Ms. Li. Every guest here is either wealthy or influential."

Zhao Tianxing sighed with sincere admiration as he watched the attendees file in.

Although he didn't know who any of these people were, a single glance at their luxurious clothes and accessories was enough to tell him they were all of considerable means.

Even though his own father was a minor manager at a company with a respectable income, he could still identify numerous luxury items on these guests that his family could never hope to afford.

Just then, Zhang Yu whispered from the side, "Old Zhao, look at that!"

Zhao Tianxing followed the direction of Zhang Yu's chin and immediately spotted a gleaming golden figure entering, surrounded by an entourage.

Focusing his gaze, he saw that the man's skin was like a layer of gold foil, faintly reflecting the light with a soft, metallic sheen.

Beside him, Zhang Yu asked curiously, "What is that? A robot?"

Zhao Tianxing hastily clamped a hand over Zhang Yu's mouth, watching nervously until he was sure the golden man hadn't looked their way, before finally letting out a quiet sigh of relief.

He then released his hand and explained, "That's the Immortal Resonance Group's Songyang City Director. You can't just say whatever you want."

"Immortal Resonance Group?" Zhang Yu asked, looking curiously at the golden man. "Then why is he so… shiny?"

Zhao Tianxing explained, "That's an Arcane Frame. You've never heard of it?"

Seeing Zhang Yu's blank expression, Zhao Tianxing figured his family probably wasn't exposed to such things and patiently explained, "An Arcane Frame… well, it's sort of like a prosthesis, but infinitely more powerful."

"And on the technological level of the Immortal Dao, Arcane Frames have been developed to encompass the entire human body."

"It's like you can replace any part of your body with a magical treasure, drastically enhancing its abilities while preserving all the original functions."

"The only catch is you need a mana level of 100 or more to have one implanted…"

At these words, Zhang Yu's eyes flickered. He knew that 100 mana was the absolute limit one could reach in the Qi Refinement realm.

He asked, "So you can get one implanted with just 100 mana, or do you have to wait until after Foundation Establishment?"

Zhao Tianxing replied, "100 mana is enough, but this man is a true Foundation Establishment cultivator. He comes from a prestigious family and graduated from Myriad Laws University."

Zhang Yu got it. This was a Foundation Establishment grandmaster, fresh out of university, coming down to a low-level lobby to stomp on newbies—showing off and putting a bunch of stubborn Qi Refinement cultivators in their place.

As more and more guests arrived, Zhang Yu spotted two other individuals who looked like they might have Arcane Frames. One had eyes that shone like jewels, while the other had a halo of light floating behind his head. Their entire aesthetic was a stark contrast to the other wealthy attendees.

These two, along with the glittering director from the Immortal Resonance Group, formed three separate centers of gravity, periodically drawing in Qi Refinement hopefuls who looked desperate enough to kneel and kowtow.

By now, Zhao Tianxing seemed to be gradually getting used to his security uniform, no longer appearing so tense as he watched the guests come and go.

As the two of them patrolled, they inadvertently overheard snippets of conversation.

Some remarked on Ms. Li Xuelian's immense wealth.

Others praised the outstanding quality of the paintings, speculating on their exorbitant value.

And, of course, some were discussing the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, personally painted by a Golden Core True Monarch.

"Brother Li? Don't tell me you're also here to seek enlightenment from the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll painted by Senior Xinghuo?"

"Of course. If any young prodigy under the age of twenty can master the martial arts contained within it, Senior Xinghuo will take them as a direct disciple. That news has already spread throughout the entire Immortal Dao community of Songyang City, so how could I possibly miss this?"

*Wait, that's a thing?* Zhang Yu thought. *And it's spread throughout the entire Immortal Dao community of Songyang? How come I never heard about it?*

*Maybe a bottom-feeder like me in the Immortal Dao community doesn't deserve to know?*

For the moment, however, Zhang Yu suppressed his questions and decided to carry out his duties as a security guard.

He walked up to the person who had been speaking and asked politely, "Sir, is everything alright?"

The youth who had spoken had sharp, defined brows and starlike eyes, marking him as someone extraordinary. He gave the security guard a puzzled look.

"Is there a problem?"

The youth announced proudly, "I am Lian Tianji of Purple Cloud High School. Can't you see I'm talking with my friend?"

Zhang Yu and Zhao Tianxing glanced at him, and then at his so-called 'friend.'

This 'friend' was a box resting on a nearby table, its surface covered in a peculiar wood grain. In size and shape, it looked exactly like a funerary urn.

*Schizophrenia?* Zhang Yu wondered. *Did he study himself into insanity?*

He had, however, heard of Purple Cloud High School. It was an elite institution even more prestigious than Songyang High School, one of the top three schools in Songyang City. It was a place the old Zhang Yu wouldn't have even dared to dream of applying to.

Purple Cloud High School was legendary for its principals, who were known for their cruel methods, appalling pressure tactics, and hellishly strict school rules.

Everything at Songyang High School paled in comparison. The legendary campus caste system, where underachievers ate their meals in the bathroom and the weak were expected to kneel before the strong… rules like these were enough to strike terror into the hearts of students from any other school.

Looking now at Lian Tianji, who was deep in conversation with a funerary urn, Zhang Yu couldn't help but sigh. Purple Cloud High School really did drive its students mad.

But just then, the 'funerary urn' spoke. "Brother Lian, I believe these two security guards have misunderstood."

"I am Li Xingyu, a soul cultivator from Mount Mang High School."

Mount Mang High School? A soul cultivator?

Zhang Yu remembered now. Wasn't that a school he had once considered applying to?

He knew that soul cultivators had lower score requirements for the college entrance exam and were on a specialized track, but he also knew it came with the requirement of abandoning one's physical body.

But staring at the 'funerary urn' on the table, he was still utterly shocked.

"Mount Mang High School… it really does turn people into ghosts."

Zhang Yu and Zhao Tianxing quickly apologized and backed away. They watched as Lian Tianji and Li Xingyu exchanged a few more words before four propeller-like devices extended from the 'funerary urn,' and it flew away like a drone.

Watching this, Zhang Yu was secretly grateful his predecessor hadn't chosen the path of a soul cultivator. Otherwise, he wouldn't even be able to look the part… to have that ethereal, transcendent bearing of an immortal. What kind of cultivator would he be then?

*Wait, that soul cultivator doesn't even have a physical body. How does he plan to practice the martial arts from the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll?*

Then he recalled the information the two had just shared about the scroll.

*If that's true, does that mean tons of young prodigies under twenty will be attending this exhibition? All just for a chance to master the peerless martial art within the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll?*

At this thought, Zhang Yu found himself looking forward to the exhibition more and more.

Four hundred an hour, a free show, and a chance to comprehend a peerless martial art? Whoever said this was a bad gig was dead wrong. This job was amazing.

He turned to Zhao Tianxing beside him and asked, "How about it, Old Zhao? Are you interested in the peerless martial art from the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll?"

Zhao Tianxing instinctively shook his head.

He knew his own limits. A technique that only true prodigies or the fabulously wealthy could ever hope to master—what could that possibly have to do with an ordinary person like him?

Far from being interested, he was filled with an urge to shrink away. Even if the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll were brought out right now, he wouldn't even dare to try, terrified of making a fool of himself in front of everyone.

A moment later, however, Zhao Tianxing—who had just started to get comfortable in his role—wanted nothing more than to cover his face and flee, to rip the security uniform right off his body.

Zhang Yu glanced at Zhao Tianxing's rapidly retreating figure, then looked in the direction he had been facing, immediately spotting several familiar faces.

"Huh? Isn't that Qian Shen? And those others look like they're from our school too, right?"

Qian Shen was the academic prodigy who was always ranked just behind Bai Zhenzhen, consistently holding the number two spot in their year since school began.

Zhang Yu clapped Zhao Tianxing on the shoulder.

"Old Zhao, look. Aren't those our classmates?"

Zhao Tianxing quickly yanked Zhang Yu back.

"Turn around, hurry!" he said, his voice tight with anxiety. "Don't let them see us."

(End of Chapter)

---

**Translator's Note**

In Chinese culture, Mount Mang is synonymous with death, burial, and the afterlife.

Located north of Louyang in Henan provice, Mount Mang was considered the most auspicious place to be buried due to its excellent _feng shui_ (high soil quality, deep earth, and protection against floods).

# Chapter 17: Scores and Secrets

"So hungry."

Qian Shen rubbed his stomach, completely uninterested in the paintings at the art exhibition. He just wanted to find a place to have a big meal.

He had, after all, just finished a supplementary body tempering session before rushing over, and his rumbling stomach made him feel like he could eat an entire cow.

"I'm going to see if I can find anything good to eat."

After telling his classmates who had come with him, Qian Shen started searching through the exhibition hall.

The students who came to the art exhibition with him were not the least bit surprised by this.

Diligently studying the Immortal Dao and arduously tempering their bodies day after day, the nutrients they required and the portions they ate naturally far exceeded those of ordinary people.

For a top student like Qian Shen, who trained arduously twenty-four hours a day, the daily food intake was even greater. Eating only five meals a day would make his private tutor worry if he had lost his appetite.

Just then, Qian Shen's gaze suddenly lit up, his eyes locking onto the buffet table.

He strode forward, grabbed a plate of large shrimp, and downed them in a few bites, but after eating for a moment, he frowned.

"How is this food so lacking in nutrients?"

As the top student of Songyang High School's freshman class, the perennial number two, Qian Shen's success was not only due to his own talent and hard work but, most importantly, his family's wealth.

To enhance the effects of his cultivation, especially the efficacy of his body tempering, the food he usually ate was rich in all sorts of Immortal Dao elements.

For a score-chaser like him, taste was secondary; the ability to increase his cultivation efficiency was all that mattered.

He could certainly afford the seafood provided at the art exhibition's buffet, but he had no interest in spending money solely to satisfy his palate, instead feeling it was a waste of his time and stomach capacity.

Seafood, gourmet meals... if it can't improve my scores? Then it's just trash.

So, as Qian Shen scanned the other dishes on the table, he called over a server, wanting to ask if there was any other food available that could be used as a dietary supplement.

"Everything edible is right here. Take what you want."

Hearing the server's somewhat cold voice, Qian Shen couldn't help but frown, and when he looked up, he saw a familiar face.

Qian Shen glanced at the server uniform on the other person and said with surprise, "You work here?"

"Yes," Bai Zhenzhen said expressionlessly. "Is there anything else?"

Qian Shen, however, frowned and said, "Are you that short on money?"

"You should hurry up and sign a contract with the student council. Otherwise, continuing to waste time on meaningless jobs like this will only drag you down on your path of the Immortal Dao."

"Even if I were to surpass you then, there wouldn't be any satisfaction in it."

Qian Shen's tone was filled with emotion; after all, he had always regarded Bai Zhenzhen, the only girl in his year who could surpass him in total score, as his rival.

He felt that Bai Zhenzhen must think the same way.

The next three years of high school, the entire grade level, and even the entire school, would be the battlefield where their two great talents would contend with and yet cherish one another.

They were supposed to break through their limits in one competition after another, ultimately getting into a top-tier university together three years later.

But in response to Qian Shen's heartfelt sentiment, Bai Zhenzhen just said flatly, "Are you telling me what to do?"

Before Qian Shen could answer, Bai Zhenzhen continued, "A guy with a total score just over 600 is going to teach me, a 650, what to do?"

Faced with Bai Zhenzhen's blatant academic discrimination, Qian Shen, a staunch believer in the supremacy of scores, felt his confidence instantly deflate. The 50-point gap felt like a mountain crashing down on him.

Your score is higher, so you must be right.

In that moment, in Qian Shen's eyes, it was as if three glowing numbers, 650, were hovering above Bai Zhenzhen's head, emitting a powerful pressure that crushed him so much he couldn't utter a single word of rebuttal.

Bai Zhenzhen frowned. "No, seriously, why are you staring over my head when you're talking to me?"

Qian Shen snorted coldly and turned to leave.

*Just you wait, Bai Zhenzhen. Wasting your time like this, it won't be long before I surpass you.*

Who would have known that just a few steps after turning around, he would almost collide with two security guards.

It was Zhang Yu, who had come over to check on the situation, and Zhao Tianxing, whom he had dragged along.

Having just seen what looked like a conflict between Bai Zhenzhen and Qian Shen, Zhang Yu, as a security guard, had hurried over.

Qian Shen looked at the two of them, and although they wore security uniforms, they were his classmates, so he recognized them at a glance.

"550 and 580?"

Hearing this form of address, Zhang Yu paused for a second, then realized in the next moment that 550 was his total score from last month's exam, and 580 was, he supposed, Zhao Tianxing's total score?

*Good grief, this guy only sees scores and can't even remember his classmates' names, can he? Another one who's studied himself into a freak.*

But in truth, it wasn't just names that Qian Shen couldn't remember. In fact, for any student below 550 points, he remembered neither their names nor their scores.

After all, to him... below 550? Weren't they all just NPCs? Was there any need to remember them?

Someone like the 550 before him was already a sub-human in Qian Shen's eyes.

Based on his observations during this period, the other party would likely score below 550 on the next monthly exam, at which point there would be no need to remember him at all starting next month.

And looking at the security uniforms on Zhang Yu and Zhao Tianxing, Qian Shen shook his head again.

"How did you two end up working here too?"

Facing the 550 and 580, the confidence that had just been crushed by the 650 instantly swelled back up within Qian Shen.

He said arrogantly, "Instead of seizing the time to study and cultivate more, what are you two doing wasting your time here?"

Zhang Yu said, "Aren't you here too?"

Qian Shen chuckled confidently. "I specifically postponed my tutoring session today to come here and comprehend the peerless martial art within the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll."

Zhang Yu said, "Yeah, we're also here to comprehend the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll."

"And we get paid 800 an hour on top of it."

"Earning money while comprehending a divine art, isn't that a much better deal?"

"Hmm?" Qian Shen paused upon hearing this, looking at Zhang Yu with some surprise.

*The words of a 550-pointer actually make some sense?*

He looked at Zhang Yu and said, "550, I'll remember you."

"My name is Zhang Yu!" Zhang Yu couldn't help but glance above his own head again. "Why do you keep staring at the space above my head?"

But Qian Shen quickly came to his senses.

"No, that's not right. You two think you can comprehend the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll?"

Zhao Tianxing could feel more and more people looking over, and Qian Shen's disdainful gaze made his cheeks flush slightly. He quickly waved his hands and said,

"No, no, no, I'm not trying to comprehend the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll."

Qian Shen, however, couldn't be bothered with Zhao Tianxing's explanation and just shook his head with a sigh.

"The Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll was personally painted by a Golden Core expert. The peerless martial art it contains is specifically meant to select true geniuses. Even I don't have absolute confidence in mastering it, let alone you two."

With that said, Qian Shen lost all interest in looking at the 550 and 580 before him and turned to leave.

Watching Qian Shen's departing figure, Zhao Tianxing's expression grew even more bitter.

Now, not only had the other boy seen him working as a security guard, but thanks to Zhang Yu's careless words, he also misunderstood that he was here to comprehend the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

Zhao Tianxing was filled with bitterness, already imagining the ridicule he would face from his many classmates.

*This is a huge embarrassment,* he thought to himself.

The nearby Zhang Yu, however, didn't have as many thoughts racing through his head as Zhao Tianxing. He looked at Bai Zhenzhen and asked, "Are you okay? You and Qian Shen don't get along?"

Bai Zhenzhen pursed her lips and said casually, "What could happen to me? Most of the time, he just brings the humiliation on himself."

Then her gaze turned to Zhang Yu, a little peculiar.

"You're also planning to comprehend the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll?"

Seeing Zhang Yu nod confidently, Bai Zhenzhen thought to herself, *This mountain of debt is driving Yu-boy more and more delusional. With his level... he even wants to try and comprehend a martial art left behind by a Golden Core True Monarch?*

The nearby Zhao Tianxing just wanted to get out of there quickly. He tugged on Zhang Yu's clothes, wanting to leave, only to find him exchanging looks and winks with Bai Zhenzhen.

Immediately after, he saw Bai Zhenzhen secretly pass a plate of seafood into Zhang Yu's arms.

Zhang Yu said, "Old Zhao, want to try some?"

Zhao Tianxing said anxiously, "The captain said we're not allowed to eat from the buffet."

As he spoke, he hurriedly used his body to shield Zhang Yu, afraid that someone might see what was happening.

Zhang Yu said lightly, "Isn't it perfect that Zhen is working here too? We can just skim a little off the top from the company."

Just as Zhang Yu was tasting the large shrimp on the plate, a voice came from behind Zhao Tianxing.

"What are you two doing?"

The voice startled Zhao Tianxing, but when he turned and saw that it was their classmate, Zhou Tianyi, he breathed a sigh of relief.

Unconsciously, it seemed Zhao Tianxing was gradually getting used to wearing a security uniform in front of his classmates.

Zhang Yu looked at Zhou Tianyi in surprise.

"Old Zhou, you're here too?"

Zhou Tianyi smiled. "Yeah, I came with Qian Shen and the others."

"Really? How come I didn't see you just now."

"Heh, what brings you here?"

The two chatted briefly about their respective situations, while a nearby Zhao Tianxing once again urged Zhang Yu that it was time to continue their patrol.

Zhou Tianyi, however, suddenly put on a mysterious expression and said, "I've got a piece of gossip about a Golden Core True Monarch. I wonder if you're interested in hearing it?"

Seeing the curious look on Zhang Yu's face, Zhao Tianxing said, "The captain is already pinging us in the group chat, asking where we are..."

Zhang Yu nodded. "Never mind then, work is more important. I'll hear it from you next time."

Just as the two were turning to leave, they heard Zhou Tianyi say, "True Monarch Xinghuo is planning to retreat to the first layer because he had half of his cultivation taken away after leaving his post."

"Hm?"

Both Zhang Yu and Zhao Tianxing immediately turned back around, waiting for Zhou Tianyi to continue.

Although the nearby Bai Zhenzhen didn't look over, she too perked up her ears to listen.

Zhou Tianyi smiled and continued, "A Golden Core True Monarch can live for a maximum of 400 years, but True Monarch Xinghuo was already 350 last year and was 'optimized' by the Myriad Laws Sect."

"When he left his post, half of his cultivation was reclaimed, leaving him unable to afford the expenses of the upper layers, which is why he wants to retreat to the first layer of Kunxu to focus on raising his descendants and teaching his disciples."

Zhang Yu was once again shocked by this bullshit world. 

"Wait... you have to give back half your cultivation when you quit?"

Zhou Tianyi stated as if it were obvious, "The sect cultivated him, gave him the opportunity and resources to form his Golden Core. Isn't it normal for him to hand over half of his cultivation when he leaves?"

Just as the three were listening to Zhou Tianyi's news about True Monarch Xinghuo, the crowd in the distance suddenly began to stir.

A guest said in a low voice, "Madam Li is here. The Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll is about to be unveiled."

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 18: Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll

Amidst the gazes of the guests, a tall woman, surrounded by a crowd, slowly approached.

A head of long, silver hair reflected a unique metallic luster.

_Is that head of beautiful hair an Arcane Frame?_ Zhang Yu wondered. _I wonder how much a single strand is worth._

The woman's red evening gown was adorned with traces of flowing light, like clusters of flames leaping within, and it emanated powerful mana fluctuations.

_This gown seems to be a magical treasure in itself,_ Zhao Tianxing thought. _It's probably priceless._

At the same time, the director of the Immortal Resonance Group, who looked as though he were covered in a layer of gold foil, took the initiative to approach Li Xuelian.

Then, two other wealthy individuals at the Foundation Establishment stage joined their conversation.

They were surrounded by a circle of rich and famous people, all desperate for a chance to exchange a few words with the four and become a familiar face.

But they weren't given much of an opportunity. After a brief chat with the three, Li Xuelian arrived before the curtain concealing the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

"Everyone, thank you for attending the art exhibition today."
