*He hasn't even gone to the bathroom once… What powerful kidneys.*

Zhang Yu’s diligent appearance made even Zhao Tianxing feel a knot in his stomach.

After what felt like an eternity, it was finally time for lunch. Zhao Tianxing had just gotten his food and was about to walk over to sit with Zhang Yu.

Then he saw the other boy shovel the meal into his stomach in two bites like a phantom before bolting out of the cafeteria as if on wings.

Seeing this, Bai Zhenzhen cursed inwardly, *You're even grinding through lunch? Can't you let anyone eat in peace?*

Lunchtime was the only period at Songyang High School untouched by grades, free from the supervision of a devil incarnate like Su Haifeng, and untainted by the meddling of a pervert like Wang Hai.

It was a rare moment in the school day when the top students could relax, rest, and even trade a bit of gossip.

It was Songyang High School's own mental spa time.

Bai Zhenzhen was deeply displeased with Zhang Yu's study fiend attitude, saving even his lunch break for cultivation.

*Bro, you’re grinding this hard, how are the rest of us supposed to eat with a clear conscience?*

*What if you surpass us because of this?*

*Is this an academic arms race you're starting?*

When Zhao Tianxing returned to the classroom, he saw Zhang Yu already performing his breathing exercises and thought to himself, *Of course.*

For the rest of the afternoon, Zhao Tianxing couldn't find the slightest chance to speak to him, because every time he turned to look, Zhang Yu was either paying rapt attention in class or doing breathing exercises for spiritual energy.

The longer he watched, the more anxious Zhao Tianxing became.

*He’s apprenticed to a Golden Core master and he’s still this diligent? Is he trying to leave us regular students no way to survive?*

Finally, when the dismissal bell rang, Zhao Tianxing found his chance to follow him, assuming Zhang Yu would be off to find another temporary job.

Instead, he heard the other boy say, "Look for a temp job?"

"Little Zhao, as high school students, we should put our studies first. How can we run off to work every day?"

"Don't get cocky just because you earn 800 an hour. That's temporary work; you can't find it every day."

Zhang Yu glanced at his balance of 8,300 yuan, which gave him the confidence to stop working for now and focus solely on his training.

He returned home, took a neural filler, and continued his breathing exercises straight through to the next morning.

During that time, aside from using the bathroom and switching the Feathered Tome's specialization back to the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, Zhang Yu invested every second into his breathing exercises.

And just like that, four days flew by.

After four days of this ascetic training, Zhang Yu's Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method reached level 6 (45/120).

His mana, through these days of diligent practice, had also surged from 8.3 to 9.4, leaving him just two spots shy of the grade's top ten.

...

On this day, outside the first-year hallway.

Su Haifeng strolled leisurely to the back door of the classroom to observe the students during their self-study period.

As the class advisor of the model class, even though he had no more classes, he made a special trip to wander by. Naturally, his goal was to use his icy glare, merciless ridicule, and the authority of a grade head to give the students' morale a savage boost.

Then Su Haifeng discovered that the students in the classroom were grinding even harder than usual today.

Fewer people were going to the bathroom.

More were focused on their breathing exercises, and fewer were dozing off in the middle of them.

The students who were actually spacing out while pretending to stare at their books just to avoid his notice were gone.

The class's overall rate of inattentiveness had dropped significantly.

In fact, Su Haifeng had faintly noticed this trend starting a couple of days ago.

Through his observations, he discovered that the source of this trend was the student named Zhang Yu.

Following Zhang Yu’s frenzied breathing exercises, his unbroken streak of 0% inattentiveness, and his recent surge in mana... Bai Zhenzhen, Qian Shen, and Zhao Tianxing were the first to be spurred into action.

Then, the competitive pressure erupting from them stimulated even more people.

The 550-pointers were grinding, the 600-pointers were grinding, and the 650-pointers were grinding, so how could you possibly still be resting?

Su Haifeng even checked a report and found that the average mealtime for model class students in the cafeteria had decreased by over 20%.

Su Haifeng looked at Zhang Yu, who was still deep in his breathing exercises, and mused, *Is it because I wounded his pride before?*

*Perhaps I can use this tactic more often in the future.*

Unconsciously, the topic for his next educational research paper had already formed in his mind: *An Exploration of Student Humiliation in High School Pedagogy*.

After another satisfied look at the academic atmosphere in the classroom, Su Haifeng nodded and departed.

Not long after Su Haifeng left, the dismissal bell rang. Zhang Yu immediately stood up and headed for the school's quiet rooms.

For becoming the student with the lowest rate of inattentiveness in the entire grade last week, Zhang Yu had not only received a 500-yuan bonus and a public commendation but also the right to a free one-hour rental of a Heavenly Spiritual Root.

And today was the day to redeem that one-hour rental.

Since the spiritual root rentals and the quiet rooms for breathing exercises were scheduled by the school, the reward would be forfeited if he missed his slot, so he hurried to the rental office without a moment's delay.

Zhao Tianxing seized the opportunity and fell in step behind Zhang Yu, asking, "Are you going to rent a Heavenly Spiritual Root?"

Seeing Zhang Yu nod, Zhao Tianxing continued, "You don't seem to rent them from the school very often, do you?"

"Want me to give you a rundown of the Heavenly Spiritual Root models we have here?"

A flicker of interest crossed Zhang Yu's eyes. The original Zhang Yu, ever conscious of the price, had always rented spiritual roots from various training institutions that offered discounts; he was not at all familiar with the models the school provided.

After all, with the advancement of the era, especially after the categorization and research done by the Ten Great Sects, spiritual roots were no longer as crudely classified as they were in ancient times.

First, in terms of grade, spiritual roots were divided by the Ten Great Sects into five levels.

These included the lowest Human Spiritual Roots, the more advanced Earth Spiritual Roots, and the even higher Heavenly Spiritual Roots. These first three grades could be purchased as long as one had the money.

Further up were the military-grade Divine Spiritual Roots and the Immortal Spiritual Roots, which were exclusively supplied to the Ten Great Sects.

Divine Spiritual Roots were only accessible to the military and certain special government departments.

As for Immortal Spiritual Roots, one had to be initiated into one of the Ten Great Sects to even have permission to use them.

In terms of classification, the ancient categories like Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth spiritual roots... such a system had long since vanished in Kunxu.

As the design and manufacturing industries for spiritual roots became increasingly advanced and prosperous, they were gradually categorized by function, such as learning-type, combat-type, cultivation-type, and so on.

Zhao Tianxing began to explain, "The most popular spiritual roots in our high school are definitely the learning-type and cultivation-type ones."

"For instance, the Host Spiritual Root..."

Zhang Yu’s face fell. "The Ghost Spiritual Root?"

Zhao Tianxing said, "Host, as in one that hosts something. A Host Spiritual Root can be temporarily lodged inside a person's body to transfer the mana they refine to yourself. It's a favorite among the wealthy."

"The Muscle-Growth Spiritual Root is another popular choice. During breathing exercises, it can refine spiritual energy into a kind of growth-promoting spiritual energy that gets injected directly into the muscles. It accelerates muscle growth for 24-hour gains, greatly enhancing the effects of body tempering..."

# Chapter 25: Sea of Qi

"The Primordial Yang Spiritual Root is also very popular among the Heavenly Spiritual Roots. After all, our school is full of virgins, and the Primordial Yang Spiritual Root can refine the primordial yang essence within a virgin's body into mana. Its effect on mana growth is incredible."

Zhao Tianxing said proudly, "This is especially true for our high school's Primordial Yang Spiritual Root, which has been passed down for nearly twenty years. It has been handled by generations of upperclassmen and has absorbed the primordial yang essence of thousands of students, granting it even more profound qualities."

Zhang Yu's brow furrowed as he listened. This Primordial Yang Spiritual Root sounded rather sordid to him, and besides…

"Hasn't everyone been sterilized? How can this virgin spiritual root still be used?"

"It's the Primordial Yang Spiritual Root," Zhao Tianxing explained. "The sterilization procedure only temporarily removes certain organs, but the primordial yang essence in our bodies still flows continuously from our kidneys; it just no longer stimulates our emotions or spirit."

"Otherwise, how would it be possible for each graduating class to undergo restorative surgery and regain what they've lost?"

As they walked, Zhang Yu continued to ask, "Among the school's Heavenly Spiritual Roots, are there any that are particularly helpful for mana growth?"

Zhao Tianxing's interest was piqued upon hearing this. Recalling Zhang Yu's recent activities, he thought about how dedicated the other boy had been to increasing his mana.

_Could it be for the Mana Competition?_

Zhao Tianxing thought for a moment and said, "There are many spiritual roots that can aid mana growth. The most effective one at our school is probably the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root. It's just rather expensive, but since you're getting it as a free reward, the price doesn't matter..."

The Sea of Qi Spiritual Root, nicknamed the 'King of Phasing,' had its greatest advantage in its vast coverage area. It could penetrate all kinds of walls, buildings, and even the earth itself to gather spiritual energy over a wide range, thereby increasing the efficiency of mana refinement.

After listening to Zhao Tianxing's description, Zhang Yu had already decided to try this Heavenly Spiritual Root.

Arriving at the spiritual root rental office beside the meditation rooms, Zhang Yu didn't immediately state his purpose, instead picking up an informational brochure from the desk to look it over.

The administrator on duty was a female teacher with a baby face.

Seeing his hesitation, she seized the opportunity to ask, "Student, are you a member here? Do you have a spiritual root you're familiar with?"

Zhang Yu answered without looking up, "I'm not, and I don't."

The administrator quickly pitched, "We're running a promotion for new members: deposit ten thousand and get one thousand free. Would you like to try it?"

Zhang Yu said, "I'm here for the Heavenly Spiritual Root rental, my reward for achieving a 0% distraction rate. I'm only here for the reward and nothing else, so you don't need to give me a sales pitch."

The administrator gave a helpless smile and stepped back.

"Well then, student, let me know if you need anything."

Hearing his words, she silently labeled Zhang Yu as stingy and lost all interest in making a sale.

Zhang Yu, however, didn't care what she thought. He simply lowered his head, quickly scanning the brochure, and found that its contents matched what Zhao Tianxing had told him.

He then said to the administrator, "I'd like to rent the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root."

"Scan your student card," she said.

Zhang Yu took out his student card and handed it to her.

This Songyang High School student card was proof of his identity, the essential credential that allowed him to legally practice cultivation and access various related services on the Immortal Dao.

A moment later, the administrator returned with a jade box and presented it to him.

"The Sea of Qi Spiritual Root is inside. Go to meditation room number two, open the jade box, and consume the spiritual root."

"Your rental period is one hour, which starts the moment you enter the room. If you go over by even one minute, you'll be charged for a full hour, so keep an eye on the time..."

After reminding him of a few more details, the administrator urged Zhang Yu to go on in.

Zhao Tianxing, who had been waiting nearby, said, "Well, I'll let you get to it, Zhang Yu. I should be going."

Zhang Yu nodded to him. "Thanks."

Watching Zhang Yu turn to leave, Zhao Tianxing replayed his expression and tone in his mind.

_Our relationship should be a little closer now, right?_

Meanwhile, inside meditation room number two.

The room was about twenty square meters. A meditation cushion sat in the center, and the surrounding walls were covered with a layer of soundproofing material, which in turn was covered with sprawling, distorted talismans of various sizes.

These talismans were said to accelerate the gathering of spiritual energy, which had some effect on improving the efficiency of one's breathing exercises.

However, Zhang Yu only had one hour from the moment he stepped through the door, so he had no time to concern himself with the room's decor. He sat directly on the cushion and opened the jade box.

Inside the palm-sized box lay a delicate, translucent crystal shimmering with a faint cyan light.

The crystal floated in the center of the box, encircled by swirling wisps of smoke-like motes of light.

This was the spiritual root he had rented: the Heavenly Spiritual Root known as the Sea of Qi.

Zhang Yu carefully picked up the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root. The moment it touched his lips, he felt a coolness in his throat as the Heavenly Spiritual Root flowed into his body like a ball of ice water, sinking into his lower abdomen and entering his dantian in a single breath.

Once inside his dantian, the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root seemed to sprout, extending crystal-like tendrils that took root in the surrounding mana.

Zhang Yu understood that, just as the manual and the administrator had instructed, the Heavenly Spiritual Root had now been successfully planted in his dantian.

Now, all he had to do was perform his breathing exercises as usual, and the Heavenly Spiritual Root would naturally do its work.

With this in mind, Zhang Yu took a deep breath and began to circulate the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

_Boom!_

A great roar seemed to erupt within his mind.

Zhang Yu felt the surrounding spiritual energy swarm toward him, pouring into the Heavenly Spiritual Root inside his body.

_Two times?_

_Three times?_

_So fast... It's still increasing!_

Feeling more and more spiritual energy flooding his body, Zhang Yu quickly centered his mind and operated his level-six Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method at full capacity.

As the circulation of mana throughout his body accelerated, wisps of spiritual energy were refined into mana.

His dantian, which had felt bloated from the initial surge of spiritual energy, returned to normal.

But as if sensing the speed of Zhang Yu's refinement, the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root in his dantian pulsed once and again increased the rate at which it gathered spiritual energy.

This time, it wasn't just the spiritual energy immediately around him that surged; even the spiritual energy from outside the room was drawn in.

The hallway… outside the window… the sky… even the ground beneath…

The Sea of Qi Spiritual Root matched the efficiency of Zhang Yu's refinement, steadily increasing its gathering range until it finally stabilized at a fifty-meter radius.

He felt a massive tide of spiritual energy, like a great river, pouring ceaselessly into his body. It was then guided into his mana circulation channels and, strand by strand, refined into his own power.

In that moment, Zhang Yu felt a thrill at the explosive growth of his mana.

_So this is the true efficiency of a level-six Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method?_

Zhang Yu finally understood that during his normal breathing exercises, he had never come close to unleashing the true power of his level-six technique.

Now, with the aid of the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root, he was truly pushing the refinement efficiency of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to its absolute limit.

Not daring to waste a single second, Zhang Yu focused wholeheartedly on his breathing exercises, drawing in spiritual energy and refining his mana.

Meanwhile, back in the rental office, the administrator who had assisted Zhang Yu looked at her computer screen in surprise.

"Hm? The spiritual energy concentration has dropped?"

The school's meditation rooms were not merely quiet; they were also arrayed with spirit-gathering talismans that controlled the ambient spiritual energy concentration to enhance the effects of breathing exercises.

The administrator carefully examined the monitoring parameters and discovered a significant spiritual energy convergence centered on meditation room number two. It was drawing in so much of the surrounding spiritual energy that it was causing the concentration in the adjacent rooms to drop.

"Meditation room two... I remember that was the first-year student from just now, wasn't it?"

"To think a first-year could achieve this level of spiritual energy convergence."

The administrator was increasingly surprised. In her memory, only second-year students or higher could utilize the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root to such a degree.

"Zhang Yu, was it?"

Recalling the name and class the student had registered with, the administrator committed them to memory, completely reversing the "stingy" label she had mentally applied to him.

"To be this powerful as a first-year, he must have spent a fortune on his pursuit of the Immortal Dao."

As she activated more spirit-gathering talismans to restore the spiritual energy concentration, the administrator thought to herself, _I'll get his contact information later. If I can convince him to sign up for a platinum membership, my sales quota for the next few months will be taken care of._

She decided not to tell anyone, intending to cultivate this promising client all by herself.

In the blink of an eye, an hour had passed.

Immersed in the thrill of the wildly surging spiritual energy, Zhang Yu's mana had risen from 9.4 to 9.5 without him even realizing it. This single hour was clearly equivalent to half a day of his usual ascetic training.

Just then, a woman's voice came through the room's intercom.

"Student Zhang Yu, your hour is almost up. Would you like to extend your time?"

For some reason, the administrator's voice sounded much gentler to Zhang Yu.

Relishing the satisfying feeling of the spiritual energy surging while his Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method ran at full power, Zhang Yu couldn't help but ask, "How much to extend?"

The administrator replied quickly, "The rental price for the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root is five thousand per hour. However, we have a special promotion today for new users. If you deposit one hundred thousand at once, you'll not only get an extra ten thousand, but also a twelve percent discount on all rental fees."

Zhang Yu sighed inwardly and slowly ceased his breathing exercises.

"I have other things to do today, so I won't be extending."

As he returned the spiritual root, Zhang Yu noticed the administrator was being exceptionally courteous, and he happened to have a few questions of his own.

With a reluctant glance at the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root as it was placed back into the jade box, Zhang Yu asked, "If this spiritual root were for sale, how much would it be?"

The administrator's eyes lit up, and she smiled. "The price of a Sea of Qi Spiritual Root is sixty million."

Zhang Yu inwardly drew a sharp breath, though his expression remained unchanged.

"That expensive?"

The administrator smiled. "It is. We don't generally recommend buying one, in fact. Renting is far more cost-effective. After all, obtaining a Heavenly Spiritual Root so early in the Qi Refinement realm is quite extravagant. Most cultivators don't even consider buying a spiritual root until after they're accepted into a university."

Zhang Yu nodded slightly. He knew that the final hurdle in breaking through from the Qi Refinement realm to Foundation Establishment was to plant one's own spiritual root, and that was indeed a concern for university-level cultivators.

Whether one implanted a Heavenly, Earthly, or Human-grade spiritual root, however, depended entirely on the cultivator's financial resources.

As for the even higher-grade Divine and Immortal Spiritual Roots, one could only hope to be granted a transplant after joining a special government department or being accepted into a major sect.

_"A useful Heavenly Spiritual Root... is really... damn expensive."_

He took one last, long look at the spiritual root as it was put away, thinking that one day, he would buy one for himself.

Before he left, the administrator took the initiative to exchange contact information with him, and it was only then that Zhang Yu learned her name was Wei Xin.

Wei Xin, for her part, silently changed the contact name for Zhang Yu in her list to "Zhang Yu (Prospective Platinum Member)."

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 26: Registering for the Mana Competition and the Coming Monthly Exam

Songyang High School.

In the blink of an eye, four days had passed since the day Zhang Yu rented the Sea of Qi Spiritual Root.

This was the day that Songyang High School's first-year students would be selected to register for the city-wide Mana Competition.

In mana class.

As the bell rang to signal the end of the period, Zhang Yu took a rare break from his breathing exercises, opening his eyes to look toward the large screen.

After several more days of ascetic training, his mana had continued to surge, climbing from 9.5 to 10.5. The sheer speed of his progress drew stunned looks from many of his classmates.

Zhang Yu's Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method had also risen from level 6 all the way to level 8 (3/160), but he was the only one who knew of this achievement. If his classmates and teachers were to find out, their reaction would be far more than mere surprise.

After all, while Zhang Yu's mana growth was rapid, it was not without precedent. Many of the wealthy could achieve even faster results, provided they threw enough money at the problem.

But to raise a breathing exercise to level 8 in such a short time… at his current level, Zhang Yu knew of no one else who had accomplished such a feat.

He looked at the large screen, where the mana rankings for the entire grade had appeared.

First Place, Bai Zhenzhen, 12.1

Second Place, Qian Shen, 11.9

Zhang Yu continued to scan down the list, soon finding his own name in eighth place.

Eighth Place, Zhang Yu, 10.5

_Eighth place, huh?_ Zhang Yu nodded slightly, knowing that registering for the Mana Competition would now be no problem at all.

But the chill in his heart quickly returned. Hearing the countdown in his mind, Zhang Yu had no choice but to close his eyes once more and seize every available second to practice his breathing exercises.

On the dais, Teacher Yan swept her hair back, glanced at the rankings, and spoke with satisfaction.

"Over the past week, everyone's rate of distraction has dropped by another eight percent, and your mana growth efficiency is twelve percent higher than last month. I'm very pleased."

She saw Zhang Yu immediately resume his breathing exercises and nodded, gratified, before continuing, "I'd also like to give special praise to one student in particular: Zhang Yu."

"Not only has he maintained a zero percent distraction rate for two consecutive weeks, but over the last week, his mana has taken a qualitative leap forward, jumping from sixteenth place to eighth. It's truly remarkable. Let's give him a round of applause."

A smattering of applause broke out, after which Teacher Yan announced that the top ten students would be participating in the Mana Competition.

"The Mana Competition begins next month. I will send you the specific schedule and rules as soon as I receive them."

"Alright, class dismissed."

"Oh, and any students who want to buy Spirit-Gathering Pills, remember to find me in the office. There's a discount running right now…"

Down below, Bai Zhenzhen looked a little thinner, her cheeks slightly sunken.

Seeing Teacher Yan’s beaming expression, she thought to herself, _This whole rat race has been so intense lately, and isn't it because of..._

At that thought, she instinctively glanced over at Zhang Yu's seat, only to see that he had already started his breathing exercises again.

_You beast! Zhang Yu, you absolute beast! Stop it! Stop dragging everyone into this damn grind!_

After fuming internally for a moment, Bai Zhenzhen ultimately couldn't bear to watch her good friend advance all by himself. She squeezed her eyes shut in anguish and began her own breathing exercises.

Not far from her, Qian Shen had been staring intently at both Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu. Seeing them both use the break and the teacher's announcements to practice their breathing exercises, his heart sank.

As a student in Songyang High School's model class, Qian Shen had always believed he would never shy away from competition.

But after the last eight days of this relentless grind with Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, his perspective had changed.

"They barely even go to the bathroom, they don't even scratch an itch… I really can't keep up with them!"

"Compared to them, am I the one who's not fully evolved?!"

Staring daggers at the two of them, still lost in their breathing exercises, Qian Shen finally closed his eyes in unwilling resignation.

Grind! Then he would just have to grind harder!

…

During physical education class.

Students were scattered about, some performing acupuncture, others doing body tempering. Beast-like roars echoed through the hall, and the floor was slick with the pungent stench of sweat.

Bai Zhenzhen wiped the sweat from her brow and subconsciously glanced toward a small, dark room in the corner.

Because he had been singled out and isolated by the P.E. teacher, Wang Hai, Zhang Yu had been training on his own in that little room for the past few classes.

At this moment, however, Zhang Yu was not practicing his spiritual energy breathing exercises as he had the past few days, but was instead practicing the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms.

With a series of sharp cracks, the muscles on Zhang Yu’s body bulged, erupting with ferocious power as he violently lifted the training equipment before him, lowered it, then lifted it again, and lowered it again…

Simultaneously, he had switched the specialization on his Feathered Tome from the level 8 Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to the level 3 Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms.

Zhang Yu had his reasons for doing this.

First, because he lacked a matching spiritual root, the amount of spiritual energy he could absorb was limited, and the benefits of leveling up his Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method were diminishing.

Second, he had already qualified for the Mana Competition, which meant his next objective was the monthly exam in nine days.

_My mana has improved significantly recently. Besides, at level 8, the passive effect of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method constantly provides sixty-five percent of the benefit of active practice, even when I'm not focused on it._

_My mana score on the upcoming monthly exam is already secure. Continuing to invest heavily in it… the return on investment for my overall score would be too low._

Zhang Yu calculated his options.

_To improve my exam results from here, I'll have to focus on my Dao heart, physical education, martial arts, and Daoist arts._

_For my Dao heart… while I haven't mastered the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, I have fully grasped its principles. That should be enough to earn a good score on the Dao heart portion of the exam._

_For martial arts, apart from the twenty points for theory, the remaining eighty are based on combat. That would require hiring sparring partners to trade blows with me, so improvement won't come quickly._

_Daoist arts are even more difficult; it's impossible to make any progress in such a short time._

After weighing his options, Zhang Yu decided it was best to spend the next nine days focusing on improving his Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms and his physical strength.

He had even discovered an unexpected side benefit of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method while practicing the forms.

As he exerted force, his muscles contracting and expanding, the mana circulation within his body continued to operate, converting wisps of spiritual energy into mana as it flowed.

In the process, as the mana circulated through his strained tendons and past his torn muscle fibers, it began to nourish the areas worn down by his training. It replenished his flesh and blood, accelerating repairs and enhancing the effects of his workout.

Originally, the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms could only produce a similar effect by guiding mana after reaching the third level.

But now, under the influence of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, a far more complex and refined circulation of mana continuously enveloped his entire body, drastically improving his recovery and the effectiveness of his body tempering.

He felt that if he could previously only practice the forms twenty or thirty times a day, with the aid of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, he could now manage at least fifty or sixty repetitions daily.

And so, for the foreseeable future, Zhang Yu planned to start grinding the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms.

As these thoughts flashed through his mind, a wave of emotion washed over him.

_It seems I'm getting more and more used to the grind._

_Sigh. This damned Kunxu really turns people into monsters._

But after completing fifteen consecutive repetitions of the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms, Zhang Yu realized he was mistaken.

He lay on the ground, drenched in so much sweat that a faint human outline was visible on the floorboards.

Even the P.E. teacher, Wang Hai, upon witnessing such a scene of diligent training, would have certainly said: You've worked hard, take a rest.

But the one supervising Zhang Yu now was not a person. It would only trigger the ritual: Continue training.

"Please abide by the ritual’s agreement. Strive to complete the wish. Do not deliberately slack off or delay. 10."

Zhang Yu lamented, "You mindless thing! I'm already at my limit."

This was agony!

The drudgery of body tempering was so much more grueling than the breathing exercises.

At that moment, Zhang Yu felt his lungs heaving like a bellows, and a tearing soreness radiated from every inch of his flesh and blood.

_I was so naive, thinking I had already adapted to this wretched world._

Listening to the incessant countdown in his ear, Zhang Yu remained on the floor like a dead fish. It wasn't until the final moments ticked away that he suddenly sprang to his feet. Enduring the overwhelming soreness and fatigue, he resumed his training of the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms.

Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms Level 3 (22/30)

After forcing his way through another repetition, Zhang Yu collapsed into his own puddle of sweat again, listening to the chilling countdown as he felt the ritual's power threatening to tear his body to pieces.

_Is this a world a person can even adapt to?_

_Damn it… Before this thing forces me to jump off a building, I have to break this cursed ritual!_

That day at noon, Zhang Yu acted completely out of character. Under the astonished gazes of Bai Zhenzhen and Zhou Tianyi, he spent over a hundred yuan at once, ordering a massive bucket of food.

If mana growth depended on absorbing more spiritual energy, then improving the effects of body tempering depended on eating more nutritious food.

"I'm going to eat ten pounds of this!"

Seeing the size of Zhang Yu's lunch, Bai Zhenzhen knew exactly how hard he must have pushed himself in P.E. class.

_He must feel he's grinded mana enough for now, so he's starting on physical strength?_

Just when did this guy start trying so hard?

Could this be some extra competitive drive that comes from being unneutered?

Watching Zhang Yu devour a whole chicken leg in a single bite, then crunch the bones to powder and swallow them, Bai Zhenzhen found herself unconsciously eating faster.

Zhou Tianyi sighed helplessly, "Slow down, you two. Nobody's grading you on your eating speed."

Not far away, Su Haifeng, also eating in the cafeteria, watched some of the slower students and thought to himself, _The lunch break is still too long._

_I've been saying the school should install more surveillance cameras in the cafeteria. Publicly reprimand and fine anyone who takes more than ten minutes to eat._

With that, he began to draft a proposal to send to the principal, offering this valuable suggestion for cafeteria reform.

For the following days, outside of his regular lessons, Zhang Yu spent every spare moment practicing the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms. When he reached his physical limit and could train no more, he was forced to practice his spiritual energy breathing exercises.

Tormented day in and day out, the time for the monthly exam, nine days later, finally arrived.

# Chapter 27: Pre-Exam Sprint

Three in the morning.

Inside an office at Songyang High School.

Su Haifeng stared at a list on his computer screen as he spoke into the phone, "Hmm... his Dao heart score hasn't changed."

"His mana saw a rapid increase a while back. It looks like he spent most of his time and money on breathing exercises, which is how he broke into the top ten."

"As for his physical strength, it hasn't been tested in three weeks due to his isolation, but it had already dropped to nineteenth place. Now that he's focusing on mana, he'll be lucky to even hold that rank."

"His martial and Daoist arts haven't shown any significant progress either. It's possible he'll drop below thirtieth place in both subjects on this monthly exam."

Looking at Zhang Yu's recent academic records, Su Haifeng shook his head.

"All in all, I'm not optimistic about him making any major improvements this time."

"The school will probably still offer him a D-rank contract."

"I understand. I'll do my best to persuade him to sign it."

"I don't know how he managed to get Li Xuelian's attention, but after this exam, he should have a clear picture of his own situation."

After hanging up, Su Haifeng casually closed Zhang Yu's file and moved on to the next document.

To him, Zhang Yu was just one minor issue among many. There were far more pressing matters and more important students at Songyang High School that demanded his attention.

...

Four in the morning.

In the abandoned building.

Today was the day of Songyang High School's monthly exam.

Although his strength had improved significantly after nine days of torment, Zhang Yu was still seizing every moment to practice the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms, striving to boost his power a little more before the exam officially began.

His current panel in the Feathered Tome's preface now read:

[Zhang Yu]

[Dao Heart: Level 1]

[Mana: 11.7]

[Physical Strength: Level 1.05]

His mana had increased from 10.5 to 11.7, thanks to his passive breathing exercises interspersed with occasional active sessions.

His physical strength had soared from Level 0.85 to Level 1.05 under his frenzied training.

Of course, the greatest progress in these nine days had been in the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms, which had now become: Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms Level 9 (89/90).

And as Zhang Yu threw one final punch, the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms finally broke through to Level 10, reaching the maximum limit for the Qi Refinement realm.

The moment he raised the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms to Level 10, it was as if countless memories flooded his mind—the image of himself practicing the forms over and over and over, his deepening understanding of his own body, his more profound reflections.

After being meticulously polished countless times, his body finally underwent a qualitative change and began to readjust itself in a more rational way.

A roar seemed to echo in his mind!

As his heart pumped waves of blood and qi to his limbs and bones, Zhang Yu's entire body seemed to undergo a metamorphosis.

His flesh and blood contracted and expanded, and a series of sharp cracks echoed from his joints as his entire frame seemed to grow slightly larger.

His muscle distribution became better suited for exerting force, his skeletal structure grew firmer and more stable, and his whole body seemed to become more balanced and coordinated.

The structural optimization of his body, a process that should have occurred incrementally while leveling the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms to level 10, was now completed in an instant.

Physical Strength: 1.05 → 1.25

With the adjustment and optimization of his physical structure, Zhang Yu's physical strength shot up by 0.2 levels, a massive 20% increase.

More importantly, Zhang Yu could feel that the improvement brought by this structural optimization was not just a one-time boost to his physical strength but would have longer-term effects. His more balanced and coordinated body would allow his future path of body tempering to be smoother and faster.

Zhang Yu smiled faintly, excitement rising within him.

_Leveling the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms to 10 can actually trigger an optimization of my body's structure._

_Could it be that all skills provide such a huge boost when they reach Level 10?_

This was information his teachers had never taught in class.

But Zhang Yu figured that Level 10 in any skill—even a basic martial art like the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms—was simply too distant a goal for first-year high school students, so it was normal that the teachers wouldn't mention it.

_Next, I'll raise the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to Level 10 and see what happens._

Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method: Level 8 (3/160)

Zhang Yu estimated that it would take him a week at most to get this breathing exercise to Level 10.

But even with this thought, he didn't immediately switch the Feathered Tome's focus to the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, because he had other plans for today.

"Please abide by the ritual’s agreement. Strive to complete the wish. Do not deliberately slack off or delay. 10."

Just as Zhang Yu was feeling inspired and marveling at his improvement, that damned countdown sounded once again.

Zhang Yu cursed a few times, but the thought that this thing lacked even will or intelligence left him with only the empty feeling of punching cotton.

So he sat cross-legged, meditating and performing his breathing exercises while also giving his body, exhausted from another night of labor, a chance to rest and recover his stamina.

It was time to prepare... for the monthly exam.

...

Songyang High School.

A trace of anxiety was visible on the faces of the students hurrying through the grounds.

The campus itself seemed to have taken on a somber atmosphere today.

Zhang Yu looked up; the original banner, "Live until you die, learn until you die," had been replaced with an anti-suicide slogan: "One person acts recklessly, the whole family pays the price."

Even the perimeter of the rooftop had been enclosed with a layer of wire mesh, making it more difficult for students to act recklessly.

Beside him, Bai Zhenzhen commented, "Looks like those beastly school leaders finally learned to care about the students. They know the monthly exams can cause emotional breakdowns, so they actually took some protective measures."

But the moment they arrived at the cafeteria for breakfast and saw the notice about price increases for certain dishes, Bai Zhenzhen couldn't help but explode with anger.

"The prices went up again? How many times is that since the semester started?"

"A bunch of parasites can't even run the cafeteria properly, how can they run the school?"

Zhang Yu tried to console her, "Sigh, being inhuman is standard procedure for them. Just stay calm and don't let it affect your exam today."

But a moment later, after hearing the new rule from the cafeteria lady serving the food, Zhang Yu raged.

"Why is the five-dollar meal set limited to one per person per day? I could still get ten yesterday! Why can't a student even get a full meal!"

"Alright, alright, Yu-boy." Bai Zhenzhen patted Zhang Yu's shoulder comfortingly. "Don't be impulsive, a teacher is looking over here. I'll just buy you an extra poor man's special."

Carrying their trays to a table, Zhang Yu checked his bank balance.

Although he had once again received the 500-dollar reward for 0% distraction, his savings had dropped to 6,000 due to the massive food consumption required for body tempering, the continuous purchase and use of neural fillers, and miscellaneous expenses like transportation.

A new month was about to begin, which meant new loan payments, new rent, and new utility bills were due...

And then there was the cost of food. Since starting high-intensity body tempering, Zhang Yu had felt his appetite grow larger and larger; eating ten pounds a day was normal. His daily food expenses alone amounted to several hundred dollars, which would add up to over ten thousand a month.

Zhang Yu felt more and more that cultivation was an endeavor that only grew more expensive the further one progressed.

_I hope I can get a good score on the monthly exam and land a good contract._

_Otherwise, I'll have to go back to working part-time._

Just then, Zhou Tianyi sat down beside them with his tray and shook his head helplessly.

"Do you guys know why the cafeteria raised its prices?"

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen snapped their heads up in unison, staring at Zhou Tianyi and waiting for him to continue.

"To promote Oasis Corporation's synthetic food, the municipal government has raised the tariffs on ingredients imported from other cities. In the future, the prices of all food in Songyang City, except for synthetic food, are likely to keep rising."

"I heard the principal is also considering replacing the cafeteria's pre-made meals with synthetic food."

Before he started cultivating, the original Zhang Yu had eaten plenty of synthetic food, since it was much cheaper.

Fried insects, vegetable protein, plus recycled water and oil—the taste was something not even a pig would eat.

"We won't even get pre-made meals anymore?"

Upon hearing this, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen let out another wail, cursing both Oasis Corporation and the municipal government for being utterly inhuman.

After breakfast, because it was the monthly exam, the three of them did not return to their classroom as usual but went to their respective examination halls.

The morning consisted of the general education exam and the martial arts theory exam, both of which were written tests worth 50 and 20 points respectively.

The afternoon featured the 100-point Daoist arts exam and the 80-point martial arts practical exam.

The 80 points from the practical combined with the 20 points from the morning's theory test made up the total 100 points for the martial arts course.

The morning exams were all written, and the original Zhang Yu had already mastered this material.

After finishing, Zhang Yu didn't bother checking answers with other students. Instead, he quickly ate lunch and hurried to the small garden to begin his training.

Freehand Combat: Level 1 (0/10)

Zhang Yu switched the Feathered Tome's focus to Freehand Combat, which was why he hadn't switched to the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method earlier.

After pushing the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms to Level 10 yesterday, no amount of time spent on the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method would yield significant improvement.

But if he used his daytime break to improve Freehand Combat, which was only at Level 1, Zhang Yu estimated he could raise it to at least Level 2.

This would undoubtedly provide a considerable boost for the afternoon's martial arts practical exam.

With this in mind, Zhang Yu practiced with even greater focus.

As he executed the moves, propelled by his Level 1.25 physical strength, his bones and sinews sang in unison, and every punch and palm strike carried the rumble of wind and thunder.

Simultaneously, with each move, a trace of mana was circulated to different parts of his body, enhancing its power.

Freehand Combat was a foundational practical martial art. Although it only consisted of fifteen moves, it included punches, palm strikes, kicks, and throws, not only covering various combat situations but also having a corresponding mana circulation route for each technique.

Zhang Yu was now repeatedly practicing these fifteen moves.

As a practical martial art, the training intensity of Freehand Combat was far lower than that of the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms.

Combined with his Level 1.25 physical strength, the mana circulation from his Level 8 Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, and the physical optimization from his Level 10 Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms, he trained at a blistering pace, raising Freehand Combat to Level 2 in just over fifty minutes.

Freehand Combat: Level 1 (0/10) → Freehand Combat: Level 2 (0/20)

In that instant, Zhang Yu felt the fifteen moves of Freehand Combat flash through his mind, becoming deeply ingrained in his memory in the blink of an eye.

But he didn't stop. Although he felt a little tired, he decided to continue practicing this martial art.

_There are still two and a half hours until the afternoon exam begins._

_I'll see if I can push Freehand Combat to Level 3 before then._

Zhang Yu continued to practice the fifteen moves over and over again, sweat pouring down like rain.

His body grew increasingly fatigued, his limbs gradually becoming sore and weak, and his movements began to lose their form slightly.

But whenever he thought of the mountain of debt he was under and his ever-increasing expenses, he gritted his teeth and persevered.

Over two hours later, a large bead of sweat dripped onto the ground with a soft splash.

Steam was rising from Zhang Yu's entire body, his muscles intensely heated from more than three hours of high-intensity exercise.

But a smile appeared on his face; he had finally succeeded in pushing this martial art to the third level.

(End of this chapter)

# Chapter 28: Daoist Arts and Practical Combat

Freehand Combat Level 2 (0/20) → Freehand Combat Level 3 (0/30)

In an instant, the fifteen stances of Freehand Combat became profoundly more familiar in his mind. Even the follow-up variations and transitions for each move grew exceptionally clear and distinct.

The mana circulation for every stance became as instinctual as breathing. Zhang Yu felt that if he were to execute a move now, the mana within him would shift on its own, flowing naturally to his limbs.

_The passive breathing exercise of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method also played a part in this process._

As Zhang Yu sensed the circulation of mana in his body, he could feel that because it was constantly coursing through every part of him, his mana manipulation had become much more fluid when performing Freehand Combat.

He was struck by how much the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method helped beginners, benefiting not only their breathing exercises and body tempering, but even their practical combat skills.

However, with the exam about to start, Zhang Yu had no more time for reflection.

After a brief breathing exercise to recover some stamina, he hurried to the examination hall.

The first exam in the afternoon was on Daoist arts, and the second was the Martial arts practical combat exam.

The content of the Daoist arts exam mainly covered the recognition and use of talismans.

After all, those in the Qi Refinement realm had yet to master true Daoist arts and could only use their knowledge and mana to activate talismans, so the three years of high school Daoist arts curriculum was fundamentally related to them.

Talismans referred to the secret arts through which mortals communicated with gods and commanded divine power.

…

Inside the computer lab.

Having arrived at the exam hall, Zhang Yu sat before a computer, silently reviewing his knowledge of talismans.

Not far away, Zhao Tianxing was frantically flipping through his textbook, repeatedly memorizing key points he was afraid of forgetting.

Bai Zhenzhen was resting her head on her desk for a quick nap, seemingly not the least bit nervous about the upcoming exam.

Just then, a bell rang, and the students all placed any items unrelated to the test on the desk at the front of the room before returning to their seats.

A moment later, the computer screens before them flickered to life, displaying this exam’s test paper.

Question 1: Which of the following talismans belongs to the God of Myriad Roads and Unimpeded Passage from the Department of Transportation.

The relevant information instantly surfaced in Zhang Yu’s mind.

The Department of Transportation, one of the eight great divine ministries of Kunxu, governed all matters of roads, aviation, and maritime traffic within Kunxu, possessing the authority to inspect all transportation in the world.

The God of Myriad Roads and Unimpeded Passage was a righteous god within the Department of Transportation responsible for urban roads, and Zhang Yu recalled that one of the deity's powers was the recording of all surveillance data from city roads and vehicles…

Through this talisman, one could borrow the power of the God of Myriad Roads and Unimpeded Passage to access all sorts of surveillance within the city's road network, a power said to reveal three hundred years into the past, leaving no detail uncovered.

After the memory flashed through his mind, Zhang Yu continued on to the options below.

There were four options in total, looking something like this:

A. ！\*★，°\*:.☆(￣▽￣)/$: \*.°★\*。

B. (o>ε(o>ｕ(≧∩≦)(￣ー￣)X(^▽^)

C. \*`)\`)\*▍\`)\*`)(((`)

D. 『』～o(▽｀o)=▊=▋=▍

_All four options are the beginning of a talisman, and judging by the style, they’re all from righteous gods in the Department of Transportation… Heh, trying to mess with my head right from the start?_

_It should be option D, the Vehicle Surveillance Talisman, right?_

Zhang Yu mulled it over and chose D, then the next multiple-choice question popped up.

“Among the following talismans, which one is not a Reporting Talisman?”

Zhang Yu paused for a moment.

_A Reporting Talisman? We never learned that. Another question that’s beyond the curriculum?_

Frowning, he randomly picked one that looked right and moved on to the next question.

After finishing all the multiple-choice questions one by one, he was met with fill-in-the-blanks and short-answer questions, where the difficulty spiked sharply.

There were questions like, “Please compose a Health Check Talisman to respectfully request the God of Health and Verdant Spring from the Ministry of Health to check your gastrointestinal tract for any tumors.”

And also, “What talisman could be used to quickly subdue three mortals without mana located 30 meters due north? Please draw the talisman. The specific data for the three mortals and the surrounding environment is provided below…”

_Damn it… if it's just three mortals, can't I just beat them up? Why would I need a talisman for that?_

Just as Zhang Yu was sweating over composing a Detainment Talisman, he heard the sound of a chair being pushed back.

He looked up to see his classmate, He Dayou, who had already finished the test and was preparing to leave.

Zhang Yu remembered that this He Dayou had placed third overall in last month's monthly exam and was a filthy rich person, just like Qian Shen.

But unlike Qian Shen, who was focused on his grades, this He Dayou loved to flaunt his wealth and generally had very little interaction with Zhang Yu.

Turning in his exam paper early like this was, in itself, a form of flaunting.

This was because talismans were a subject where one could only truly succeed by pouring money into it, making this exam the clearest dividing line between the poor and the rich.

Many people even referred to talismans as the language of the rich.

Specifically, the so-called drawing of talismans allowed one to mobilize the power of the Eight Great Divine Ministries to accomplish all sorts of incredible feats, and these eight ministries were often referred to by the world as the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods.

But schools only taught the most basic methods of talisman creation; to learn more advanced ones, or even many talismans not taught in schools at all, one had to purchase Talisman Tomes.

And besides the exorbitant cost of purchasing these Tomes, there were also membership fees, offerings to the gods, faith level requirements, and other massive expenditures.

It could be said that besides being categorized by a cultivator’s realm, the most important criterion for the talismans provided by the Tomes was money.

Only by spending enough money on a Talisman Tome could one attain a sufficient faith level to unlock more permissions, thus mastering more advanced talisman creation methods and various different types of talismans.

Only after fulfilling these prerequisites did one earn the qualification to study and practice talismans diligently, which included things like one-on-one talisman dialogues with the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, divine-guided talisman debugging, and talisman optimization while practicing under a god's guidance… of course, this diligent practice was also incredibly expensive.

One could say that learning talismans outside of campus was a process entirely built on money.

And throughout this entire process, if one violated the rules set by the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, such as by privately sharing talismans or using them to break sect laws, they would be punished—with light penalties being fines and severe ones being complete financial ruin.

Every time Zhang Yu attended a Daoist arts class to study talismans, he couldn't help but lament that this was a subject that was anything but fair and just, and it was the best way for the wealthy to rack up points on the college entrance exams and widen the gap with the poor—truly worthy of being called the language of the rich.

But Zhang Yu had also once heard Zhou Tianyi say that talismans were not even the most expensive among the Daoist arts.

Many of the various Daoist arts that could only be learned after Foundation Establishment required enormous sums of money, enough to leave even a university student deeply in debt.

After finally surviving the Daoist arts exam, Zhang Yu had just stepped out of the classroom when he saw a large crowd surrounding He Dayou, checking their answers.

He Dayou smiled faintly, took out a jade-like tablet, and then traced a series of ghost-like scribbles on it.

As the mana in his hand fluctuated, a golden, illusory figure slowly emerged from the jade tablet.

He Dayou said with a smile, “This is an Answer Talisman from the God of Celestial Knowledge and Myriad Questions. If you have any questions, just ask him.”

Many of the students who witnessed this scene gasped in amazement, their eyes filled with envy as they looked at He Dayou.

As Zhang Yu’s gaze was fixed on the jade tablet in He Dayou’s hand, Bai Zhenzhen's voice sounded from the side.

“Is that a Talisman Tome? He even got a jade-colored skin for it. That guy must have been planning this flex for a long time, huh?”

Zhang Yu turned his head to see Bai Zhenzhen beside him, indignant and contorted with jealousy.

Zhang Yu asked, “How did you do on the test?”

Bai Zhenzhen replied with dissatisfaction, “How else? At least a quarter of it was talismans we never learned.”

“The college entrance exam went 20% beyond the curriculum the year before last, and this year it’s pushing 25%? If this keeps up, by the time we take the exam, will half the content be stuff we were never taught? They have absolutely no shame.”

“They’d better hope I don’t run into those filthy rich kids in the practical exam, or I’ll beat them until they fail.”

On the other side, He Dayou seemed to sense the gazes of Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu. He turned his head and gave them a slight smile.

Bai Zhenzhen instantly switched to a calm and detached expression, nodding slightly at him.

A short while later, the next exam was about to begin, and He Dayou walked towards the Martial arts practical exam hall with a few of his companions.

He Dayou was the kind of person whose elementary school essay could be titled "My Father, the School Director."

Because his father was, in fact, a director on the board of Songyang High School.

But despite being born with a silver spoon, he didn't feel his life was easy, for he was merely one of his father’s thirty-something children.

It was only after passing numerous assessments, countless competitions, and repeatedly meeting family KPIs that he became one of only two high school students, one of only two cultivators, among those thirty-plus siblings.

As for his other mortal brothers and sisters, they had long since gone to work at their father's company to pay back their upbringing debt.

_Although I am the child of a wealthy family, the fact that I've made it this far is ultimately due to my own effort and talent._

_I earned my father's investment through my own hard work, so why can't I flaunt my wealth?_

_Those poor ghosts do nothing but whine all day, thinking I got to this point just because I have a rich dad? What a bunch of naive and ridiculous fools._

With these thoughts in mind, He Dayou had always looked down on those who were both poor and had bad grades.

And after he entered Songyang High School as the son of a director and gained a deeper understanding of the school's many unwritten rules, he gradually began to look down on the poor students with good grades as well.

_Good grades are ultimately temporary. These poor people have no idea… from the moment of their birth, they never stood a chance of getting ahead._

_Perhaps they and we can no longer even be considered the same species._

Holding such views, He Dayou had always maintained his rank as third in the grade, flaunted his wealth from time to time, and lived a peaceful campus life, waiting for the moment he would be admitted to a top university.

Until the change in one person shattered his inner peace.

Watching Zhang Yu work harder and harder over the past half-month, even sparking a competitive frenzy throughout the entire class, made him feel disgusted.

_This kind of poor ghost… counting his loan payments on his fingers every month, rushing off to a part-time job right after school to earn a few hundred or a thousand in pocket change, scrimping and saving just to cultivate, dreaming of striking it rich overnight and living a long life._

_They have no idea what kind of people they're competing against in the college entrance exams._

_And they’re still scrambling around at school._

_So poor it's ugly._

He Dayou couldn’t stand the sight of Zhang Yu's frantic efforts, as if hard work could actually let him win against wealthy people like them.

This was especially true after he heard the rumor that Zhang Yu had been accepted as a disciple by a Golden Core True Monarch; the director's son specifically used his connections to confirm the news.

After confirming that Zhang Yu had not been taken as a disciple by any Golden Core True Monarch, his aversion for the person reached its peak.

_He’s intentionally not clarifying it. Is he trying to bluff by borrowing the tiger's might?_

Therefore, he planned to use the practical combat exam as an opportunity to teach this poor ghost a lesson and make him recognize his true place.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 29: Combat Examination

Within the enormous training grounds, the students taking the examination stood in neat lines, their gazes fixed on the proctor at the front.

This scar-faced, powerfully built, middle-aged man, who exuded a murderous aura, was none other than Zhang Yu’s martial arts teacher, Lei Jun.

If the five major subjects of the high school Immortal Dao—Dao heart, mana, and physical education—were considered foundational, then martial arts and Daoist arts were the practical application of those immortal techniques.

As for whether martial arts or Daoist arts were stronger or more useful, cultivators each had their own differing opinions.

Zhang Yu still recalled a controversial rant this martial arts teacher, Lei Jun, had delivered during their very first class.

"In this world, martial arts are incredibly useful; Daoist arts are worthless."

"Every Daoist art you practice is another path to poverty. The more you train, the poorer you become, until all your money ends up in corporate pockets and you're left a destitute wretch."

"But martial arts are cheaper, more cost-effective, and still highly practical. Therefore, only by practicing affordable martial arts can you build a fortune; the more you train, the wealthier you become."

This was Lei Jun’s martial philosophy.

As today’s proctor, Lei Jun likewise refrained from using the power of any Daoist art.

His method for arranging the monthly exam was always the same: have students with similar scores from the previous month draw lots for one-on-one combat.

The two opponents would fight three consecutive matches, each with a duration of three minutes. A match would end if someone was knocked down or forced out of bounds within that time.

After all three matches were concluded, the teacher would award a score based on both combatants' performance.

This was actually quite similar to the martial arts combat test in the college entrance examination, except that during the college exam, students fought against Yellow Turban Strongmen rather than each other.

But this was just a monthly exam, after all, so it was impossible to truly adopt the standards of the college entrance exam, especially since not hiring Yellow Turban Strongmen saved the school a considerable sum of money.

And so, after Lei Jun finished explaining the rules for the combat examination, the large screen overhead flickered to life, and as names began appearing one by one, the lottery commenced.

Once the drawing concluded, the results were sent to each student's phone, instructing them to proceed to their designated areas to begin the combat examination.

The entire training ground had been divided by white lines into a grid of small squares, each a dozen or so square meters in size, serving as an individual fighting ring.

Following the lottery results, Zhang Yu walked into square number 12 and saw He Dayou already waiting for him.

Seeing He Dayou offer a polite smile and a nod, Zhang Yu nodded in return.

"You finally came," He Dayou said, suppressing the violent urge in his heart as he slowly walked toward the center of the square.

In order to teach Zhang Yu a lesson under legitimate pretenses, He Dayou had used his privilege as the son of a school director to rig the lottery, matching Zhang Yu, who ranked 10th last month, against himself, who had ranked 3rd.

Of course, according to the lottery rules, their scores from the previous month were close enough that the matchup was unlikely to be questioned.

_But this past month, aside from his mana class, his progress in the other subjects has long since fallen behind, hasn't it? His true rank should be somewhere between 20th and 30th._

He Dayou, on the other hand, considered himself to have not only maintained his top-three standing, but had also raised his Freehand Combat to level 2 two weeks ago, and had even recently mastered a new martial art at a tutoring center.

_Still, I won't need the new martial art. To deal with this pauper, level 2 Freehand Combat is more than enough._

_The only question now is… should I injure his arm? Or his leg?_

Lost in thought, He Dayou walked with Zhang Yu to the center of the square, the two of them taking their positions just over a meter apart.

He Dayou’s eyes began to roam over Zhang Yu's body as he considered how he would inflict a painful blow.

Outside the square, an assistant teacher took out a phone and began to record a video.

After the examination, Lei Jun and the other first-year martial arts teachers would review all the combat videos in order to assign their scores.

"Are you two ready?"

Hearing the assistant teacher’s question, Zhang Yu and He Dayou nodded in unison.

"Then, model class students Zhang Yu and He Dayou, first combat match..."

"3, 2, 1… begin!"

The moment the assistant teacher gave the command, He Dayou struck, his right arm blurring into an afterimage as he chopped a palm strike toward Zhang Yu’s neck.

At the same time, he had already anticipated all of Zhang Yu's possible counterattacks in his mind.

After all, as a second-generation heir, he had enough time and money to hire sparring partners for daily combat training.

He had already experienced, trained against, and developed counters for every possible reaction an opponent could have to this palm strike.

Such was the advantage of practical combat experience.

Level 2 Freehand Combat, combined with his superior experience, gave He Dayou absolute confidence in his ability to defeat his opponent.

_Then… I’ll go for the arm._

The mana in He Dayou's body surged toward his palm...

Pow!

A loud thud echoed from He Dayou's abdomen.

He then felt his vision spin wildly, followed by the shock of the hard ground and an explosion of pain throughout his body.

It took a full few seconds for He Dayou to gradually realize what had happened.

He had been sent flying out of the ring in a single move by Zhang Yu, and had landed hard on the ground.

_I was defeated in an instant?_

He Dayou’s face flushed a deep crimson.

"How is this possible?"

Seeing He Dayou's agitation and hoping to avoid any trouble, the assistant teacher immediately played back the recorded footage of the fight for both him and Zhang Yu to see.

The video showed that just as He Dayou had launched his palm strike, Zhang Yu had moved with impossible speed, ducking under the attack while simultaneously slamming his entire body into He Dayou and throwing him out of the ring with a tackle.

The entire exchange had taken less than a second, and it almost looked as if He Dayou had deliberately allowed Zhang Yu to throw him.

Watching the playback, He Dayou grew even more indignant. He hadn't used his full strength yet, and he still had his new martial art in reserve, yet a single moment of carelessness had…

_I underestimated this Zhang Yu far too much, getting distracted during our fight…_

At this thought, He Dayou felt a rising tide of indignation.

But he knew that whether it was carelessness or negligence on his part, any further excuses would only bring him more shame.

He took a deep breath and nodded at Zhang Yu.

"A good move. Let's continue."

The assistant teacher asked if He Dayou was physically fit to continue, and after receiving confirmation, had them both step back into the square.

Once again, they stood a meter apart, facing each other.

Zhang Yu watched He Dayou with a smile, thinking to himself,

_My score for this combat exam should be quite high._

The effects of level 3 Freehand Combat were even better than he had anticipated.

Although Zhang Yu estimated his own combat experience was likely inferior to that of a second-generation heir like He Dayou.

But his level 3 proficiency meant he was intimately familiar with the fifteen moves of Freehand Combat.

In the previous match, the instant He Dayou had moved, Zhang Yu had already known what he intended to do and where the opening in his technique would appear.

The moment the idea surfaced in his mind, his body was already in motion, surging forward and channeling mana into his arms to smoothly execute the throw.

_In a fight between first-years using Freehand Combat, as long as my opponent's skill level is below 3, their reaction time will likely be a step slower than mine._

_Coupled with my current physical strength, I doubt I would lose a Freehand Combat duel against any other first-year in the entire school._

Meanwhile, He Dayou’s expression was grim, all traces of his earlier nonchalance gone.

He resolved to focus completely in this second match and use his full strength to viciously defeat Zhang Yu.

This time, he would not give his opponent the slightest opportunity.

"Zhang Yu versus He Dayou, second match."

"3, 2, 1… begin!"

The instant the assistant teacher finished speaking, He Dayou exploded with his full power, his right fist gathering a surge of mana as he threw a vicious punch at Zhang Yu’s face.

Boom!

Again, a tremendous impact resounded.

Again, there was the familiar spinning of his vision, the hard, cold ground, and the pain that wracked his entire body.

He Dayou scrambled to his feet in a daze.

Had he been defeated in an instant again?

He watched the assistant teacher's recording once more.

The video showed that at the very instant he threw his punch, Zhang Yu had already landed a kick on his chest, sending him flying out of the ring.

Because they had both moved so quickly, it almost looked as though He Dayou had intentionally thrown himself chest-first into Zhang Yu’s outstretched foot.

The third match began.

This time, He Dayou did not rush to attack with his full strength, instead adopting a defensive posture and cautiously observing Zhang Yu.

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Beaten in an instant twice in a row. Is he finally starting to be careful?_

The reason he had been able to defeat his opponent in an instant was that he had used his familiarity with Freehand Combat to predict his opponent’s movements and trajectory, allowing him to actively intercept the opening created by the full-force attack.

It was a tactic that used the sum of their combined speeds, causing He Dayou to lose before he could even react.

But now that He Dayou was being cautious and no longer attacking with full force from the outset, Zhang Yu could no longer replicate his previous instant victories.

But Zhang Yu had prepared a strategy for this exact situation.

In terms of both mana and physical strength, Zhang Yu, who had recently grown by leaps and bounds, was confident he was not far behind He Dayou, the third-ranked student in their year.

In terms of pure physical power, his opponent also had a balanced build like his own, rather than relying on brute strength.

Since his opponent was unwilling to attack, Zhang Yu decided to take the initiative.

He channeled his mana and sent a palm strike toward He Dayou's chest.

"Here it comes!" A sharp glint flashed in He Dayou’s eyes as he threw a punch of his own, blocking the attack.

Then he saw Zhang Yu launch the exact same palm strike again.

_The same move? What is he playing at?_

After blocking three of Zhang Yu’s palm strikes in a row, He Dayou’s arm felt sore and numb, and the mana within him roiled.

The sheer volume of Zhang Yu’s mana and the strength of his physical body were far beyond his expectations.

His opponent’s strategy was also remarkably simple: to clash with him head-on.

Zhang Yu's level 3 Freehand Combat didn't just give him greater familiarity with the techniques. It allowed him to execute the same move with greater physical power and more abundant mana.

This gave him a decisive advantage in a direct confrontation.

He Dayou quickly realized this as well, but a slight smile couldn't help but touch his lips.

_He wants to meet force with force?_

_Fine, let’s clash. We’ll see who’s tougher._

He channeled his newly learned cultivation technique, the Lesser Heavenly Star Palm, and the mana in his dantian instantly transformed into a chilling palm force that blasted from his hand toward Zhang Yu.

# Chapter 30: A Contest of Palm Force and the Dao Heart Examination

The Lesser Heavenly Star Palm was not a martial art with any specific stances. Rather, it was a pure application of mana, channeling it into a frigid, yin-natured palm force.

As He Dayou unleashed the force of his Lesser Heavenly Star Palm, he was confident that its frigid power would heavily injure Zhang Yu, freezing his internal organs.

He also believed that, given Zhang Yu’s financial situation, he certainly wouldn't have the money for hospital treatment and would be forced to just endure the injury.

_Poor bastard, this will keep you out of school for at least a week._

Boom!

As their palms slammed together, their mana collided with a force that seemed to detonate within their bodies.

Although He Dayou's Lesser Heavenly Star Palm was formidable, he had, after all, only just recently mastered it.

And while the technique Zhang Yu employed was the exceptionally common Freehand Combat, he had already trained it to level three and could unleash a respectable palm force of his own.

As their palm forces met and their mana surged, He Dayou discovered his advantage was not as great as he had imagined. His Lesser Heavenly Star Palm could only force back his opponent's power bit by bit, slowly invading his body.

What surprised him even more was that Zhang Yu was like a roly-poly toy. Each time a bit of the Lesser Heavenly Star Palm's force invaded, he would quickly push it back, holding on and refusing to be defeated despite his clear disadvantage.

Meanwhile, the circulation of mana within Zhang Yu’s body continued unabated, endlessly restoring his reserves and allowing him to withstand He Dayou's Lesser Heavenly Star Palm again and again.

The assistant teacher watching from the side was startled by the scene.

"They're competing with mana?"

Seeing their solemn expressions, the assistant teacher feared an accident would occur, which would ruin his performance review for the year. The thought that one of them was the son of a school director made the possibility of an incident even more terrifying.

He quickly interjected with a reminder, "Students, if either of you can't hold on, concede immediately. The other party must then withdraw their mana at once."

"Don't let a monthly exam lead to serious injury and jeopardize your future."

Neither of them spoke. He Dayou stared intently at Zhang Yu, frantically channeling his mana and unleashing wave after wave of Lesser Heavenly Star Palm force.

Zhang Yu, however, remained calm and composed, actively employing the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to recover his mana while simultaneously resisting He Dayou's assault.

In the blink of an eye, both of their foreheads were beaded with sweat, and steam rose from their bodies as if they were two great furnaces.

But Zhang Yu’s complexion was rosy, and he appeared increasingly at ease.

In contrast, He Dayou's face was now ashen, and he was gradually showing signs of faltering.

He could no longer control his emotions, his gaze a mixture of shock and anger as he stared at Zhang Yu.

The assistant teacher checked the time; their contest of mana had already lasted for over a minute. Seeing He Dayou's condition, he had no choice but to remind them again, "Students, if you can't hold on, concede immediately."

"This is just a monthly exam."

He Dayou struggled to open his mouth several times, his eyes fixed on the increasingly relaxed Zhang Yu, and finally forced a few words through his clenched teeth. 

"I..."

"I surrender."

As they both slowly withdrew their mana, He Dayou collapsed onto the floor.

His face was ashen, and the mana within his dantian was almost completely depleted.

He looked at Zhang Yu with resentment and asked, "How much mana do you have left?"

Seeing his opponent's deathly pallor and weakened state, Zhang Yu answered humbly, "Only about ten or twenty percent."

He Dayou snorted; he could tell from Zhang Yu's appearance that it was far more than that.

He slowly rose to his feet and gave Zhang Yu a long, hard look.

"You're good."

"We'll have a rematch next time."

With that, He Dayou turned and left.

As he walked away, he replayed the battle in his mind and was forced to admit something to himself.

_Zhang Yu... is strong._

_But... it's a pity. As a poor commoner, he's destined to become our dog._

_I hope you can hold on until I can defeat you fair and square. Don't leave me with any regrets._

On the other side, watching He Dayou's unsteady retreat, Zhang Yu thought to himself, _A rematch?_

_You'd better not think about it, classmate... This was the closest you'll ever get to my level of strength, your fondest memory. If we fight again, I'm afraid you'll be saying, "My apologies, Lord Zhang Yu, for not making you use your full strength."_

Zhang Yu headed out of the examination hall and immediately saw Bai Zhenzhen leaning against the wall.

"Hey, Zhen, that was fast."

"Yeah, it was over in a few moves." Bai Zhenzhen glanced at him. "Who did you get?"

Zhang Yu replied, "He Dayou."

"Damn it!" Bai Zhenzhen stamped her foot in anger. "He just got to show off in the Daoist arts exam, and now he gets to humiliate you? That guy must be on cloud nine today."

"But don't worry, I'll challenge him during the next practical combat class and humiliate him for you."

Zhang Yu looked at Bai Zhenzhen, speechless. "I won."

Sensing Bai Zhenzhen's astonishment, Zhang Yu decided to act directly.

He threw a punch, which Bai Zhenzhen immediately blocked with a palm.

Their fists and palms collided in rapid succession, their four arms blurring into afterimages that filled the air with the muffled thuds of heavy hammer blows.

Thump!

After exchanging several moves, the two abruptly broke apart.

"Your Freehand Combat is at level three?" Bai Zhenzhen asked.

"Your Freehand Combat is at level three?" Zhang Yu echoed.

Bai Zhenzhen said in shock, "Weren't you only at level one before? How are you suddenly at level three? Don't tell me you reached level three a long time ago and were just waiting for a chance like today's fight with He Dayou to make a big show of it. You... you've been reading too many of those power-fantasy novels, haven't you?"

Zhang Yu looked back at her with equal suspicion.

"Zhen, are you projecting your own thoughts onto me? You're the one who claimed to be at level two. You'll really do anything for the spotlight, won't you?"

Bai Zhenzhen blushed and explained, "I wasn't trying to show off."

"Having a high Freehand Combat level doesn't get you extra points."

"On the contrary, holding something back in a real fight allows you to catch your opponent by surprise and get a higher score on the practical exam."

"Haven't you heard the teachers say that intelligence warfare is a part of combat?"

Zhang Yu suddenly thought of his fight with He Dayou.

That frigid palm technique his opponent had suddenly used had almost caught him off guard.

Hearing Bai Zhenzhen’s words now, Zhang Yu found himself in complete agreement.

_I really should hold something back,_ he thought. _I can't just reveal all my trump cards._

After Zhou Tianyi finished his exam, the three of them went to the cafeteria for dinner, after which they went their separate ways, either heading home or to tutoring sessions.
