"You..." Mo Tianyi sighed, thinking to himself that if he'd known this would happen, he never would have urged Bai Zhenzhen to try her luck at the art exhibition. Otherwise, Zhang Yu might have actually become a Golden Core disciple, and the chances of a poor student getting into the Ten Greats would have been that much higher.

Bai Zhenzhen continued, "I came to talk to you today because I want your people to get to know Zhang Yu."

"Although he's just a tiny bit inferior to me, he's still an incredibly rare talent, and he's also being targeted by the student council now."

Mo Tianyi's image on the screen refreshed as he recomposed himself, smiling.

"I've long heard of Student Zhang Yu's talent."

"This Mana Competition will be a perfect opportunity to witness it."

"That's it?" Bai Zhenzhen said, annoyed. "How about a real investment?"

Mo Tianyi replied helplessly, "We're all poor with limited resources. You know our focus has always been on our leader; we really don't have much to spare."

"This is a small token from me personally. Please don't think it's too little..."

With that, he transferred 2,000 yuan to Bai Zhenzhen.

Watching this, Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Well now, it seems Zhen dragged me here today to shake them down for money._

But it looked like this 'Alliance of the Rich-Haters' was extremely poor and couldn't offer much.

Seeing the transfer notification on her phone, Bai Zhenzhen frowned.

"Only 2,000?"

She knew who he was talking about—the one among these poor geniuses who currently had the best grades, the greatest talent, and the most potential; the one everyone believed was most likely to break through the shackles and enter one of the Ten Greats.

This poor genius had earned the trust of the other impoverished students, who scrimped and saved to invest many resources in him.

They were all counting on this prodigy to get into a top university and a major sect, hoping his success would lift everyone up with him and slowly tear open the inescapable net cast over Songyang City.

Even inviting Bai Zhenzhen to the art exhibition last time, in her opinion, was likely done in the hopes that she would become a Golden Core disciple and could then use that status to help their leader.

Bai Zhenzhen said, "Didn't we agree to watch over and help each other, to be united as one? You're just going to say one thing and do another? Was my membership fee a waste?"

Mo Tianyi shook his head with a wry smile. Compared to the 2,000 yuan membership fee Bai Zhenzhen had paid, the money she had wheedled and extorted from them each time already amounted to tens of thousands.

If Bai Zhenzhen weren't so exceptionally talented, and if they didn't think she could draw a great deal of attention away from their leader in the future, they certainly wouldn't have invested so much in her.

Sensing the awkward atmosphere, Wu Qingqing smiled from the side and said, "Zhenzhen, don't be anxious. Our leader is at a critical juncture, so there isn't much money to go around. Mo Tianyi may manage the funds, but he still needs the approval of several seniors to use them."

"I think we should do this: Student Zhang Yu is so formidable that as long as he achieves a good ranking in this Mana Competition, Mo Tianyi can bring it up with the seniors. Then it would be perfectly justifiable to request funds for you."

After some more back-and-forth, Bai Zhenzhen finally grabbed Zhang Yu and left the stands.

Watching their retreating figures, Wu Qingqing said helplessly, "Every time Zhenzhen comes to us, it's for money. She treats us like an ATM."

Mo Tianyi replied, "When it comes to getting into the Ten Greats, her conviction is indeed the strongest among us. That's why she's so desperate for money."

Mo Tianyi could clearly sense that Bai Zhenzhen wasn't counting on their leader to get into the Ten Greats and then protect them; she wanted to get into the Ten Greats herself.

Mo Tianyi added, "I just didn't expect her to bring Zhang Yu along to ask for money this time."

Speaking of Zhang Yu, Wu Qingqing said admiringly, "Improving by seventy points in a single month... Zhang Yu really is amazing. He's worth our investment."

Mo Tianyi, however, shook his head.

"If he were wealthy, that performance would indeed be enough to contend for a spot in the Ten Greats."

"But unfortunately... he's poor."

He sighed in lament. "For a poor person to prop up the heavens above them, amazing monthly exam scores are far from enough... far, far from enough..."

Behind Wu Qingqing, Ye Xianyun had been silently reading her book the entire time, as if nothing in the outside world concerned her.

...

Elsewhere, as Bai Zhenzhen walked, she said to Zhang Yu, "Yu-boy, the Mana Competition is starting soon. You'd better make me proud!"

"Get a top-ten finish, at least. That'll give me more leverage when I ask them for money."

_That's not... You seemed plenty forceful when you were demanding money just now._

Zhang Yu thought for a moment, then voiced the question on his mind.

"This union of the poor—besides watching over each other and pooling money, are there any other ways to get into the Ten Greats?"

From his perspective, it seemed unrealistic for a few poor students, even if they were all Immortal Dao geniuses from their respective schools, to break the blockade of the wealthy and get into the Ten Greats just by scrimping and saving.

Bai Zhenzhen explained, "That's exactly what I want to find out from them."

"As far as I know, their leader is a second-year student from one of the three key high schools."

"I don't know what method he used, but it seems he has yet to sign a contract with any school or student council, he hasn't been crushed by their joint efforts, and he still retains his eligibility for the university entrance exams."

"I want to know how he did it."

"The only way, it seems, is to continuously increase our influence within their group, then find that 'leader,' and figure out a way to make him reveal his methods."

Zhang Yu asked curiously, "Then how do we increase our influence?"

Bai Zhenzhen stated the obvious. "We're students. The way to increase influence is, of course, through exams! Competitions! Results!"

"This is true for both the poor and the rich. They invest in whoever gets the best results."

"It's just that I'm really not good at this Mana Competition. It's up to you to see how high you can place."

Not long after Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen returned to the Songyang High School rest area, Zhang Yu's gaze suddenly shifted, and he saw a person in the stands.

"Liang Qin?"

Seeing Liang Qin wave at him with a look of encouragement, Zhang Yu nodded back in greeting.

"What the hell? He followed me all the way to Red Pagoda High School just to watch my competition as a spectator?"

_Dude, are you okay? If you keep this up, I won't dare turn my back to you ever again._

Meanwhile, Liang Qin watched Zhang Yu in the rest area, a faint smile playing on his lips. He then took out his phone, opened a platform, and prepared to place a bet.

Gambling, after all, was a popular form of entertainment deeply loved by the people of Songyang City.

The platform Liang Qin frequented was a major one endorsed by the deputy mayor himself, offering a comprehensive range of betting options on practically anything in Songyang City.

A quick search now confirmed for Liang Qin that there were indeed events for various high school competitions.

He had taken time off to watch the competition, of course, to track Zhang Yu for his payment.

However, upon seeing the Mana Competition, he couldn't help the itch to start betting.

At the same time, Zhang Yu noticed a promotional flyer for a platform floating down nearby.

"Why compete when you can bet? New users get a 100 yuan bonus..."

Zhang Yu felt speechless.

_Fucking gambling ads are being promoted right here at the venue? I guess if everyone does it, it's not considered chaos, right?_

Seeing this, Bai Zhenzhen immediately snatched the flyer away, stared at Zhang Yu, and said, "Yu-boy, you can't touch this."

Zhang Yu said, "I think I have a pretty good shot at the top ten. If I placed a bet..."

Bai Zhenzhen's expression turned serious. "How much do you plan to bet? What if you lose?"

Zhang Yu replied, "The probability of winning is very high..."

Bai Zhenzhen continued, "If you win, the problem is even bigger. Your entire perspective on money will change. Because you've won once, you'll always want to win again."

As a Songyang City native, Bai Zhenzhen had seen too many people ruined by gambling.

She had even seen news reports about immortals who had gambled away their entire fortunes.

She continued to persuade him, "I'm afraid you'll get used to relying on this and end up betting yourself away."

"Yu-boy, you really can't touch it."

With a slight tremor of her palm, Bai Zhenzhen turned the flyer to dust.

Zhang Yu took a deep breath, circulating the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra to suppress the stray thoughts in his mind. 

"You're right, Zhen. I was being greedy. I really shouldn't touch this stuff."

Zhang Yu understood the logic perfectly well. It was just that the immense financial pressure had momentarily tempted him with greed.

A moment later, a burst of music signaled the official start of the Mana Competition.

One by one, drones controlled by soul cultivator students flew out, delivering the props needed for this trial.

As the crowd watched the competition items being placed in the arena, successive gasps of surprise erupted.

"They're flying swords!"

"Are we supposed to ride them? Such a difficult test for the first trial? Previous competitions have never tested flying swords!"

"It's over, it's over! I've never used a flying sword before!"

The host walked up to a flying sword that was floating in mid-air and announced, "From the Nine Heavens, sword-light descends—one strike shakes Kunxi! We thank the lethally effective Nine Heavens Flying Sword company for its joint sponsorship of this Mana Competition."

_Holy shit!_

Zhang Yu cursed internally. _A flying sword manufacturer sponsors the event, so you bastards make the Mana Competition about flying swords? Utterly shameless. By that logic, if the Joyful Union Sect were the sponsor, would you test dual cultivation? Go on, I dare you!_

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 44: Flying Sword

Zhang Yu could tell at a glance that the flying swords on the field were a completely different beast from the children's flying sword his predecessor had once bought; they were obviously not something one could master casually.

Confronted with the murmurs of discontent from the entire audience, the host's expression remained unchanged as he finished reciting the advertisement, then proceeded to announce the rules for the first round of the competition.

The flying swords currently floating on the field were products of the Nine Heavens Flying Sword company, a type of civilian-grade mana flying sword.

It was claimed that one needed no training in any sword-wielding arts, required no minimum Dao heart level, and could control the flying sword simply through variations in mana output, testing one's ability to control a flying sword with mana.

The scabbard of this flying sword acted as a remote control and mana transmitter. By varying the frequency, type, and magnitude of the inputted mana, one could control the flying sword.

The specific content of this round was for the competing students to use the flying swords to strike signal plates dancing in mid-air; the faster the speed and the more precise the force, the higher the score.

The total score for this round, just like the upcoming second and third rounds, was 100 points.

Ultimately, the final rankings of this Mana Competition would be determined by the sum of the scores from all three rounds.

As the operating manuals for the flying swords were distributed, the students were given half an hour to study.

Behind the White Dragon High School team, a middle-aged man in a tracksuit smiled faintly and said, "So it's still a test of mana control, then? At least it's not too outrageous. I thought we were going to have to learn sword-wielding arts on the spot."

This was White Dragon High School’s competition coach, a man named Han Xingye.

Unlike Songyang High School, where mana class teachers served as competition advisors, White Dragon High School had teachers who specialized in competitions.

Hearing Han Xingye's words, Song Hailong, who stood beside him, touched his own sky-high hair and said casually, "This is the first competition for our year."

"Coach, help me take a look and see if there are any noteworthy opponents here, especially the quality of this year's students from Purple Cloud and Red Pagoda."

As the three most powerful high schools in Songyang City, if nothing unexpected happened, many of the opponents White Dragon High School, Purple Cloud High School, and Red Pagoda High School would be competing against for the next three years were likely present on this field.

Han Xingye readily agreed to Song Hailong's request.

Aside from Song Hailong's outstanding academic performance, it was, of course, due to his status as someone from an unquestionably wealthy family.

This chosen scion from one of Songyang City’s great families was a descendant who ranked at the top of his family's KPIs, and could be called the ace of his generation in the Song family.

Han Xingye nodded, his fingertips swiping repeatedly across his Talisman Tome, and in the next moment, accompanied by a burst of mana output, he had already activated the Heaven's Eye Talisman.

This Heaven's Eye Talisman was a spell to respectfully request the God of Celestial Knowledge and Myriad Questions from the Department of the People to evaluate the individuals he saw.

This evaluation gathered a person's comprehensive and vague profile based on all-encompassing data, from bank deposits and personal assets to school grades, work performance, and family relationships.

Disliked the vagueness and wanted more detail, more specifics? Then one would need a higher faith level and would have to spend more money.

In short, the efficacy of the Heaven's Eye Talisman was simple: the more detailed, the more expensive; the more vague, the cheaper.

As Han Xingye looked out over the entire venue, he naturally didn't dare to check any detailed evaluations. He was afraid a single glance would bankrupt him, knowing full well that such things were not without precedent in the history of Kunxu.

The moment the Heaven's Eye Talisman activated, a cloud of golden light particles converged into Han Xingye's eyes.

As he looked across the entire scene, he could see different evaluations appearing above each person's head.

Not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning.

Not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning, bankrupt gambling addict, not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning.

Not worth mentioning, Ice-Skinned and Jade-Boned (Expand Details), not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning.

"Hm?"

Han Xingye's gaze shifted as he noticed that a female student from Purple Cloud High School had actually leaped up into the spectator stands.

"Is that Le Mulan from Purple Cloud? Why did she climb up there? Is she looking at the competition's signal plates?"

He looked closer, and the evaluation above her head immediately expanded.

Ice-Skinned and Jade-Boned | Booster Fiend | High Caste | Purple Cloud Loyalist | Untouchable Beauty

He was an old hand with the Heaven's Eye Talisman, after all, and though the terms were a bit complex at first glance, Han Xingye pondered the vague evaluations for a moment and quickly pieced together their probable meaning.

"She's a high-quality, wealthy individual with a special constitution, a high tolerance for boosters, excellent grades, unwavering loyalty to Purple Cloud High School, and a complex background."

"Boosters? Constitution?"

Han Xingye grew thoughtful, sending the keywords to Song Hailong before turning his attention to the others present.

Just as he was sizing up the students on the field, the competition officially began.

The venue was divided into eighteen sub-arenas, and in each round, eighteen contestants were randomly drawn to take the stage, controlling flying swords in their respective arenas to shoot at the signal plates in mid-air.

In Han Xingye's eyes, a stream of 'not worth mentioning' students from ordinary high schools took the stage. They were like fumbling rookies, clumsily operating the flying swords, and doing well to hit even one or two of the mid-air signal plates, earning them a mere 10 or 20 points from the judges.

"Looks like none of them have ever used a flying sword before, have they?"

Han Xingye knew that although this round was nominally a test of mana control, prior experience with flying swords made all the difference.

Especially when it came to the control of space, distance, accuracy, and speed. A first-timer, no matter how strong their mana control, would likely struggle to achieve a high score.

But for the students of the three great academies, playing with flying swords was hardly a rare experience.

For instance, among the ten students from his White Dragon High School competing this time, each of their families owned at least four or five flying swords.

He even knew that Song Hailong's family possessed an entire sword vault containing hundreds of flying swords, and he had surely lost count of how many times he had handled them.

At the same time, besides the endless stream of 'not worth mentioning' individuals, students with 'Rare' and 'Elite' evaluations began to appear on stage in Han Xingye's Heaven's Eye Talisman vision.

Han Xingye knew these were typically the top students from ordinary high schools or the elite students from key high schools.

"Getting 30 or 40 points would be impressive enough for them."

"Their mana control is weak to begin with, and they've never used a flying sword. If it weren't for the genuinely good quality of the Nine Heavens flying swords, they probably couldn't even hit a single signal plate._

At this thought, Han Xingye felt a flicker of temptation, wondering if he should buy a Nine Heavens mana flying sword for himself.

Just then, his gaze shifted slightly, and amidst the crowd of 'not worth mentioning,' 'rare,' and 'elite,' he finally spotted a different evaluation.

Pure-hearted Score-Grubber

Han Xingye looked at the student's uniform; it appeared to be someone from Songyang High School.

In the arena, Qian Shen took a deep breath and slowly gripped the scabbard of the flying sword before him.

The next moment, as he channeled a stream of mana into it, the flying sword shot out of the sheath with a _swoosh_.

The flying sword was all blade, with no hilt, and it soared skyward like a streak of cold light, heading for the signal plates in mid-air.

Although he hadn't used one much, Qian Shen had tried his grandfather's mana flying sword a few times.

Following the techniques his family tutor had taught him, he now slowly infused mana into the scabbard, controlling the flying sword by altering the rhythm of the mana flow, striking one signal plate after another with a series of swooshes.

72 points.

Seeing his score for this round, Qian Shen breathed a small sigh of relief.

"Not bad, that should be an acceptable result."

On the other side, Han Xingye glanced at the score of 72 and secretly shook his head.

"Sigh, Songyang High School is an old, key high school, yet the quality of its students declines with each passing year."

"In the end, they're just complacent, unwilling to learn from the advanced methods of other schools, like Purple Cloud High School's score-caste system or our school's low-score slavery system. Their teaching methods never innovate, so how can they possibly keep up with the times…"

Just as Han Xingye was thinking this, he saw another contestant with a special evaluation appear.

In his eyes, Lian Tianji from Purple Cloud High School walked onto the stage with the words 'Son of Heavenly Diligence' above his head, and with a flick of his arm, he sent the flying sword out, swiftly racking up 90 points.

"That seems to be Lian Tianji, the one in Purple Cloud High School's current year who is the best match for the Heavenly Diligence Art."

As more and more contestants took their turns, Han Xingye's eyes roamed the venue, and he began to see an increasing number of exceptional students.

A 'Son of the School Director' from Songyang High School had just appeared, scoring 78 points.

Le Mulan, the 'Ice-Skinned and Jade-Boned' from Purple Cloud High School, created a sensation the moment she appeared, scoring a staggering 95 points, the highest so far, drawing gasps of amazement from the entire audience.

As Han Xingye's gaze swept the area, a particular woman suddenly caught his attention.

Sword Freak (Expand Details)

"Oh? A student from Songyang High School?"

Han Xingye watched Bai Zhenzhen walk onto the stage. He knew that individuals with an 'expandable' tag usually had complex backgrounds, indicating extraordinary origins, strength, or talent, but he had never expected to find one among the students of Songyang High School.

His gaze narrowed slightly, and he saw a line of text expand above Bai Zhenzhen's head.

Sword Freak | Fist Freak | Palm Freak | Blade Freak | Spear Freak | Booster Freak | Score Tyrant | Loan Slave | Card Slave | Proponent of Daoist arts' Uselessness | Songyang Hater | She is very poor...

Looking at the evaluation that was too long to be read in a single breath, Han Xingye was profoundly shocked.

He never thought he would find himself shocked while looking at a student from Songyang High School, and for the sole reason that her profile was just too complex, far beyond that of an ordinary person.

The next moment, however, his shock subsided slightly, simply because her score was 34 points.

"I don't know why the evaluation is so long, but judging from that score, this woman is not worth mentioning."

Soon, his attention was drawn to Song Hailong.

Before this top student from White Dragon High School took the stage, he removed the towering mass of long hair from his head.

Zhang Yu, who was watching this scene, was astonished.

"What the hell! He's already bald in high school?"

Bai Zhenzhen returned to the rest area with a sullen expression on her face, and hearing Zhang Yu's surprised exclamation, she pointed and explained, "That's not a wig, it's an external spiritual root."

"An external spiritual root?" Zhang Yu recalled that such a thing existed, but this was the first time he had ever seen one in person.

Bai Zhenzhen said with envy, "This isn't like those outdated spiritual roots at school. This kind of external spiritual root is plug-and-play, you can swap it out whenever you want. Yu-boy, you better remember this, it's the birthday present I want most."

Zhang Yu patted Zhen's shoulder comfortingly.

"I can't afford an external spiritual root, but I can definitely help you with the baldness and the wig."

Bai Zhenzhen rolled her eyes, then continued to stare intently at the hairpiece Song Hailong had placed on a chair, contemplating the possibility of snatching it.

But after a look at the surrounding students and teachers, she could only let out a long sigh.

After Song Hailong took the stage, he felt the mana circulating within him as if it were an extension of his own limbs, and a faint smile touched his lips.

_Equipping a spiritual root to enhance mana, to make it surge dramatically?_

_Such a peasant's way of thinking._

Song Hailong had only one purpose for equipping an external spiritual root: to train his mana control during the more turbulent processes of breathing exercises for spiritual energy and mana refinement.

_Only the weak worry about losing control over a mana surge brought on by spiritual energy. For a powerhouse like me, it's the perfect training opportunity._

He gripped the scabbard in one hand, and with a release of mana from his palm, the flying sword shot out like a bolt of lightning.

From the sidelines, Han Xingye watched his student on the field wield the flying sword as if it were a bolt of lightning, instantly racking up 100 points to become the new highest scorer in the venue, a proud expression spreading across his face.

_100 points is only because the maximum score is 100._

_With the sheer volume of Song Hailong's mana, the intensity of his mana control, and his mastery of the flying sword, he was held back by the score limit in this round._

Meanwhile, after Bai Zhenzhen returned to the rest area, Teacher Yan's gaze frequently swept over her.

_Bai Zhenzhen only started practicing for the Mana Competition recently, didn't she? Her rate of improvement is remarkably fast. Is it talent? Or just a fluke?_

In Teacher Yan's eyes, however, Bai Zhenzhen's talent in mana was ultimately no match for Zhang Yu's.

A few moments later, when Zhang Yu took the stage, she found herself looking forward to his performance as well.

On the field, Zhang Yu gently gripped the scabbard. As he fed mana into it bit by bit, he could feel the flying sword within begin to tremble slightly.

Just moments ago, while offstage, Zhang Yu had been contemplating how he could possibly score as high as possible.

His current situation felt as if he had perfectly nimble, unimpaired hands, and someone walked up to him and said: "Oh? You have strong finger control? Let me test you. Use this excavator to open a bottle cap, and we'll see just how good your finger control really is."

_What the hell, another unjust and unfair competition where the rich have an absolute advantage._

Zhang Yu complained silently in his heart.

_This flying sword feels like a drone, or maybe a racing drone. Even if my mana control is exquisite, since I've never used one of these before, there's no way I can control it with any real skill._

The thought of having to maneuver this flying sword back and forth to hit those palm-sized signal plates in mid-air felt incredibly difficult to Zhang Yu.

_So, I can't treat it like a traditional flying sword…_

(End of Chapter)

## A Chat About the New Book, Seeking Your Continued Support

Let's have a chat about the new book, and I’d like to ask for your continued support in reading along.

The new book has been out for nearly a month now, and so many readers are enjoying it. As the author, I am incredibly happy—so happy that I wish I could keep my phone in my pocket to check it all day long.

The initial inspiration for this book likely stems from Cyberpunk. However, I have always felt a certain disconnect with Western Cyberpunk content. What I wanted to write was *Immortal Dao* Cyberpunk, similar to the difference between standard Cthulhu and Chinese-style Cthulhu.

Some veteran readers might know that I started attempting something similar as far back as three books ago, in *Tribulation of Tomorrow*. However, at that time, my understanding of Cyberpunk was quite superficial—consisting merely of cool equipment, prosthetics usable by everyone, and mass-produced combat power.

I can only say that the Cyber elements back then were merely fashion accessories in my book, serving only as embellishments.

By the time of the book before the last one, *Talisman of the Old Days*, I tried incorporating content regarding loans and debt repayment within the cultivation system. I attempted to construct a loop of interests with a stronger Cyber style, which finally established a bit of a genuine *Immortal Dao* Cyber atmosphere. However, my skill was still lacking, and my understanding was insufficient, so I failed to capture the specific *Immortal Dao* Cyber flavor I wanted.

Then came my previous book, *I Said I Could Turn Back Time*, where I directly depicted the Immortal World as a Cyber Immortal World. Unfortunately, due to inconsistent styles between the beginning and end, combined with my poor health and the protagonist becoming too overpowered, I couldn't properly flesh out that Immortal World, and the story ended hastily.

Now, after several years of accumulation, I have a much deeper understanding of the *Immortal Dao* Cyber flavor I desire. I feel that I can finally write a unique and interesting novel.

As more and more readers flood in, this book has shifted from being purely for my own interest to something that carries a growing sense of responsibility. Reading the words you leave behind every day makes me feel that I must not let down the profound love shown by so many readers.

However, this book is truly difficult to write. Because the worldview and the characters' mindsets are quite unique, I constantly need to shift my mindset to keep writing. Sometimes, as I write... I unknowingly slip into "normal" thinking and make the plot too conventional. I then have to delete and rewrite; for instance, I just deleted two chapters.

Coupled with the fact that the worldview needs constant deduction and development, I can never write fast enough... *laughing-crying face*.

Finally, I want to say, dear readers, that you all display magical prowess in the chapter comments. Your stunning brilliance is truly at the peak of perfection, putting people like me to shame.

I have felt the talent and passion rushing toward me. To repay this enthusiasm, I have decided to postpone the premium launch date (originally scheduled for December 1st) and provide more free chapters as a bonus. I simply want to do better! ~(＾◇^)/

I hope you will continue to support and follow the story. Your readership and chapter comments are the driving force behind this book's progress! Please also recommend it to your friends and bring them along to take a look at Kunxu.

Ladies and gentlemen of talent, let me see your limits!

Please keep up with the daily updates! Please keep up with the daily updates! Please keep up with the daily updates!

# Chapter 45: Purple Cloud Supplements

A sharp, piercing shriek of friction cut through the air of the stadium.

Zhang Yu's palm was held high, and upon it rested the flying sword, spinning at an incredible speed like the rotor of a helicopter.

_I choose you! Spiral shuriken!_

The next moment, he expelled a breath of mana, and the spinning flying sword shot out like a colossal disc, sweeping from low to high toward the signal plates hanging in midair.

...

Ascetic (expand details)

As Han Xingye’s attention focused on the expanded text above Zhang Yu’s head, he saw a long string of words.

Ascetic | Athlete | Extremely Impoverished Resident of Songyang City | Debt-Slave | Card-Slave | ???

After seeing the string of evaluations above Zhang Yu’s head through the Heaven's Eye Talisman, Han Xingye was stunned for the second time that day.

"Songyang High School again?"

"Where in the world did they recruit their talent this year?"

The preceding “Ascetic” and “Athlete” were easy enough to understand. It simply meant he was diligent and self-disciplined in his training, as well as being athletically gifted.

The following three evaluations were also simple to grasp, summing up to just two words: poor man.

But it was the final three question marks that truly shocked Han Xingye.

"Question marks?"

"A concealment talisman? A disguise talisman?"

If there was a Heaven’s Eye Talisman that could inspect one’s status, there were naturally countermeasures to balance it, such as concealment or disguise talismans.

But firstly, how could such a poor person afford to use talismans?

And secondly, Han Xingye had never seen anyone use a concealment or disguise talisman only to deliberately create this “???” effect; wasn't that just blatantly advertising that you were hiding something?

"These three question marks… how arrogant."

Arrogance and poverty, two words that should not belong together, were what Han Xingye simultaneously perceived from the text above Zhang Yu's head.

Thus, he grew curious about Zhang Yu's performance.

Then, he saw it—the flying sword that spun to life and soared into the sky like a disc.

Han Xingye's gaze sharpened as he watched the rapidly spinning flying sword stir up cyclones of air, sweeping through the signal plates like a full moon, a trace of astonishment crossing his face.

Then he began to laugh.

"Heh, that certainly is an easier way to hit the signal plates. By turning it into a disc, he can sweep through all of them in just a few passes, compensating for his lack of experience in sword manipulation."

80 points

Han Xingye was nodding slightly at the score when he heard numerous students cry out in protest, complaining that Zhang Yu had cheated or violated the rules.

Han Xingye’s eyes swept over them.

_Not worth mentioning, rare, not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning..._

Looking at the disgruntled students, Han Xingye curled his lip and thought, _A bunch of fools._

_To make a flying sword spin like that while maintaining control, preventing it from flying off and crashing wildly, requires incredibly fine mana control._

_This mana flying sword was designed for straight-line trajectories. To make it rotate like that, he would have had to constantly alter the rhythm of his mana input every single instant._

_That kid used his formidable mana control to make up for his lack of experience in sword handling._

_Eighty points isn't high at all; if anything, it’s too low._

_The judges probably took the sponsors into account and didn't want to encourage this kind of technique._

Han Xingye glanced over at Purple Cloud High and Red Pagoda High. Sure enough, not a single student from the three great schools voiced any opposition. It was clear they could all see the difficulty involved.

In the subsequent matches, some competitors tried to imitate Zhang Yu’s method, but every one of them failed, sending their flying swords careening off course.

Thankfully, the referees were watching closely, preventing any injuries.

At this point, the many students who had initially protested gradually came to realize that Zhang Yu’s spinning sword technique was anything but simple.

On his way back, Zhang Yu lamented internally, _This flying sword really isn't built for this kind of maneuver. My mana could have pushed the tempo even faster, but the sheath’s command reception frequency was at its limit. Otherwise, my score could have been higher._

Evidently, the high-speed rotation was still well within the limits of the mana control he had honed through the tenth level of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, but it had reached the design limits of the flying sword itself, which had never been intended for such use.

The moment Zhang Yu returned to the Songyang High School rest area, he was immediately met with praise from Teacher Yan.

"Zhang Yu, you did very well. Using mana control to compensate for your lack of sword handling skills—that score of eighty was too low."

"As for the complaints from those underachievers from ordinary high schools, just treat them like air. Don't pay them any mind."

Teacher Yan thought about Zhang Yu's score, inwardly delighted.

_If the next two rounds have events that play more to his strengths, could he perhaps squeeze into the top ten?_

Only the top ten in the Mana Competition's overall score would receive prize money and an official ranking, something that would be useful in university interviews. The high school’s valuation of such an achievement would be completely different.

The thought of her year-end bonus increasing if Zhang Yu actually managed to break into the top ten sent Teacher Yan's spirits soaring.

She casually pointed to the student with the lowest score from this round and said, "Bai Zhenzhen, go get a bottle of water for Zhang Yu. Zhang Yu, don't be nervous for the next two rounds, just perform at your normal level..."

Bai Zhenzhen’s eyes widened. She shot a glance at the snickering Zhang Yu beside her and could only stand up reluctantly to go fetch water from the organizers.

"Wait, Zhen, let me take a picture."

"You wanna die, Zhang Yu?"

Bai Zhenzhen hurled the water bottle at his head and sat down in a huff.

_Damn it all, I should have just left before the competition started._

_What a load of crap, this Mana Competition. It's just a game for rich people._

_You'd better make it into the top ten, Yu-boy, or else I'll..._

Not far away, He Dayou looked at Zhang Yu's score, a flicker of surprise in his eyes.

_His mana control is that incredible? Good thing... good thing he's a poor ghost._

Soon after, the first event concluded completely. The host returned to the stage, smiling broadly as he announced, "For good boosters, choose Purple Cloud. Wholehearted, for all ages, Purple Cloud Supplements. One dose cures all ills. We thank the Purple Cloud Company for their joint sponsorship of this Mana Competition."

"All first-aid drugs for the upcoming second round will be sponsored by the Purple Cloud Company..."

As he spoke, the host began to announce the rules for the second event.

This round would test the ability to neutralize specialized mana.

The process involved attaching sensor patches to the competitors, after which a judge would inject a stream of specialized mana. The competitor would then be timed on how long it took them to neutralize it; the shorter the time, the higher the score.

If more than ten minutes passed, or if a competitor felt they could not endure it, they could immediately take a mana-dispelling drug sponsored by the Purple Cloud Company to eliminate the specialized mana from their system.

In addition, the Purple Cloud Company had set up temporary stalls all around the venue, selling various drugs that the competitors might need.

The reason the Purple Cloud Company was selling drugs here was because of another rule for this second round.

In this round, taking drugs was permitted.

Zhang Yu was stunned.

_What the hell! Are you people even human? You’re encouraging drug use in a competition just to earn sponsorship money from the Purple Cloud Company?_

At the same time, Zhang Yu saw his classmates from Songyang High School begin to pull out their own supplies.

Painkillers, tranquilizers, focus enhancers... watching them take out their three-piece sets, Zhang Yu suddenly realized they had come prepared.

Beside him, Teacher Yan asked with concern, "Zhang Yu, did you bring your drugs?"

"Remember to take them before it starts."

Taking drugs during a competition... this seemed perfectly normal to Teacher Yan.

Afraid of pain and itching, chew a painkiller. Lacking willpower, drink a tranquilizer. Worried about losing focus while circulating your technique, down a bottle of focus enhancer...

In short... to be a dragon on the field, you had to stay drugged off the field.

This was competition.

To compete was to take drugs!

Mana competitions had always been a favorite sponsorship target for pharmaceutical companies, so there was usually at least one round where competitors were allowed to use drugs, as long as they were on the organizer's approved list. This was something the referees and soul cultivator assistants would be supervising and inspecting.

Therefore, taking drugs was a part of the competition, even a reflection of a high school's resources.

Seeing Zhang Yu's dumbfounded expression, Teacher Yan sighed and opened her bag.

"Look at you, coming to a competition without even preparing your drugs?"

"Good thing I brought a spare set."

With that, Teacher Yan pulled out various bottles and jars from her bag, pouring out a few doses and handing them to Zhang Yu.

Facing Teacher Yan's loving and concerned gaze, Zhang Yu had no choice but to accept the drugs.

_Crap! This body can't take drugs, can it?_

The original Zhang Yu had ruined his health by taking drugs, and the memory terrified the current Zhang Yu into never touching them, at most using some neural fillers to reduce his need for sleep.

Coupled with his own astonishing talent and massive debt, he never had any intention of carelessly taking drugs.

Although he wasn't sure if his current body would have problems with these substances, he certainly had no intention of taking the risk.

_Taking all these drugs for a mere competition... I'm afraid the life I gain from cultivation won't be enough to offset the cost._

But feeling Teacher Yan's expectant gaze on him, he could only force a smile and nod, thinking, _I'll just pretend to take them in the bathroom later._

Meanwhile, the entire stadium had transformed into a drug exhibition.

In the Purple Cloud High School rest area, Lian Tianji abruptly tossed a large handful of pills into his mouth, followed by a big gulp of water to wash them all down.

The coach beside him watched as his face gradually turned reddish-purple and nodded.

"Good. You're entering your competition state."

After speaking, he took out a wooden box from his bag.

As the box opened, ten syringes glowing with a faint purple light were revealed to everyone.

The coach announced, "This is the Meridian Expansion Injection from the Purple Cloud Labs. It will temporarily widen your body's meridians as it circulates through your blood, accelerating your technique circulation efficiency in a moment."

"One shot per person, no fighting over them."

After watching each student administer their injection, he rallied them, "Everyone must hold out until the very end. Our total score isn't far behind White Dragon High. We must catch up in this round!"

"ROAR!"

Having just taken their drugs and injections, the students felt an infinite fighting spirit surge within them and let out a deafening roar.

In the Red Pagoda High School rest area.

The coach was holding a panda-like demon-kin student, scooping up handfuls from a nearby bag of veterinary drugs.

"Bufan, have some more. We're at the bottom of the three great schools right now. If the second round goes like this too, my year-end bonus is finished."

The little panda, Xiong Bufan, raised a paw and gave him the middle finger.

"Enough!"

"Stop feeding me!"

"Mmph... you bastard... stop feeding me!"

On the other side, in the White Dragon High School rest area.

Song Hailong swallowed a large handful of drugs, then looked toward the Purple Cloud High School section in the distance.

Hearing the roars coming from their direction, he snorted coldly.

"In a little while, I will personally crush all of your fighting spirit."

At that moment, Coach Han Xingye walked over carrying a thermos.

"This is the Spirit Recovery Needle, specially prepared for you by the school," he said to the group. "Inject it into your dantian. Hurry up and get one."

As the thermos opened, a wave of cold air washed over them, revealing two rows of fluorescent syringes.

Song Hailong grinned, and as the student with the number 1 printed on his uniform, he was the first to pick one up.

The other students around them followed suit according to the numbers on their chests, taking the syringes from the thermos and plunging the needles into their dantian.

Students from other schools watched this scene with immense envy.

"Is that the Spirit Recovery Needle? It's concentrated spiritual energy essence that can rapidly restore mana. Are they planning to replenish their mana while simultaneously neutralizing the specialized mana during the event?"

Another student's face was full of jealousy. "A Spirit Recovery Needle to the dantian, my fate is mine and not for the heavens to decide. Sigh... I wonder if I'll ever be able to afford one in my lifetime."

Just then, a commotion erupted from a corner of the stadium.

A student, foaming at the mouth and convulsing, was carried out, sparking a wave of discussion.

One student lamented, "An overdose?"

A teacher scoffed, "There's no such thing as an overdose, only insufficient drug resistance. They still need more training!"

Another teacher clapped his hands, urging, "Stop minding other people's business! Focus on the competition!"

As everyone's preparations gradually concluded, the second event officially began.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 46: The Mountain

One by one, detection patches were pressed onto the students' arms.

A judge then lightly touched a finger to each student’s arm, slowly infusing a stream of specialized mana.

Simultaneously, on the panel of the detection patch, numbers jumped with the injection of mana, rising from 0.5 to 1.3, then to 2.4… continuing until they finally stopped at 5.

This represented that the judge had infused a total of five units of specialized mana into the student's arm.

During this infusion process, the judge was exceedingly cautious, terrified of making a mistake and accidentally killing the student.

Even if it was a student from an ordinary high school, injuring or killing them would require compensation; prices varied, high and low, depending on their pedigree.

If it happened to be a student under contract, the compensation would be even more expensive.

After all, it wasn't unheard of for news to break about the battle aftershocks from a Foundation Establishment expert accidentally killing a bystander, only to discover it was over a dozen genius third-year high school students in whom fortunes had been invested, leading to a final compensation—calculated from training fees, living expenses, tuition, tutoring fees, sterilization fees…—that bankrupted the expert.

And in the few seconds of the mana infusion, the student's body abruptly tensed and their breathing grew heavy; their system was clearly already being affected by the specialized mana.

Even if no one actively triggered this specialized mana to attack, its mere presence within the body would inherently cause a certain amount of damage.

Fortunately, the student had taken a painkiller. Though there was some discomfort, it had not yet reached an unbearable level.

As the infused mana reached 5, the detection patch's panel began to time, recording how long the student would take to dispel this specialized mana; the shorter the time, the higher the score.

Because the time at which each student was infused with specialized mana differed, they naturally couldn't be ranked by who finished first, but rather by their own individually recorded times.

After stopping the mana infusion, the judge took a capsule from an assistant.

He popped the capsule into his mouth and, with a smile, spoke to the camera before him.

"For mana replenishment, choose Purple Cloud. After taking one of Purple Cloud’s Spirit-Gathering Capsules, my mana has been rapidly restored. Infusing another fifty students will be no problem at all."

Just like that, as the competition began, several judges injected specialized mana into the students' arms one after another.

More and more contestants began to close their eyes and circulate their techniques, focusing wholeheartedly on dispelling the specialized mana that had invaded their bodies. The entire venue grew quieter and quieter, until gradually only the sound of breathing exercises remained.

From the moment that ball of specialized mana was infused by the judge, Zhang Yu felt a fire burning in his right arm, a fire that grew fiercer and more incandescent as the mana continued to pour in.

A sharp, stabbing pain traveled incessantly from his arm to his brain, making Zhang Yu understand why so many contestants had taken painkillers.

Right now, for instance, the pain made him want to smash his fist into the face of the old judge still infusing him with specialized mana.

_Damn it, no wonder I saw someone selling insurance earlier. It’s way too easy to get injured in this event._

Hurriedly activating the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra, Zhang Yu finally felt the unbearable pain gradually weaken.

He then marshaled the mana within his dantian, sending it surging toward his right arm.

_The invasion is from a heat-aspected specialized mana._

_That means I need to counter it with a cold-aspected mana._

Zhang Yu recalled the mana conversion pathway Teacher Yan had taught him, circulating the mana in his dantian and transforming it into a current of frigid mana that rushed toward his right arm.

Wherever this frigid mana passed, a cooling sensation spread through his body, as if a bucket of ice water had been poured over him.

And when Zhang Yu’s frigid mana collided with the invading heat-aspected mana, he could feel the scorching temperature in his arm begin to drop.

But in the process, his own frigid mana was rapidly consumed, like using a bucket of water to douse a fire; although the flames diminished, the water was also gone.

Zhang Yu could only do his best to convert more mana to extinguish the fire.

Fortunately, he had the full-body mana circulation of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to constantly restore his mana, the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra to stabilize his mind, and his powerful mana control to continuously convert frigid mana.

…

A short time earlier.

Before the judge had reached the Songyang High School section.

Within the White Dragon High School competition area.

Han Xingye glanced at Song Hailong, who was dispelling the specialized mana in his body, then looked toward the large screen up ahead and thought, _It should be soon, right?_

Within Song Hailong's body, his mana was currently like a great river, flowing inexhaustibly toward the ball of scorching mana in his right arm.

The Spirit Recovery Needle ceaselessly restored his mana, and combined with his own astonishing reserves, it allowed him to unleash his mana without restraint, even enveloping the entire ball of scorching mana in an attempt to extinguish it in a single breath.

During the mana-dispelling process, all sensations of pain were suppressed by drugs to the point of near nonexistence, leaving Song Hailong to feel almost nothing amiss; he only needed to focus on the task at hand.

_With my mana reserves and my control over mana, who in this round can possibly be faster than me?_

Just then, a cry for help rang out across the field.

A student was seen letting out a muffled groan as he collapsed to the ground, and people immediately rushed over to feed him a mana-dispelling drug.

"It's fine, he just ran out of mana. He's already been given a mana-dispelling drug."

A moment later, another student let out a blood-curdling scream and fell, vomiting a large mouthful of blood.

This was a case of poor execution while dispelling the mana, causing the specialized mana to scatter throughout the body and inflict internal injuries.

Han Xingye glanced in the direction of the fallen student.

_Not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning, not worth mentioning…_

He knew that more and more students from ordinary high schools would likely be unable to hold on, whether due to insufficient mana reserves, a lack of mana control, or because their drugs were of poor quality… they would be eliminated one by one.

He paid it no mind.

_Do they think they can close the gap just by taking drugs alongside us?_

_With everyone taking drugs, the gap between the ordinary high schools and the three great schools will only grow wider…_

Just as he was thinking this, the large screen in front of him suddenly flashed, and a name appeared.

White Dragon High School, Song Hailong, 1:29

Seeing this, Han Xingye gave a slight smile, "Oh? Faster than he was at school. It seems the atmosphere here has hyped him up."

Next, name after name began to appear on the large screen, quickly filling up ten rows.

The screen only displayed the top ten names.

The names on the screen shifted back and forth, the rankings from second to tenth in constant flux, yet Song Hailong's name remained firmly planted at the very top, as if he alone was suppressing all the other students at the venue.

But soon, more and more names began to lock into place, the changes from the second to the tenth rows gradually ceasing.

The crowd stared in shock at the ten unchanging names, and soon a student discovered an obvious fact, "These ten people… are all students from White Dragon High School!"

Although White Dragon High School wasn't among the first batch of contestants to be infused with mana, following Song Hailong's ascent to the top, its students had also dispelled the specialized mana in their bodies one after another and, based on their various completion times… had swept the top ten spots on the leaderboard.

Teacher Yan gazed at the ten static names on the large screen, feeling as if a mountain had just risen to block Songyang High School's path.

"Sigh, the three great schools… In the end, this kind of competition truly is their domain."

Just then, the names from second to ninth place suddenly shifted down one spot; a newcomer had charged into second place in one fell swoop.

Red Pagoda High School, Xiong Bufan, 1:35

The students of Red Pagoda High School were also beginning to finish dispelling the specialized mana in their bodies.

Not long after Xiong Bufan claimed second place, two more students from Red Pagoda High School squeezed into the top ten.

Han Xingye turned his head toward the Red Pagoda High School section and, within the vision of his Heaven's Eye Talisman, immediately found the most conspicuous thing.

Protected Zone | Drug Barrel | High-Speed Mana

The "Protected Zone" evaluation was easy to understand; Han Xingye guessed this monster must have come from a demon-kin protected zone.

_High-Speed Mana…_ Han Xingye wasn't quite sure about that one, but "Drug Barrel" he understood perfectly.

_How many drugs did they stuff into this monster?_

_Damn it, are they secretly using monsters for drug experiments?_

_That monster's body must be full of illegal drugs. I should really report you people._

_What? Our school does it too? And on humans?_

_Well, in that case, forget it._

Although Xiong Bufan's performance brought great prestige to Red Pagoda High School, he hadn't claimed first place, and the leaderboard was still dominated by White Dragon High School.

But a moment later, the top nine students all dropped down one place again.

As Le Mulan of Purple Cloud High School’s name appeared out of nowhere in first place, it was as if a great roar sounded through the air.

Purple Cloud High School, Le Mulan, 00:25

"Twenty-five seconds!"

Cries of astonishment erupted from more and more students.

They found it impossible to imagine that while they were still struggling for their lives against the foreign mana in their bodies, someone had managed to dispel it in a mere twenty-five seconds.

Was she even human?

Everyone could imagine that Le Mulan was guaranteed a perfect score of 100 in this second round, but in truth, she was being limited by that 100-point ceiling; otherwise, the gap between her and the others would have been even greater.

This was Han Xingye's third shock of the day.

He frowned at the words "Ice-Skinned and Jade-Boned" above Le Mulan's head, thinking that her ability to dispel the foreign mana so quickly must be related to some special constitution.

Not far away, Song Hailong showed no sign of anger. Instead, he looked toward the Purple Cloud High School section and laughed heartily, "Interesting, interesting! It seems my greatest rival for the next three years of high school will be this Le Mulan."

A full minute later, the other students from Purple Cloud High School finally dispelled the foreign mana in their bodies, with Lian Tianji and one other also making it into the top ten.

Ultimately, the top three spots were occupied by Le Mulan, Song Hailong, and Xiong Bufan, respectively.

The top ten on the list was completely carved up by four students from White Dragon High School, three from Purple Cloud High School, and three from Red Pagoda High School.

Looking at the ranking, which no longer showed the slightest change, a sense of gloom fell over the many high school students at the venue.

For most of them, this was the first time they had truly experienced the gap between themselves and the three great schools.

The ten names and their scores on the screen were like a great mountain pressing down on them, displaying a chasm-like disparity between the three great schools and everyone else.

Just then, the ranking on the large screen changed once more.

The names from fourth to tenth place all dropped down one spot.

In a situation where the three great schools held near-total dominion over the competition, someone had unexpectedly thrown a wrench in the works, forcefully charging into fourth place.

Songyang High School, Zhang Yu, 1:38

When the timer detected that Zhang Yu had dispelled the specialized mana in his body, it let out a soft beep.

But that gentle sound landed like a great stone in the hearts of the several Songyang High School students nearby.

The students from the three great schools also subconsciously glanced toward the Songyang High School section, surprised to find a student there on a level close to their own.

Teacher Yan looked at the ranking on the board and quickly pulled out her phone to snap a picture.

This was an important record of her teaching success.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 47: Contention

Inside the venue.

Following a fleet of drones, box after box of catered meals was delivered.

After the first and second rounds of the Mana Competition concluded, it was already time for lunch.

However, the many contestants eating their boxed lunches were still discussing the highlights of the two previous matches, their gazes occasionally drifting toward the scoreboard on the large screen.

But the name that had originally ranked fourth had vanished, and the top ten was once again dominated by the three elite schools: White Dragon High School, Purple Cloud High School, and Red Pagoda High School.

This was because with the official conclusion of the first and second matches, the top ten displayed on the large screen had been updated to show the top ten in total points.

Only those who entered the top ten in the Mana Competition's final overall rankings would receive prize money, a true placement, and a result that universities would recognize—something that would be useful during college interviews.

And the name that had torn open a fissure in the second match, forcing its way into fourth place, had now disappeared as if it were a phantom.

It was like a small bird trying to break through the heavens, only to be swatted back down by a great hand formed from the three elite schools.

Teacher Yan sighed inwardly.

_Zhang Yu’s score in the first flying sword match was ultimately a bit too low. It dragged him down, which is why his total score couldn't squeeze into the top ten._

But what could be done about it?

The rich had an absolute advantage when it came to wielding flying swords, and Teacher Yan couldn't blame Zhang Yu's family for not buying him a mana flying sword.

_If there's anything to blame, it’s his bad luck for running into a competition sponsored by a flying sword manufacturer._

Elsewhere, Zhang Yu looked at the lunch box in his hand, eating while complaining, "They're selling a single meal for eighty? Why don't the people from Red Pagoda High School just go rob someone?"

Just as Zhang Yu was grumbling, another lunch box was placed before him.

Zhang Yu looked up to see Teacher Yan holding it out.

Teacher Yan said kindly, "You must be exhausted after this morning. I knew you'd be hungry, so you can have this one too."

Nearby, Bai Zhenzhen watched this scene and pouted to herself. 

_How could he be hungrier than me? Yu-boy dispelled the specialized mana in a minute and a half, but I had to hold on for over eight minutes to finish. It nearly killed me._

The more Teacher Yan watched Zhang Yu devour two meals, the more pleased she grew. Such a large appetite was clearly the sign of a good student.

As for Bai Zhenzhen, Qian Shen, and He Dayou, who also had big appetites? Hah, for students with no chance of placing in a mana competition to eat so much—were they anything but useless gluttons?

Teacher Yan offered some encouragement, "You did very well this morning. Just do your best this afternoon, and don't put too much pressure on yourself."

Although Teacher Yan wished Zhang Yu would give it four hundred percent of his focus, she knew that circulating mana was not something to be rushed. A calm and peaceful mindset was crucial, or it could backfire.

Thus, fearful that placing in the second match would put too much mental pressure on Zhang Yu, she immediately came to comfort him, hoping he would compete in as relaxed a state as possible.

Inwardly, Teacher Yan couldn't help but calculate Zhang Yu's score.

_Eighty points in the first round, ninety-three in the second, for a total of 173._

She looked up at the large screen, her eyes scanning from the first-place score of 195 down to the tenth-place score of 176.

_As long as Zhang Yu can catch up by 4 points in the next round, he can make it into the top ten._

Four points might not sound like much, but Teacher Yan knew that in a highly difficult and competitive event like the Mana Competition, the higher the score, the harder every single point was to earn.

This was especially true with thirty top students from the three elite schools all vying for those top ten spots.

Thinking of this four-point gap, Teacher Yan couldn't help but feel a little tense herself.

"It all depends on what this final round will test."

Lunchtime ended quickly, and the final round of the afternoon's Mana Competition officially began.

The host walked onto the stage and began, "For martial arts, for Daoist techniques, come to Immortal Resonance! With three hundred laboratories and one hundred cultivation technique masters, they have been dedicated to Immortal Dao education for a hundred years. We thank the Immortal Resonance Education Group for sponsoring this Mana Competition…"

Immortal Resonance Group. Zhang Yu remembered that this company was affiliated with the Myriad Laws Sect. It was the same major corporation where he had worked part-time testing techniques and obtained the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

He also recalled seeing the Songyang City Director of the Immortal Resonance Group at Li Xuelian's art exhibition.

A moment later, a complex mana circulation diagram was distributed to every competing student.

This was the task for the final round of the Mana Competition: to convert one's own mana into specialized mana by following the pathways on the diagram.

At the same time, cameras operated by the soul cultivator students were sweeping across the entire venue, ready to assess the condition of each contestant at a moment's notice and to facilitate the recording of their completion order.

As the timer officially started, students began circulating their mana according to the pathways on the diagrams.

Zhang Yu frowned slightly as he studied the routes on his diagram.

_This thing… it seems to be a type of specialized mana used for combat._

Although his level 10 Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method gave him exceptionally strong control over his mana, the pathways on this mana circulation diagram were vastly different from the mana cycle of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

If the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method was a technique of internal circulation for self-improvement, then the cultivation pathways on the diagram before him were a method of projecting mana externally for combat.

He could tell that, in terms of complexity, this cultivation pathway was inferior to the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

But whether it was the circulation pathways or the techniques they contained, they were completely different from the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method he was familiar with.

In particular, there was an oscillation and refinement technique that he had never encountered before.

_This Mana Competition is going way too far off-curriculum._

And yet…

Zhang Yu glanced at the Feathered Tome that had appeared beside him, only to find no change whatsoever.

_It's not a cultivation technique?_

_I guess I have no choice but to force my way through it._

Zhang Yu drew upon the mana in his dantian and began to circulate it cautiously according to the diagram.

Meanwhile, in the Purple Cloud High School section.

Lian Tianji gazed at Le Mulan not far away, noting her confident expression, and thought, _Our esteemed number one student is guaranteed to get an outstanding score. All I have to do is not drag us down and help boost our school's total score…_

Le Mulan looked at the diagram before her and tilted her head. 

"I feel like I've drilled something similar to this."

_Let me think… this is the Body-Protecting Astral Qi from some martial arts technique, isn't it?_

She circulated the mana within her body and, sure enough, began converting it strand by strand into the specialized mana indicated on the diagram with practiced ease.

Body-Protecting Astral Qi, converted from mana, was considered a specialized mana belonging to the Martial Dao branch within the Immortal Dao system established by the Ten Great Sects.

Le Mulan recalled that converting mana into Body-Protecting Astral Qi required the step of mana oscillation, and the better the quality of the astral qi, the more oscillations were needed.

"Each mana oscillation increases the quality of the astral qi, but it also makes it harder to control."

"According to the instructions in this diagram, it should require seven mana oscillations, followed by circulation along the prescribed pathways…"

Suddenly, her brow furrowed slightly.

Listening to the various muffled grunts and pained cries coming from nearby, she found it distracting.

These were students who had been injured dispelling mana in the previous round. Their injuries hadn't healed, and circulating their techniques now only agitated their wounds.

"Can't these students from ordinary high schools afford some decent medication?"

"Even if they can't afford it, they can't even buy quality painkillers?"

As the thought crossed her mind, Le Mulan suddenly realized that these poor students from ordinary high schools probably really couldn't afford expensive painkillers.

This was the sound of poverty.

_It's distracting me from the test._

But Le Mulan knew that the power of money could block out the sound of poverty.

She reached out, put on a pair of soundproof earmuffs worth tens of thousands, and felt the world finally fall silent. A faint smile touched her lips as she resumed her mana conversion.

…

Over in the White Dragon High School section, Song Hailong stared at the diagram in his hands as the mana throughout his body began to circulate automatically, moving as if by his will alone, gradually aligning with the instructions on the chart.

His long-term practice with the Heavenly Spiritual Root made his mana control exceptionally deft now that he was without it.

He had also practiced many similar problems before, which made his movements more fluid and faster by a large margin.

Boom!

A mass of mana in his dantian abruptly scattered amidst a violent oscillation, only to be slowly gathered back together by Song Hailong.

"First mana oscillation, complete!"

_Simple! Simple! Simple! Too simple!_

_My parents have the finest genes, selected from among thousands._

_I stopped sleeping at the age of five._

_I am now eighteen. In all these years, I have always had the best performance, the highest scores, and the strongest constitution among my peers in the Song family! I am also the only one of my generation who has never attempted suicide, never grown weary of studying, and never suffered from depression! I am the Song family's ace!_

"You pieces of trash in this arena, what makes you think you can compete with me!"

At that moment, he was completely focused, without the slightest distracting thought, wanting only to master the technique in the diagram as quickly as possible and trample the top students from the other two elite schools under his feet.

…

At the same time, Xiong Bufan of Red Pagoda High School was hunched over his diagram. His eyes were shut tight, and his fluffy tail twitched continuously, as if he had reached a critical moment in his cultivation.

The competition coach at his side watched this scene and thought, _When Bufan and his batch were at the breeding facility, they were being dosed with alchemical enhancers since before birth. By the time he was ready for high school, his physique was the most outstanding of them all._

_When the school brought him over from the breeding facility in the conservation area, the toughness of his meridians was already more than ten times that of an ordinary student. No matter how he strained himself circulating his technique, there's no need to worry about injury._

_Since he enrolled, I've had him constantly train the speed of his mana circulation._

_He has also practiced Body-Protecting Astral Qi many times before._

_This time, he is bound to be the first to master this diagram._

_Hmm, I really should have the principal naturalize more demons… no, wait… I mean, plan for more demon-kin students._

_How is just one enough? I think adding another four to the competition team would be no problem. Those leaders who insist on a pure human team are too conservative. I heard the neighboring city already has a team composed entirely of demons… I mean, demon-kin._

…

Zhang Yu had to admit that without the relevant training or prior preparation, securing a good rank in this round seemed like an impossible task.

This competition wasn't just a contest of talent and aptitude; it was also a battle of financial power, influence, and resources.

_Damn it!_

_Does my journey in this competition end here?_

_Zhang Yu! Are you really going to lose to money?_

…

Not far away, Teacher Yan saw Zhang Yu's troubled expression and sighed inwardly.

She then glanced at the other Songyang High School students. Seeing them sweating profusely, their faces pale, or looking as if they desperately needed to take a dump from the strain, Teacher Yan shook her head helplessly.

The students of Songyang High School were already no match for the top students of the three elite schools. After consistently failing to achieve results in the Mana Competition, the school had simply stopped investing in it.

Without the school's investment, their competition results grew worse and worse, which in turn made the school even less willing to invest. It was a vicious cycle.

Teacher Yan understood that without the school's full support, lacking the proper teaching and practice, the two sides were never on the same starting line to begin with.

Just then, a student suddenly raised his hand.

"I need to use the restroom."

Teacher Yan cursed inwardly.

_So you really did have to go._

"Go on, quickly!"

At that moment, Teacher Yan suddenly heard the sound of sinews and bones ringing out in unison from nearby.

She turned her head and was surprised to see Bai Zhenzhen practicing a fist form.

_Has she already given up? This is a competition of circulating mana, what is she doing practicing martial arts for?_

The sounds of the fist form also drew Zhang Yu's attention. He glanced over and sighed to himself, _Alas, Zhen has been driven mad._

_Huh?_

Suddenly, Zhang Yu felt that the fist form Bai Zhenzhen was practicing was inexplicably familiar, as if it could be combined with something.

The martial art was very simple, composed of just six moves repeated over and over. After watching for a moment, he had a sudden realization.

_Could this martial art be combined with the mana circulation diagram?_

Seeing "Limitless Cloud Hand Level 0" appear on the Feathered Tome, Zhang Yu felt an urge to pick Bai Zhenzhen up and spin her around.

"Zhen!"

"You're a saint!"

"You're the savior of Songyang High School!"

The diagram detailed a method of mana circulation, while Bai Zhenzhen was performing the external martial stances.

Together, they formed a complete combat martial art—the Limitless Cloud Hand.

This was an advanced-level martial arts cultivation technique.

However, this technique emphasized internal cultivation over external moves. The key lay in the application of mana, in how to convert it into Body-Protecting Astral Qi. The six external forms were less like techniques and more like six practical examples of its application.

The Mana Competition had simply isolated the mana circulation diagram from the technique to use as a test question.

For an ordinary person, the absence of the external forms wouldn't affect their ability to learn the method of converting Body-Protecting Astral Qi.

But for Zhang Yu, whether or not it was a complete cultivation technique that could be registered by the Feathered Tome… that made a world of difference.

Zhang Yu had no idea how Bai Zhenzhen had comprehended the external forms. All he could do now was seize the opportunity, immediately switch the Feathered Tome's specialization to the Limitless Cloud Hand, and begin practicing.

Limitless Cloud Hand Level 0 (0/1, 15.4/5 Mana)

One pass!

All he needed was one pass! Even if it was riddled with errors, even if his execution was a complete mess, he would be able to completely master this Limitless Cloud Hand!

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 48: The Top Ten!

At the Mana Competition, within the Purple Cloud High School zone.

Dense beads of sweat covered Le Mulan's forehead.

She had just completed her fourth mana oscillation. The repeatedly ravaged mass of mana had seemingly transformed into a hazy white mist, floating and sinking indeterminately within her dantian, growing ever more difficult to control.

"Three times. Just three more times and I'll succeed."

...

Song Hailong's breathing grew increasingly heavy.

A vast tide of mana rose from his dantian like layered white clouds, gradually coalescing into a vortex.

"The last mana oscillation."

"As expected... I'll be the one to win in the end."

Boom!

Boom!

A sudden roar echoed from the distance.

Song Hailong's expression suddenly changed.

Someone actually beat me to it?

No... that's not it... He quickly realized something, his eyes revealing his astonishment.

"It's two people. Two people were actually faster than me?"

In the distance, Xiong Bufan pressed his palms together. Wisps of white, cloud-like mana flowed from his hands and gathered into a ball, making it seem as though he had caught a living cloud. However, the cloud quickly began to dissipate, clearly unable to last for long.

But he paid it no mind, instead turning to look in the other direction—where the roar had come from.

"Just a step behind me? Are they from White Dragon High or Purple Cloud High?"

Xiong Bufan stared at the column of white qi that shot skyward, condensed and unwavering like a pillar of cloud, a look of astonishment in his eyes.

"What's he doing? This is just a competition; the goal is speed, and everyone is rushing. Why would he practice the Body-Protecting Astral Qi to such perfection?"

"What a show-off!"

In Songyang High School's competition area.

Zhang Yu spread his palms, and torrents of white energy erupted from them, streaming straight toward the sky like a plume of white signal smoke. In an instant, it drew the attention of more and more people.

After Zhang Yu had hastily forced his way through the Limitless Cloud Hand at top speed—and, as expected, failed to convert any astral qi in the process—he felt that he had already mastered the cultivation technique.

At a mere thought, his qi moved with his will. Currents of mana completed seven consecutive oscillations, transforming into vigorous astral qi that erupted from his palms and created the spectacle before them.

Witnessing this, Teacher Yan excitedly clenched her fist, then quickly pulled out her phone and began snapping a series of pictures in Zhang Yu's direction.

Teacher Yan thought to herself, _Zhang Yu's talent for mana control is this astonishing? It seems the previous mana exam failed to reflect this at all._

Recalling Zhang Yu's recent mana growth, she mused that it must have been his improvement in this area that had so greatly increased the efficiency of his breathing exercises.

Bai Zhenzhen watched with a moved expression, saying with heartfelt relief, "The boy's grown up."

And after a moment, the results of the third stage of the Mana Competition also appeared one after another.

Xiong Bufan of Red Pagoda High School was ranked first.

Zhang Yu of Songyang High School was ranked second.

Song Hailong followed closely behind, becoming third.

Le Mulan of Purple Cloud High School was pushed to fourth place.

And as the third stage gradually concluded, the total Mana Competition scores for each student were released one by one.

The students looked at the final rankings, their expressions a mixture of emotions.

First Place, White Dragon High School, Song Hailong, Total Score: 290

Second Place, Purple Cloud High School, Le Mulan, Total Score: 287

Third Place, Red Pagoda High School, Xiong Bufan, Total Score: 285

The three great academies had still swept the top three ranks, pulling far ahead of the other contestants.

At this moment, however, the gazes of most students were not on the top three, but were instead fixed on the person in fourth place.

Fourth Place, Songyang High School, Zhang Yu, Total Score: 273

Although Songyang was also a key high school, its name now appearing in the top ten, surrounded by the three great academies, was strikingly out of place.

It was as if a crack had been forcibly torn open in what was originally an impenetrable dark cloud.

"Fourth place, how much was the prize money again?"

Looking at the final rankings, Zhang Yu couldn't help but grin as he began to wonder about the prize money for fourth place.

He himself was already very satisfied with this ranking.

After all, he was confident he would surpass these rivals in the future.

But in terms of current strength, he was still no match for the prodigies of the three great academies.

He still needed more time to develop.

He had to admit that squeezing into fourth place was thanks to Zhen's divine intervention and the Feathered Tome's filial piety, though the most important factor was, of course, his own perseverance.

Qian Shen stared intently at Zhang Yu, clearly remembering that Zhang Yu's monthly exam score was 620—a full six points lower than his own.

Yet this 620-scorer was now ranked in the Mana Competition alongside the high-level prodigies, the high-caste elites, the ultimate monsters from the three great academies who all scored over 650?!

"It's happening again... It was the same at the art exhibition. This Zhang Yu always manages to perform far beyond the capabilities his score would suggest."

He clutched his head, his eyes wide with disbelief.

"It's as if the six-subject, 700-point evaluation system is no longer sufficient to perfectly express his level of evolution."

"This man..." Qian Shen stared intently at Zhang Yu, a thought that surprised even himself suddenly bubbling up in his mind.

"This man, who cannot be perfectly defined by a score, might just spark another reform of the high school scoring system in the future, making it even more perfect."

Just then, He Dayou glanced at Qian Shen muttering to himself with his head in his hands and thought, _What is this idiot freaking out about now?_

He turned his head, his eyes fixed on Zhang Yu, unable to conceal the turbulent emotions within.

Envy, jealousy... it was impossible not to feel such things, especially when it was all happening to the poor kid he despised most.

At this thought, a hint of regret even surfaced in He Dayou's heart.

_He's just a penniless nobody in the end._

_And it's a good thing... that he's just a penniless nobody._

...

Inside Purple Cloud High School's rest area.
