Thinking of the ritual afflicting him, Zhang Yu replied in an equally flat tone, "Making me sign is the same as killing me."

Their gazes clashed. Seeing Zhang Yu's unyielding stance, Zhang Pianpian seemed to sense a grim resolve in his eyes, an acceptance of death.

She nodded slightly. "I didn't expect you to become like this."

"I thought you were better suited for a quiet, ordinary life."

"Since you're unwilling to sign with Songyang High School, then come with me. I'll take you to White Dragon High School."

Zhang Yu was momentarily stunned. Though a thousand questions flooded his mind, he asked the one he felt was most crucial.

"Can I still take the exam for the Ten Greats?"

Zhang Pianpian smiled. "Of course."

"The you of today finally has some of the spirit needed to strive for the Immortal Dao. Since that's the case, I'm willing to give you a chance to test for the Ten Greats."

Though this was his first time meeting his body's original sister, the Zhang Pianpian before him felt like a complete stranger, worlds apart from the person in his memories.

_Is this really Zhang Yu's sister? Are they the same person?_

_Did money and scores change her so completely?_

But Zhang Yu knew this wasn't the time to dwell on that, so he asked what he considered the second most important question.

Zhang Yu said, "Can I bring someone else with me?"

Seeing Zhang Pianpian tilt her head and look at him with curiosity, Zhang Yu continued, "Can I bring Bai Zhenzhen to White Dragon High School?"

Zhang Pianpian looked bewildered. "Why?"

Zhang Yu replied, "She's my sworn brother. I want to help her."

He thought to himself, _If I leave Zhen to face the student council alone, those bastards will be even more ruthless._

Zhang Pianpian asked, completely lost, "Sworn brother? Is Bai Zhenzhen a relative of ours?"

At first, Zhang Yu thought she was mocking him, but seeing her genuinely serious expression, he tried to explain.

"I mean that we're exceptionally close. When I was at my poorest, during the darkest time of my life, she gave me 500 yuan and bought me a meal."

Still looking confused, Zhang Pianpian asked, "Can't you just transfer 500 back to her now?"

"No," Zhang Yu said.

"What about 5,000?"

"This isn't about the amount of money."

He felt even more unsettled. The Zhang Pianpian before him was so unlike the sister from his memories.

Seeing Zhang Yu's insistence, Zhang Pianpian mulled it over for a moment before saying, "White Dragon High School has a limited number of spots. I can bring one person at most."

Zhang Yu's heart sank.

But then Zhang Pianpian continued, "However, if you can pass an assessment."

"Both of you can be protected."

Zhang Yu asked at once, "What kind of assessment?"

"Divine Assistant, or divine ministry outsourcing, as it's also known," Zhang Pianpian said flatly. "As long as you hold a position within a divine ministry, then at least until I enter university, no one would dare to touch either of you, even if you stay at Songyang High School."

"I can be your sponsor for the assessment."

"But you must understand, if you come with me to White Dragon High School, you'll be protected until graduation."

"If you only rely on this Divine Assistant position, however, they won't be so constrained after I go to university."

"And there is only half a year left until I graduate and leave for university."

"Are you sure you want to take this risk?"

# Chapter 55: The Divine Assistant Assessment

Listening to Zhang Pianpian's explanation, Zhang Yu asked another question.

"Why is it that if I take the assessment, Zhen will be safe too?"

Zhang Pianpian rested her chin on one hand and said coolly, "I can act as your sponsor and recommend you for the Divine Assistant personnel assessment."

"Once you become a Divine Assistant, you can take on an intern of your own."

Zhang Yu got it. _So a temp worker outsources to an intern, huh._

Zhang Pianpian continued, "After you become an auxiliary member of the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, I'll take you to Songyang High School to have a talk with the student council and back you up."

"For the next six months or so, as long as I’m still in Songyang City and haven't left for university, they probably won't give you two any trouble."

_Talk to them at Songyang High School? Back us up? What's your status? What are your scores? How much money do you have? Can you really pull that off?_

As if sensing Zhang Yu's doubts and worries, Zhang Pianpian didn't elaborate, only stating calmly, "I am the current number one third-year at White Dragon High School, and I am also the strongest high school student in Songyang City."

The strongest high school student in Songyang City!

If the Zhang Yu from his past life had heard these words, he would have just thought, _Oh, not bad, pretty impressive._

But now, hearing Zhang Pianpian's statement, he felt as though his sister was radiating a blinding light.

Anyone who had gone to high school in Songyang City knew the weight those words carried.

That title was an honor earned only after enduring countless rounds of soul-crushing, self-destructive cultivation, shedding buckets of blood and tears, and trampling over the corpses of innumerable high school students.

And so, Zhang Yu asked, "So, what does this Divine Assistant job actually entail?"

"Work?" Zhang Pianpian tilted her head. "You don't actually have to do any work. With this status, you just collect a paycheck on time every month."

Zhang Yu understood at once. _Isn't this a damn no-show job? Has such a good thing finally happened to me?_

Zhang Yu quickly asked another question, "So what's on the assessment?"

Zhang Pianpian shook her head. "The specific content of the assessment is randomly generated, so I don't know either."

"But based on my understanding of the Divine Assistant, the higher your Dao heart and the stronger your willpower, the better."

"Dao heart and willpower?" Zhang Yu mused, nodding slightly. "Is the assessment held in the Spirit Realm?"

"Correct." Zhang Pianpian stood up, saying as she walked toward the exit, "The assessment is held in the Spirit Realm."

"I'll send you the address for the assessment registration in a moment."

"If you register today, you should be able to take the assessment tomorrow."

"Remember to ask for a day off from school tomorrow."

"Also, I'll have someone send over a spiritual interface mask for you to borrow for the exam."

With that, Zhang Pianpian had reached the doorway.

"Finally, remember not to reveal our sibling relationship to anyone. If someone asks, just say that I admire your talent."

Watching Zhang Pianpian's departing figure, Zhang Yu thought for a moment before sending a message to Su Haifeng to ask for a day off.

Then, without waiting to see if it was approved, he put his phone down for the time being and began to consider what preparations he should make next.

_Dao heart? Willpower? And the test is in the Spirit Realm?_

Zhang Yu decided to trust what Zhang Pianpian had said, his mind turning to follow her guidance.

_To improve my Dao heart and willpower, the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art is definitely the most effective._

_I'll push myself to advance this cultivation technique tonight._

However, considering the importance of this matter and its bearing on his and Bai Zhenzhen's future, Zhang Yu planned to up the ante and go all out, pushing the cultivation technique even harder tonight.

He picked up his phone and contacted Wang Hai.

"Teacher Wang, I'd like to buy some drugs."

Wang Hai was overjoyed to hear this, nearly bursting into laughter.

_Finally! The body tempering genius, the Golden Core disciple of my class, is finally willing to buy drugs from him!_

At this moment, Wang Hai felt a deep sense of relief, as if he were seeing a failing student who had lost his way finally return to the proper path.

He thought for a moment and said, "What kind of drug do you need?"

Zhang Yu replied, "Something that will let me train all night without rest."

"The side effects and damage to my body need to be as minimal as possible."

"The quality has to be good; a higher price doesn't matter."

"I only need enough for one night, so the dose doesn't have to be large."

Zhang Yu thought that although his body's previous owner had overdosed, he had been recuperating for so long and his physical strength had greatly improved. Taking a single dose to go all out for tomorrow's assessment shouldn't be a major issue.

On the other end, as a prime purveyor of alchemical enhancers who both used and sold his own supply, Wang Hai knew his products inside and out.

Although he was a little disappointed to hear Zhang Yu only needed enough for one night, it made him all the more eager to show Zhang Yu the benefits of using them, hoping he would become a repeat customer.

"Wait a moment..."

Wang Hai immediately wracked his brain, and considering Zhang Yu's physical strength, he ultimately drew up a list that included painkillers, a focus enhancer, stimulants, and a stamina injection.

He sent the list to Zhang Yu and added, "This is all top-shelf stuff, with the minimal side effects you asked for. If you want it, I'll give you a ten percent discount."

Looking at the list, which totaled five thousand eight hundred yuan, Zhang Yu sighed internally.

_Good alchemical enhancers really aren't cheap. It's a good thing I only need them for one night._

After his recent expenses on food, transportation, and extended time with the Heavenly Spiritual Root, plus the new month's fifteen-thousand-yuan loan payment, fifteen hundred in rent, and a few hundred for utilities, Zhang Yu's savings had dropped to just over forty-five thousand.

Now, with another 5,800 deducted, he would only have a little over thirty-nine thousand left.

_Sigh, I'm so poor._

Zhang Yu transferred the money to Wang Hai and waited for the delivery.

With Songyang City's delivery efficiency, he would probably receive the package within the hour.

Just then, he received a message from Zhang Pianpian. She had sent him the URL for the assessment application.

"Songyang City Inspection Department, Divine Assistant Recruitment Registration..."

The Inspection Department was one of the Eight Great Divine Ministries.

Zhang Yu saw that the site also listed the recruitment requirements, job description, and compensation.

He met all of the recruitment requirements.

The job description mentioned things like patrolling, inspections, and maintaining public order—all rather vague. Zhang Yu had no idea what it actually entailed.

And the compensation...

"Required weekly work hours: 18. Salary: 1,000 yuan per month?"

An hourly wage of less than fourteen yuan.

_A job like this requires an assessment?_ Zhang Yu was thankful he was the one getting a no-show job.

However, from his understanding of Kunxu, the prestige of a job could be judged entirely by its hourly wage.

A position that paid less than fourteen yuan an hour... could that truly shield him from the student council? The wage itself reeked of poverty and insignificance.

Fearing that Zhang Pianpian had sent him the wrong link, he couldn't help but send her a message voicing his concerns.

Zhang Pianpian's only reply was, "No matter how low the status, it still falls under the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods. Besides, the usefulness of a position depends on the person using it."

"The monthly pay is a little low, but some hidden benefits aren't mentioned in the recruitment notice."

"For example, you can get a work-issued Talisman Tome for free after joining."

"And after becoming a Divine Assistant, you can get a discount if you study talismans."

Zhang Yu's eyes lit up at her words, a thoughtful look on his face. With these additional benefits, the job was indeed quite extraordinary.

He submitted his application on the website, writing Zhang Pianpian's name in the sponsor field.

A moment later, Zhang Yu received a notification to attend the assessment at 9:00 AM the next morning.

After finishing all of this, Zhang Yu couldn't help but feel a little emotional.

The channels, the jobs, the statuses, the information... everything Zhang Pianpian had told him today was something he had been completely oblivious to in the past.

It reminded him of the original Zhang Yu's memories—attending the high school interview almost completely ignorant, only to discover a vast chasm between himself and the city's students, not just in wealth, talent, and ability, but also in information and intelligence. He hadn't even known what he should be striving for.

Gathering his thoughts, Zhang Yu began to wait for the delivery, meditating and cultivating the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra.

Since the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art required him to practice its forms while circulating the heart art, he primarily cultivated the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra when he was in his rented room.

In the blink of an eye, more than forty minutes passed. The spiritual interface mask sent by Zhang Pianpian's people and the alchemical enhancers packaged by Wang Hai arrived one after the other.

Zhang Yu grabbed the bag of drugs and was about to head to the abandoned building to train.

But then he considered the value of the spiritual interface mask and decided to bring it with him.

He arrived at the abandoned building.

Zhang Yu took the painkillers, focus enhancer, and stimulants that Wang Hai had prepared for him one by one, then injected a syringe of the stamina solution into his arm.

A moment later, Zhang Yu felt his entire body grow hot, the vital energy and blood within him erupting like flowing magma. He felt as if his stamina was now endless, that he possessed an inexhaustible strength.

Boom!

With a punch, he began to furiously practice the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art.

It originally took him fourteen minutes to complete one set of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, but now, pushed by the drugs, Zhang Yu's hands and feet became a blur of afterimages. He finished all nine sets of martial arts in just six minutes.

Moreover, throughout the process, he felt no soreness in his muscles, nor was he even slightly out of breath.

During his cultivation, Zhang Yu had only one thought.

_This is insane! Wang Hai's drugs are absolutely insane! This 5,800 yuan was well spent!_

_Teacher Wang! Taking drugs really is better than training naturally!_

For one hour, Zhang Yu trained frantically.

After two hours, Zhang Yu was still training.

After five hours, Zhang Yu still hadn't stopped.

He trained with vigor and vitality all night without any rest, until 7:00 AM, when he was suddenly hit by a wave of exhaustion and could no longer continue.

He collapsed onto the ground, his heart pounding as if it would leap from his chest. A dull pain pulsed through his internal organs, only gradually subsiding after more than ten minutes.

"The effects have worn off."

Recalling the pain that had just coursed through him, Zhang Yu thought to himself, _That kick was too strong. My organs haven't fully healed; I definitely can't take these drugs often._

However, the results of such a frenzied night of cultivation were substantial.

Not only had his physical strength increased from 1.33 to 1.35 and his Dao heart risen to level 3 (5%), but most crucially, his Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art had advanced to level 6 (3/60).

Now, when Zhang Yu circulated the Martial Ascension Will, he felt all fear and hesitation vanish. No matter how perilous the path ahead, he would forge through to the very end, tearing a way forward with his own two hands.

He ate breakfast, returned to his rented room, and rested until 8:50 AM.

Zhang Yu put on the spiritual interface mask, activated the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, and then connected to the assessment website.

When the time reached 9:00 AM, Zhang Yu perceived a flash of light in the darkness, and then he found himself in another world.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 56: Passing the Assessment and Heading to Songyang

"Zhang Yu!"

"Zhang Yu!"

"Zhang Yu!"

Pulled from his stupor by the repeated calls, Zhang Yu abruptly awoke to the sound of giggles filling the classroom.

Looking up at the podium, he saw the teacher glaring at him coldly.

"Get out and stand in the hall."

Zhang Yu stood up helplessly and walked out of the classroom.

Day after day of this high school life, yet he felt not a sliver of hope.

His grades worsened, his rank plummeted, and he had dropped from the model class to the very worst one. Students and teachers alike looked at him as if he were a bucket of trash.

Meanwhile, the various loans he had taken out to cultivate the Immortal Dao were piling up, suffocating him.

Finally, one day, he walked to the school's rooftop.

Just as he was about to take a step out, his cell phone rang.

Zhang Yu answered the call, and a voice on the other end said, "Hello? Hi, is this Mr. Zhang Yu? There's a new cemetery plot that just opened in the northern suburbs. For only two hundred thousand, you can enjoy our post-mortem corpse-refining service, giving you a chance to live again..."

Zhang Yu let out a dry laugh. "Your big data is really something else, isn't it? It even guessed I was preparing to jump off a building? Too bad it didn't calculate that I'm completely broke and can't afford your tomb."

The person on the other end continued, "If you're penniless, then wouldn't you want a chance to turn your life around? Our company has a 'Heaven Mending Plan.' If you're interested in learning more, I can send you the details..."

Zhang Yu hung up and continued to stare down at the abyss-like darkness below his feet.

"Turn things around..."

After a moment of silence, he ultimately opened his phone again and looked at the website the person had sent him.

A teddy bear on the screen began to speak, "Make a wish to the gods."

"Simply perform a ritual for me, and all your wishes will be granted in five minutes."

"Completely free, no requirements, and absolutely no hidden charges."

"One click, and your life will be transformed..."

Watching this, Zhang Yu felt something—a painful memory—darting through his mind, but he couldn't quite grasp it.

It was the rage of being constantly forced, endlessly tormented, of having his head held down and made to suffer.

And just before those painful memories could break free, his emotions and instincts had already reacted.

"Fuck!" Zhang Yu roared, hurling his phone away before flipping his middle finger. "Hahaha, think you can fool me?"

"Try again in your next life!"

Zhang Yu's consciousness stalled, and the next moment, he awoke in the classroom once more.

But the memories and emotions concerning the evil god were growing more intense, causing him to gradually remember something.

"I remember now. I'm taking the assessment for the Divine Assistant personnel."

"This assessment seems to be related to an evil god?"

Zhang Yu felt he now understood the key to the assessment and decided he would perform his best.

...

Sun Jia'yi was immensely proud.

Because he was not a man, but a god.

Although he was just one of the Inspection Department's 480 million minor Duty Gods, he was a god nonetheless, possessing the authority to review mortals.

Though he only reviewed the assessment for an outsourced job with an hourly wage of fourteen yuan, he had always been diligent and serious in his work.

This was a god.

A god, however humble, never dares to forget the woes of Kunxu!

At this moment, rows of lit screens appeared before Sun Jia'yi, each continuously playing the content of one assessment after another.

It was an instinct-based test of the applicants' reactions to the temptation of an evil god within an illusionary landscape in the Spirit Realm.

And for the outsourced staff members applying to the Inspection Department, whether or not they could withstand this evil god's temptation within the illusion was the key to passing the assessment.

"This candidate from Taitian City, what's the meaning of listing all his family's assets and background on his resume?"

"So what if he's worth over a hundred million? If you can't pass, you can't pass. Did he really think I would bend the rules for his family background?"

Sun Jia'yi sneered, dismissing it with contempt. Seeing the applicant hesitating in the illusion, he directly failed him.

"Weak-willed. Unqualified."

Sun Jia'yi was a proud god, and the more privileged the students he failed, the more he could feel his divine pride and enjoy the satisfaction that came from his conscientiousness.

His thoughts turned to the next candidate, one from Hong'an City.

The applicant's resume was filled with all kinds of honors from his first and second years of high school. He was the top student of his grade, a regular in competitions, with dazzling talent, outstanding ability, and infinite potential. It was highly likely he would get into a top university in the future, or even join a major sect.

But watching the applicant struggle back and forth in the illusion, taking a full ten minutes before finally managing to reject the evil god's temptation, Sun Jia'yi still mercilessly chose to fail him.

"Hmph, does he think a promising future and a shiny resume will make me show mercy? I'm not one of those commoners who only cares about scores."

"Even if he were a true prodigy, a favored son of heaven like a university student, if he lands in my hands, he doesn't pass if I say so."

"To take so long to refuse is a clear sign of a weak will. How could I possibly let you pass?"

His thoughts turned again, and this time, Zhang Yu's file and assessment content appeared before him.

"Mm, he decisively threw the phone away on the rooftop. Not bad."

"The difficulty increases next. Let's see how he fares."

The scene on the screen then shifted repeatedly as various methods of temptation by the evil god were presented to Zhang Yu one after another.

A beautiful admirer asked Zhang Yu to make a wish to the evil god with her; Zhang Yu kicked her aside and fled at top speed.

He was being hunted with no way out when the evil god offered salvation; Zhang Yu sneered, turned, and threw the evil god doll at his enemies, shouting, "Good stuff! You can wish for anything from this thing!"

When a giant ragdoll chased him, threatening him with terrifying power to form a contract, Zhang Yu ran while calling the police, and after the constables arrived, he even wanted to charge forward with them to fight the evil god.

But... Sun Jia'yi, sitting before the screen, was no longer watching his spirited performance, because someone had contacted him.

Seeing Zhang Pianpian's name pop up in the contact window, along with her title as the acting vice-captain of the Songyang City Inspection Department's patrol team, he frowned slightly.

"What is it, colleague?"

Zhang Pianpian said, "There is a candidate named Zhang Yu, I hope..."

Sun Jia'yi was about to wave his hand in refusal when he saw she had already activated a Talisman Tome and cast a talisman.

"You dare cross the Spirit Realm and cast a talisman on me, a magnificent Duty God?"

"What audacity!"

But upon seeing the specific talisman she cast, Sun Jia'yi immediately relaxed.

"A Favorability Talisman?!"

A Favorability Talisman was a type of spell that could quickly increase a god's goodwill.

Its principle of operation required no name, no information, and no account number; as long as it was activated while in contact with the target, money could be sent directly into their account with the transaction record automatically hidden.

Recognizing the effect of the Favorability Talisman, Sun Jia'yi's originally stern expression softened.

"I didn't expect a mere mortal from the lower realm like you to be so knowledgeable about talismans, to have even learned the Favorability Talisman."

And after noticing the number in his account change, a smile spread across his face as he remarked, "For a high school student to be so reverent toward the gods truly shows the firmness of his faith."

"What is it you require of me?"

Zhang Pianpian was not surprised by this.

Based on her two years of experience using the Talisman Tome and studying talismans, raising one's faith level relied on payments, learning talismans relied on payments, and hiring a righteous god for tutoring relied on payments... therefore, the art of talismans was simply the art of payment!

However, making payments to gods also required specific methods. Channels like Talisman Tome payments, private transfers, public transfers, and Favorability Talismans were worlds apart, and this was where the skill level in the art of talismans came into play.

Zhang Pianpian said, "I must trouble this great god to lower the difficulty of Zhang Yu's assessment just a little..."

Sun Jia'yi said dismissively, "Hah, a job that pays fourteen yuan an hour, how difficult can the assessment be?"

...

Inside the illusion.

Zhang Yu looked at the world before him, his gaze filled with bewilderment.

He now found himself in a white room.

In the center of the room floated a line of text: An evil god tempts you. Will you accept?

Below it floated two options: Accept and Decline.

_Wait... this has to be a trick question, right?_

Because the question seemed far too simple, Zhang Yu was unable to answer.

After thinking for a full ten minutes and being genuinely unable to spot the trap, Zhang Yu nervously chose "Decline."

The next moment, a notification that he had passed the assessment appeared before him.

With a bewildered expression, Zhang Yu withdrew from the Spirit Realm, still not quite understanding what had just happened.

Just then, his cell phone rang.

Zhang Yu answered the phone, and Zhang Pianpian's voice came from the other end.

"You should have passed the test by now, right?"

Zhang Yu immediately voiced the confusion in his heart.

Zhang Pianpian explained, "Oh, I sent some money to the minor Duty God on watch and had him lower the assessment difficulty a bit."

_A bit?_

_This is a god?_

Zhang Yu was shocked. "You can bribe a god with money?"

Zhang Pianpian replied, "How could that be possible."

Zhang Yu was about to breathe a sigh of relief when Zhang Pianpian continued, "Spending money only makes it _possible_ to bribe a god. It really depends on how much you spend and how you spend it. That's where skill with talismans comes in."

Zhang Yu said, "But... that's a god!"

"In Kunxu, gods get things done for money. That's what 'money moves the gods' means," Zhang Pianpian said as if it were obvious. "Without money, how could the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods operate Kunxu? How could they manage the world?"

Zhang Yu was speechless once again; he could only say that he had gained a much deeper understanding of Kunxu.

Remembering what she had said before, Zhang Yu asked, "Didn't you say this assessment tested one's Dao heart and willpower?"

Zhang Pianpian said lightly, "Yes, it does. You need a strong enough Dao heart and enough willpower to hold on until... I can find the on-duty Duty God responsible for your assessment in the Spirit Realm and then use a talisman to transfer money into his account."

She continued, "Alright, I've brought your work ID and work Talisman Tome. Let's meet at the gate of your high school."

"Now... we can go have a talk with the student council of Songyang High School."

Zhang Yu quickly dragged his exhausted body onto a bus and arrived at the school stop an hour and a half later. From a distance, he could see Zhang Pianpian standing at the intersection.

She handed Zhang Yu a black-and-white object that resembled a manual.

"This is your work Talisman Tome. You have permission to use one talisman for free each day, and you can get a discount when learning the Inspection Department's talismans through this tome..."

She then pointed to a strange symbol on the Talisman Tome and said, "This is the mark of the Inspection Department. You can show it if you run into trouble."

Zhang Yu carefully took it in his hands, thinking, _So this is a Talisman Tome. Even the cheapest one must cost close to a hundred thousand, right?_

The Talisman Tome was crucial for learning the art of talismans, which in turn affected one's Daoist art grades in high school. Zhang Yu had even heard of students mortgaging their own organs to buy one.

_They actually give these out as soon as you join? The Inspection Department is really rich._

_If Zhen saw this, wouldn't she get on her knees and call me 'daddy'? Beg me to let her play with it for a bit?_

# Chapter 57: Upperclassman

Songyang High School.

The students of first-year Class 1 filed into the training hall, preparing for today's martial combat class.

As she walked, Bai Zhenzhen wondered, _What is Yu-boy up to? I can't even reach him._

_Sick leave? What high schooler even gets sick leave?_

_Could he have buckled under the pressure?_

Just as Bai Zhenzhen’s thoughts were running wild, she suddenly noticed a large group of people standing in the training hall, in addition to the martial arts teacher, Lei Jun.

Her gaze fell upon the students behind Lei Jun and suddenly sharpened as she noticed the tallest one. _The human door plank?_

Looking at the students surrounding the 'human door plank,' Lan Ling, Bai Zhenzhen immediately recognized them as second-years.

The extra year of cultivation had made the second-years a full size larger than the first-years; their secondary sexual characteristics had all but vanished, and their exposed arms were covered in a dense pattern of pinpricks...

Every one of these marks of cultivation spoke to the power and diligence of the second-year students.

Bai Zhenzhen wasn’t the only one who recognized them, of course.

Soon, students began to approach the second-years to greet them.

Zhao Tianxing was the first to bow to the martial arts teacher, Lei Jun, before turning to the second-years and bowing again, saying deferentially, "Greetings, upperclassmen!"

Zhao Tianxing, who normally weighed over three hundred pounds, looked like a corgi standing before Lan Ling.

Only after Lan Ling gave a slight nod did Zhao Tianxing cautiously retreat.

This was the dynamic in high school—the deference lowerclassmen had to show their seniors.

A full year of cultivation separated each grade—first, second, and third—which often resulted in an absolute disparity in power.

It had even led some to classify the three grades as the early, middle, and late stages of Qi Refinement, just to emphasize the distinction.

At Songyang High School, for instance, underclassmen were expected to greet their seniors proactively; if a senior was standing, a junior could not sit; in the restroom, a junior had to let a senior relieve himself first; and when using alchemical enhancers in the same room, the senior always went first...

Rules like these had long been integrated into the students' daily routines.

Of course, Songyang High School was more humane than the three elite academies. It was said that at White Dragon High School, seniors could even force their juniors to kneel and kowtow.

Fortunately, the vast differences in curriculum and teaching locations between grades, coupled with immense academic pressure, meant that juniors and seniors rarely crossed paths.

A true cause for celebration, indeed.

Now, in the training hall, every arriving student proactively bowed to greet Lan Ling and his group.

This only made one person’s behavior stand out all the more.

Zhao Tianxing watched Bai Zhenzhen, who still hadn't greeted the seniors, and grew anxious on her behalf.

_What's gotten into Zhen? She’s going to get targeted by the upperclassmen if she keeps this up._

He could already feel several of the second-years glancing her way, and just imagining himself in her position made him feel a wave of vicarious embarrassment and tension.

Once all the first-years from Class 1 had assembled, Lei Jun addressed them.

"Today, the upperclassmen from second-year Class 1 have graciously set aside one of their periods to provide you with some combat guidance. Let’s have a round of applause to welcome them!"

_What? We get to be beaten up by the second-year elites?_

Hearing this, the students burst into excited applause.

"Thank you, upperclassmen!"

One of the top students was already grinning, thinking gleefully, _These are students from the second-year model class. If you wanted to hire them for combat practice on the outside, wouldn't a single session cost over a thousand?_

A student eager to improve his combat scores could hardly wait, thinking, _A pointer from a second-year elite would be worth it even if I got my arm broken!_

Qian Shen’s gaze was fixed on the towering, door-plank-like form of Lan Ling.

_Lan Ling, ranked second overall in the second year last month, and first in the physical education competition. The ace of the second-year athletic competition team. But…_

_"Pointless,"_ Qian Shen thought, turning away. _"Comparing scores across grades is meaningless. These second-years from the model class have an entire extra year of cultivation… any one of them would be invincible to a first-year. To us, it makes no difference who we face."_

He Dayou simply smiled and nodded at the second-years, which served as his greeting. As the Son of the School Director, he was, after all, acquainted with many of the top students from the upper grades.

Lei Jun looked at the eager expressions on most of the students' faces, pleased with their morale.

"Excellent. You're all full of spirit."

"Daoist arts require money—the more you spend, the more powerful you become."

"If you want to excel in the martial arts, you have to take a beating. The less you fear losing, the less you fear pain, the less you fear being utterly crushed, the faster your combat skills will improve."

"Only by being beaten down, crushed, and forcing yourself back to your feet time and time again can you truly improve your combat experience."

Seeing the students below already raising their hands impatiently, Lei Jun was about to pick someone to begin the sparring when Lan Ling leaned in and whispered something in his ear.

Lei Jun nodded, his gaze shifting to Bai Zhenzhen, who was hiding at the back of the crowd.

"Bai Zhenzhen," he called out, "you're up first. Go a round with an upperclassman and set an example for your classmates."

"Lan Ling, this is Bai Zhenzhen, the top combatant among the first-years. Give her some proper guidance."

Lan Ling slowly walked onto the floor, curling a dumbbell in his right hand, and addressed Bai Zhenzhen gently, "Junior sister, shall we have a little spar?"

Bai Zhenzhen’s expression darkened. She walked forward slowly under the envious gazes of the crowd, though in her mind she was already cursing the human door plank to high heaven.

_This damn creep. I knew he was up to no good. He's just using the contract as an excuse to beat up a junior, isn't he?_

She guessed this wouldn't be a simple spar; he would undoubtedly use this chance to teach her a harsh lesson.

The best defense is a good offense!

The moment she stepped onto the floor, Bai Zhenzhen shot forward, aiming a kick straight at the vital point in Lan Ling’s lower abdomen—his dantian.

Yet he didn't even try to dodge, simply letting her foot connect with a heavy thud.

Even though she had clearly kicked a vital point, his expression remained unchanged, and he didn't retreat a single step, as if nothing had happened at all.

Bai Zhenzhen, on the other hand, felt as if she had kicked a block of granite; the bones in her foot felt like they were about to shatter.

_Is the gap between me and a second-year really this huge?_

Just as she tried to retreat, an iron pincer of a hand clamped down on her ankle.

Gripping her ankle, Lan Ling smiled. "Junior sister, it seems you've underestimated me."

As the two fought, Lei Jun provided commentary for the students on the sidelines.

"A good surprise attack! Remember this—a surprise attack is a profound skill in real combat, and it's the best option for the weak to defeat the strong."

"However, Bai Zhenzhen knows far too little about Lan Ling."

"Lan Ling underwent the 'absolute' sterilization procedure long ago. Not only does he no longer possess any sexual characteristics and is unaffected by hormones, but he has also eliminated many conventional weak points..."

"Now Lan Ling has her locked down. She keeps kicking and striking, trying to break free, but Lan Ling's physical strength is above level 6, while Bai Zhenzhen's is only about 1.4, isn't it? Once you're caught, it's over..."

Midway through his commentary, a loud bang erupted from beneath Lei Jun’s feet as his figure shot out like a bolt of lightning.

At the same instant, a deafening boom echoed through the air.

To the astonishment of the crowd, Lan Ling had violently flung Bai Zhenzhen through the air, sending her hurtling toward the training hall wall as a series of afterimages.

But just an instant before her head made impact, Lei Jun appeared behind her, and the two of them crashed through the wall together, flying out of the training hall with a tremendous roar.

A moment later, Lei Jun returned to the training hall with a limping Bai Zhenzhen, his expression grim as he looked at Lan Ling.

"Don't you think that was a bit much?"

Bai Zhenzhen was one of the best first-year martial combatants; if she were seriously injured, it would reflect poorly on Lei Jun's performance record.

Lan Ling offered a placid smile. "I had faith that with you here, Teacher, she would be perfectly fine."

"This was also a good opportunity to teach our junior sister a lesson about underestimating an opponent in a real fight."

With that, he turned to Bai Zhenzhen. "Junior sister, have you committed this combat lesson to memory? Shall we continue?"

Seeing his renewed invitation, fury flared in Bai Zhenzhen's eyes. A long-suppressed power stirred within her, ready to burst from its cocoon.

_No,_ she thought frantically, _I can't reveal it. If I reveal it here, it's all over…_

Lei Jun was about to intervene but was stopped in his tracks by a single look from Lan Ling.

"Don't worry, Teacher. I'll be more measured this time."

Though Lei Jun had his suspicions before, this single moment confirmed them.

He recalled the student council's previous demand to bar Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu from the martial arts competition and understood that today's events were also at their behest.

Thinking of the student council at Songyang High, he could only sigh to himself before issuing a warning.

"This is my class. Don't take it too far."

Lan Ling smiled. "Rest assured, Teacher. Student Bai Zhenzhen is a high-value asset to the school. I certainly won't let her get seriously injured."

By now, the other first-years had also sensed that something was wrong with the atmosphere, but none of them could figure out what was happening.

He Dayou's eyes shifted. As the Son of the School Director, he could already see what was going on.

_They're trying to suppress Bai Zhenzhen? Is there a problem with the contract negotiations? Are they trying to lowball her?_

The thought made him regret that Zhang Yu wasn't present; it would have been a fine chance to see the poor bastard squirm.

Just then, a male voice called out from the training hall's entrance.

"Hey, are you bullying my intern?"

Amid looks of shock and surprise, Zhang Yu strode in from the entrance, raising his right hand as he spoke, his fingertips flashing across a black-and-white Talisman Tome.

Detainment Talisman—activate!

In the next instant, countless points of golden light flashed into existence around Lan Ling, coalescing into giant, golden hands that shot toward him.

Lan Ling had barely begun to move when nine giant, golden hands seized him, pinning his head, shoulders, arms, legs, and torso.

"The Detainment Talisman?"

_That pauper Zhang Yu... where did he get a Talisman Tome to cast the Detainment Talisman?_

Feeling the nine giant hands crushing him, trying to force him to the ground inch by inch, Lan Ling grew enraged.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 58: Pressure

Roar!

With a furious roar, Lan Ling’s muscles bulged. A terrifyingly immense force erupted from within him, forcibly resisting the pressure of the Detainment Talisman.

"So strong, are you?" Zhang Yu slowly walked up to Lan Ling, watching as his opponent’s power surged, bit by bit breaking free of the Detainment Talisman.

Zhang Yu brandished the Talisman Tome bearing the Inspection Department's mark and said with a smile, “The Inspection Department is on official business, by divine authority. You wish to resist? To make an enemy of the gods?”

Staring at the Inspection Department's Talisman Tome, Lan Ling's eyes suddenly narrowed, a flash of disbelief in their depths.

_This poor bastard joined the Inspection Department?_

The next moment, he shattered the Detainment Talisman with a deafening crack but did not move rashly again. He simply stared at Zhang Yu with a scrutinizing gaze, as if seeing him for the first time.

Seeing that Lan Ling was no longer fighting, Zhang Yu shot a smug smile at Bai Zhenzhen, who was a short distance away, thinking to himself, _I must look cool as hell today._

Bai Zhenzhen stared intently at the Talisman Tome in Zhang Yu’s hand, thinking, _Where did Yu-boy get a Talisman Tome like that? …I have to borrow it for a bit._

Meanwhile, the crowd looked on in astonishment as Zhang Yu suddenly appeared and repelled Lan Ling with a single Detainment Talisman.

He Dayou watched the scene unfold, his expression a mixture of shock and suspicion.

_How did Zhang Yu get into a divine ministry?_

Zhao Tianxing’s heart was filled with both nervousness and fear.

_Zhang Yu actually bought a Talisman Tome? Did he take the day off to sell an organ?_

But in the next moment, he shook his head violently, ashamed of his own train of thought.

_Is this really the time to be thinking about that? How did Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen get into a conflict with a second-year senior? That's the real problem here._

Even so, a hint of envy still surfaced in Zhao Tianxing’s eyes as he looked at Zhang Yu, and an irrepressible thought bubbled up within him.

_Going head-to-head with a second-year senior like that… is actually kind of cool._

Qian Shen stared at the Talisman Tome in Zhang Yu's hand, utterly astonished.

_Zhang Yu’s Daoist art exam score is going to skyrocket!_

Just as Zhang Yu and Lan Ling were locked in a stare-down and the atmosphere grew increasingly tense, the temperature of the entire training ground suddenly began to plummet.

A cloud of white vapor even rose from Lan Ling’s body, which had been in strenuous motion just moments before, due to the sudden temperature change.

He gave Zhang Yu a cold snort, then slowly backed away, turning his head toward the main entrance.

"President."

All eyes turned in the direction he had spoken.

Accompanied by a set of footsteps, Zhou Chechen walked over slowly, frost spreading from beneath his feet.

Zhou Chechen, Vice President of the Student Council; the man who had spoken as the student representative at the start of the school year and whose name and face appeared on screen and over the broadcasts month after month for his litany of outstanding achievements.

He was the model student, the ultimate senior, and his very presence silenced the entire hall.

He Dayou was the first to react, bowing to Zhou Chechen and saying, "Greetings, senior."

This seemed to flip a switch, and nearly all the first-year students present bowed in unison, saying together, "Greetings, senior."

The second-year students, for their part, also bowed and called out, "Greetings, President."

Although he was nominally the Student Council Vice President, the third-year president was busy preparing for the college entrance exams, so all practical matters of the student council were, in fact, decided by Zhou Chechen.

In strength, academics, wealth, and authority… he was the school’s uncrowned king.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhou Chechen as if they were watching a king receive the adulation of his court. They were the only two students in the entire hall who had not bowed their heads.

Zhou Chechen did not address Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen first, instead turning his gaze upon the second-year students as the frost emanating from his body grew ever denser.

"Shuang Youpeng, you ranked first in overall score and first in practical combat as a first-year. What did you think of the fight between Bai Zhenzhen and Lan Ling just now?"

From behind the group of second-year students, a second-year boy with a relatively smaller build stepped forward.

Under the crowd’s watch, his hands seemed to have a mind of their own, fidgeting with his hair and picking at his ear, his eyes full of fear as he looked at Zhou Chechen.

He said very cautiously, "She was careless, arrogant, and underestimated her opponent, failing to recognize the disparity between them."

Seeing Shuang Youpeng’s cowering appearance, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen felt like they were watching a dog wagging its tail and begging for scraps before Zhou Chechen.

Shuang Youpeng, once the top-ranked first-year student, now showed none of his former spirit.

Zhou Chechen nodded slightly and said, "From what I've seen, this year's strongest first-year combatant isn't as clever a fighter as you were."

Shuang Youpeng hurriedly waved his hands. "You flatter me, President. You flatter me."

Zhou Chechen then turned back to the first-year students and asked faintly, "Have you expressed your gratitude for your senior's guidance?"

The first-year students immediately bowed and said, "Thank you for your guidance, senior."

In a few short moments, Zhou Chechen had become the center of attention, holding every student captive with his every move, word, and glance.

It was only then that Zhou Chechen finally looked Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen in the eye, saying coolly, "Zhang Yu, the match between Bai Zhenzhen and Lan Ling was a normal instructional spar. Why did you attack a senior with a Detainment Talisman?"

As he spoke, he slowly raised his palm, from which streams of ice-blue mist emerged, causing the surrounding temperature to plummet once more.

Zhou Chechen continued, "As Vice President of the Songyang High School Student Council, I can tolerate neither the use of a Detainment Talisman on school grounds nor such disrespectful behavior toward a senior."

Zhang Yu’s eyes shifted as he raised the Talisman Tome in his hand.

"Zhou Chechen, do you intend to attack a Divine Assistant of the Inspection Department?"

Zhou Chechen’s eyelids lowered slightly, the corners of his mouth seeming to curl into a faint smile.

In his vision, the Heaven's Eye Talisman had already revealed the information hovering above Zhang Yu’s head.

Songyang City Patrol Unit Outsourced Employee (Expand for details)

_A mere outsourced contractor for the Patrol Unit, a position no bigger than a grain of rice, dares to run wild at Songyang High School?_

Just as the frigid energy in Zhou Chechen’s palm was about to erupt, a warm breeze suddenly swept in from all directions, not only dispersing the cold but also restoring the temperature to normal.

Zhang Pianpian entered the training ground through the main gate, accompanied by another young man.

"Are you trying to attack my temp?"

Zhou Chechen snapped his head around, and his gaze froze the moment he saw her face. 

_Zhang Pianpian? Why is she here? Is she going to back Zhang Yu?_

_Zhang Pianpian? Zhang Yu? Their surname is Zhang… are they related?_

But Zhou Chechen recalled checking Zhang Yu’s file; he didn't have any relatives this powerful.

If Zhang Yu really had such a powerful relative watching his back, dealing with him wouldn't have been so simple.

Zhou Chechen then wondered, _Or perhaps… Zhang Yu found a higher bidder and has become Zhang Pianpian’s dog?_

Seeing the lingering chill in Zhou Chechen’s palm, Zhang Pianpian continued walking toward the center of the room.

"Hm? Did you not hear me?"

"Or is it… you wish to make an enemy of me?"

As Zhang Pianpian spoke, she gently lifted her right index finger, and a Talisman Tome flew naturally to hover before it.

The next moment, Zhang Pianpian’s fingertip traced across the Talisman Tome at high speed.

Bai Zhenzhen watched in surprise, her eyes flicking to the school uniform Zhang Pianpian wore.

_White Dragon High School? What is she doing? Is she about to fight Zhou Chechen?_

Zhang Yu was also startled.

_She’s going to attack right away? What kind of talisman is she preparing? Another Detainment Talisman?_

As everyone watched with bated breath, Zhang Pianpian finished drawing the talisman, and a wave of mana pulsed from it.

Talisman of Dominance—activated!

Two lines of text suddenly materialized above Zhang Pianpian’s head.

The first line read: **White Dragon High School Third-Year Monthly Exam Total Score: 699**

The students staring at this score instantly widened their eyes, falling into a state of profound shock.

_A 699 on a third-year monthly exam?_ Qian Shen screamed internally. _That’s a god! A future god of the college entrance exams!_

Before the crowd could even process that score, the second line of text began to materialize above Zhang Pianpian’s head.

Bank Balance: 2

At first, it was just a 2, but a 5 quickly appeared after it.

And so it went, with another digit materializing every second.

25,000?

250,000?

2,500,000?!

By the time the number jumped to 25,000,000, the students present could feel their breathing quicken.

The students were now beginning to understand what kind of talisman Zhang Pianpian had used.

The Talisman of Dominance—a spell that called upon divine power to display one’s scores and bank balance as a form of intimidation.

When the number leaped to 250,000,000, the crowd felt their own vitality begin to surge uncontrollably.

And when the number finally stopped at 2,500,000,000, combined with the 699-point score above it, everyone felt an oppressive weight slam into them, like a great mountain pressing down on their chests.

This was merely her bank balance!

The thought of the assets and the power of the Immortal Dao that this number represented stirred their hearts.

Even He Dayou couldn't help but be shocked.

_Her bank balance alone is 2.5 billion? Just what is this woman’s total net worth?_

He couldn’t help but take out his own Talisman Tome and activate a Heaven's Eye Talisman, wanting to see her background for himself.

But all he saw were three large words hovering over her head.

You Are Not Worthy

She had used a talisman to conceal her background, making it completely impossible for him to investigate.

Upon seeing those words, He Dayou’s body trembled and his face went pale, as if he had been struck by lightning. It was as if he were seeing a great chasm stretching out between himself and Zhang Pianpian, one he could never hope to cross.

Zhao Tianxing stared intently at the string of digits above Zhang Pianpian's head, trying to count them again and again, but felt like he kept losing his place.

When he finally confirmed the number was 2.5 billion, he couldn’t help but gasp.

_So rich, she’s just so incredibly rich. The pressure from a wealthy person is really intense!_

In that moment, Zhao Tianxing was overwhelmed by a sense of inferiority, feeling as though he wasn’t even worthy to stand in the same room with her.

Zhang Yu was equally stunned.

_This is my wealthy older sister?_

_That's not right. I don't remember our family being wealthy at all._

_In fact, you could say we were dirt poor. So… where did Zhang Pianpian get all this money?_

_Something’s wrong… This is all wrong…_

The questions that had been nagging at him since the Divine Assistant assessment now crescendoed.

_How did she go from being penniless to a billionaire?_

_I… want to learn how, too._

Zhang Yu couldn't understand the reason, but no matter what...

_Sister, why did you leave us? Mom and I are your real family!_

Meanwhile, Zhou Chechen slowly dissipated the frigid energy in his palm.

His gaze swept imperceptibly over the score, the bank balance, and the words 'You Are Not Worthy' above her head several times.

Finally, he looked at Zhang Pianpian politely and said, “Senior Zhang, you’ve misunderstood. I was not aware that Zhang Yu was your subordinate. Had I known, why would I have made things difficult for him?”

Seeing her Talisman of Dominance had stunned the entire crowd, Zhang Pianpian nodded in satisfaction.

“Very good. I hope you remember what you’ve said today.”

"Don't let me hear about you causing any trouble for my subordinate. Otherwise, I’ll use this pocket change above my head to buy you."

"I'm sure your father would be more than happy to make the sale."

Hearing this, the corner of Zhou Chechen’s eye twitched, and for a moment, he was rendered speechless.

Just as a hush fell over the hall in the wake of her words, the young man who had entered with Zhang Pianpian laughed heartily.

“Pianpian is only joking. Don’t take it to heart, Junior Brother Zhou.”

The speaker was none other than Songyang High School’s top third-year student and the true president of the Student Council, Chu Chengxuan.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 59: The Strongest First-Year

Bang!

Zhou Chechen slammed his palm down on the office desk, killing intent surging from his eyes, so palpable it seemed real.

He bit out each word, "Zhang Pianpian, that woman treats Songyang like it's nothing!"

After being intimidated by Zhang Pianpian today, he felt as if he could already see the gloating in the eyes of the underclassmen and his peers, and sense the severe blow to his own prestige.

Zhou Chechen whipped his head around to face Chu Chengxuan, the student council president, and asked, "President, are you just going to stand by and watch that woman run wild in Songyang?"

Chu Chengxuan, while reviewing a textbook, said nonchalantly, "That woman, Zhang Pianpian… her background is a mystery, her wealth is inexplicable, and she's a lunatic. Why provoke her?"

"In a little over half a year, she'll be off to university, and the senior students from the upper echelons will deal with her then."

Seeing that the other was still engrossed in his book, Zhou Chechen understood that Chu Chengxuan was completely preoccupied with the college entrance exams, university admissions, and interviews; he had no intention of clashing with that madwoman Zhang Pianpian on his behalf.

But at his words, a cold glint flashed in Zhou Chechen's eyes. "Half a year?"

"Then I'll just wait half a year before I deal with Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen."

But for now, in Zhou Chechen's eyes, both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were nothing more than dead bones in a barrow, living only under Zhang Pianpian's protection. Once that half-year was up, he would strike with a vicious hand.

The one Zhou Chechen had truly set his sights on was still Zhang Pianpian.

As boundless hatred and shame filled him, a thought surfaced in his mind.

_University lasts for ten years; the one-year gap between grades won't be nearly as significant as it is in high school._

_Zhang Pianpian, I truly, truly hope... you last until I get into university and catch up to you._

---

Outside Songyang High School.

Inside a private room in a teahouse.

Zhang Pianpian surveyed the room and said, "There are no issues. We can speak freely here for the time being. There are a few things I need to go over with you."

"Sis!" Zhang Yu exclaimed, excitedly grabbing Zhang Pianpian's arm. "You're really my sister! Having a big sister is the best!"

Just then, a thud echoed.

Zhang Pianpian turned to see Bai Zhenzhen kneeling on the floor.

Bai Zhenzhen declared solemnly, "For this immense kindness today, if Sister will not cast me aside, I am willing to take you as my adoptive mother. From this day on, I am yours to command."

"Wait... she's my sister."

"It's fine, Yu-boy. I don't mind the formalities. From now on, I'll call her adoptive mother, and you can call me Mom."

As Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu bickered, Zhang Pianpian said flatly, "That bank balance was fake."

Huh?!!

As the two whipped their heads around to stare, Zhang Pianpian swiped her finger again, casting another talisman, but this time, the balance that appeared over her head was only two hundred and fifty thousand.

She explained flatly, "The Talisman of Dominance I used earlier was one I modified myself. It can display a fake bank balance."

Zhang Yu was stunned. _You can modify talismans like that? To show a fake bank balance? How come I never heard of anything like this in my Daoist art class? Aren't you supposed to use them exactly as they were handed down by the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods?_

Going from 'my sister is a billionaire' to 'my sister is pretending to be a billionaire' made Zhang Yu's heart sink.

Seeing their stunned expressions, Zhang Pianpian continued, "You need to remember, if you want to deal with the wealthy, you must understand how they think."

"The rich rely on their money, so they best understand its power. They are the easiest to motivate with money, and the easiest to intimidate with it. This is what's known as using wealth to control wealth."

"The foundation for these tactics is information. To obtain, alter, and intercept that information... you need sophisticated talismans."

"Talismans are the most powerful tool you can learn in high school. Remember this: talismans are the most useful and powerful things there are! No Daoist art or martial skill is as useful as a talisman…"

Zhang Yu looked at Zhang Pianpian, who had begun to seriously hype up talismans, and could almost see the words 'Talisman Shill' materializing above her head.

Even though the two-point-five billion had shrunk to a mere two hundred and fifty thousand, Bai Zhenzhen was still all smiles as she hugged Zhang Pianpian and asked sweetly, "Mom, what's our next move?"

Watching Bai Zhenzhen's excessively sweet display from the side, Zhang Yu felt his skin crawl, as if he were watching a thousand-year-old zombie awaken.

Zhang Pianpian said calmly, "The college entrance exams are in six months. Once they're over, I'm heading to university on the second layer of Kunxu."

"Which means I can only protect you for the next six months."

"After those six months, without my protection, the student council at Songyang High School will undoubtedly make a move against you."

"And there's one more point."

"You need to understand, the reason I can protect you right now is because they think I'm rich, just like them."

"They think I've signed you, that you won't be trying for the Ten Greats."

"The moment they find out you're aiming for the Ten Greats, they won't care about my protection anymore, and the measures they take will be a hundred times more ruthless than what you've seen."

"So…"

As she spoke, Zhang Pianpian stared directly into Bai Zhenzhen's eyes, as if trying to pierce all her innermost thoughts.

"What are your plans?"

"Wait to die? Prepare to flee Songyang City? Or risk being crushed to dust to try for the Ten Greats?"

Bai Zhenzhen met Zhang Pianpian's gaze without flinching, her expression turning serious. "I want to get into a top university of the Ten Greats."

Zhang Pianpian then turned to Zhang Yu.

Zhang Yu said, "Sis, stop keeping us in suspense. Zhen and I both have wills of steel, and we're determined to get into a top university of the Ten Greats."

"Just tell us what we need to do."

Zhang Pianpian nodded slightly, then continued, "You're too weak."

Seeing their indignant expressions, Zhang Pianpian said flatly, "If you want to get into the Ten Greats as penniless nobodies, your current strength is far from sufficient, to say nothing of breaking through the blockade set up by the wealthy."

"First, become the strongest first-years in Songyang City."

"Once the two of you have taken the top two spots in every remaining first-year competition and have become Songyang's strongest first-years, then I'll tell you the next step."

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were both stunned.

_All the remaining first-year competitions?_

_Does that mean they have to surpass every first-year student, including those from the three major schools, in Dao heart, physical strength, martial arts, and Daoist arts?_

_Especially the Daoist art competition... that thing is practically designed to crush the poor._

_But thankfully, the Daoist art competition is at the very end of the first year. The next one up is the martial arts competition, where they both had a slight advantage._

Next, Zhang Pianpian had Bai Zhenzhen sign an intern contract with the Songyang City Patrol, and after officially confirming her status as a member of the patrol, she sent the two of them on their way.

Bai Zhenzhen, however, remained behind, wringing her hands with an embarrassed look on her face.

"Um... about that..."

Zhang Pianpian asked, puzzled, "What about it?"

With a sweet smile, Bai Zhenzhen gestured with a crooked finger toward Zhang Yu, who was fiddling with his Talisman Tome.

"That Talisman Tome... do interns get one?"

Zhang Pianpian shook her head.

"The Patrol Department isn't extravagant enough to issue Talisman Tomes to interns. By the way, don't tell anyone about my relationship with Zhang Yu. Also, I've already arranged for Mom and Dad to move to a safe village, so you don't need to worry about them."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu froze for a moment before nodding.

Finally, after urging Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu to hurry back to their studies and cultivation, Zhang Pianpian watched them leave from a distance, then made a phone call.

A woman's voice came from the other side of the line.

"Hello? Pianbao? Is something the matter?"

"Lend me some money."

"Aren't you saving up to buy a Heavenly Spiritual Root? Are you asking me for a loan because you've finally got enough?"

"Something came up today. I spent some money on a divine consultation, and now I can't make the interest payment on my loan for this period."

"Oh? What was so important that you needed a divine consultation?"

"I helped that guy out. I originally just thought he had a good disposition, that he could live a life beyond the ordinary, but I never intended to go this far. However…"

Zhang Pianpian's gaze swept over Zhang Yu's head.

Songyang City Patrol Outsourced Employee (Expand Details)

Songyang City Patrol Outsourced Employee | Ascetic | Athlete | Extremely Impoverished Resident of Songyang City | Debt-Slave | Card-Slave | ???

When Zhang Pianpian focused her attention on the '???', she received a single piece of feedback: Unknown potential, indefinable.

Zhang Pianpian then shifted her gaze to Bai Zhenzhen.

Songyang City Patrol Intern (Expand Details)

Songyang City Patrol Intern | Sword Freak | Fist Freak | Palm Freak | Blade Freak | Spear Freak | Booster Freak | Score Tyrant | Loan Slave | Card Slave | Proponent of Daoist arts' Uselessness | Songyang Hater | She is very poor...

Then, with a few quick swipes of her finger, she cast two consecutive spells, and a new line of text appeared above 'Songyang City Patrol Intern' over Bai Zhenzhen's head.

Unknown Spiritual Root: Hidden, Evolving Type. No current data.

As Zhang Pianpian's finger moved, motes of light flashed across the Talisman Tome floating beside her.

When the spell was complete, both the '???' above Zhang Yu's head and the 'Unknown Spiritual Root' above Bai Zhenzhen's had vanished, completely concealed from view.

Meanwhile, Zhang Pianpian continued speaking into the phone, "They're even more exceptional than I anticipated."

"Maybe... they'll be able to keep up with me."

On the other end of the line, the woman said in surprise, "Oh? I've never heard you praise anyone so highly. Now I'm even more excited to meet them."

# Chapter 60: Talisman Tome

On the street.

Bai Zhenzhen kept bumping Zhang Yu with her shoulder, a fawning look on her face.

"Yu-boy, you've been playing with that for a while now."

"Let me have a turn."

"This thing is worth a hundred thousand! A hundred thousand!" Zhang Yu clutched the Talisman Tome tightly. "You're so strong, what if you accidentally break it? You could never afford to replace it."

"And wipe your drool, you're about to get it on my Talisman Tome."

Bai Zhenzhen watched with longing eyes as Zhang Yu breathed on the Talisman Tome and polished it.

"Let's trade," she said, trying to curry favor. "You let me play with the Talisman Tome, and you can play with anything of mine you want."

Seeing that Zhang Yu was still engrossed in his Talisman Tome, Bai Zhenzhen grew angry and grabbed his hand. Then, she put on a sweet smile and shook his arm.

"Brother Zhang Yu~ Please let me play with it."

Zhang Yu quickly covered his eyes, feeling as if he had just stared directly at an elder god.

"Stop it, you're grossing me out."

"Hmph! Your weakness is exposed." Bai Zhenzhen quickly snatched the Talisman Tome from his loosened grip.

Zhang Yu rolled his eyes. "Fine, you can play with it for a bit. Just give it back when we get to the station."

Bai Zhenzhen shook her head and sighed. "A man with roots is a man with weaknesses."

"Just look at Door-plank—he was completely unassailable today."

"Yu-boy, I suggest you get snipped. Erase that weakness of yours..."

Zhang Yu snorted coldly. "Do you still want to borrow my Talisman Tome?"

When they reached the station, Zhang Yu parted ways with a reluctant Bai Zhenzhen under her lingering gaze and started for home.

At this very moment, in another part of the city.

A figure answered a call from Su Haifeng.

Su Haifeng's voice came through the line, "...That's the basic situation. He has become a Divine Assistant under Zhang Pianpian's protection, so the usual methods at school are off the table for now."

"Also, he has a Talisman Tome. As a temporary worker for the Inspection Team, he gets at least one free talisman a day..."

Zhou Tianyi nodded slightly and said faintly, "I understand. I have to make my move before he becomes familiar with the Talisman Tome and its spells. He also happened to use his one free talisman for the day... so today is the best opportunity, isn't it?"

Su Haifeng urged, "If you're going to do it, do it fast. You should go find him right now."

Zhou Tianyi nodded. "I know. I'll go find Zhang Yu as soon as I'm done with what I'm doing."

Su Haifeng was perplexed. "Is there something so important it can't wait?"

Zhou Tianyi shook his head. "Some things cannot be delayed by a single second."

"Don't worry, it won't take long. It won't affect my plans for Zhang Yu."

After hanging up, Zhou Tianyi's figure blurred into motion. A gale seemed to erupt from under his feet as he shot down the street ahead.

He tightened the delivery bag on his back, and with a loud crack, the pavement beneath his feet fractured as he accelerated again.

While dealing with Zhang Yu was important, his customer had paid for guaranteed on-time delivery, so he had to finish his current order before he could go after his target.

Ever since an evil god had unlocked his potential, Zhou Tianyi had discovered a unique trait: the more urgent his pace, the faster his mana recovered, the stronger his body became, and even the cultivation speed of his leg techniques would increase.

Thus, to cultivate and earn money simultaneously, he had chosen to hide his identity and work as a delivery driver.

He still remembered his first day on the job, when the soups and drinks in his delivery bag had spilled everywhere. He was not only chewed out by the customer but was also docked several hundred in fines by the platform.

Back at the station, his manager poured him a cup of water and told him to carry it in his hand on his deliveries; as long as the water didn't spill, the food would be safe.

From that day on, the number of orders he delivered daily grew, and his rating on the platform climbed higher and higher.

Then, at some point, Zhou Tianyi began to notice that everything on the road seemed to be slowing down. He later asked his manager about it and learned it wasn't that the world was slowing down, but that he was getting faster.

If he were not hiding his true strength, he was confident he could place first in the entire grade every single month in their exams.

After completing his last delivery and seeing the payment arrive in his account, Zhou Tianyi let out a soft sigh of relief.

"Right then... time to find Zhang Yu."

A short while later, Zhou Tianyi arrived downstairs from Zhang Yu's apartment building.

_According to Zhang Yu's own words, he can't cultivate in his rented room. He has to go to that abandoned building nearby to practice every day,_ he thought.

_Then I just need to wait for him to head to the abandoned building before I strike._

...

Upon returning to his apartment.

Zhang Yu washed his face, then began to fiddle with the Talisman Tome in his hands, intending to study its functions properly.

After all, even though he had used a Detainment Talisman earlier, the entire process had been too rushed. He had been so busy with one thing after another that he hadn't had a moment to himself to properly examine the tome.

He pressed his palm against the Talisman Tome, and with a surge of mana, his fingerprint, palm print, and mana signature were successfully identified.

A golden light flashed across the tome, revealing a yellow background like a sheet of talisman paper. By simply tracing a finger across its surface, he could draw various talismans.

Then Zhang Yu gently lifted his hand, and the Talisman Tome floated up with it, hovering just before his palm.

Zhang Yu waved his hand from side to side, and the tome drifted back and forth, closely following his palm's every move.

"This follow-mode is pretty useful. I don't need to hold it, I can just focus on drawing."

He tapped the very bottom of the Talisman Tome's display and swiped upward. The talisman paper background changed, replaced by rows of data.

[Follower Name: Zhang Yu]

[Realm: Qi Refining]

[Overall Faith Level: 1]

Zhang Yu looked further down and saw the names and symbols of the Eight Great Divine Ministries, with their respective faith levels listed next to them.

Because Zhang Yu had never done anything to raise his faith level, his standing with all Eight Great Divine Ministries was still at the default Level 1 that came with the tome.

He casually tapped on the first one listed, the Department of the People, and the image on the Talisman Tome shifted, displaying a divine hall in the Spirit Realm.

Past layers of red walls and golden tiles, celestial dragons danced and phoenixes circled. A great god, shimmering with five-colored light, stood majestically in the hall, one hand forming a Daoist seal. A compassionate aura washed over him, and the god's slightly closed eyes seemed unable to bear the sight of the world's suffering.

This was the first righteous god of the Department of the People, the All-Beings Innate God.

Three options appeared on the Talisman Tome.

1. Worship God
2. Make an Offering
3. Consult

Below the "Consult" option was a shroud of gray mist, hiding further options that were presumably locked due to his insufficient faith level.

Looking at the three options, Zhang Yu wondered, _What does 'Worship God' do?_

He tapped it curiously, and a line of text appeared on the tome: The All-Beings Innate God has felt your reverence.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 61: Worshipping a God

"Huh?" Zhang Yu stared at the screen.

_Is this some kind of remote, online god-worshipping?_

Just then, he felt his phone vibrate.

Department of the People - All-Beings Innate God

Payment: 1000

Holy hell!

Zhang Yu was stunned; he never imagined that one tap to worship a god would cost him 1000.

But what he found even more unacceptable… was that he had never even set up a payment account for the Talisman Tome. It had just debited the money directly from his bank card?

Back at Songyang High School, when he had used the Detainment Talisman, Zhang Yu had been using the single free daily use granted to temporary members of the Investigation Team.

He tried to find a refund or customer service option, but his search turned up nothing.

Worried he might accidentally make another payment, he decided to contact Zhang Pianpian to ask about it.

After hearing Zhang Yu's story, Zhang Pianpian replied, "That's how worshipping a god works. One tap is one prayer, and it costs one thousand. A long press lets you pray continuously."

Zhang Yu said, "That's not... I get that I have to pay now, but the problem is I never set up a payment account. How can it just take money from my bank card without even asking me?"

Zhang Pianpian stated matter-of-factly, "That is the might of the gods. They can move funds from billions of accounts every second of every day."

"If they couldn't even withdraw money directly from your account, what right would they have to be called gods?"

She added a word of caution, "So, you can owe anyone money, but you must never, ever owe money to a god."

_What the hell..._

Hearing this, Zhang Yu was speechless for a moment before he could only mutter, "The Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods are really something else."

Zhang Pianpian said, "But you don't need to be afraid. The Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods have their own rules; they won't act recklessly."

"This time, it only charged you 1000 because you chose to worship a god yourself."

Zhang Yu sighed internally and asked, "Sis, can you just walk me through the functions of the Talisman Tome? I'm afraid I'll get charged again by accident."

Zhang Pianpian explained, "Daily worship of a deity is the most fundamental way to raise your faith level. The longer your continuous streak of worship, the greater the increase to your faith level with each prayer."

"But if you miss a single day, you have to start all over again."

"For those with a high faith level or experts in the Dao of talismans, daily worship is a mandatory practice."

Zhang Yu understood now.

_So it's a daily check-in, is that it? Except the minimum cost for checking in each day is 1000._

Zhang Pianpian continued, "As for making offerings to a god, there are different methods like lighting incense, raising merit banners, and establishing memorial tablets. The more expensive the offering, the better the effect on your faith level. It can also grant miraculous effects like increasing the power of your talismans or granting special talisman privileges."

"You can tap on 'Make Offering' to take a look. It won't charge you for just looking at the options."

That instant 1000 charge had genuinely spooked Zhang Yu. Hearing her reassurance, he cautiously tapped on the option to make an offering.

He saw a price list for various items like lighting incense, hanging a merit banner, setting up a memorial tablet, and chanting scriptures, with costs ranging from the hundreds to the tens of thousands.

After reading through the descriptions for a moment, it suddenly dawned on him… these all seemed to be remote offerings, where paying money would manifest the effect in a temple in the Spirit Realm.

_Don't tell me these are all virtual items!?_

Zhang Yu finally understood how the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods got their money. Every single one of these gods was practically raking in cash while lying down.

Zhang Pianpian went on to explain, "Consult a God, as the name implies, is for seeking guidance on the Dao of talismans. The costs here are very high, and your faith level is too low right now, so you don't need to spend any money here."

"The options further down, the ones shrouded in mist that you can't see, all require a higher faith level to unlock. Don't even think about them for now…"

After ending the call with Zhang Pianpian, Zhang Yu stared helplessly at the Talisman Tome, a bitter feeling welling up in his heart.

"This talisman stuff… is really too difficult."

"How much money would it cost to win first place in the Daoist art competition?"

Just as Zhang Yu was lost in thought for a moment, the ritual countdown in his mind started blaring again, reminding him not to daze off and to get back to training.

Zhang Yu had no choice but to put these thoughts aside for now. He first mixed a cup of demonic beast meat powder for himself and drank it, then headed to the abandoned building, intending to start today's practice.

In any case, the Daoist art competition was still months away; the most immediate event was the martial arts competition.

And when he thought of martial arts, Zhang Yu's confidence instantly returned.

_I have level 5 Freehand Combat, level 10 Limitless Cloud Hand, and level 6 Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art. If I go all out in a combat competition, I'll have a huge advantage. The problem is..._

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _I have to keep these trump cards hidden._

Especially the level 10 Limitless Cloud Hand, which was a cultivation technique he had just obtained from the Mana Competition.

If he were to use a level 10 Limitless Cloud Hand in the martial arts competition just over a month later, he was afraid it would attract far too much attention, to the point where not even Zhang Pianpian could protect him.

_In the martial arts competition, I have to hide my high-level cultivation techniques, so for now, I need to focus on improving my fundamental attributes._

Arriving at the abandoned building, Zhang Yu once again began practicing the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art.

As the martial will in his sea of consciousness erupted, he began performing the nine disciplines of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, both internally and externally.

Under the effects of the art, Zhang Yu felt his blood boil and his body surge with motivation, a will to battle heaven and earth urging him to train relentlessly.

And just as Zhang Yu was wholeheartedly immersed in his training, relentlessly practicing the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art.

In the shadows of the abandoned building's stairwell, a figure was silently observing the ascetically training Zhang Yu.

Zhou Tianyi thought to himself, _I can't give Zhang Yu any time to use his Talisman Tome._

_I have to wait until he's at his weakest, most powerless moment, and succeed with a single sneak attack..._

After waiting for about two more hours.

Watching Zhang Yu's movements gradually slow down, Zhou Tianyi held his breath and began to draw upon the mana in his dantian... he was preparing to strike.

Swoosh!

The instant Zhang Yu turned his back, Zhou Tianyi shot forward like a gale, pushing his level 5 Rushing Wind Leg Technique to its absolute limit as he aimed a kick at the center of Zhang Yu's back.

Seeing that he was already within three meters of Zhang Yu and his opponent had yet to fully turn around, a glint of triumph flashed in Zhou Tianyi's eyes.

He was confident that with the power of his kick, he could knock Zhang Yu down the moment it connected.

Zhou Tianyi had already planned out the next few moves to follow up with after knocking Zhang Yu down, ensuring his opponent would be rendered completely unconscious.

In the very next instant, however, a burst of white, misty astral qi erupted from Zhang Yu's back.

Bang!

Zhou Tianyi's heart lurched as he felt his kick land as if on a wad of cotton, light and completely devoid of impact.

But a moment later, an overwhelming force rebounded violently with the white astral qi, slamming heavily into the sole of his foot.

# Chapter 62: Annihilation, and a Friend

Inside the abandoned building, Zhou Tianyi, after a bitter wait of over two hours, believed he had finally found an opportunity to ambush Zhang Yu.
