But his lightning-fast strike was unexpectedly thwarted by a surge of astral qi erupting from Zhang Yu's back.

Having thrown the kick, Zhou Tianyi was left standing on only one leg.

The sudden rebound from the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi threw him off balance, sending him flying backward.

"What!"

_Zhang Yu has been learning the Limitless Cloud Hand for less than a month! How can he already emit astral qi from his back?_

Shock flooded Zhou Tianyi's mind as he felt the immense power contained within that surge of astral qi.

But before one shock could subside, another took its place; just as he tumbled to the ground and snapped his head up.

A figure radiating a murderous aura had already closed the distance, appearing directly before his eyes.

Before, when watching Zhang Yu train from a distance, Zhou Tianyi had only thought he looked imposing.

Now, face-to-face, he truly understood what that aura was.

It was a berserk killing intent, an endless will to fight. Watching Zhang Yu charge him like a vengeful demon under the influence of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, he felt an overwhelming impulse to turn and flee.

But just as Zhou Tianyi took an instinctive step back, Zhang Yu unleashed his full power.

Facing the masked man who had tried to ambush him, Zhang Yu, under the influence of his Martial Ascension Will, had entered a complete combat state.

_Fight! Fight! Fight! I will grind any and all enemies to dust!_

He unleashed his level 10 Limitless Cloud Hand with everything he had.

Zhang Yu thrust out a palm, and mana surged wildly from his dantian, oscillating seven times in a single instant before transforming into a torrent of Formless Cloud-Astral Qi that poured forth.

As the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi rushed at him, Zhou Tianyi knew this was a matter of life and death; with a roar, he stomped his foot and kicked out with all his might.

Boom!

The moment the two forces collided, Zhou Tianyi felt his mana give way; the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi struck him like a freight truck, sending him flying into a concrete wall not far behind.

The impact punched a hole straight through the wall.

Zhou Tianyi collapsed to the ground amidst a pile of shattered concrete and brick.

He tried to struggle to his feet, but a wave of excruciating pain shot through him, and he had no idea how many bones and muscles were broken as he collapsed to the ground once more.

Zhang Yu slowly approached him, still immersed in the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art and radiating a vicious aura. He stared coldly at the masked Zhou Tianyi and asked, "Who are you? Why did you attack me?"

Zhou Tianyi did not answer, instead assessing his injuries as despair washed over him.

With injuries this severe, he had no idea how much money it would take to recover; it would be a catastrophic setback to his Immortal Dao cultivation, and might even destroy his path completely.

While he was lost in his thoughts, Zhang Yu grabbed his mask and tore it away.

A flicker of astonishment crossed his face when he saw who was beneath it.

"Zhou Tianyi?"

Zhou Tianyi's mind raced, and he looked at Zhang Yu, saying, "Zhang Yu, do you know why you were admitted to Songyang High School?"

Seeing Zhang Yu was listening, Zhou Tianyi continued, "It's because your physical body is highly compatible with certain wealthy individuals, so they selected you to be cultivated at the high school."

"Just like many of the other poor students at Songyang High, physical compatibility has always been a hidden criterion, right alongside academic performance."

Zhang Yu frowned, not immediately believing Zhou Tianyi, and asked, "Then why recruit them into Songyang High School? Couldn't they be trained somewhere else?"

Zhou Tianyi sneered. "What do you think Songyang High School is? It has a dark and complex side that is far beyond your imagination."

"At Songyang High, the poor can be their dogs, or they can be a bank of spare parts. Of course, they need to be trained uniformly, to undergo the same cultivation as their masters."

Zhang Yu suddenly recalled the Heavenly Demon Parasitic Art.

_Could it be that a student at Songyang High is really practicing that cultivation technique?_

Zhang Yu stared at Zhou Tianyi. "So, you were sent by the student council?"

"Like I said, Songyang is complicated..." Zhou Tianyi shook his head, then suddenly coughed up a large mouthful of blood.

Under the influence of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, Zhang Yu had shown his attacker almost no mercy, striking with lethal force.

Zhou Tianyi could feel how severe his injuries were. He knew if he didn't get treatment soon, not only would his Immortal Dao cultivation suffer, but his very life would be at risk.

A flicker of desperation appeared in his eyes, and Zhou Tianyi began speaking faster. 

"Zhang Yu! An evil god awakened your potential and granted you some kind of power, didn't it?"

Zhang Yu’s gaze sharpened, but he remained silent; he could never reveal anything about himself or the evil god ritual.

Zhou Tianyi said, "You don't have to deny it. You..."

A sickly flush crossed his face, and a spasm of pain from his internal injuries left him momentarily speechless.

"Zhang Yu... we're... on the same side..."

"Take... take me to a clinic nearby."

Seeing Zhang Yu still motionless, feeling his life slipping away, Zhou Tianyi grew more frantic and finally blurted out, "I... I also serve an evil god, and that entity... is very interested in you..."

Just then, his body temperature began to rise, and pinpricks of light, like sparks, appeared on his cheeks.

A flicker of terror crossed Zhou Tianyi's eyes, and he roared, "I didn't mean to say it, I didn't really say it! Wait, I was just using him..."

As the light showed no sign of stopping, Zhou Tianyi finally couldn't help but scream, "Idiot!"

"That idiot!"

The next moment, crimson flames erupted all over his body.

Zhang Yu's brow furrowed deeply as he watched Zhou Tianyi turn to ash in the blink of an eye.

_Zhou Tianyi was working for an evil god?_

But when he thought about how the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods demanded your money, while the evil gods only demanded your life, Zhang Yu suddenly realized that the evil gods... weren't without their advantages.

After all, Kunxu was full of poor people who had nothing but their lives to give.

_Come to think of it... maybe followers of evil gods aren't that rare in Kunxu._

Watching the ashes on the ground gradually disperse, he wondered, _Was that a backlash from some kind of ritual power?_

_Definitely feels like the work of some idiotic ritual._

Thinking back on what just happened, Zhang Yu wondered, _Have I been making too much noise lately, enough to attract the attention of an evil god? No, Zhou Tianyi knew me long before this. Could I have been targeted a long time ago?_

His heart sank, knowing this was something he couldn't discuss with anyone.

The three great academies, the student council, the evil gods... recalling the opponents he would have to face, Zhang Yu sighed to himself.

_Ultimately, I just have to get stronger._

He especially thought about his fight with Zhou Tianyi; if he hadn't been strong enough, he would have been the one defeated.

He thought back on the day's events: advancing and retreating during the illusionary landscape assessment, receiving Zhang Pianpian's open protection, and defeating Zhou Tianyi with his own martial strength...

At that moment, a realization seemed to dawn on Zhang Yu, and he suddenly broke into a smile.

Before, whenever he switched between the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra and the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, he had felt a kind of mental conflict.

But now he suddenly thought, _Fight when you should fight, retreat when you should retreat. Face different situations with different mindsets. Why was I ever conflicted over such a simple truth?_

In that instant, Zhang Yu felt his Martial Ascension Will operate more harmoniously and smoothly, and switching to the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra became effortless, without the slightest hint of sluggishness.

_Time to keep training._

Whether it was enemies in the shadows or rivals from Songyang High and the three great academies, Zhang Yu needed to grow even stronger.

The night passed in a flash, and Zhang Yu's Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art reached level 6 (41/60).

Meanwhile, nside an office at Songyang High School.

Su Haifeng listened to the voice on the other end of the line, his own voice laced with surprise.

"He died from the backlash? Did he betray us?"

Listening to the response, Su Haifeng nodded repeatedly. "I will cooperate with you to process Zhou Tianyi's withdrawal."

"Rest assured, no one at the school should notice anything unusual."

"But what's the plan for Zhang Yu?"

"Honestly, between the school board, the student council, and the patrol teams... I think he's already attracting too much attention. Since our hidden asset Zhou has failed, it's too risky for any of our remaining people to make a move and risk exposure. Maybe we should leave Zhang Yu alone for now and look at the other candidates."

"After all, that Zhang Pianpian can only protect him for half a year at most..."

...

Songyang High School.

A calm, scholarly atmosphere still permeated the school grounds.

Zhang Yu took in the peaceful scene, watching the students focus on their textbooks and cultivation, and it felt as though the violent conflict on the training grounds yesterday had never even happened.

Even Zhou Tianyi's disappearance today went largely unnoticed by the class. They only heard that someone had processed his withdrawal, just like Liang Qin before him, causing almost no ripples. After all, students withdrawing was hardly a rare occurrence at Songyang High School.

It wasn't like someone jumping off a building, which might at least give the students something to talk about over a meal.

But Zhang Yu could still sense a few subtle differences.

For instance... no one was willing to come near him anymore.

The classmates who used to greet him, ask him questions, or seek his advice on cultivation... had all vanished.

It was as if an invisible wall now surrounded him, keeping everyone else away.

Of course, he knew why.

_Are they so afraid of being associated with the student council's trouble that they don't even dare to speak to me?_

Clatter!

Bai Zhenzhen casually set her tray down and sat opposite Zhang Yu.

Looking at Zhen, Zhang Yu sighed. At least he still had a good friend like her.

Bai Zhenzhen scarfed down her food while looking at Zhang Yu.

"Yu-boy, let me borrow the Talisman Tome for a few days."

Zhang Yu retracted his previous thought. _I don't have friends who ask to borrow something worth a hundred thousand the moment they sit down._

Clank.

Qian Shen also placed his tray on the table, sitting down beside Zhang Yu.

Zhang Yu smiled. Old Qian might have a lower score than him, be a bit prejudiced, and look down on lower-scoring students, but it seemed he was a reliable friend nonetheless.

Qian Shen shoveled a few mouthfuls of food into his mouth, then suddenly asked, "Um... that Zhang Pianpian who scored a 699 yesterday, do you know her well?"

"Could you introduce me? I want to add her as a friend..."

Zhang Yu shot Qian Shen a glare.

He retracted his previous thought.

_This guy!_

_I treat you like a brother, and you're trying to make a move on my sister?_

_Doesn't he see there's no room for him on that golden thigh?_

But then Zhang Yu had another thought. He remembered that Qian Shen was also without any backing, and saw the look of pure adoration in his eyes.

Zhang Yu understood. _So he's just a superfan who wants to be on her friends list?_

Zhang Yu said, "Adding her as a friend shouldn't be a problem."

"But a spot on her friends list costs 3,000. You can just pay me."

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 63: Changes

Songyang High School.

Inside the cafeteria during lunchtime.

Zhao Tianxing held his meal tray, somewhat hesitant.

The campus now seemed tranquil, as if nothing had changed.

But the conflict on the training grounds yesterday had already spread throughout the campus.

Nearly every student knew that Zhang Yu of Year One, Class 1, had sided with White Dragon High School, clashing with student council vice president Zhou Chechen and a group of second-year seniors.

Based on Zhao Tianxing's observations of the various student cliques, the general consensus was simple.

The Songyang loyalists' take was: "What is he, if not a traitor to our school? A turncoat to our class? Siding with White Dragon for personal gain makes him a Songyang defector! He should be expelled!"

The jealous students wondered: "First Li Xuelian, now Zhang Pianpian. How does Zhang Yu keep attracting these rich girls? We strongly suspect his surgery wasn't thorough; the school needs to investigate him."

Anger, jealousy, and a hidden undercurrent of envy coalesced into pure, undisguised malice.

Most students, afraid of trouble, didn't dare get anywhere near Zhang Yu, fearing they'd be targeted by the student council and the Songyang loyalists.

Zhao Tianxing was no different; he was terrified that getting too close to Zhang Yu would put a target on his back.

After all, bullying was not unheard of at Songyang High School.

Zhao Tianxing had heard a story about Shuang Youpeng from the previous year, who had taken first place in the monthly exams as a first-year and was considered a rising star.

But upon entering his second year, his grades started falling behind those of the wealthy students, and that was when the torment began.

They forbade him from doing homework, from using alchemical enhancers, from training, and from pulling all-nighters to study.

They even forced him to eat fried chicken, french fries, beer, and desserts every day, making him watch as his stomach bloated, fat accumulated, and the hard-earned muscle he had trained so diligently wasted away.

They forced him to watch videos, read novels, and play games every day, to see his grades plummet point by point, and to feel his very Dao heart writhe in agony.

Only when he finally broke and begged for mercy did Zhou Chechen let him go.

Just imagining the ordeal made it hard for Zhao Tianxing to breathe.

So when Zhang Yu invited him to eat today, he had panicked and claimed he had something to do, saying he would go to the cafeteria later.

Weighed down by hesitation, Zhao Tianxing got his food and, holding his tray, instinctively averted his eyes when he saw Zhang Yu looking his way again.

That single act of avoidance made Zhao Tianxing's heart sink.

"Sigh, I guess Zhang Yu and I aren't friends anymore."

He wandered aimlessly through the cafeteria for a few steps, tray in hand, but couldn't resist looking back toward Zhang Yu's table.

When he saw Bai Zhenzhen and Qian Shen sit down with Zhang Yu, a flicker of envy appeared in his eyes.

"Bai Zhenzhen, Qian Shen... how can they be so bold? Aren't they scared at all?"

"If only I could be like them and just do what I want."

Although he always overthought things, Zhao Tianxing hated this about himself; he wished he could stop worrying so much about what others thought, but he just couldn't.

Just then, Zhao Tianxing subconsciously tightened his grip on his tray, wanting to walk over to Zhang Yu's table, but he felt the eyes of the students around him, both consciously and unconsciously, fixed on him, as if sitting next to Zhang Yu would make him an outcast to the entire school.

Of course, he was just overthinking; with so many people in the cafeteria, almost no one was paying him any special attention.

Watching Zhang Yu, Qian Shen, and Bai Zhenzhen chat cheerfully, Zhao Tianxing felt an unconscious yearning in his heart.

After returning home yesterday, he couldn't stop replaying the image of Zhang Yu standing his ground against Zhou Chechen, not yielding an inch.

He envied Zhang Yu for being able to do that, and desperately wished he could face any pressure with the same effortless composure.

Just as Zhao Tianxing was hesitating, stuck in his indecision, he suddenly saw Zhang Yu wave him over.

"Old Zhao! Over here!"

Zhao Tianxing froze for a second. _Does Zhang Yu think I just couldn't find him?_

He gritted his teeth and strode quickly over to Zhang Yu's side, taking a seat.

In that moment, he felt like everyone in the cafeteria must be staring at him, and all he wanted was to sit down as fast as possible so Zhang Yu would stop calling out.

This time, he wasn't imagining it; many people were indeed watching Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, Qian Shen, and him.

But in that instant, Zhao Tianxing also felt cool, perhaps as cool in others' eyes as Zhang Yu had been yesterday.

He was wrong; to most students, Zhao Tianxing now looked like a clown, equally branded as an untouchable.

Just as Zhao Tianxing sat down, Zhang Yu received a message back from Zhang Pianpian.

Zhang Yu's message to Zhang Pianpian had read: "Sis, I have a classmate who's really dedicated to his studies and wants to add you as a friend."

Zhang Pianpian: "What's his score?"

Zhang Yu: "His highest was over six hundred and twenty."

Zhang Pianpian: "Too low. Not happening."

Zhang Yu: "Huh?"

_My sister is seriously discriminatory about scores,_ Zhang Yu thought.

He suddenly remembered the phone calls Zhang Pianpian used to make to him. Back then, with a score below 600, he must have seemed like walking trash in her eyes... no wonder she was so blunt.

Then again, considering the environment at White Dragon High School, Zhang Yu felt that... well, it was perfectly reasonable for the top-ranked student there to act this way.

Looking up at Qian Shen's expectant face, Zhang Yu said apologetically, "I... she said your score of over 620 is too low, so she won't add you."

Qian Shen looked stunned for a moment, then his face flushed red as he reminded Zhang Yu not to forget the last digit.

"My highest was 626!"

But after saying this, Qian Shen's head dropped, his expression crestfallen.

Zhang Yu felt as though a thousand thoughts had crossed Qian Shen's mind in that instant, before he finally nodded and said, "My score really is too low."

Then Qian Shen looked up again, his face full of admiration.

"As expected of someone with a 699. Even her way of choosing friends has so much class."

"Please tell her I'll study harder, raise my score, and earn the right to be her friend."

"Also, even though I'm at Songyang High School, I've always admired White Dragon High. I even tried to test in before, but I just missed the cutoff for their model class..."

Zhang Yu got it. Qian Shen was a White Dragon wannabe, through and through. The damn air at White Dragon High must smell sweeter to him or something.

With a look of disgust, he relayed the message to Zhang Pianpian.

Zhang Pianpian: "In the future, don't bother relaying messages from peole scoring 620-something. Their grades are too low. They can't keep up with us."

Looking at Qian Shen's newly determined expression, Zhang Yu thought for a moment and decided he couldn't bring himself to repeat her words.

...

During the afternoon class.

The literature teacher was lecturing at the front of the room.

Bai Zhenzhen was at her desk, diligently practicing her mana control.

Just then, her phone buzzed softly. Picking it up, she saw it was a message from Mo Tianyi.

Mo Tianyi: "Bai Zhenzhen, have you and Zhang Yu thrown in your lot with Zhang Pianpian from White Dragon High?"

Zhen froze for a second. She understood immediately but was unsure how to respond.

Zhang Pianpian, the top third-year at White Dragon High, was the epitome of a wealthy student in the eyes of Mo Tianyi and his circle of poor students.

From their perspective, Zhang Pianpian taking Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu under her wing... could only mean she had forcibly poached them from Songyang High School.

What other reason could there be? Bai Zhenzhen couldn't possibly tell Mo Tianyi that Zhang Pianpian simply admired her and Zhang Yu's talent and wanted to support their bid to enter the Ten Greats.

As for Zhang Yu and Zhang Pianpian's sibling relationship, she had promised to keep it a secret. She wasn't a gossip like Zhou Tianyi, so that was out of the question.

But then, it dawned on her. Why explain at all?

If she explained too much, would she have to tell them they hadn't signed anything? Would she have to reveal that she and Zhang Yu planned to aim for the Ten Greats under Zhang Pianpian's protection?

What if Mo Tianyi and their leader then wanted Zhang Pianpian's patronage as well... what would she do?

Or worse, what if Mo Tianyi's group let it slip, and the wealthy students found out? That would just create unnecessary complications.

It was a good thing that everyone currently assumed they had been recruited by the wealthy Zhang Pianpian and would no longer aim for the Ten Greats.

If they really made it into the Ten Greats, she could repay the tens of thousands Mo Tianyi and the others had invested in them, and maybe even help them reach the second layer of Kunxu.

_Ultimately, for Yu-boy and me, just as for Mo Tianyi, getting into the Ten Greats is all that matters._

_Therefore, any choice that increases our chances of success is the optimal one._

With that decided, Bai Zhenzhen replied immediately.

"Yes. I'm sorry, we couldn't handle the pressure anymore. We're not aiming for the Ten Greats. We've already signed with Zhang Pianpian."

A moment later, Mo Tianyi replied, "Sigh, I don't blame you. I heard about the pressure Songyang High put on you. It's understandable that you couldn't take it. But please, I hope you and Zhang Yu will keep our business a secret and not tell anyone."

"Don't worry. Even though we've given up, we're still rooting for you. You're the last hope for us poor students. Go for it!"

...

In the Spirit Realm.

Mo Tianyi read Bai Zhenzhen's sincere reply and breathed a small sigh of relief, though a flicker of regret crossed his mind.

Both Zhang Yu's fourth-place finish in the Mana Competition and Bai Zhenzhen's previously demonstrated willpower had led him to believe the two of them might actually have a chance at the Ten Greats.

But now, it seemed...

"In the end, they couldn't handle the pressure."

He then felt a pang of regret for the money sent to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, all of it now wasted.

"If I'd known, I never would have sent them the money. It would have been better to save it for our leader."

He sighed internally.

"In the end, the one who can get into the Ten Greats, the one who can lead us in shattering this ceiling above our heads, has to be our leader..."_

Just then, a line of text flashed before his eyes: "Work has been idle for more than one minute. Please return to your station immediately."

Mo Tianyi quickly shook himself from his thoughts, reopened his connection to the Spirit Realm, and resumed his work.

Unlike other schools, soul cultivator students at Mount Mang High School were required to participate in work-study programs from their first year.

Soon, dialogue boxes began popping up in front of Mo Tianyi. Today, he was working as a customer service representative for a tutoring agency.

Customer: "My son already had the sterilization procedure, but his high school application was rejected. Now the girls' schools and soul cultivator programs are also rejecting him for being 'physically incomplete.' What can I do?"

Mo Tianyi replied: "Girls' schools and soul cultivator programs have lower entry barriers, so they're always highly sought after. Physical 'incompleteness' is an easy reason for disqualification. However, there is a possible solution. You could have your son undergo a sterilization reversal surgery and then re-interview."

Mo Tianyi: "If that fails, he can repeat the year and undergo the sterilization procedure again. A two-time sterilization is a major bonus on a resume. It demonstrates a resolute Dao heart, and he would almost certainly be admitted next year."

Mo Tianyi: "We have partner hospitals we can recommend..."

Beside Mo Tianyi, a dozen identical copies of himself were simultaneously handling different customer dialogue boxes.

These copies of Mo Tianyi existed within the Spirit Realm, confined to a ten-square-meter room containing nothing but themselves and the dialogue boxes.

After eighteen consecutive hours of work, he was finally granted a five-minute break.

Looking at the wages he had earned, Mo Tianyi immediately transferred the money to his leader.

_Our leader really needs the money right now._

The thought that his earnings for the day would give his leader a slightly better chance of getting into the Ten Greats filled Mo Tianyi's heart with satisfaction and hope.

_You have to succeed, leader. You're the only poor student in all of Songyang City with a chance of getting into the Ten Greats._

_You're our only chance to escape this life..._

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 64: Martial Arts Tutoring

"Mo Tianyi contacted you?"

In the school hallway, Zhang Yu listened to Bai Zhenzhen's explanation and finally nodded slightly.

"You're right. There's no need to tell them the truth right now."

Bai Zhenzhen continued, "Besides, there's something strange about their leader."

"I told you I was going to try and find out who he is, right?"

"According to Mo Tianyi's group, this leader of theirs also placed in a competition during his first year."

"I spent weeks looking into it, even going over the first-year competition results from the three major schools for the past few years. Only two of the winners could be considered poor students."

"But from what I've gathered, both of them have already signed contracts with White Dragon High, so there's no way they could aim for the Ten Greats."

Zhang Yu asked, "So, you're saying Mo Tianyi and his group have been scammed?"

Bai Zhenzhen shook her head, a strange look on her face.

"According to them, their leader signed a contract with them, witnessed by the Heavenly Covenant God, promising to get into the Ten Greats and to bring them to the second layer when he is able."

"In any case, I just don't understand the situation."

As they spoke, they arrived at the training grounds.

...

On the training grounds.

Their martial arts instructor, Lei Jun, was already there, waiting to begin their tutoring session for the upcoming martial arts competition.

Ever since Zhang Pianpian's visit to Songyang High the day before, the two had been allowed to participate in the martial arts competition again, and their tutoring had resumed.

It was three sessions a week, at a cost of 3,000.

While this was a cheap rate for the instructor, it was still a significant expense for Zhang Yu.

Paying this week's 3,000 fee brought Zhang Yu's savings down to a little over 35,000.

On the training grounds, Lei Jun was wearing a tank top with the characters for "The Grand Use of Martial Arts" printed on the front, and he was diligently performing his warm-up exercises.

Apart from Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, there were no other students around.

They were the only two first-years participating in the martial arts competition.

Unlike the mana competition, where one could participate just for the experience even without hope of placing, the martial arts competition was different.

In the martial arts arena, there was a real risk of being permanently disabled by a student from one of the three major schools.

For poor students, especially, there was the added risk of being driven to financial ruin by the fight.

After all, the costs of on-site first aid, hospitalization for serious injuries, and subsequent treatment would increase exponentially with the severity of the wounds.

Therefore, any first-year who felt they had no chance of placing, rich or poor, chose not to waste their money on the martial arts competition.

Seeing Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen arrive, Lei Jun called out, "I've already registered both of you."

He then sent them a web link. "First thing's first, get your insurance sorted out today."

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen both understood; the first rule of combat was to get insurance.

However, after looking at the price list, they both chose the cheapest plan.

It wasn't that they couldn't afford a premium plan, but that the basic one offered better value for the money.

After all, they would rather spend their money on improving their strength to achieve a higher rank in the competition than on insurance.

Lei Jun reminded them, "That plan only covers up to one hundred thousand in medical fees. If your injuries are more severe, you'll have to pay the rest yourself."

"When you fight, do your best to avoid injury, or at least keep it minimal."

Zhang Yu wholeheartedly agreed. First place in the martial arts competition was only worth a 50,000 prize and the rights to an expert-level martial art. It wasn't worth sustaining injuries that could cost over a hundred thousand to treat.

Lei Jun sighed. "You have it easy now. Back in my day, weapons were allowed in competitions. Even with referees, every year students would either die in the ring or drop out of school under a mountain of debt."

"It got so bad that one year only seven people competed, so the old geezers finally changed the rules to forbid weapons."

"Now the competitions are bare-handed, but you still need to be mindful of whether you can afford the medical bills afterward."

"Alright, that's enough talk. You've bought your insurance, so let's warm up."

Once they had finished warming up, Lei Jun beckoned them over.

"The three major schools have access to Immortal Dao technologies that we don't, and they invest an amount of capital you can't even compare to."

"Things like Heavenly Spiritual Root cultivation, the latest alchemical enhancers from their labs, and even body modification surgeries are all commonplace for them."

"I've looked up the data for the top students from those schools who compete. Their physical strength averages above level 2, and their mana is over 25. And that's before you factor in the alchemical enhancers, combat spiritual roots, and other things they might use during a match..."

"Their stats will inevitably be far superior to yours."

"They're stronger, faster, and have deeper mana reserves."

As Lei Jun spoke, a question arose in Zhang Yu's mind.

_If the three major schools have such a huge advantage, how does our school ever win prizes in these competitions? What's their secret? Is Wang Hai really that good?_

Meanwhile, Lei Jun continued, "...but in a real fight, the person with the better stats doesn't always win. Otherwise, there'd be no point in having practical exams."

Lei Jun said gravely, "So, from now on, you need to get used to fighting opponents who are stronger than you, and you need to learn how to avoid injury as much as possible."

As he spoke, a powerful aura began to emanate from him, washing over Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

"To give you more practical training time, you two will fight me together from now on."

"I will do my best to fight you using the strength and speed of a level 2 physique and a mana level of 25."

A moment later, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen shot forward from the left and right, rushing toward Lei Jun.

Bang!

With the sound of impact, Lei Jun's hands shot out to his sides, blocking a kick from Bai Zhenzhen and a palm strike from Zhang Yu.

In the next instant, the three figures became a blur of motion, engaging in a high-speed battle across the training grounds.

But Zhang Yu didn't feel like he and Bai Zhenzhen were ganging up on Lei Jun at all.

Lei Jun's combat experience was already immense, and now, with superior strength and speed, he effortlessly neutralized his attacks, struck his openings, and even cut off his coordination with Bai Zhenzhen.

It made Zhang Yu feel as if he were facing Lei Jun's oppressive presence all by himself.

Zhang Yu couldn't help but wonder, _"Are all my opponents in the martial arts competition going to have stats so much higher than mine?"_

Zhang Yu realized he had been underestimating the competition. Having to conceal his trump card, the level 10 Limitless Cloud Hand, meant the challenges he would face would be far greater than he had anticipated.

A moment later, with a resounding bang, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were sent flying.

In contrast to the two of them, who were panting heavily, Lei Jun wasn't even flushed or out of breath; he looked as if he had just gone for a walk.

Lei Jun said, "Rest for five minutes, then we continue."

_Old Lei is so strong,_ Bai Zhenzhen thought. _He saw through every move I made. Just how many martial arts does he know?_

_Old Lei seems to have a level 10 Dao heart, 100 mana, and level 10 physical strength,_ Zhang Yu thought. _He's also mastered at least a dozen martial arts to level 10. He's at the absolute peak of the Qi Refinement realm._

_"So why hasn't he advanced to Foundation Establishment?"_

He then voiced his curiosity.

"Instructor Lei, are you still in the Qi Refinement realm? You haven't reached Foundation Establishment?"

Lei Jun's expression darkened at the question. "Foundation Establishment isn't that easy."

Seeing their curious expressions, Lei Jun sighed and said casually, "You have to pass a certification exam for Foundation Establishment. There's one for Golden Core, and another for Nascent Soul. You can't just break through to the next realm whenever you feel like it."

"Uncertified Foundation Establishment is a criminal offense, punishable by death by the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods and the Ten Great Sects. The Ten Great Sects are extremely strict about this."

"You can only take the Foundation Establishment certification exam after you get into a university."

"If you don't get certified before you graduate, you lose your chance for life."

Recalling his own university days, a shadow passed over Lei Jun's eyes.

He remembered that during the years he was trying to get his certification, the number of available slots was drastically reduced.

He recalled how, in just a few short years, the minimum requirement for the spiritual root alone had skyrocketed from 'Human' all the way to 'Heavenly,' a level of competition that had driven him to despair.

In contrast, returning to his hometown of Songyang on the first layer, where he only had to work and cultivate twenty-four hours a day to pay off his loans... felt much more relaxed.

Lei Jun said reflectively, "Having that Foundation Establishment certificate makes all the difference in the world."

"Without Foundation Establishment, ten years of university life is just a fleeting dream. You can't stay up there; you eventually have to come back down to the first layer of Kunxu."

Turning to look at Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu, he thought to himself, _Cherish these easy high school days. Once you get to university, you'll miss how simple things were._

A few minutes later, Lei Jun said, "Rest time's over. Get up."

In the next instant, the three were a tangled mess of combat once more.

After the day's tutoring session, Zhang Yu returned to the abandoned building to continue his practice of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art.

This cultivation technique improved both his Dao heart and his physical strength, offering comprehensive benefits that made it his primary focus.

The Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art was especially valuable as it incorporated nine different martial styles, including fist, leg, and palm techniques, deepening his understanding of both the fundamentals and practical application of various martial arts.

And so, the following days were spent with Zhang Yu dividing his time between studying, cultivating, and attending Lei Jun's tutoring sessions with Bai Zhenzhen.

Eleven days passed in the blink of an eye.

...

That night, in the abandoned building.

As Zhang Yu executed the final form of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, he at last raised the cultivation technique to level 10.

In that instant, the nine martial styles—fist, leg, palm, and more—became as natural to him as breathing, and the combat mindset inherent to the Martial Ascension Will became something he could control at will, granting him boundless fighting spirit and courage while ensuring he remained calm and composed, never succumbing to reckless impulse.

"As expected of a heart art designed for combat, especially its level 10 effect..."

As Zhang Yu's gaze focused, everything around him seemed to slow down a beat.

Even the motion of him raising his own hand appeared to be in slow motion.

It wasn't that everything had actually slowed, but that the level 10 effect of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art had caused his focus and concentration to surge instantaneously, creating the illusion of time dilating.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 65: Exhausting the Savings

With the 10th-level effect of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, Zhang Yu could feel his grasp of combat becoming far more refined. Any subtle change in his opponent's moves could not escape his observation, and he could more precisely mobilize every ounce of his strength to fight. His practical combat ability had skyrocketed.

However, this state also consumed a great deal of stamina, and after maintaining it for one minute, Zhang Yu began to feel dizzy.

_This state of total concentration should be reserved for critical moments in battle, not used carelessly._

The 10th-level Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art gave Zhang Yu a much higher degree of confidence for the martial arts competition.

_But it's still not enough..._

Thinking of the unfairness and injustice of the Mana Competition, and of what Zhang Pianpian had said about taking first place in the martial arts competition, Zhang Yu wanted to secure an even greater advantage.

So, he once again opened the shopping platform and looked at the cultivation techniques he had bookmarked over this period.

Zhang Yu had already considered what he would cultivate after reaching the 10th level of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art.

At this moment, he was looking at an expert-level martial art called the Imperishable Seal Art, along with its 30,000-credit price tag after a fifty-percent discount, its user reviews, and the description of its 10th-level effects.

This Imperishable Seal Art, like the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, was an expert-level cultivation technique.

It was a technique that targeted an enemy's mana, allowing for mana redirection and reflection.

Not only was it exceedingly difficult to learn, but mastering it was even harder. The user review section was filled with comments about the technique's difficulty, stating that anyone who bought it would have to spend money hiring a tutor.

One-star review: Avoid at all costs! You can't learn it on your own at all, and hiring a tutor cost me tens of thousands.

Two-star review: I bought it at the original price of sixty thousand, only to come back and see it was on sale.

One-star review: I'll come back and leave a good review once I reach level 10.

Zhang Yu guessed that its difficulty, which led to poor sales, was likely the reason the technique was discounted.

But this was not a problem for Zhang Yu, because he discovered that this Imperishable Seal Art had only four stances.

Furthermore, he would be able to fully utilize the technique's 10th-level effect in the upcoming martial arts competition, and it would complement his Limitless Cloud Hand.

_Although the Limitless Cloud Hand can redirect force and use an opponent's strength against them, the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi has a weakness: it's vulnerable to specialized mana disrupting the astral qi._

_But if I use the Imperishable Seal Art in coordination with the Limitless Cloud Hand, I'll be able to redirect or even reflect the opponent's specialized mana._

_Combined with the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method constantly replenishing my mana, and the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art allowing me to observe the entire field and grasp every detail..._

_My combat system will become more complete, better suited for defeating stronger opponents, and better at... avoiding injury while securing victory._

In the martial arts competition, when facing opponents with higher stats, avoiding or minimizing injury was crucial for a poor student like Zhang Yu.

Therefore, compared to more aggressive, wild, and domineering offensive techniques, Zhang Yu leaned toward a defensive, counter-attacking style.

And the only drawback of this Imperishable Seal Art... was its price. Even after the discount, it still cost 30,000 credits, and Zhang Yu now had only a little over that amount in his account.

In other words, buying this technique would leave him broke.

But when he thought about becoming the strongest first-year in Songyang, about his goal of getting into the Ten Greats...

_I must get into the Ten Greats, I must take the competition championship. Besides, the first-place prize for this competition is 50,000 credits. If I can't win, then holding on to these 30,000 is useless._

At this thought, Zhang Yu gritted his teeth and spent the 30,000 credits in his account in one go.

In the blink of an eye, he received the e-manual for the Imperishable Seal Art.

After a quick review, the technique appeared in his Feathered Tome, and he switched it to his specialization.

As a technique that specialized in mana redirection and reflection, the most crucial aspect of the Imperishable Seal Art was control over mana; its external martial forms consisted of only four simple stances.

Thus, in less than a minute, Zhang Yu had cultivated the technique to level 1.

Instantly, memories of practicing the Imperishable Seal Art over and over again flooded his mind.

Zhang Yu felt his control over mana become increasingly refined. He could even temporarily convert an opponent's incoming mana into his own and then unleash it.

Of course, this process also consumed mana, but the amount he expended was less than the mana of his opponent's attack.

Zhang Yu nodded to himself.

_As long as I continue to level up the Imperishable Seal Art, I'll be able to manipulate more of my opponent's mana with less of my own._

_According to the website's description, once the Imperishable Seal Art reaches level 10, redirecting 10 units of mana will only cost me 3 units, a thirty-percent ratio._

With this in mind, Zhang Yu nodded to himself and continued his ascetic training of the Imperishable Seal Art.

...

In the blink of an eye, another two days passed, bringing them to the day before the martial arts competition.

Figures flew across the training ground as Lei Jun took on two opponents at once, guiding Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

Witnessing Zhang Yu's and Bai Zhenzhen's rapid progress over this period, Lei Jun grew more and more astonished.

_These two kids... their understanding of various martial arts deepens by the day, and their combat experience is increasing so quickly._

Over the past few days, while maintaining an output equivalent to level 2 physical strength, Lei Jun had been forced to use increasingly advanced combat techniques to consistently suppress Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

But that was not what surprised him most. Instead, it was...

_Through their daily ascetic training and our repeated spars, these two have gradually developed their own distinct fighting styles._

Lei Jun threw a punch, only to have it blocked by a mass of white astral qi under Zhang Yu's control. He felt the force of his blow scatter, the vast majority of it deflected.

_That kid Zhang Yu, his use of that Limitless Cloud Hand is getting more and more ingenious. He's like a slippery ball; I strike with ten parts of force, and he can deflect seven or eight of them. I always have to use specialized mana to break through his astral qi first, which inevitably turns the fight into a battle of mana attrition._

_And now he's recently mastered that technique called the Imperishable Seal Art, making his defense even more seamless._

_Hmm... I don't have to worry about him getting beaten into bankruptcy in this competition._

Lei Jun then turned, blocking Bai Zhenzhen's sword-finger with his palm, and thought to himself, _Bai Zhenzhen... she's a true martial arts genius._

_In just two short weeks, she has already begun to keep up with my changing moves, see the flaws in my attacks, and force me into a position where I must defend._

_But her fighting style... it's too dangerous._

Boom!

As Lei Jun once again increased his power output, a wave of mana oscillation swept out, sending them both flying.

"That's all the time for today's tutoring."

He sighed with a smile. "You two have made tremendous progress during this time; you've improved about as much as you can for now."

"In tomorrow's competition, remember that safety comes first. Put your own safety above all else, don't push yourselves too hard, and don't force anything."

Bai Zhenzhen had grown familiar with Lei Jun over this period and replied directly, "Got it, old Lei. What place do you think we can get?"

Lei Jun thought for a moment and said, "There's a chance for the top ten."

"Only top ten? And only a chance?"

Lei Jun smiled helplessly. "The three great schools have too many methods that are beyond the standard curriculum, and even their conventional methods are things you could never afford. The top students' stats are also higher than yours. You're not starting on the same line. You two should be happy just to have a chance at the top ten."

"That's enough talk. Go back and prepare. And don't forget to bring your competition alchemical enhancers tomorrow."

"We'll meet at the entrance of White Dragon High School at midnight."

The venue for this martial arts competition was, in fact, White Dragon High School.

Zhang Yu was momentarily stunned. "Midnight?"

Lei Jun said, as if it were the most natural thing in the world, "White Dragon High School has classes during the day, so the competition is scheduled for midnight."

Zhang Yu could only think that this was so typical of White Dragon High School; they never disappointed when it came to being unreasonable.

Zhang Yu asked again, "How do we get there?"

"Take the subway on your own. Only two of you are participating in the martial arts competition. Did you expect the school to charter a bus?"

Zhang Yu could only think that this, too, was typical of Songyang High School, never disappointing him, just like White Dragon High.

Watching the two of them leave, Lei Jun sighed inwardly.

_If those two had been born into wealthy families, perhaps they would have had a chance to test into the Ten Greats._

...

That night.

After another two hours of intensive ascetic training, Zhang Yu finally raised the Imperishable Seal Art to level 10.

His body jolted as he felt his meridians, as if they had been tempered a thousand times over, suddenly become much tougher and more capable of handling the flow of various types of specialized mana.

At the same time, all his experience with mana redirection and reflection fused together in his mind, completing some sort of sublimation and culminating in a new enlightenment.

Now, when he used the Imperishable Seal Art, Zhang Yu was confident he could directly convert an opponent's mana to replenish his own.

This meant that with the Imperishable Seal Art at level 10, he could grow stronger as he fought, using the mana from his opponent's attacks to restore his own.

Of course, this absorption and replenishment naturally had its limits.

_In a single battle, I can supplement a maximum of 30 units of mana this way. Any more than that... and my current meridians won't be able to take it._

Thinking of this, Zhang Yu looked at his Feathered Tome again. After two weeks of ascetic training, his base stats had also improved significantly.

[Zhang Yu]

[Dao heart: Level 3 (53%)]

[Mana: 21.8]

[Physical Strength: 1.51]

_Sigh, it's a shame I didn't learn the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method a month or two earlier. If only I'd had more time to raise my physical strength..._

After returning home and taking a quick shower, Zhang Yu hurried to catch a bus, setting off on the road to White Dragon High School.

...

11:31 PM.

The moment Zhang Yu stepped out of the subway station, he saw a building roughly thirty stories tall, which he knew to be White Dragon High School.

But he had no time to admire it, because at this moment Zhang Yu was very, very, very hungry.

_Where's Zhen?_

_I have to find her and borrow some money for dinner. How am I supposed to compete if I'm starving?_

As for Zhang Yu's own money, that was, of course, long gone.

The Imperishable Seal Art alone had wiped out the thirty thousand credits in his account.

The little that was left over had been spent on food, drinks, and alchemical enhancers over the last few days.

Just as Zhang Yu was looking around anxiously, a hand slapped him firmly on the shoulder.

Zhang Yu turned his head, a pleased surprise on his face.

"Zhen? Quick..."

"Yu-boy, lend me some money," Bai Zhenzhen said weakly, clutching her stomach. "I don't have money for dinner, I feel like I'm going to collapse."

Zhang Yu was aghast. "You spent all your money too?"

Seeing Zhang Yu's reaction, Bai Zhenzhen cried out in anguish, "You're broke too? What are your spending habits like? How do you blow through money so fast you can't even afford dinner?"

(End of Chapter)

---

# Chapter 66: The Competition Begins

Just as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen stood in speechless despair, contemplating asking Lei Jun for a loan, a familiar voice called out.

"Zhenzhen, Zhang Yu, you're already here."

The two whipped their heads around, and the sight of Zhao Tianxing emerging from the subway station was like that of a savior. They rushed forward like a pair of zombies, throwing their arms around him.

Zhao Tianxing had come today specifically to watch their competition.

Zhang Yu said, "Old Zhao, lend us some money. We need to buy dinner."

But after a moment, Zhao Tianxing only managed to transfer 10 credits, saying with a helpless look, "My mom's afraid I'll spend money recklessly, so this is all she lets me carry when I go out."

_Useless mama's boy. I'm ashamed to be associated with you._

But ten credits were better than nothing. Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen could only drag their famished bodies to a nearby convenience store and buy a few buns.

However, with their current cultivation levels and physical conditioning, a few buns were nowhere near enough to quell the hunger gnawing at them.

Bai Zhenzhen's eyes gleamed as she stared at the convenience store, and she suddenly said, "Yu-boy, let's rob the place."

Zhang Yu nodded. "Sure. You do the robbing, I'll be in charge of disposing of the loot."

Bai Zhenzhen then asked, "Do you think White Dragon High School will provide free food?"

Zhang Yu replied, "Free? We'll be lucky if they don't charge us double."

Just then, both of their eyes lit up.

A familiar figure was standing before the main gate of White Dragon High School, gazing at the school sign with reverence as he snapped pictures with his phone.

"Old Qian!"

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen hurried over, grabbed Qian Shen's hand, and said, "Treat us to dinner. We're too hungry to compete."

Qian Shen looked at them quizzically, opened his phone, and asked, "Is 300 enough?"

_Holy crap!_ Zhang Yu was stunned.

He then began to reflect on what he had been doing for the past two months.

Befriending a debt-ridden person like Bai Zhenzhen? Befriending a mama's boy like Zhao Tianxing?

_Old Qian! You are my, Zhang Yu's, one true friend!_

Thanks to Qian Shen's treat, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen devoured twelve 10-credit meal sets at the convenience store, costing Qian Shen 120 credits.

Patting her slightly bulging stomach, Bai Zhenzhen said with satisfaction, "This should be enough. We have to compete soon, so being half-full is perfect."

Zhang Yu nodded in agreement and said to Qian Shen, "Don't worry, Old Qian. After the competition, as soon as we get the prize money, we'll pay you back."

Qian Shen, however, didn't seem concerned about that. He suddenly scratched his head and asked, "Um... will the 699-point Zhang Pianpian be coming to watch you compete today?"

Zhang Yu cast a pitying glance at Qian Shen.

_Ah, poor fool, utterly captivated by a high-scoring student._

Zhang Yu really wanted to tell him that with his score of six hundred twenty and her six hundred ninety-nine, the gap between them was simply too vast for them to ever be friends.

But feeling the meal settling in his stomach, Zhang Yu said, "Probably not. She's extremely busy, how would she have time to watch a first-year competition?"

Qian Shen nodded, seeming to be lost in thought.

"That's true. She's a third-year now, so she must be busy preparing for the college entrance exams and university interviews, right?"

Zhao Tianxing, who had been standing to the side, kept glancing nervously at the time on his phone.

"Didn't you guys arrange to meet Teacher Lei at midnight? It's almost time, shouldn't we head over?"

So, the group of four made their way back to the main gate of White Dragon High School. Seeing that Teacher Lei Jun hadn't arrived yet, Zhang Yu suggested they wait inside.

However, the moment the four of them came within a meter of the gate, they seemed to trigger some kind of sensor.

A warning voice sounded from a nearby electronic screen: "Non-White Dragon High School personnel, please do not enter."

The four turned to see the screen displaying a message:

To tour the school, please scan the code to purchase a visitor's ticket.

Single-person 12-hour tour ticket, access to floors 3 and below, price: 500.

Those with monthly exam or college entrance exam scores of 660 or above may enter for a free tour.

Those with scores below 550 and those without a high school education are prohibited from entry.

_What the hell... No underachievers allowed, is that it? Banning those below 550 is one thing, but why do you need a 660 just for free entry?_

Zhang Yu looked at the information on the screen, then at his friends.

He felt that in that instant, all four of them were being thoroughly looked down upon by White Dragon High School.

And as for buying a ticket... where was he supposed to find 500 credits in his bank account?

Was he really going to be eliminated outside the school gates by a 500-credit fee before the competition even began?

Zhang Yu could only turn his head in embarrassment and look toward Qian Shen again, only to find that Bai Zhenzhen was doing the exact same thing.

Qian Shen, however, was gazing at the gates of White Dragon High School with a look of pure yearning.

"It's true what they say," he sighed. "Not just anyone can walk through the gates of White Dragon."

With that, he prepared to scan the code and buy a ticket.

Just as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were about to ask to borrow money, Teacher Lei Jun finally arrived.

"You two don't need to buy tickets," Lei Jun said, waving them over. "We're here for the competition; White Dragon High sent us tickets."

After receiving the electronic tickets from Lei Jun, the group finally entered White Dragon High School, leaving only a mortified Zhao Tianxing standing outside the gate.

Under their collective gaze, Zhao Tianxing scratched his head furiously.

"You guys go on ahead," he said repeatedly. "I'll call my mom for money. I'll buy a ticket and come find you."

Lei Jun knew that Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing were here to watch the competition, so he nodded.

"The venue is on the first basement level. You can make your own way there."

The moment Zhang Yu and group stepped into the White Dragon High School building, he noticed a peculiar scent in the air.

Beside him, Qian Shen took a deep breath.

"Do you smell that?" he said in awe. "That sweet fragrance in the air? White Dragon High adds a special intellect-enhancement agent to its air circulation system. It boosts concentration and neural excitability. They've also added a hint of fruit and floral scents..."

Zhang Yu was speechless. _Holy crap, the air in White Dragon High School really is scented._

The group continued forward, where they saw the corridor floor divided into white and red lanes.

The white lane ran down the middle, inscribed with the words: For students of this school with scores of 660 and above only.

The red lanes flanked the sides, marked with: For students of this school with scores below 660 only.

Zhang Yu paused for a second, then let out an exasperated laugh.

_Unbelievable. So if your score is below 660, you have to walk along the edges?_

Qian Shen explained from the side, "All the different areas and facilities in White Dragon High have score-based standards for student access. Students must stay within the areas designated for their score range."

Zhang Yu was speechless again. _Hey, why are you explaining all this? Qian-boy, you're from Songyang, how do you know so much about White Dragon? Planning to transfer?_

They proceeded down the corridor to the elevators, intending to take one to the basement, only to find a sign that read: Students with scores below 660 are prohibited from using the elevator.

Zhang Yu was starting to get it. At White Dragon High, if your score was below 660, you weren't treated like a person; you could barely move.

Fortunately, as visitors, they didn't have to abide by the rules meant for the school's own students.

The group took the elevator down to the first basement level, and in an instant, a massive gymnasium, ten meters high and covering over ten thousand square meters, appeared before them.

The venue was filled with high school students milling about. Clearly, the contestants from many schools had already arrived.

But as Zhang Yu looked around, nearly all the competitors were from the three great schools. He could barely see anyone from the other high schools.

_Compared to the Mana Competition, this martial arts competition has practically become an internal league for the three great schools._

In the surrounding spectator stands, apart from a few scattered students from various schools, there were three large, organized blocks of students sitting bolt upright, like phalanxes.

Zhang Yu looked at the students sitting in neat rows and at their uniforms, surprised. 

"Are those students from the three great schools?"

He found it astonishing.

"Students from the three great schools aren't using every single second to study, and are here watching a competition instead?"

He especially noticed the students from White Dragon High, who were wide-eyed and ramrod straight, their faces glowing with an energetic fervor, as if they were on stimulants.

Just then, a male voice sounded from nearby.

"They are all first-year students from the three great high schools. After all, observing the battles of powerful peers also helps one improve their own practical martial arts skill, recognize the gap between themselves and the strong, and further strengthen their Dao heart."

Zhang Yu and the others turned toward the source of the voice.

Lian Tianji from Purple Cloud High School was walking slowly toward them, a smile on his face.

"I guessed you would participate in the martial arts competition," he said to Zhang Yu. "And I was right."

He then glanced at Zhang Yu's small group, surprised. "Is this everyone from Songyang?"

A moment later, he nodded thoughtfully. "Then again, it's understandable. This is Songyang, after all."

Zhang Yu felt his Songyang uniform being subtly insulted once again.

However, Zhang Yu was no die-hard patriot for his school. What did Songyang being looked down on have to do with him? His real identity was as a contract employee of the Songyang City Patrol.

So, Zhang Yu asked curiously, "How many people came from the three great high schools?"

Lian Tianji pointed toward one side of the arena. "Look, they're all over there. Purple Cloud, White Dragon, and Red Pagoda—each school sent a full team of ten. We already had a preliminary round at our own schools; only the top ten finishers could come compete."

After they parted ways with Lian Tianji, Lei Jun said, "Let's go. We need to check in at the contestant rest area. Qian Shen, you go find a seat in the stands."

Zhang Yu and his group arrived at the rest area assigned to their school.

Zhang Yu looked at the rest areas for the three great high schools, the key high schools like Songyang, and the other ordinary high schools.

How to describe it.

Zhang Yu felt the three types of rest areas were like the difference between a "VIP lounge," a "sun tent," and a "straw mat."

The "VIP lounges" for the three great schools had sofas, reclining chairs, drinks, fruit, and snacks.

The "sun tent area" for the key high schools had a row of chairs and a case of water.

And the "straw mat area" for the ordinary high schools had just a row of benches.

_It's like White Dragon is terrified the riff-raff from the ordinary high schools will come and freeload._

"This is completely discriminatory."

Meanwhile, after watching the three of them leave, Qian Shen made his way up into the spectator stands alone.

Just as he was looking for a place to sit, he noticed that the person sitting in front of him looked very familiar from behind.

He walked up quickly and saw that the person was wearing a hat, sunglasses, and a mask, and immediately turned their head away when they saw him.

Qian Shen looked at the top of the person's head, then at their face, and said with a jolt of recognition, "You... are you the 611-point He Dayou?"

A 611-point He Dayou was worthy of sitting with him to watch the competition.

He Dayou really hadn't wanted to be recognized, especially by people from his own school. He didn't want anyone to know he had come to watch the martial arts competition, and he particularly didn't want anyone thinking he was here for Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, which was why he had come in disguise.

But now, having been identified by Qian Shen, he could only turn his head back reluctantly.

"Yeah, you're here too, Qian Shen."

Qian Shen asked curiously, "Are you also here to watch Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen compete?"

He Dayou gave a dismissive laugh. "Their skill level... isn't even average in this competition. What's there to watch?"

"Actually, a friend from my middle school is competing and specially invited me to come."

Qian Shen sat down beside He Dayou and asked, "Which high school is your friend from? What's their score?"

He Dayou turned his head away, looking as if he didn't want to speak.

...

On the other side of the arena.

The contestants first gathered together to listen to the organizers announce the rules.

"To prevent powerful contestants from being eliminated too early, this competition will begin with a seeding round."

"Based on the scores from this round, all contestants will be divided into eight groups. They will then compete within their groups via random pairings. The winner from each of the eight groups—a total of eight contestants—will advance to the final elimination tournament..."

Just as everyone was wondering how the seeding round would be scored...

With a series of heavy thuds, a two-meter-tall golden figure slowly strode into the arena.

The referee at the front announced, "For the seeding round, each of you will take turns fighting a Yellow Turban Strongman."

"The average physical strength level of the contestants in this competition is 1.98, so the Yellow Turban Strongman will maintain a physical strength output of 1.98 and will fight each of you for one minute."

"Afterward, a panel of judges will score your performance during that minute."

"The specific scoring rules are as follows..."

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 67: The Gap, The Scoring

Zhang Yu listened for a while to the specifications of this scoring competition and quickly got the gist of it.

"So they'll stick sensor patches all over my body, and on the Yellow Turban Strongman as well, and then the number of times each sensor patch is hit will be recorded."

"For example, hitting the sensor patch on the Yellow Turban Strongman's back is worth five points, the chest is three points, and an arm is one point."

"Conversely, if the sensor patch on my back gets hit, five points will be deducted..."

"The final tally will be the total score within a one-minute combat period."

"Of course, there's another method: directly knocking the Yellow Turban Strongman out of bounds, which adds 300 points in one go."

Zhang Yu understood that the purpose of this scoring competition was to prevent high-scoring contestants from being grouped together in the subsequent group stage, lest they be eliminated too early.

"This way, no powerful contestant should deliberately hide too much of their strength, because that might land them in the same group as another strong fighter."

Thinking this, Zhang Yu nodded slightly and turned his gaze toward the Yellow Turban Strongman.

It was a humanoid figure over two meters tall, clad in golden armor and a golden faceplate, with slabs of exposed muscle that looked like marble, inscribed with dense, overlapping runes.

"Hmm... feels like it's missing a little something..."

Just as Zhang Yu was thinking this, a staff member came over and sprayed advertisements on the Yellow Turban Strongman.

On its chest was ‘Oasis Foods, for the healthy diet of all Kunxu people’, and on its back was ‘The ultra-potent, ultra-fierce, world-dominant Wilan Pharmaceuticals’.

Seeing this, Zhang Yu finally nodded, thinking to himself, _I knew something was missing. Now that's more like it._

He remembered that this Oasis Foods was the company that promoted synthetic food, and it was backed by the Netherworld Palace, one of the Ten Great Sects.

Wilan Pharmaceuticals, on the other hand, was different from Purple Cloud Supplements; it was a company more focused on combat-use drugs and was also a sponsor of this martial arts tournament.

Meanwhile, Bai Zhenzhen, standing to the side, looked at the Yellow Turban Strongman and commented, "Songyang High School is so much worse than White Dragon High. Look, they get to use Yellow Turban Strongmen for exams and competitions, while we still have to make students beat each other up."

Zhang Yu nodded and said, "The realism of this model of Yellow Turban Strongman is very high; it almost looks like a real person."

It was also Bai Zhenzhen's first time seeing a Yellow Turban Strongman in person, and she agreed, "The hobbies of the rich are just like this; they love making valuable things look cheap."

"Like making designer clothes look like garbage bags, or making a Yellow Turban Strongman look like a person like this."

Zhang Yu suddenly had an idea. "Then do you think our school could hire someone to play the part of a Yellow Turban Strongman?"

Just then, Lei Jun, who was behind them, spoke up. As the martial arts combat teacher and the organizer of Songyang High's combat exam, he said with a dark expression,

"Someone who could act as a Yellow Turban Strongman... would their fee be cheap? Who do you think will pay for hiring someone? Are you hoping to pay a fee to take the monthly exams?"

At this, Lei Jun snorted coldly and jutted his chin toward the ring.

"The first round of the scoring competition is about to start. Watch carefully and learn. Don't embarrass me when you get up there."

When the contestants had gathered earlier, White Dragon High School, as the host, had already distributed contestant numbers and tags; they would go up to fight the Yellow Turban Strongman according to their numbers.

Under everyone's watchful eyes, the announcer walked onto the ring and stood beside the Yellow Turban Strongman.

"Welcome, everyone, to this year's Songyang City First-Year Martial Arts Championship, jointly sponsored by Oasis Foods and Wilan Pharmaceuticals."

"Delicious and all-natural, wellness through nature. All meals at this event are provided by the Oasis Group."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen both made a sound of disgust.

Synthetic food? Not even a dog would eat that.

The announcer continued, "A thousand-year heritage, an essential for any outing. Whether it's a tournament in the ring or a brawl on the streets, Wilan Pharmaceuticals is your trusted assistant... Any contestants wishing to purchase alchemical enhancers may do so at the pop-up pharmacy next to the arena."

Finally, after the announcer finished all the sponsor advertisements, the first round of the scoring competition was about to begin.

"Now, let's welcome our first contestant to the stage!"

A contestant wearing the White Dragon High School uniform walked onto the ring and, following a countdown of 3, 2, 1, engaged in a fierce battle with the Yellow Turban Strongman.

Zhang Yu could tell that this White Dragon student's strength and speed were on par with the Yellow Turban Strongman's 1.98-level physical fortitude.

Every punch and kick followed a fierce and powerful style, directly blocking the Strongman's attacks while striking the sensor patches on its body to score points.

From a distance, it looked like two giant bears tearing at and fighting each other on the ring; the sound of every impact was like the clash of metal, shaking the heart of everyone watching.

When the one minute was up, the White Dragon student had earned a total of 128 points.

The next few contestants who took the stage were from either White Dragon High, Purple Cloud High, or Red Pagoda High.

The more Qian Shen watched, the more alarmed he became.

"Every single one of these top students from the three great high schools has a physical fortitude that would place them as the absolute number one in Songyang's first year. Is the gap really this big? Are these the kind of people Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen have to face today?"

He Dayou, however, was completely unsurprised by this.

"Unless you can join our school's athletic competition team and receive the special training program, it's impossible to surpass this batch of freaks from the three great high schools in terms of physical fortitude."

"Not to mention the gaps in other areas like mana, martial arts, and spiritual roots. When combined in actual combat... it's even more despairing."

As the Son of the School Director, He Dayou knew all too well the gap between Songyang High and the three great high schools.

When it came to the admission slots for the Ten Greats' top universities each year, the top students of Songyang High could often only fight for the leftovers with White Dragon High's second-tier experts after White Dragon's absolute top students had taken their pick.

Just then, a White Dragon student who was over two and a half meters tall, resembling a titanic giant, slowly walked onto the ring.

Standing in front of this student, even the Yellow Turban Strongman seemed almost delicate by comparison.

And as this student appeared, the White Dragon students in the audience, who had been sitting upright and proper, suddenly all stood up to applaud and cheer.

Zhang Yu, however, was more focused on the opponent's current hairstyle.

"Isn't that Song Hailong? Why did his hairstyle change?"

Song Hailong was White Dragon High's number one first-year, the contestant with a large '1' displayed on the chest and back of his uniform.

Zhang Yu still remembered that when he participated in the Mana Competition last time, he had long hair that shot up toward the sky.

Today, however, it was a short buzz cut.

Song Hailong smiled faintly, reached out a hand toward the audience, and pressed down. In the next moment, the cheering and applauding White Dragon students immediately sat back down, silent and still.

Watching this scene, Zhang Yu was suddenly reminded of the legendary low-score slavery system at White Dragon High. Those White Dragon students in the audience truly gave Song Hailong their absolute obedience.

Bai Zhenzhen, at his side, stared at Song Hailong's new hairstyle and said, "He definitely changed his external spiritual root again!"

"His last external spiritual root was obviously one that affected spiritual energy, meant for mana cultivation."

"Since this is a martial arts combat competition, that Song Hailong must have switched to a combat spiritual root."

With that, Bai Zhenzhen turned her head to look at Zhang Yu and urged, "Yu-boy, Yu-boy, quick, take out your 100,000-credit Talisman Tome and use a Heaven's Eye Talisman to check out Song Hailong's details."

Over the past two weeks, besides focusing on martial arts, Zhang Yu had also been familiarizing himself with the Talisman Tome from time to time.

But he didn't dare touch any of the paid features inside, only daring to use the single free daily attempt to practice talismans.

The two talismans he practiced the most were the Detainment Talisman and the Heaven's Eye Talisman, which were taught in school.

At this moment, Zhang Yu carefully took out the Talisman Tome, his fingertip swiping quickly across the screen. As the Heaven's Eye Talisman activated, he immediately felt the whole world change.

For a non-clerical professional, this was the enhanced view one got after paying.

For a short period, component evaluations floated above each person's head. Having practiced this several times, Zhang Yu was already used to this perspective and now focused his gaze on Song Hailong in the ring.

Elephant Tendon Body (Expand Details)

Elephant Tendon Body | Demon Slayer | Heavenly Spirit Embodiment | Unyielding Battle Spirit | White Dragon Slave Master | The King Son of the Family

At the same time, Song Hailong on the stage let out a wild laugh, grabbed the Yellow Turban Strongman's large hand, and then, under the shocked gazes of everyone present, sent the Yellow Turban Strongman flying out of the ring with a deafening boom.

In less than a single second, the battle was already over.

Song Hailong, 300 points.

The White Dragon students in the audience immediately erupted in fierce applause and cheers.

And watching Song Hailong slowly walk off the stage, the many contestants felt as if they weren't looking at a person, but at a ferocious, giant beast.

Qian Shen gasped, watching this scene. "Song Hailong, 683 points on the last monthly exam... Seeing him in action in person is just as shocking as that score."

On the other side, Zhao Tianxing had just entered the arena and was still looking for Qian Shen in the audience when he saw the scene on the stage.

"Too brutal. Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen have to fight this kind of monster?"

A trace of worry couldn't help but surface. "Will they really be okay? They won't get seriously injured, will they?"

Meanwhile, Zhang Yu stared at the long string of component evaluations above Song Hailong's head.

"What is all this stuff?"

After he read them out, Bai Zhenzhen, who was next to him, explained, "I know about Heavenly Spirit Embodiment. It should refer to an Embodiment Spiritual Root. It's a combat-type spiritual root within the Heavenly Spiritual Root category. The spiritual energy meridians formed by the spiritual root will entwine around the entire body, comprehensively increasing the user's strength, speed, stamina, and resilience."

Zhang Yu couldn't help but give Bai Zhenzhen a second look.

_This girl, Zhen... it was the same last time with the external spiritual root. She recognized it at a glance._

_She clearly can't afford a spiritual root, so how does she know so many of them?_

While Bai Zhenzhen was unsure about the other component evaluations, Lei Jun, from behind them, suddenly spoke.

"Implanted with elephant demon muscle, has long-term combat experience against demonic beasts, rarely shows negative emotion, a top student of White Dragon, and the Song family's ace son for this generation."

Zhang Yu was surprised. _Old Lei, you understand the Heaven's Eye Talisman too?_

Seeing their surprised looks, Lei Jun said calmly, "If a Daoist art could be used for free like you do, it would be quite useful indeed."

_Old Lei! You have betrayed the martial path!_

With Lei Jun's explanation, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen also gained more information from this round of the scoring competition.

On the ring, more powerhouses began to display their strength.

First was Lian Tianji from Purple Cloud High, whose fists and feet were like a torrential storm, completely suppressing the Yellow Turban Strongman whose physical fortitude was maintained at level 1.98, wildly scoring 261 points.

Not long after, a student from Red Pagoda High who looked like a brown bear took the stage, instantly tackled the Yellow Turban Strongman to the ground, and then threw it out, scoring 300 points.

Soon after, Le Mulan from Purple Cloud High made her appearance. With just one hand, she pressed the Yellow Turban Strongman to the ground, completely subduing it.

Then, the woman kicked the sensor patch on the center of the Yellow Turban Strongman's back again and again until she reached 305 points, deliberately stopping only after surpassing Song Hailong's 300. She then gave Song Hailong a glance and walked off the stage.

And from the moment Le Mulan appeared, the Purple Cloud students in the audience remained completely silent, a field of stillness.

Zhao Tianxing found this strange.

Upon hearing his question, Qian Shen explained as if he were an expert, "At Purple Cloud High, scores are updated daily based on students' classroom performance, and the grade ranking is also updated daily. The number one student of the grade each day can set a grade-wide rule for one day, as long as it doesn't disrupt the educational order."

"As far as I know, since the first day of school, Le Mulan has always been number one in Purple Cloud's first year."

"And the daily rule she sets has never changed."

"That is, all first-year students must remain silent in her presence, and plebeian students with scores below 650 are not allowed to speak to her without her permission."

Plebeian students below 650? Hearing this, Zhao Tianxing instantly felt as if he had been insulted as well.

But then he considered that Qian Shen, who was speaking, hadn't reached 650 either, and his mood immediately stabilized.

Zhao Tianxing asked, "How do you know so much?"

Qian Shen gave a faint smile. "I've done a bit of research on matters concerning the three great high schools."

In the contestant area on the other side, the provoked Song Hailong burst out laughing. 

"Le Mulan, I'll be waiting for you in the finals!"

# Chapter 68: Grouping

For this martial arts competition, each school could send a maximum of ten participants.

After arriving at the venue, Zhang Yu discovered that there were only just over forty contestants in total, thirty of whom belonged to the three great high schools.

The remaining dozen or so contestants were all from other regular and key high schools.

They might not have understood the state of the martial arts competition, perhaps they lacked channels for information, or maybe they came with a sliver of hope, wanting to see the world or try their luck.

But as the powerhouses from the three great high schools took the stage one by one to display their strength, the students from the other high schools gradually began to have second thoughts and started to withdraw from the competition.

Of course, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen did not back down.

Zhang Yu recalled the rules, knowing that the contestants would be sorted into different tiers based on their scores.

Then, after a random draw, contestants of the same tier would be assigned to eight different groups for the group stage elimination rounds.
