Bai Zhenzhen replied, “I’ll borrow from my godmother myself and pay it back myself. You don’t need to borrow for me. But I’ve watched that Le Mulan carefully. She’s a bit tricky to fight and it’s too easy to get injured. To beat her… it might cost four hundred thousand to get patched up.”

Bai Zhenzhen sighed and said, “Yu-boy, don’t you wish we were rich?”

Having lived two lives, Zhang Yu was rendered speechless by her words.

He hadn’t been born into a wealthy family in either of his two lifetimes, so what could he possibly say?

…

A short while later, after all the quarterfinal matches had ended and the contestants had received proper treatment, ensuring their lives were not in danger.

The list of the four semifinalists was announced to the entire venue: Zhang Yu, Song Hailong, Le Mulan, and Bai Zhenzhen.

The upcoming semifinal matches would be Zhang Yu versus Song Hailong, and Le Mulan versus Bai Zhenzhen.

Finally, the winners of these two matches would fight to determine the competition champion.

And perhaps because the semifinals were considered to be of greater interest, the two matches would not be held simultaneously but one after the other.

After the referee drew lots for the match order, the first match was Le Mulan versus Bai Zhenzhen, and the second was Zhang Yu versus Song Hailong.

…

On the stage.

Le Mulan looked at Bai Zhenzhen before her, and her brow furrowed slightly as her gaze swept over the ugly scars on her opponent’s hands and feet.

She asked in confusion, “Why do you have scars on your body?”

Bai Zhenzhen shrugged. “No money to fix them.”

Le Mulan was shocked. Although she knew that poor people were very poor, the fact that someone couldn’t even afford to have the scars on their body repaired struck her as ‘appalling’.

_Is this what it’s like to be poor? How terrifying._

Facing an opponent who couldn’t even afford proper treatment, her fighting spirit instantly diminished, and a trace of pity even arose within her.

Although her opponent had managed to seize Xiong Wenwu's weakness to win as the underdog, Le Mulan wasn’t concerned.

Because when facing any first-year high school student, Le Mulan had absolute confidence… that she had no weaknesses.

With the countdown, 3, 2, 1, begin!

Le Mulan’s fingertips tapped repeatedly, and sharp blades of sword qi slashed out through the air, flying directly towards Bai Zhenzhen’s position.

It was the Stardust Swordplay that Le Mulan had painstakingly cultivated to the fifth level.

At the fifth level, the Stardust Swordplay could already injure an enemy from a distance of five meters.

Seeing this five-meter-long sword qi, Bai Zhenzhen’s expression changed, and she hurriedly activated her own Body-Piercing Sword Qi to block.

But Bai Zhenzhen soon discovered that Le Mulan’s Stardust Swordplay was not just about sharp sword qi. Each strand of qi seemed to be part of a military formation, interconnected in a complex manner, always managing to besiege her from various angles.

And if Bai Zhenzhen tried to break through the obstruction of this sword qi, she would feel her opponent’s attacks grow more concentrated with every step she took.

She felt as if she were in a large array, her space for movement constantly being compressed by Le Mulan’s continuous stream of sword qi, and the situation was becoming increasingly dangerous.

She tried to enter a stealth state, but her position was quickly revealed by the collision of her blocking sword qi with the incoming attacks.

Her opponent’s sword qi was simply too fast and dense; with her speed and explosive power, she couldn't rely solely on movement to dodge.

As for waiting for the opponent's mana to run out? Bai Zhenzhen could see that the mana within her opponent’s body was incredibly turbulent, showing no signs of depletion. If she tried to exhaust her opponent's mana, her own would likely run out first.

Bai Zhenzhen sighed inwardly.

_Sigh… using stealth on the stage is really disadvantageous. It’s only most effective the first time you use it. Afterwards, when opponents are prepared, it’s not as useful._

Le Mulan, however, was not at all surprised to see Bai Zhenzhen struggling.

_My Stardust Swordplay forms its own array. The sword qi is disciplined and orderly, and the techniques are flawless._

_Unless someone with a powerful protective cultivation technique forces their way through, it’s impossible for an expert of the same level to get close to me._

And in Le Mulan’s eyes, Bai Zhenzhen was by no means on the same level.

_There are weaknesses,_ Bai Zhenzhen thought to herself. _But my own stats aren’t high enough. If I force it, I might win, but I’ll be severely injured, right?_

_This single sword strike could cost three or four hundred thousand…_

Should she risk several hundred thousand?

Bai Zhenzhen felt herself hesitate.

She had the courage to break through Xiong Wenwu's storm-like assault and strike at the flaw in his body.

But when it came to gambling several hundred thousand for a victory, she hesitated.

And it was this very hesitation that made her understand that this sword strike would be difficult to succeed with, because she no longer had the determination to press forward at all costs.

_Sigh…_

And so, a few seconds later, seeing that she was about to be completely surrounded by sword qi, Bai Zhenzhen chose to surrender.

As she walked off the stage, a flicker of relief crossed her eyes.

_In the end, my strength is still insufficient, and I’m too poor._

_Forget it. I’ll just tell Yu-boy about this weakness. Let my good son teach this woman a lesson for me. It shouldn’t cost him that much money._

With Le Mulan’s victory, the semifinals moved on to the second match—Zhang Yu versus Song Hailong.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 75: Dragonback Mountain Toppler

Le Mulan returned to the rest area for Purple Cloud High School and saw Lian Tianji kneeling on the ground.

She walked over to him and, treating him like a small stool, sat directly on his back.

This was his punishment for failure. For the next three days, whenever he appeared before her, he would have to serve as her bench.

Lian Tianji asked, "Is it over already?"

He had reviewed the fight between Bai Zhenzhen and Xiong Wenwu. Although Bai Zhenzhen's stats were lacking, her practical combat ability was exceedingly strong, and she could always perceive her opponent's weaknesses. Lian Tianji had originally thought Bai Zhenzhen would be able to force a few more moves out of the hallowed grade-level number one.

Le Mulan frowned, kicking Lian Tianji's side with her raised right foot.

"A bench shouldn't speak," she said coolly.

Lian Tianji immediately shut his mouth.

However, Le Mulan added another sentence, saying, "She ran out of money for treatment, though it would have just wasted a bit more time even if she had it."

Lian Tianji understood instantly. That was how the world worked—money was a part of one's strength, and a lack of money was a reflection of weakness.

Bai Zhenzhen was poor, and…

Lian Tianji thought to himself, _It's only natural for the poor to lose to the rich._

Just then, Zhang Yu and Song Hailong ascended the stage.

Lian Tianji slowly turned his head, his gaze fixed on the fighting ring.

After being defeated, a person often had two ways of coping.

Either claim they were careless.

Or praise the opponent for being too strong.

The former was more disgraceful, while the latter allowed one to save face.

Therefore, Lian Tianji also wanted to choose the latter.

_If Zhang Yu beats Song Hailong, I might even be able to get my advertising partnership back…_

After all, if that happened, his situation would change from ‘defeated by a Songyang student’ to ‘a narrow loss to a finalist’.

"You can do it, Zhang Yu!"

Also cheering for Zhang Yu in his heart was Chu Qiuhe, back in the White Dragon High School rest area. He couldn't even stop himself from secretly cursing Song Hailong.

Although, as a White Dragon student, he knew full well how terrifying Song Hailong was, a sliver of fantasy still welled up in his heart.

_Maybe? Maybe if he gets careless, he'll lose by accident? Song Hailong… only if you lose can the rest of us save face._

As Song Hailong spread his arms and raised his hands high on the stage, a tsunami of cheers erupted from the audience.

"Song Hailong! Number one!"

"Song Hailong! Number one!"

Listening to the perfectly synchronized shouts from the White Dragon contingent, Zhao Tianxing felt that Zhang Yu looked utterly isolated and helpless on the stage.

He couldn't help but think, _Shouldn't we be cheering for Zhang Yu, too?_

But when he voiced this idea, he saw He Dayou, who was beside him, quickly turn his head away and pretend he hadn't heard.

Qian Shen also spoke with some difficulty, "Let's just forget it. This is White Dragon's home turf, after all."

Watching the imposing, unified cheers of the White Dragon students, Zhao Tianxing's initial desire to cheer for Zhang Yu gradually faded.

As he thought about how nervous he felt just watching from afar, he found it impossible to imagine the pressure Zhang Yu must be under, standing on the stage himself.

…

On the stage.

As Song Hailong’s right hand clenched into a fist, the cheers from the audience instantly died away, and the entire venue fell silent once more.

Song Hailong looked at Zhang Yu and laughed heartily.

"I really didn't expect a kid from Songyang to be able to fight his way past so many opponents and reach the semi-finals."

"As a reward, I'll help you lower the difficulty of this match."

As he spoke, Song Hailong ran a hand through his spiky hair, and in the next moment, a string of digits appeared on his forehead.

_10,000,000?_

Just as Zhang Yu was wondering, Song Hailong directly answered his unspoken question. 

"This is a built-in feature of my external spiritual root. It displays my medical insurance coverage limit."

"My current limit is ten million. If you can burn through this entire ten-million treatment budget, I'll admit defeat."

_Of all the nerve… you actually just displayed your own health bar, didn't you._

Zhang Yu stared intently at the number, beginning to contemplate its impact on the coming fight.

But the thought that his opponent had insurance to cover ten million while he only had enough for a hundred thousand… no, now only enough for seventy thousand worth of injuries, filled Zhang Yu with a sense of helplessness.

In the next instant, however, he had already activated the heart art of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, suppressing all his negative emotions and mustering his will to fight, dedicating himself wholeheartedly to the battle before him.

Meanwhile, in the audience, because Song Hailong's physique was so formidable, his voice always resonated throughout the arena, allowing the spectators to hear and see everything. His display now sparked a wave of gasps and praise.

"As expected of White Dragon's number one! His insurance coverage is a full ten million!"

"He's so rich! No wonder he's so good!"

"Obviously. How could a poor person be as outstanding as Song Hailong?"

"Song Hailong has the highest scores on the monthly exams and he's so wealthy. I think they should just give him the martial arts competition championship directly!"

And on the stage, Song Hailong beckoned to Zhang Yu.

"You go first. If I make a move, you might not get the chance."

Seeing Song Hailong’s completely unguarded posture, Zhang Yu sent a probing palm strike, empowered by Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, slamming it fiercely into his opponent's chest.

With a crackling boom, the palm, powerful enough to shatter stone monuments, landed on Song Hailong's body, yet Zhang Yu felt as if he had struck a massive rubber tire.

Not only did his opponent's body not budge an inch, but the ten million on his forehead only decreased by 300.

Zhang Yu recalled what Lei Jun had told him about the Elephant Tendon Body.

"This Song Hailong has been implanted with elephant demon muscle. Mana channeled through the elephant demon muscle can be used to directly fortify the physical body, making his strength and damage resistance incalculable by normal standards."

_On top of that, his physical strength is already far beyond mine, and he has the protective effect of the external ‘Embodiment Spiritual Root’…_

Clearly, because of Song Hailong’s powerful physique, he had taken Zhang Yu’s palm strike without suffering any significant injury.

At the same time, Song Hailong shook his head and said, "That palm only cost me 300. It’s far too weak."

"Put some fire into it, kid. At this rate, even if I just stood here and let you hit me, how long would it take you to burn through this ten million?"

Several more palm strikes slammed into Song Hailong's vital areas, but it was still like hitting a rubber tire. Although Song Hailong's body trembled slightly, the total reduction to the number on his forehead… was only another 2,000 or so.

What was even more astonishing… was that in the next moment, the number on Song Hailong's forehead actually began to recover.

The initial reduction of over 2,300 gradually reverted to just over 2,000.

Seeming to notice the change in Zhang Yu's gaze, Song Hailong laughed aloud, pointed to the number on his forehead, and said, "See? It’s going back up."

"My apologies, my apologies. The combat spiritual root I'm using this time isn't an ordinary Embodiment Spiritual Root, but the deluxe edition."

"Besides enhancing my physical strength and damage resistance, this spiritual root can also continuously absorb spiritual energy from the air, allowing my injuries to gradually heal on their own."

Seeing Zhang Yu's expression grow increasingly grave, Song Hailong boomed with laughter. 

"Still not going to make a move? If you don't hurry up, it'll be back to ten million."

Hearing Song Hailong's loudly proclaimed words, everyone—from the audience to the contestants from the various schools around the arena—felt as if they were witnessing an insurmountable wall of money standing between the two combatants.

It made everyone feel as if that ten million was an impenetrable city wall blocking Zhang Yu's path, leaving him without a single shred of hope for victory.

"If you won't come to me, then I'll come to you."

The two-and-a-half-meter-tall Song Hailong spread his massive hand, swiping at Zhang Yu like a dragon's claw.

Mana coursed through his elephant demon muscle, directly amplifying his strength and physique, to the point where he hardly needed any complex techniques; this brute force alone was enough to sweep through the entire first year.

Feeling the overwhelming force of the claw attack, Zhang Yu showed no hint of panic.

_The difference in our stats is too great. It'll be difficult to defeat him with my own power alone._

_The only way is to borrow his strength to defeat him. A defensive counterattack is my only strategy._

Just as Zhang Yu was thinking this, raising his arms wreathed in Formless Cloud-Astral Qi to block Song Hailong, he saw his opponent’s claw attack shift, transitioning into a set of grappling techniques.

_Grappling?_

_It's more than that…_

In a state of total concentration, Zhang Yu watched every minute change in his opponent's attack, quickly dodging while parrying with his Formless Cloud-Astral Qi.

He soon realized that Song Hailong was executing a martial art focused on grappling and throwing.

It was the expert-level martial art cultivated by Song Hailong, the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand, level 1, activated!

This was an expert-level martial art that used pure physical violence to power grappling and wrestling techniques.

And for Song Hailong, implanted with elephant demon muscle and using all his mana to fortify his body, this martial art that relied purely on physical violence was a perfect fit.

Although Song Hailong's martial skill wasn't his strong suit due to focusing his energies elsewhere, and this technique wasn't particularly difficult, it was still only at a mere level 1.

But relying on his incredibly powerful physique, combined with this level 1 grappling and wrestling art, was more than enough for Song Hailong to crush other experts of the same level.

Zhang Yu could feel that pressure now. In his state of total concentration, he could feel his opponent's hands moving like a great net, slowly closing in to envelop him completely, intending to slam him to the ground and utterly subdue him.

_He wants to wrestle with me? Play a ground game?_

With no related skills of his own, Zhang Yu was naturally unwilling to be taken to the ground to grapple with his opponent, where the fight would be decided by physical strength and ground techniques.

He was like a small, slippery fish, repeatedly making narrow, difficult escapes from under Song Hailong's all-encompassing net.

But finally…

"Got you."

Song Hailong's hand clamped down on Zhang Yu's arm, a slight smile touching his lips.

But just as he and Zhang Yu both exerted their strength, Zhang Yu let out a furious roar.

The Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, which had previously only covered his palms, suddenly surged, extending all the way to his elbows. He then slipped from Song Hailong's grasp like an eel.

Below the stage, Lian Tianji's body jolted.

_In a desperate situation, his Limitless Cloud Hand broke through again?_ he thought in shock. _Level 5? This Zhang Yu is truly a martial arts prodigy._

# Chapter 76: The Final Two Emerge

Feeling the 'chair' beneath her tremble, Le Mulan didn't reprimand him, because she too had been taken aback by Zhang Yu's breakthrough just now.

"To achieve a breakthrough in a martial art in the middle of a fight is truly impressive. No wonder Lian Tianji lost in a real battle."

"But this alone is not enough. The gap between him and Song Hailong is still too vast."

A level 5 Limitless Cloud Hand was clearly not enough to close the gap between them, and the situation on the stage seemed to be unfolding exactly as Le Mulan had predicted.

The breakthrough of Limitless Cloud Hand only served as a minor surprise for Song Hailong. As he unleashed his Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand, his overwhelming advantage in strength and size allowed him to ultimately slam Zhang Yu to the ground.

"It's over."

Le Mulan knew that for someone unskilled in grappling and wrestling, being thrown to the ground and entangled by an opponent was a hopeless situation, with absolutely no chance of victory.

But in the next moment, something unexpected happened once again.

Zhang Yu had also begun using the 'Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand' against Song Hailong.

…

On the stage.

After watching Song Hailong execute the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand several times, and then seeing the same technique appear in his Feathered Tome, Zhang Yu knew that his only chance of victory now was to learn this martial art himself.

…

Below the stage.

Le Mulan thought to herself, _Has he gone mad? Does he really intend to learn grappling and wrestling on the spot to fight Song Hailong on the ground?_

Le Mulan felt Zhang Yu must have been beaten senseless. Over the next few moments of the fight, however, she could see that… although the grappling techniques Zhang Yu used were crude and distorted, they always managed to delay his defeat at critical moments, staving off the inevitable.

This was especially true when combined with his Limitless Cloud Hand, which allowed him to leverage his opponent's strength against them during the grapple, redirecting attacks and putting up an increasingly fierce struggle.

"He truly is a martial arts prodigy. The moment he encountered grappling, he was able to grasp its principles and combine it with his own martial arts to find the key points of applying force."

"But he's only delaying his defeat…"

Le Mulan felt as though Zhang Yu was dancing on a razor's edge. She knew that while the grappling on the ground might look clumsy, it was exceptionally dangerous. The moment Song Hailong locked one of his joints or vital points, it would mean snapped tendons and fractured bones—a crippling injury.

The same Zhang Yu who was full of life one moment could be crushed into a formless pulp by the immense force in Song Hailong's hands the next.

But in the following instant, Le Mulan shot to her feet.

On the stage, Zhang Yu's technique had suddenly transformed. It went from crude to proficient, from chaotic to orderly. He was actually using the 'Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand' to fight Song Hailong head-on.

_He learned it?_

_No… he's already mastered it?_

It wasn't just Le Mulan who was astonished; even her stool, Lian Tianji, stood up in surprise.

"Mastering an opponent's martial art in the middle of a fight? That kind of talent…"

His expression was a mixture of excitement and fear.

This terrifying level of martial arts talent was something he had never even witnessed. In recent years, even if someone possessed such a gift, they would never dare to use it so openly.

Lian Tianji murmured, "Isn't he afraid of bankruptcy? This is cracking a martial art and using a pirated copy in broad daylight."

At the same time, on the other side of the arena, Bai Zhenzhen snatched Zhang Yu's phone.

Lei Jun's face was also a mask of excitement and terror.

"Do you know the password?" he asked solemnly.

Bai Zhenzhen nodded as she quickly worked the phone.

"I helped Yu-boy borrow money once, so I know his password."

Lei Jun reminded her, "The technique is called Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand. Just search for Dragonback…"

Bai Zhenzhen quickly found 'Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand' on a shopping website, but her face fell.

"It costs forty thousand," she said in a panic. "He doesn't have enough."

Just then, the notification sound of a money transfer rang in Bai Zhenzhen's ears like heavenly music.

Received a 40,000 transfer from Zhang Pianpian.

As the digital manual and usage rights were sent to Zhang Yu's account, Bai Zhenzhen finally let out a sigh of relief.

She and Lei Jun looked back at the stage, and it was as if they were watching two dragons, one large and one small, wrestling on the ground.

Although Song Hailong held the absolute advantage, he was unable to completely suppress Zhang Yu.

And as the two continued to clash, Song Hailong suddenly felt his opponent's technique improve yet again. He was now able to intercept his attacks time after time and was even beginning to lock Song Hailong's own body in return.

_What!_

_His Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand has surpassed mine?!_

If it had been a head-on brawl, a trade of fists and palms, then even if Zhang Yu surpassed Song Hailong with the same technique, Song Hailong would have been hard to defeat.

But in a ground grapple using the same 'Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand,' even with Song Hailong's physique, it would be dangerous if he were completely locked down.

This was especially true since at the same time Zhang Yu's 'Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand' surpassed his, a level 5 Formless Cloud-Astral Qi was also erupting from his arms.

This caused every one of Song Hailong's grabs and throws to be redirected and broken, while his opponent's attacks, once launched, required even more of Song Hailong's strength to counter.

_Fine, I'll just wear him down! With my physique, his stamina will soon give out…_

The two rolled and grappled continuously. With his technique now a step behind, Song Hailong had to focus all his attention on countering Zhang Yu.

Just then, he felt his opponent's strength begin to wane.

A flicker of joy lit up Song Hailong's heart. _My chance to win is here._

But in the next moment, Song Hailong suddenly felt the ground beneath him vanish.

Having focused all his energy on the ground battle without paying attention to his surroundings, he had unknowingly rolled to the edge of the stage with Zhang Yu.

And then he was thrown out of bounds.

Thud!

As his feet landed heavily outside the ring, Song Hailong's mind was still a complete blank.

_I lost?_

Suddenly realizing he was outside the arena boundaries, a flash of fury crossed Song Hailong's eyes. His muscles bulged as he prepared to charge back onto the stage.

But in an instant, three figures appeared before him.

Three referees simultaneously placed a hand on his shoulders, their presence gradually calming him down.

He took a deep breath, looked at Zhang Yu on the stage, and said slowly, "You won."

With that, Song Hailong squared his shoulders. "Let go of me. I'll walk on my own."

The three referees withdrew their hands, watching as a stone-faced Song Hailong walked back to the White Dragon High School rest area.

On the stage, another referee had already stepped up.

"Song Hailong's Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand," he asked. "Do you have the usage rights for it?"

Clearly, Zhang Yu's display of learning and using the technique on the spot had raised suspicion of him having cracked a martial art and using a pirated version.

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen rushed over, holding Zhang Yu's phone.

"He bought it, he bought it! He bought the usage rights for Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand. Here's the order."

While showing the order on the phone to the referee, Bai Zhenzhen also took out the Talisman Tome that Zhang Yu had left offstage and flashed the Investigation Department's mark on it.

Seeing the order and the Talisman Tome, the referee took no further action, merely giving Zhang Yu a word of caution before departing.

Only then did Bai Zhenzhen breathe a sigh of relief. She turned to Zhang Yu and complained, "What in the world were you thinking? Cracking a martial art right on stage? Learning and using it on the spot? If the company finds out, they'll sue you into bankruptcy!"

Zhang Yu helplessly scratched his head. "Sigh, I got carried away in the heat of the moment. My mind was so focused on winning that there was no room for anything else."

Then he smiled at Bai Zhenzhen. "Besides, I just knew you guys would have my back."

Bai Zhenzhen rolled her eyes. "This Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand cost forty thousand! If you don't win this championship, you can pay off the debt with your own part-time work."

After saying that, she asked, "Are you hurt anywhere?"

Zhang Yu shook his head.

Although the close-quarters battle had been incredibly dangerous, apart from a few bruises, Zhang Yu was largely unharmed.

The real issue was the mental exhaustion…

Right now, Zhang Yu was continuously rubbing his head. The prolonged state of total concentration, the close-quarters combat on the verge of bankruptcy, and the all-out effort of battle cultivation… he hadn't felt it while it was happening, but now that it was suddenly over, his head felt like it had turned to mush.

"Zhen, help me back so I can rest. I'm so dizzy."

Bai Zhenzhen snorted, then simply scooped Zhang Yu into her arms and started walking toward the Songyang High School rest area.

As she walked, she said, "We've invested way too much in this martial arts competition. You have to beat that witch Le Mulan in the next fight."

Zhang Yu closed his eyes, slowly letting his mind rest, and hummed softly in agreement.

Bai Zhenzhen then whispered, "Let me tell you where Le Mulan's weaknesses are…"

…

Meanwhile, with Song Hailong's return, the atmosphere in the White Dragon High School rest area instantly grew heavy.

The competition coach cleared his throat and said, "This Zhang Yu is indeed very impressive. His stats aren't high, but his martial arts talent is astonishing, and he can even achieve repeated breakthroughs in battle. He certainly has what it takes to defeat a stronger opponent."

"Sigh, really, Hailong, your true strength is still greater than his. If it weren't for the arena rules, his defeat would have only been a matter of time."

There are two ways to rationalize a loss.

One is to say you were careless; the other is to praise the opponent for being amazing.

Clearly, the competition coach was now using both methods.

In truth, if any other student had lost, this coach wouldn't have gone to such lengths; he would have made them kneel first.

But when the richest and best-performing student in the class lost, he obviously couldn't do that.

The other students quickly chimed in with their agreement.

"That Zhang Yu is pretty amazing."

"Big Brother Hailong just wasn't watching his feet, and the stage was too slippery today. Otherwise, how could he have lost with his strength?"

"Who could have expected him to have repeated breakthroughs in battle? And even learn Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand?"

"By the way, does he have the usage rights? Couldn't we get him disqualified…"

"The referee already checked. If there's no problem, then there's no problem."

The White Dragon students' attitude toward Zhang Yu was contradictory.

Because they didn't believe Zhang Yu's true strength surpassed Song Hailong's—his stats were even lower than theirs—they were all a bit unconvinced by the result.

But Zhang Yu had also achieved something they absolutely could not do through his profound martial arts skill and talent, which stirred a faint sense of admiration within them.

And on a nearby stretcher, Chu Qiuhe, who had been feigning unconsciousness, was secretly delighted.

_That's right, keep praising Zhang Yu._

The more they hyped up Zhang Yu's strength, the more justifiable his own defeat would seem.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 77: The Most Powerful Move

In the rest area for Purple Cloud High School.

Le Mulan had already reseated herself on Lian Tianji's back.

She watched Bai Zhenzhen hurry over to the arena, explaining the usage rights to the referee with her phone, and commented, "Bai Zhenzhen can actually use Zhang Yu's phone for purchases? Does she know his phone password and payment password?"

"Those two must be friends willing to die for each other."

Watching Zhang Yu slowly walk back to the rest area, Le Mulan patted Lian Tianji's head and said, "I remember you're friends with this Zhang Yu, right?"

...

The moment Zhang Yu returned to the rest area, he downed all the alchemical enhancers he had bought before the match to restore his stamina, mana, and energy.

Feeling the rapid recovery of his strength, he felt a little more at ease.

The organizers had provided a half-hour break before the final match, which Zhang Yu felt was enough to recover eighty or ninety percent of his stamina and mana.

Bai Zhenzhen said from the side, "...Did you remember everything I just told you?"

Seeing Zhang Yu nod, she then continued, "Then that's all. Rest well and prepare for the next battle."

Not long after Bai Zhenzhen left, Zhang Yu felt his phone vibrate slightly. He opened it to see that Lian Tianji had recommended a friend to him.

"Le Mulan?"

Unsure why Le Mulan would want to add him, Zhang Yu simply chose to accept for the time being.

He then saw a message pop up directly from Le Mulan: Let's meet. There's something I want to discuss with you.

Zhang Yu went to a deserted corridor outside the competition grounds and saw Le Mulan already waiting there gracefully.

This top student from Purple Cloud High School was beautiful, with an icy temperament, and seemed to be the focus of everyone's attention wherever she went, drawing the eyes of others.

Upon seeing Zhang Yu arrive, she said bluntly, "Two hundred thousand. I'll buy your loss. How about it?"

Zhang Yu was slightly taken aback. "You want to buy the competition championship?"

Le Mulan said nonchalantly, "Wealth is power, and money is a part of strength. The Martial Arts Competition selects the strongest, so why can't I use money to buy it?"

Zhang Yu stared at her and snorted. "You're not confident you can beat me?"

Le Mulan shook her head. "I just think that fighting you might cost more than two hundred thousand. I find it a very good deal to spend this two hundred thousand for a guaranteed victory."

Seeing Zhang Yu fall silent, Le Mulan added, "If two hundred thousand isn't enough, then let's make it four hundred thousand. But that's my limit. I won't agree if you try to raise the price any further."

Zhang Yu swallowed. He had to admit that the four hundred thousand yuan Le Mulan was offering right now was more powerful than any move he had encountered in all his consecutive arena battles.

Four hundred thousand—what kind of cultivation technique could that buy? For how long could he lease a spiritual root? How much cultivation equipment could he purchase? And how much could he improve his talismans?

Zhang Yu even felt that if he had this four hundred thousand, the boost to his cultivation would far exceed the championship's fifty-thousand-yuan prize and an expert-level cultivation technique.

After all, in Kunxu, as long as you had money, you had potential, you had aptitude, and you could advance by leaps and bounds on the Immortal Dao; even righteous gods had to serve people.

Zhang Yu opened his mouth and said, "Alright, transfer it directly to my card."

Le Mulan spread her fingers, and a purple, jade-like Talisman Tome materialized in her palm.

"Sign a contract with me under the witness of a righteous god, and I'll transfer the money to you immediately."

Seeing Zhang Yu fall silent instead of agreeing, Le Mulan was surprised.

"You're actually hesitating over four hundred thousand?"

She found it very strange.

"I heard from Lian Tianji that a few hundred yuan is enough to hire you as a security guard, right?"

"You poor people fight tooth and nail every day for a few hundred or a few thousand, so why are you hesitating now that four hundred thousand is right in front of you?"

"With your background, it's impossible for you to get into one of the Ten Greats. Is winning the Martial Arts Competition really that important?"

There was not a trace of mockery in Le Mulan's tone; she seemed genuinely, truly puzzled by Zhang Yu's current behavior.

Shaking her head, she turned to leave.

"Since you can't decide right away, I'll be going. However, you can come get this four hundred thousand anytime before the finals begin. But this is the absolute maximum; I won't raise the price again."

Watching Le Mulan depart, Zhang Yu used his phone to ask Zhang Pianpian: _Sis, if I don't get first place in the Martial Arts Competition, only second, how much will it affect my chances of getting into one of the Ten Greats?_

Zhang Pianpian: _For the connections I found for you, the better your first-year results and the higher your competition ranking, the higher the chance of being selected. First place in the competition naturally has a better chance than second._

Zhang Yu understood. That meant if he took the four hundred thousand, it wasn't as if he couldn't get into the Ten Greats, but the probability would just be a little lower...

But just as the thought of agreeing to Le Mulan's offer truly began to surface in his mind, that damn ritual started clamoring at him again.

_I knew it._

_You idiotic thing are really afraid I won't get into the Ten Greats, aren't you._

As he felt the four hundred thousand slip away, a heart-wrenching pain rose in Zhang Yu, a pain more intense than when he had traded blows with Lian Tianji or grappled with all his might against Song Hailong.

_Is this the heartache of losing a huge sum of money?_

Immediately, Zhang Yu activated the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, severing all distracting thoughts.

At this moment, only one thought remained in his mind.

He was going to pin that rich girl Le Mulan to the ground in the arena and beat her senseless.

...

The final match began.

Le Mulan and Zhang Yu stepped onto the arena simultaneously.

The Martial Arts Competition had finally reached its last stage.

Streams of blue-white sword qi erupted from Le Mulan's body in an overwhelming tide, slashing ferociously toward Zhang Yu.

Once Le Mulan's Stardust Swordplay was unleashed, it was relentless and imposing, like a military formation that was difficult to break through.

Watching Zhang Yu dodge left and right under her sword qi, occasionally using his Formless Cloud-Astral Qi to block the strikes, Le Mulan felt as if she were watching a cornered rat.

"Are you trying to exhaust my mana?" Le Mulan laughed. "Do you think you can?"

The next moment, as Le Mulan's sword qi erupted, the mana within her grew increasingly turbulent, like a surging river, powerful and unending. The force of her mana had already surpassed that of every other contestant present.

At the same time, a female voice sounded from within her body.

"Welcome to the Purple Cloud Replaceable Inner Core system."

"Remaining mana balance: eight million."

Le Mulan touched her lower abdomen, then looked at Zhang Yu before her.

"This replaceable inner core inside me... I've charged it with a total of eight million yuan worth of mana."

Simultaneously, a line of text appeared on her wrist, a number counting down from eight million.

Evidently, as she continuously unleashed her mana and sword qi, the mana charged into the inner core was constantly being consumed. But at a rate of only a thousand yuan per second, the full eight million was still a very long way from being depleted.

But this also meant that for every second Le Mulan fought, she was spending over a thousand yuan.

Le Mulan flicked her fingertips, and streams of sword qi shot toward Zhang Yu like a tempest. Forget getting close, he was being forced bit by bit toward the edge of the arena.

"And if you're worried that my meridians can't withstand this surging mana, you don't have to be."

"My 'Mana-Vein' combat spiritual root has already protected all my meridians, allowing me to maintain a high mana output indefinitely without fear of wear and tear."

Meanwhile, watching Le Mulan's extravagant display in the arena—a seemingly inexhaustible bombardment funded by eight million yuan worth of mana—the audience grew excited.

This was far more impressive than Song Hailong's ten-million-yuan insurance policy, because that ten million belonged to the insurance company, whereas the money Le Mulan was throwing around was her family's own cold, hard cash.

One spectator looked at Le Mulan spending money like water and praised, "So beautiful. The way she spends money like it's nothing is just so beautiful."

Another spectator was filled with envy. "It must be so amazing to be rich, so blissful."

A third spectator had an epiphany. "As expected, if you want to go far on the path of the Immortal Dao, you have to throw money at it. When I get home today, I'm going to squeeze my old man for every coin he's got. I have to take another step forward on the Immortal Dao."

Le Mulan frowned slightly at the noise from the audience.

She continued to fire off sword qi as she looked at Zhang Yu and said, "Did you hear that? Although they're a bit noisy, they're not wrong. Money is the foundation of cultivation."

"As a poor person, if you had earned that four hundred thousand today, you could have gotten a tiny bit closer to me."

"It's a pity you actively gave up this chance to become stronger."

She looked in Zhang Yu's direction and asked with a sincere expression, "I'm very curious. You're clearly so poor, yet you're unwilling to make money. Why is that?"

It seemed that after saying so much, all Le Mulan wanted was an answer to this question that piqued her curiosity.

Zhang Yu looked at her sincere inquiry and suddenly felt the urge to laugh out of anger.

_So the rich young lady is here to observe the life of a poor wretch, is that it?_

He snorted coldly. "You set the price at four hundred thousand because you thought that's the most it would take to beat me?"

Le Mulan nodded. "Correct. I calculated that your defeat is worth at most four hundred thousand. Spending a single cent more would be a waste."

At the same time, under the constant bombardment of sword qi, a crack finally appeared in the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, and a sword slash cut across Zhang Yu's palm.

Zhang Yu said flatly, "Then what if you add in the blood of this poor wretch?"

Blood dripped into the astral qi, dyeing the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi with wisps of crimson.

But faced with the wound on his hand, Zhang Yu showed no panic at all. Instead, as if he had been prepared, he violently flung his blood-covered hand toward Le Mulan's position.

Le Mulan, who had remained motionless from start to finish, always forcing her opponents back with sword qi, now actually shifted her feet slightly, deliberately dodging the splattering blood.

With Le Mulan's dodge, a clear flaw immediately appeared in her Stardust Swordplay.

Zhang Yu shot forward like a bolt of lightning, intending to break through the layers of sword qi and get close to Le Mulan.

At the same time, Bai Zhenzhen's words flashed through Zhang Yu's mind.

...

"This Le Mulan's first flaw is that she... seems to have an obsession with cleanliness."

"I suggest you spit directly at her, preferably phlegm. Not only will she dodge, but I bet she won't even be willing to use her sword qi to block it."

# Chapter 78: Champion

Although Bai Zhenzhen's suggestion was to spit phlegm, Zhang Yu still felt it would be beneath his dignity as a contracted member of the Inspection Team, so he chose to use his own blood.

And as expected, the blood of a 'poor wretch' like him equally disgusted Le Mulan, who would rather dodge than let her sword qi touch it.

On the other side, Le Mulan saw Zhang Yu seizing the opportunity to charge and let out a cold snort. She flicked her sword-fingers, about to block him with sword qi, only to find that Zhang Yu's speed was astonishingly fast.

This was because Zhang Yu's weighted clothing had already been torn to shreds over the past few fights.

Facing Le Mulan in this battle required him to unleash his full speed, so he had simply taken off the weighted suit before the fight began and spent about ten minutes adapting.

After the battle started, he deliberately held back his full speed, partly to lull Le Mulan into a false sense of security, and partly to continue warming up.

He needed to adapt to the speed of Le Mulan's sword qi, and he also needed his body and blood to grow warmer, hotter, and more ignited!

...

Bai Zhenzhen: "Her Ice-Skinned and Jade-Boned body should be a special constitution. I don't know if it's innate or acquired, but because of it, her mana doesn't need any special conversion. It's directly a low-temperature, specialized mana. The moment it's refined, it's a cut above the rest."

"After this low-temperature mana is infused into her sword qi, any collision with it will lower your body temperature, slowing your nerve reactions and muscle speed..."

"You have to get your body scorching hot to resist this low-temperature mana for a short period."

...

At this moment, Zhang Yu's full-speed sprint was like a clap of thunder and a flash of lightning. It couldn't be said that it was too fast for Le Mulan to react, but it was certainly faster than she had anticipated.

_His full speed is this fast? He was holding back before?_

_Did the low-temperature mana not work?_

This series of surprises slowed Le Mulan's sword qi reaction by another fraction of a second. In the end, she could only slash all of them in front of her, trying to stop Zhang Yu in his tracks.

Facing more than a dozen streams of sword qi rushing toward him, Zhang Yu thrust out his right palm, wreathed in crimson astral qi, choosing to meet the sword qi head-on.

This was the other flaw Bai Zhenzhen had mentioned about Le Mulan.

Although the Stardust Swordplay was sharp, Le Mulan had ultimately not cultivated this sword art to the absolute limit possible in the Qi Refinement realm.

Her immense mana allowed her to shoot out sword qi with impunity, but her mana control was simply not refined enough to maintain fine control over so many streams of sword qi for an extended period.

Therefore, after fighting for a while, if multiple streams of sword qi struck at once, they would actually interfere with each other and weaken in power due to her insufficient control.

In an instant, Zhang Yu's right arm had clashed with the dozen or so streams of sword qi.

_Just as I thought, it's not as powerful as it looks._

Using the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi in conjunction with the Imperishable Seal, Zhang Yu shattered most of the sword qi, though his palm was cut by several more slashes. The splashing blood dyed his astral qi an even deeper crimson, wreathing his arm like fire.

But Zhang Yu's steps did not pause for a moment. He had already rushed to within half a meter of Le Mulan and reached out to grab her arm.

"Ah!" With a roar, Le Mulan unleashed dozens of streams of sword qi from her two fingers, all slashing toward Zhang Yu.

Zhang Yu's expression remained unchanged. Shielded by his Subcutaneous Astral Qi and the Imperishable Seal, he endured the sword wounds and splattering blood to seize Le Mulan's right arm.

At that moment, Zhang Yu had finally closed the distance.

Bai Zhenzhen's words once again flashed through his mind.

...

"I can feel that her sword qi's primary goal isn't to injure me, but to force me back."

"Her final flaw is likely that, due to her obsession with cleanliness, she is not skilled in close-quarters combat."

"After all, it's only been half a year since high school started. Even for a rich person like her, I don't believe she could have truly mastered every aspect of combat."

...

At this very moment, facing Zhang Yu at close range, Le Mulan—who had watched his fight with Song Hailong—instantly felt a profound sense of danger.

Le Mulan's first reaction was to slash out with streams of low-temperature sword qi, trying to force Zhang Yu back.

But from within Zhang Yu's now scorching body, power was erupting ceaselessly, and his Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, mixed with the hot blood flowing from his body, blasted forward viciously.

For a time, within that half-meter distance, the ice-blue sword qi and the crimson astral qi clashed brilliantly.

But Le Mulan felt as if the close-range Zhang Yu had transformed into a fiery storm, continuously devouring her sword qi and threatening to swallow her whole.

The sword qi was deflected by the astral qi and repelled by the Imperishable Seal.

At the same time, the level-two Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand activated fiercely. With a single move, he slammed Le Mulan brutally to the ground, leaving her head spinning.

The next moment, seeing the bloody, dirty, and smelly Zhang Yu sit right on top of her, Le Mulan's face filled with horror, and she roared, "Get..."

Simultaneously, the sword qi within her body was about to erupt again.

But halfway through her roar, before her sword qi could be fully unleashed, she heard a strange sound from her hands. Zhang Yu had already used a heavy technique from the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand to dislocate her wrist joints.

The drugs she had taken prevented her from feeling any pain, but she could no longer unleash sword qi from her fingers.

Le Mulan looked at Zhang Yu, both shocked and furious, not expecting that a single dodge, a moment of carelessness, would be seized upon by him so completely.

It had left her in this predicament without even having had the chance to fully display her abilities.

Filled with indignation and rage, she kicked her legs to struggle further, only to hear Zhang Yu's cold voice by her ear.

"You said you're very rich, and that money is a part of your strength."

Amidst a series of sickening cracks, Zhang Yu dislocated the joints in Le Mulan's legs one by one.

"Well, I'm about to destroy you now. Let's see you try and stop me with your money."

At that moment, Le Mulan felt as if she had become a toy in Zhang Yu's hands. As he employed the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand, her joints were broken one after another, and she soon lost all mobility, lying on the ground, unable to move.

Le Mulan stared daggers at Zhang Yu, as if she wanted to slice him into a thousand pieces.

Zhang Yu said flatly, "One last thing."

"Bai Zhenzhen was the one who saw all these flaws of yours and told me about them."

"If it weren't for her insurance premiums being too low."

"She could have beaten you too."

Boom!

Grabbing Le Mulan's head, Zhang Yu swung her off the arena, tossing her to the ground like a piece of trash.

Looking at the blood-covered Zhang Yu standing alone on the stage, the entire venue fell silent.

No one could have thought, no one could have predicted, no one could have even imagined that the winner of today's Martial Arts Competition would be a poor student from Songyang High School.

Xiong Wenwu, defeated.

Song Hailong, defeated.

Le Mulan, defeated.

One by one, the top students and wealthy scions of the three major high schools had all been defeated—defeated by a poor student, defeated by someone from another high school.

The poor won? The rich lost?

In the moment that countless students from the three major high schools were lost in silence and shock...

Zhao Tianxing suddenly began to clap excitedly.

He had no ulterior motive, nor was he trying to show off; he simply saw Zhang Yu's achievement today and subconsciously, irresistibly, began to applaud him.

At that moment, the tattered Songyang High School uniform on Zhang Yu's body seemed to become grand and noble in Zhao Tianxing's eyes.

But the lonely applause sounded so abrupt in the vast, quiet hall that after a few claps, Zhao Tianxing stopped in fear.

But soon, Bai Zhenzhen, cheering from below the stage, also began to clap.

Beside Zhao Tianxing, Qian Shen also began to clap, his eyes filled with shock as he looked toward the arena.

He Dayou, the Son of the School Director, also clapped lightly.

"You're impressive. You've brought great honor to Songyang."

From Purple Cloud High School, Lian Tianji also applauded slowly, thinking to himself that his advertisement would probably be back.

Song Hailong looked at Zhang Yu with a complicated gaze, then suddenly began to clap. His applause led all the White Dragon students to join in.

Even Chu Qiuhe, who had been lying on a stretcher feigning unconsciousness, had at some point propped himself up and was now clapping furiously.

Amidst the applause from the entire venue, Bai Zhenzhen laughed and jumped onto the stage.

"Champion! Champion! We're the champions!"

"I told you that Le Mulan was no good! She can't fight up close, doesn't have the skill."

She pulled Zhang Yu's hands up high, looking out over the entire crowd with pride, the Songyang High School uniform on her body seeming to shine even more dazzlingly.

She then shouted, "Anyone looking for advertising or endorsements can contact us! My brother here is not only the Martial Arts Competition champion, he's also fourth place in the Mana Competition..."

Beside her, Zhang Yu looked out at the crowd, but his vision began to blur.

Although he hadn't been seriously injured in the last fight, the intense concentration, the consecutive use of several martial arts, and the amount of blood he'd lost, on top of the exhaustion from previous battles, made him feel dizzy once again.

He reached a hand out to Bai Zhenzhen.

"Zhen, I'm dizzy. Help me to a doctor."

Bai Zhenzhen said excitedly, "Wait, wait, just stand here a little longer! The whole crowd is watching us."

Zhang Yu sighed. "To help you teach that Le Mulan a lesson, I risked bankruptcy, fought with my life, and shed my blood. It's one thing that you won't call me 'dad,' but now that your dad is feeling unwell, you won't even lend a hand?"

Bai Zhenzhen felt that Zhang Yu would be able to brag about this for the rest of his life.

But she was still dissatisfied that he hadn't precisely followed her strategy, criticizing, "Didn't you bleed so much because you insisted on looking cool? According to my plan, spitting phlegm, blowing snot, and just spitting would have been safer and much more effective than splattering blood, wouldn't it?"

Lying on the ground nearby awaiting medical attention, Le Mulan's eyelids twitched, a flicker of shock in her eyes. A realization dawned on her.

_The depths these two poor people will sink to... are immeasurable._

Bai Zhenzhen had already picked up Zhang Yu and was carrying him toward the first aid area, wanting to stop the man from bragging in front of her any longer.

Lei Jun followed behind them, his face full of concern.

The mere thought that Zhang Yu had won first place in the Martial Arts Competition made his heart surge with emotion.

# Chapter 79: Song Hailong Wants Me to Be His Coach

Lei Jun’s heart was pounding. He was thrilled about his impending bonus, raise, and the prestige of his teaching achievements, but even more than that, he felt a wave of nostalgia for his past.

Once upon a time, Lei Jun had also been a spirited high school student, dreaming that one day he could defeat all his rivals with his iron fists, crush the top students and the wealthy beneath his feet, and stand at the very pinnacle of all the high schools in Songyang City.

"A single punch worth a hundred million! That is the ultimate realm pursued by generations of martial artists!"

But reality soon slapped him across the face.

His monthly exam scores left him feeling powerless to catch up.

The fierce, advanced competition in the tournaments made him feel as if he and those wealthy prodigies were not even in the same dimension—like a mayfly gazing upon the vast blue sky, the gap was one of despair.

Only then did he understand that the path of the Fist, the Sword, or of Qi… none could compare to the path of Money; the reality was that a hundred million could shatter all arts.

He came to understand a simple truth: only with money could one’s fists be strong. The larger the bank balance, the greater the power of the punch.

But today, his student had defeated numerous powerhouses with a frail body, using supreme talent and skill to compensate for physical weakness and the disparity in healthcare and wealth, completely overwhelming the prodigies from the famous schools.

He had accomplished something Lei Jun had once dreamed of, but later dared not even consider.

_Sigh, to defeat money with one's own fists... this is the realm our generation of martial artists should strive for. Even if it was just in a first-year tournament, this is something I'll remember for the rest of my life._

Meanwhile, the paramedic before him said nonchalantly, "It's nothing serious. He just lost a lot of blood and is feeling faint. A transfusion will fix him right up."

"I'll also prescribe some enhancers to restore his stamina, mana, and energy..."

Lei Jun pulled out a few boxes of alchemical enhancers.

"No need. He can have mine. These should work, right?" He figured this might keep his insurance premiums from rising so much next time.

The paramedic curled his lip, thinking to himself that it was truly difficult to squeeze any extra money out of these three paupers.

A moment later, the referee came over, first inquiring about Zhang Yu’s condition before asking Bai Zhenzhen if she wished to fight Song Hailong for third place.

Bai Zhenzhen naturally declined; Song Hailong’s style as a muscle-bound monster and super tank was a perfect counter to her own.

And so, a moment later, the top four of the martial arts tournament were finalized: Zhang Yu, Le Mulan, Song Hailong, and Bai Zhenzhen, in descending order.

Over on the other side, Le Mulan had also recovered her mobility after receiving medical treatment.

After a brief rest, Zhang Yu joined Le Mulan and Song Hailong on the winners' podium to receive their respective champion, runner-up, and third-place medals.

However, while Zhang Yu was all smiles, Le Mulan and Song Hailong both wore gloomy expressions, looking as if they were constipated.

Cheers—and jeers—erupted from the audience.

Someone from Red Pagoda High said, their face contorted with jealousy, "This Zhang Yu's talent is absurd! If he can learn martial arts just by watching others, he should have to pay for it! Otherwise, he's just a martial arts thief!"

A student from Purple Cloud High wailed, "That Zhang Yu actually sat on our sacred number one! I wouldn't dare do that even in my wildest dreams! Damn it, this is worse than death!"

Someone from White Dragon sighed, "The winner stands, the loser kneels. I never thought Songyang High would have a prodigy worth kneeling for."

'Worth kneeling for' was the highest praise a high-scoring prodigy could receive at White Dragon High School.

In front of the podium, Lei Jun beamed as he took out his phone to record the moment.

Beside him, Bai Zhenzhen snapped a few photos before switching to video, her mind already racing with ideas on how to leverage their tournament fame for advertising deals.

As she filmed, she called out to the trio on the podium, "Come on, smile! You look awful with those long faces. Not you, Zhang Yu. Tone it down a bit; don't look so smug."

Lei Jun added from the side, "I'll treat you all to a meal after this. Go ask Qian Shen and the others if they want to come, and figure out what you'd like to eat."

...

In the Purple Cloud High School rest area.

Le Mulan walked back slowly, holding her second-place medal.

She had already changed out of the school uniform that had been stained with blood during her fight with Zhang Yu.

The complex emotions of fury, anger, and indignation that had twisted her features after the battle had vanished, and her serene expression made it seem as if nothing had happened at all.

Upon returning to the rest area, however, her brow furrowed slightly when she saw Lian Tianji kneeling on the ground.

"Get up. I'm revoking the stool punishment."

Lian Tianji looked up in surprise, his eyes filled with a hint of confusion. This was the first time he had ever seen Le Mulan go back on her word.

Le Mulan said calmly, "I've already lost. What right do I have to punish you?"

"If you were to become my stool, should I, who also lost, become your stool? Or should I go be Zhang Yu's stool?"

As she spoke, she turned her head slightly to look in Zhang Yu’s direction, her tone complex.

"Your failure this time wasn't your fault. That Zhang Yu is truly formidable."

"Although I still don't understand why he's unwilling to earn more money, he certainly made me aware of my own weaknesses."

Le Mulan was already planning a future training regimen focused on close-quarters combat.

Initially, in her post-match analysis, Le Mulan believed she had been too confident and had underestimated her opponent, thinking a single dodge would be enough to secure an easy victory. She never expected him to capitalize on such a minuscule opening.

However, upon reviewing the entire fight, she suddenly realized he had come prepared; not only had he identified her subtle weaknesses, but he also had the ingenuity and capability to exploit them.

Beyond that, she naturally also considered her aversion to Zhang Yu's blood.

_I should have some appropriate contact with the poor..._

Le Mulan couldn’t help but frown again at the thought. It created an uncontrollable, awkward feeling—a kind of mental discomfort.

_It conflicts with my heart art. Changing one's way of thinking is truly not easy._

Suddenly, she remembered she had added Zhang Yu as a friend.

_Perhaps I'll start by looking at a poor person's social media feed..._ she thought.

Lian Tianji climbed to his feet with a smile.

"This defeat will make us stronger. The next time we face Zhang Yu in a tournament, we'll definitely beat him."

"The next tournament?" Le Mulan said. "You mean the physical tournament? There's no sense of accomplishment in beating him in that."

Lian Tianji paused for a moment before nodding in agreement.

"That's true," he said with a sigh. "His physical strength is already so far behind ours. In two months, by the time of the physical tournament, the gap will probably be even wider."

"Unless he can join Songyang's tournament team and undergo their so-called special training program..."

...

In the White Dragon High School rest area.

Now awake and surrounded by his classmates, Chu Qiuhe lamented, "It was only after waking up and carefully reviewing the fight that I realized how terrifying Zhang Yu is. I'm afraid there isn't a single first-year student in all of Songyang City who can surpass him in practical combat skill."

Someone from White Dragon retorted unconvinced, "That's an exaggeration. I think Big Brother Hailong just slipped off the stage because he was sweating too much. He just needs to use some antiperspirant before the next match."

Chu Qiuhe pointed at him. "What are your scores? What's your rank? Kneel before you speak to me."

Only after the student knelt did Chu Qiuhe continue slowly, "You can't fully comprehend how terrifying Zhang Yu is unless you've actually fought him..."

Just then, Song Hailong returned, and the crowd immediately fell silent.

Song Hailong casually tossed the third-place medal into his bag without a second glance.

Song Hailong understood that while third place in the martial arts tournament was an honor for others, for him, it was a disgrace.

Just then, his phone rang. A mature male voice came from the other end.

"I saw your match. The two people who placed ahead of you are not stronger than you."

"You lost to people weaker than you. Father is very disappointed in you..."

Hearing this, Song Hailong grew flustered. "Brother, I was just careless..."

"Don't make excuses," the man on the other end said coldly. "You know how much Father despises excuses for failure."

Song Hailong took a deep breath and said softly, "I'm sorry."

The two-and-a-half-meter giant, listening to the reprimand, looked as anxious and flustered as a schoolboy.

After hanging up, Song Hailong looked toward Zhang Yu, his expression simmering with anger.

Since he had lost, he would have to find a way to redeem himself—in a way only the wealthy could.

He strode over to the Songyang High School rest area, his oppressive frame immediately casting a shadow over Zhang Yu.

As Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen watched him warily, Song Hailong asked coldly, "How much?"

"What's your price to be my combat sparring partner?"

As someone with absolute wealth, the natural response to being defeated was to spend whatever it took to hire your opponent as a training partner, practicing relentlessly until you could crush them in turn!

Whoever defeated you, you paid them to learn everything they knew!

Hearing Song Hailong's words, both Bai Zhenzhen's and Zhang Yu's eyes lit up, and the boy in front of them suddenly seemed much more impressive.

Zhang Yu cleared his throat. "I'm very expensive, and very busy. I'll have to check my schedule to see if I'm available."

Bai Zhenzhen nodded eagerly beside him. "Yes, yes! I'm Zhang Yu's agent. You can discuss the financial arrangements with me! I also made the top four in the tournament, and I'm Zhang Yu's combat coach. I was the one who guided him in that final fight against Le Mulan. Do you want to hire me, too?"

After adding both Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu as contacts, Song Hailong looked at them and said, "Work out the exact price between yourselves and let me know."

"But there's one thing..."

Looking at Zhang Yu's frail physique, Song Hailong said with dissatisfaction, "You'd better find a way to increase your physical strength."

"Because I'm only going to get stronger and faster. I can't wait for you to catch up. If your stats are too low, I'll be able to crush you with pure strength, and then there'd be no point in training together."

Watching him walk away, Zhang Yu knew he was right.

Whether it was for the sparring money, the physical tournament in two months, or even for his future college prospects, he needed to work harder to raise his physical strength.

_I have to catch up to Song Hailong and Le Mulan._

A moment later, Zhao Tianxing, Qian Shen, and He Dayou came down from the stands to see Zhang Yu.

"That was so cool, Yu!" Zhao Tianxing said excitedly. "I took some pictures of you on the stage, take a look..."

Qian Shen remarked with feeling, "The tournament is on a whole other level, far beyond the standard curriculum. It's like a test from another dimension. A perfect score of 100 in combat is no longer enough to represent your achievements."

Bai Zhenzhen asked, "Old Lei is treating us to a meal soon. Are you guys coming? Any preferences?"

Zhao Tianxing replied, "What should we eat? I'm fine with anything, but something healthy like boiled chicken would be best."

Bai Zhenzhen nodded, making a note on her phone. "Okay, Zhao Tianxing is easy."

He Dayou stated flatly, "I don't eat peasant food. If the restaurant isn't expensive enough, I'm not going."

Bai Zhenzhen nodded and made another note. "He Dayou isn't coming."

Qian Shen said, "I know a good place. Drinks are on me."

Bai Zhenzhen noted, "Qian Shen's treat."

...

Inside a downtown restaurant.

As soon as Zhang Yu walked in, he announced, "Do you have king crab? We'll take ten."

Following behind him, Lei Jun's face darkened. _Is he trying to eat me into bankruptcy?_

Qian Shen interjected, "This place doesn't have seafood. Besides, it's not very nutritious and isn't suitable for high school students."

"This place specializes in authentic pre-packaged meals. There are no extra seasonings, so you get to taste the food in its purest form."

"The meals are also incredibly nutritious. Each dish contains over ten thousand clean calories. I often eat here after working out."

Lei Jun nodded to himself. Qian Shen was a considerate kid, mindful of his teacher's budget.

Qian Shen turned to the waiter. "Do you have any pre-packaged meals with demonic beast meat? We're all top students from Songyang High School here today. Do you have any dietary supplements on the menu?"

Lei Jun sighed. So much for Qian Shen being considerate. He wasn't a Daoist art instructor; didn't the boy know how limited a martial arts teacher's salary was?

Not wanting to let the students order recklessly, Lei Jun said directly, "I only brought 6,000. If we go over, we're all washing dishes."

A moment later, the group was seated together, raising their glasses of beast protein milk.

"Cheers!"

They were health-conscious high school students and a teacher, after all. Of course they would drink healthy and nutritious beast protein milk.

Besides, school would be starting soon after their meal, so it wouldn't be wise to drink anything that might affect their performance in class.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 80: Cultivation Technique, Cultivation

Inside the restaurant.

Lei Jun stood up and said, "I'd like to say a few words."

"I never expected such an incredible outcome in this martial arts tournament."

"Honestly, given Songyang's resources, I would have been satisfied just to snag tenth place."

"But with Zhang Yu taking first and Bai Zhenzhen fourth, it just goes to show that my teaching methods are pretty effective..."

Seeing Lei Jun's triumphant expression, Bai Zhenzhen thought to herself, _So Old Lei can be a real braggart._

Old Lei smiled at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen and continued, "Of course, the two of you, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, made indispensable contributions."

"In all my years of teaching at Songyang, I've never seen martial arts talent like yours. As your teacher, I have to thank you for this achievement."

He then pointed to Zhang Yu, who was taking advantage of the moment to practice the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra.

"Look at Zhang Yu. He uses every spare moment to cultivate. I haven't seen that kind of diligence and self-discipline in years."

Zhang Yu shook his head inwardly with a sigh. If this ritual wasn't constantly nagging him, who would want to cultivate while eating and walking?

Old Lei continued, "Finally, I hope you'll keep up the hard work and get into a university you're happy with."

After his speech, Old Lei downed his milk tea in one gulp, and the atmosphere at the table grew more lively.

With Lei Jun present, Zhao Tianxing seemed a bit reserved. He raised his glass to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

"Yu-boy, Zhen, congratulations on your great results in the tournament."

Qian Shen pointed to a dish. "This is their specialty. You have to try it."

As the dishes arrived, the group, none of whom were ordinary, fell upon the food like a whirlwind, their chopsticks a blur as they devoured one plate after another.

Just then, Zhang Yu's phone buzzed.

He took it out and saw it was a message from Zhang Pianpian.

Zhang Pianpian: Little brother, congratulations on first place in the martial arts tournament. You're one step closer to your goal.

Zhang Pianpian: And don't forget to pay back the forty thousand you borrowed.

Looking at her last message, Zhang Yu sighed to himself, _My dear sister, she's not exactly rolling in money either._

Just then, Qian Shen asked curiously, "What did Le Mulan mean on the stage, talking about you and making money?"

So Zhang Yu briefly explained the situation with Le Mulan and the 400,000.

This was the first Lei Jun had heard of it. His eyes widened as he looked at Zhang Yu. 

"So you chose to take first place? To beat her on the stage?"

Zhang Yu declared proudly, "How could a martial artist of my caliber bow down for a mere four hundred thousand?"

Lei Jun pointed at Zhang Yu, his heart aching. "Foolish! Utterly foolish!"

_Zhang Yu isn't even trying to get into the Ten Greats,_ he thought.

He sighed aloud. "How can first place in the martial arts tournament compare to four hundred thousand?"

"Money is power, potential, and the future. Even though you had to sacrifice first place, with your talent, that four hundred thousand could have helped you place in many more tournaments to come."

Beside him, Zhao Tianxing couldn't help but sigh. "Four hundred thousand... that's a steep price for first place in a martial arts tournament."

Seeing the regretful looks on Lei Jun's and Zhao Tianxing's faces, as if they themselves had lost the money, Zhang Yu was speechless. And yet... this was Kunxu. It was perfectly normal.

Besides, Zhang Yu knew that, in a way, they were right. Whether it was for the upcoming physical tournament or the talisman tournament, money would be incredibly useful to him.

Just then, his phone buzzed again. He opened it and saw a message from the tournament organizers.

First, the 50,000 in prize money was being processed.

Second, he needed to choose his prize: an expert-level cultivation technique.

Zhang Yu immediately focused on the list of cultivation techniques they had sent.

As he read, he considered the cultivation techniques he had already mastered.

_For my Dao heart, I have the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art. For mana, I have the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method. For combat, in addition to the Limitless Cloud Hand and the Imperishable Seal Art, I've now also learned the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand._

_Dao heart, mana, combat... I already have expert-level techniques for all of those. The expert-level technique I need most now, especially for the physical tournament in two months, is a body tempering art._

Although the effectiveness of techniques like the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art and the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method would diminish as his stats increased, they were still sufficient for now.

His current method for body tempering, the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms, was far too basic in comparison.

He filtered the list of rewards to show only the body tempering cultivation techniques. There were three options: Dragon-Elephant Might, Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, and Tendon-Shifting Marrow-Swapping.

After looking them over, Zhang Yu still wasn't sure which to choose, so he decided to ask Lei Jun for his opinion.

Lei Jun listened and nodded slightly. "You're right, what you need most now is a body tempering cultivation technique."

As a veteran teacher, although Lei Jun didn't teach physical education, he was still quite knowledgeable about body tempering cultivation techniques.

He glanced at the three techniques Zhang Yu had picked out and immediately had a good sense of them.

He said, "This Dragon-Elephant Might, as its name suggests, is a strength-based technique. It's the best for increasing physique, but it has high requirements for alchemical enhancers; it's hard to make progress without a dozen injections a day. The result... is something similar to Song Hailong."

A human tank, in other words. Zhang Yu recalled Song Hailong's two-and-a-half-meter frame and nodded in understanding.

Lei Jun continued, "Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi is a more balanced body tempering cultivation technique. It focuses on internal refinement, building power in the tendons and bones for explosive strength. It's best practiced in conjunction with alchemical enhancers and dietary supplements."

_A bruiser,_ Zhang Yu judged. _Half tank, half damage-dealer._

"Finally, this Tendon-Shifting Marrow-Swapping is definitely not for you. It focuses more on flexibility and the body's ability to contort, and it's meant to be used in conjunction with other specialized techniques."

At this point, Zhang Yu had narrowed his choices down to Dragon-Elephant Might and Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

But both techniques had their pros and cons, and he couldn't immediately decide.

Lei Jun added, "I'd recommend Dragon-Elephant Might. For one, it's a relatively simple technique. For another, it fits well with Songyang's style of body tempering. You can even ask Wang Hai for some pointers."

"That Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi emphasizes internal refinement, which is extremely difficult. Without guidance from a master teacher, not only is it hard to master, but you can also easily injure yourself. Injuries sustained while practicing this art are so common that insurance policies don't even cover them."

Suddenly, an idea struck Zhang Yu.

"Teacher," he asked, "how many forms does each technique have?"

Lei Jun thought for a moment. "I don't remember for Dragon-Elephant Might. A few dozen, probably. But each form is simple and unadorned, progressing step-by-step. It's not hard to learn."

"I remember Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, because the entire technique consists of a single standing stance. But don't underestimate it. That one stance requires the perfect coordination of your entire body. It's extremely difficult and makes you prone to injury. It's not suitable for you right now..."

Zhang Yu's eyes suddenly lit up. He knew which one he would choose.

Zhang Yu immediately sent his selection to the organizers. Soon after, the digital manual and usage rights for Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi were delivered to him.

Before long, Zhang Yu and the others had eaten their fill. Seeing that it was almost six-thirty, they decided they couldn't be bothered to go home and wash up, so they headed straight for the school.

...

Meanwhile.

Early in the morning at Songyang High School.

Zhou Chechen frowned at Lan Ling. "What did you say?"

Lan Ling could only repeat himself. "Zhang Yu took first place in the martial arts tournament."

"Zhang Yu? First place in the martial arts tournament?" Zhou Chechen asked in disbelief. "Did White Dragon, Purple Cloud, and Red Pagoda not even send any contestants?"

Lan Ling had no choice but to take out his phone. "He defeated Song Hailong from White Dragon High School, then beat Le Mulan from Purple Cloud High School to take the top spot."

Zhou Chechen took the phone and watched the video of Zhang Yu's fight. After a moment, he looked up, a surprised expression on his face.

"The weak defeating the strong... No, his stats may be lower, but considering his martial skill and combat performance, at the moment of victory, he was indeed the stronger one."

"I never would have thought... truly, never, that our own Songyang could produce someone like him."

"Zhang Pianpian must have invested a small fortune in this Zhang Yu to get him this far."

At this thought, a dark expression flickered across Zhou Chechen's face. Zhang Yu should have been his to sign, but now he was under Zhang Pianpian's protection.

It was as if a promising project he had scouted was snatched from under his nose, and now its value was skyrocketing.

For a wealthy man like Zhou Chechen, earning less was the same as losing money, to say nothing of missing out on such a promising asset.

He could only tell himself that in another six months, he would be able to snatch both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen back. When that time came, he would be sure to recoup all his lost potential earnings from the two of them.

Just then, Lan Ling reminded him, "What about Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's application to join the physical tournament team?"

Zhou Chechen snorted. "Rejected."

Lan Ling said, "Wang Hai is very keen on having them join. He's mentioned it several times."

"And then there's Zhang Pianpian's inspection team... without a valid reason, it might be difficult to justify."

The thought of Zhang Pianpian causing another scene at Songyang High School, potentially embarrassing him publicly, made a flicker of anxiety cross Zhou Chechen's eyes.

Then Zhou Chechen said calmly, "Each school can send five people to the physical tournament."

"Then tell them this... in one month, if Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen can place in the top five among first-years in physicals, they can join the competition. If their stats aren't good enough, they'll have no one to blame but themselves. It will have nothing to do with us."

Lan Ling's eyes flickered. He knew that with their current physical scores, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen would have no problem maintaining a top-five rank.

Unless, of course, another group of first-year students was chosen to participate in the special training program to completely eclipse Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen in terms of physical strength.

Zhou Chechen made a quick calculation. "In one month, based on their current rate of progress, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's physical strength will only reach between level 1.8 and 2.1."

Zhou Chechen picked up the student files from his desk and said calmly, "It's been half a year since the semester started. The first-years have a solid foundation. Let's start a bit early this year. Recruit these five into the special training program and have them participate in the physical tournament."

"In one month, we'll use the special training program to boost their physical strength to level 3.0 or higher. That will push Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen out of the running, and then even Zhang Pianpian won't have anything to say about it."

He looked at the student files in his hands. In addition to the five first-years—Qian Shen, He Dayou, Zhao Tianxing, and two others—there were also more than a dozen second-year students, paired up to correspond with each of the five first-years.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 81: Competition Slots

Songyang High School.

Inside the classroom.

School life remained as tranquil as ever, and the students’ enthusiasm for learning was as high as usual.

The language teacher explained the text from the podium with a complete lack of presence, while below, students were practicing forms, meditating, taking alchemical enhancers, and some had even started fighting… that was combat training.

This was the typical classroom atmosphere in an key high school.

First-year students, still bound by their middle school habits, would hold back a bit right after school started, but now, half a year in, everyone had revealed their true colors as Immortal Dao aces.

The language teacher didn't mind any of it; after all, whether it was practicing forms, meditating, or fighting, taking, popping, or injecting alchemical enhancers, or any other form of Immortal Dao cultivation, it was all far more important than her trivial language class, as long as the students didn't come after her.
