As far as she knew, general education teachers at Songyang High School already held good status. Her classmate who had gone to teach at White Dragon High School was often used by the school leadership as an example to lecture students: if you don’t get into a good university after the college entrance exams, you’ll end up as useless as your high school language teacher.

Thinking of this, the language teacher sighed inwardly.

_Alas, if it weren’t for the sects and the municipal government’s requirements, the key high schools would probably have cut general education class time down to nothing._

Just then, the language teacher heard a student's phone ring.

She was finally losing her patience and wanted to speak up: Student, please put your phone on vibrate during language class so you don't disturb the other students' self-study.

But when the language teacher looked up, she saw that the phone belonged to none other than Zhang Yu.

Although she was just a teacher of a mere general education course, she was well acquainted with this campus celebrity's reputation.

Grade One Study Demon, Songyang School Traitor, the Impure, Moocher… she had heard all of Zhang Yu's various nicknames.

She heard he had even taken first place in the martial arts competition last night, and no one dared to say a word when he was two minutes late for school today.

Considering he was someone with a rich benefactor from White Dragon High School who could stand up to the Student Council, how could a mere general education teacher like her dare to tell him to put his phone on vibrate.

So, the language teacher quickly lowered her head and pretended she hadn't heard a thing.

Zhang Yu had been cultivating his heart art to improve his Dao heart when he picked up his phone and saw that the prize money from the martial arts competition had arrived.

_The money's a bit low, but at least it arrived quickly._

Although 50,000 had been deposited, after paying back the 40,000 to Zhang Pianpian and repaying the meal money he had borrowed from Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing, Zhang Yu's account was once again left with less than 10,000.

Zhang Yu knew that Bai Zhenzhen's fourth-place prize was 10,000, so the number in her account was probably about the same as his right now.

But when Zhang Yu thought about how the next month was only two weeks away, and he would have to pay loan interest, plus rent and utilities, he felt a wave of annoyance.

_Right, I also need to buy a new weighted suit, and if I focus on body tempering for the next two months, my daily food expenses are probably going to increase…_

The more Zhang Yu thought, the more expenses he realized he had.

_Good thing there's that income from Song Hailong._

Meanwhile, on the other side of the classroom, Bai Zhenzhen also received the notification that her prize money had arrived.

In addition, she also received a message from Zhang Pianpian.

Zhang Pianpian: You don't use your spiritual root often enough, so you're not very skilled with it, are you? Otherwise, you should have been able to go further in the martial arts competition.

Zhang Pianpian: From now on, just rent a spiritual root every day. Just say I'm investing in you and paying for it.

Zhang Pianpian: An evolutionary spiritual root only gets stronger the more you use it.

Seeing Zhang Pianpian's messages, Bai Zhenzhen was first startled, then immediately realized.

_She saw that I have a spiritual root? She wants to give me cover to use my spiritual root?_

Bai Zhenzhen was very aware of her spiritual root's condition; she would secretly use it to cultivate every day after returning home.

But because she was constantly worried about someone discovering she possessed such a 'great treasure,' she never dared to use this spiritual root to aid her cultivation every day in a public place like school.

After all, if something like this became known, just the various banks offering mortgages, casino marketers, and scammers would be enough to drive her crazy, to say nothing of what the wealthy might think.

So, after being exposed so directly by Zhang Pianpian, Bai Zhenzhen's first feeling was one of instinctual panic, a fear that had accumulated in the deepest part of her heart since childhood, like having a shameful secret she'd hidden for a decade suddenly exposed.

However, thinking of Zhang Pianpian's care during this time, of Yu-boy's sibling relationship with her, of how she had frankly revealed her own status as a fake rich girl, and of her score of 699, Bai Zhenzhen gradually calmed down.

_I should trust Zhang Pianpian._

Then it occurred to her… if she could use Zhang Pianpian's name as an excuse to rent a spiritual root every day, she could then openly use her own spiritual root to cultivate at school every day.

_If I do that, my cultivation time using the spiritual root could increase by at least ten hours a day._

_I won't be so constrained in the next competition._

Recalling the martial arts competition, although Bai Zhenzhen had taken fourth place, she constantly felt a sense of frustration, the uncomfortable feeling of being cut off in the middle of a grand display.

Because her various stats were inferior to her opponents from the three great high schools, and because the numbers in her bank account were smaller than her opponents', she was always forced to be more hesitant in her actions, and in the end, she even had to concede.

And now, with the ability to use her spiritual root more for cultivation, she immediately felt a renewed confidence that she could catch up to those top students from the famous schools.

_Yu-boy stole the show in this competition, but next time, it'll be my turn._

_Although it's nice to have my son take first place, it would be even more satisfying to crush him underfoot and take the championship myself._

…

During PE class.

The smells of sweat and alchemical enhancers mingled, creating an aroma unique to the Immortal Dao of Songyang.

The clang of equipment and the groans of human bodies sounded continuously—the sounds of students struggling valiantly on the Immortal Path.

But some people cast glances toward Bai Zhenzhen not far away, sensing the spiritual energy surging in the air, their minds filled with different thoughts.

Some were envious, "To rent a spiritual root for Bai Zhenzhen to use every day, that Zhang Pianpian is too good to her, isn't she?"

Some thought of a plan:, "I can love White Dragon High too! I want to be Zhang Pianpian's dog!"

And others let their imaginations run wild, "Bai Zhenzhen became Zhang Pianpian's dog and gets to rent a spiritual root every day. If I become Bai Zhenzhen's dog, I wonder if she'd let me borrow the spiritual root for an hour a day?"

On the other side, Zhang Yu was not training his body intensely like the students around him, but had gone into a small side room to study the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand he had newly acquired yesterday.

After all, since he had switched the Feathered Tome's specialization to this grappling technique yesterday, the 24-hour cooldown had not yet passed, so the only thing he could rapidly improve right now was this practical combat skill.

_I'll practice this for now. After the cooldown ends tonight, I'll switch back to Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi._

Zhang Yu's hands moved in a flurry of afterimages as he began to practice the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand.

Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand Lvl. 2 (4/20)

This martial art, powered purely by physical violence, had a total of eighteen moves. Although the number of moves wasn't small, each one was extremely short, all of them methods for breaking tendons and fracturing bones, throwing an opponent to the ground, or trapping them in a submission hold in an instant.

The art of grappling emphasized speed and ferocity. On average, each move took less than a second to execute, and in a flash, Zhang Yu had completed the entire set of Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand.

Recalling the several martial arts he had cultivated before, Zhang Yu felt a sense of understanding.

"The moves in martial arts are often required to be simple and fast, which is why practicing a full set is so quick."

Zhang Yu understood that if it weren't for this, he wouldn't have been able to learn and even surpass Song Hailong's Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand on the tournament stage.

A few minutes later, Zhang Yu felt a jolt in his mind as countless experiences with the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand emerged, and the martial art had been upgraded from Level 2 to Level 3.

_If I keep cultivating at this speed, I should be able to raise the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand to Level 10 today._

While Zhang Yu was diligently cultivating his martial arts in the small room, the PE teacher, Wang Hai, called Qian Shen, He Dayou, Zhao Tianxing, and two other students aside.

"The school plans to select a group of promising first-year students to join the sports competition team for training."

"Are the five of you willing to go?"

Before anyone else could react, Qian Shen asked directly, "Just the five of us? Aren't Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen going?"

Wang Hai said, "The school leadership feels that those two need to settle down a bit more."

Qian Shen was perplexed, "Their monthly exam scores are first and second in the grade, and they need to settle down? But we get selected?"

Wang Hai certainly couldn't say that it was all because of the Student Council, so he could only offer another reason.

"Because they're too poor."

Seeing the five students slightly stunned, Wang Hai continued, "They can't even afford the competition team's tutoring and nutrition fees. How can they join the team?"

Not only did the other four find this perfectly reasonable, but now even Qian Shen was at a loss for words.

Especially when he remembered how Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had to borrow money from him for dinner, he understood that their financial situation must be dire.

After recruiting the five students into the sports competition team, Wang Hai went to find Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

"Your applications for the sports competition have been rejected again."

Wang Hai looked at the two with some regret, "You should know what this is about."

Wang Hai had previously thought Zhang Yu was a Golden Core disciple, but after Zhang Pianpian came to Songyang High School to back him up and clashed with the Student Council, he became a little less certain.

But regardless of whose disciple he was, Wang Hai could sense that Zhang Yu's aptitude was extraordinary and that he had the potential to compete for a top spot in the sports competition.

He thought to himself, _What a pity. The Student Council isn't giving them a chance at all._

Hearing Wang Hai's words, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen of course understood, knowing that this was certainly the Student Council's doing.

Wang Hai continued, "But you're not completely out of chances. If, in one month, your PE scores can remain in the top five of the grade, you can represent the school in the sports competition."

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen exchanged a strange glance, confusion rising in their hearts.

As if understanding their confusion, Wang Hai continued, "The school has selected five first-year students to join the sports competition team."

"In one month, if you can keep your PE scores in the top five while competing against them, you can represent the school in the sports competition."

Now Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen understood. It was obvious the Student Council believed that after these five students joined the competition team and received training, their physical scores would completely surpass their own.

Seeing the fighting spirit burning in Zhang Yu's and Bai Zhenzhen's eyes, Wang Hai sighed inwardly.

As Songyang High School's ace PE teacher, he knew the competition team's training methods all too well.

_This so-called opportunity to compare after a month is just an excuse from the Student Council, a way to legitimately squeeze Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen out of the competition so that even Zhang Pianpian can't say anything._

_Based on Zhang Yu's and Bai Zhenzhen's rate of progress, raising their physical strength to 2.1 or even 2.2 in a month would be their absolute limit._

_But the competition team, with their special training program, can raise He Dayou and the others' physical strength to over 3.0 in just one month._

_This has nothing to do with talent; it's purely a massive gap in Immortal Dao technology. If Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were to join the special training program, their improvement in a month would probably be even greater…_

It was because he knew all this so clearly that Wang Hai understood… the moment Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen failed to be selected for the special training program, they had already lost any chance of catching up to the competition team members in physical strength, let alone any chance of participating in the sports competition.

(Chapter End)

---

# Chapter 82: Level 10, Part-Time Job

In the small garden behind the academic building.

Accompanied by the whistle of displaced air, Zhang Yu was practicing the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand, move by move.

Just then, a teacher suddenly darted out from the side and looked at Zhang Yu, saying, "What grade and class are you in? What's your name? Why are you here during class time? Are you skipping?"

Zhang Yu answered calmly, "I am Zhang Yu from Grade One, Class One. I came out to practice some martial arts during math class."

Upon hearing the name Zhang Yu, the teacher's imposing manner immediately faltered.

And when he heard Zhang Yu was skipping math class, even the slightest hint of a stern expression vanished from his face.

Skipping math class counted as skipping class?

If you haven't even skipped a general education course like math for the sake of your Immortal Dao cultivation, can you even be called an ace of Songyang High School?

Thus, after checking that Grade One, Class One was indeed having math class at this time, the teacher nodded and said, "There are still 27 minutes left. Remember to head back as soon as class is over, don't be late for the next one."

After the teacher left, Zhang Yu once again silently cultivated the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand.

Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand Lvl. 9 (89/90)

The reason he wasn't cultivating the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand in the math classroom was simply that his progress in this martial art was too fast, and he didn't want to attract attention in the classroom.

As he executed the final move, the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand instantly advanced to Level 10.

In that moment, countless martial arts experiences and practice memories surged forth from Zhang Yu's mind, bringing his understanding of the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand, of grappling, and of throwing to a new peak.

At the same time, he could feel the Level 10 effect of the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand.

When he performed this martial art again, he could accurately sense his own center of gravity.

Zhang Yu realized that if he wished, he could also sense his opponent's center of gravity and even use the techniques within the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand to instantly shatter their balance and throw them to the ground.

_I get it. Whoever I trip, falls._

_Truly a pure combat martial art._

_And it feels like it pairs quite well with my Limitless Cloud Hand and Imperishable Seal Art...?_

As streams of white astral qi erupted from his palms, with his Level 10 mastery of the Limitless Cloud Hand and Level 10 Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand, he faintly felt that he could combine the two martial arts.

_If I substitute the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi for the explosive power of my hands, I can execute grappling and throwing techniques from a distance._

A sudden flash of insight crossed Zhang Yu's mind.

_Although the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand is powered by pure physical violence, that's not a flaw, but rather an advantage._

_Because it means a cultivator can later integrate all kinds of powerful forces, whether it's astral qi, palm force, or fist strength, into the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand._

_This martial art is like a grand framework that can accommodate many different combat techniques..._

At this moment, Zhang Yu sensed the foresight in Song Hailong's cultivation of this Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand. Not only was it suitable for Song Hailong to use immediately, but it also laid the groundwork for future combat power growth.

_I wonder if he thought of this himself, or if it was designed for him by his family or private tutors behind him._

…

Dinnertime.

In the cafeteria.

Every student was shoveling down their food with focus. After all, whether it was the three great schools, the key high schools, or the regular high schools, there wasn't a single high school student who wasn't enthusiastic about eating.

However, one could faintly sense a miasma of resentment floating above the cafeteria today.

It was the resentment of dissatisfaction with the cafeteria's food.

Bai Zhenzhen walked through the cafeteria hall with her tray. Although her appearance was striking, her ice-cold demeanor made many students feel she was unapproachable.

The moment she sat down, Bai Zhenzhen was heard complaining, "Half the windows have switched to selling synthetic food, and the prices for all the remaining pre-prepared meals have gone up. What a bunch of animals!"

Clearly, with the momentum of the Oasis Group, synthetic food was being continuously promoted in Songyang City and had imperceptibly made its way into the high school cafeteria.

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhao Tianxing and Qian Shen and said, "We must absolutely not buy synthetic food. We have to boycott it fiercely and make them lose their shirts!"

"Is synthetic food even fit for human consumption?"

"Besides, who knows what they put in it…"

Just as Bai Zhenzhen was speaking, she saw Zhang Yu carrying a large plate of a paste-like substance and sitting down under the astonished gazes of the three of them.

Bai Zhenzhen exclaimed in shock, "Yu-boy! Why are you eating this stuff? Weren't you against eating synthetic food?"

Zhang Yu said matter-of-factly, "The cafeteria is having a promotion today. Free tasting for synthetic food."

Bai Zhenzhen immediately stood up, "I want to see for myself just how bad this synthetic food is."

She walked over to the synthetic food window and heard the cafeteria lady in front introducing, "This is meat paste, this is vegetable paste, and this is rice paste. After you choose, you pick a flavor profile: Mapo Tofu flavor, Kung Pao Chicken flavor, Seafood Medley flavor…"

A short while later, Bai Zhenzhen returned to her seat with the free synthetic food she had received and, after one bite, her face showed utter shock, "This is synthetic food?"

It was impossible to know what kind of Immortal Dao technology was used, but when Bai Zhenzhen took a bite, she found that not only the taste and aroma but even the texture was seventy to eighty percent close to that of real pre-prepared meals.

Bai Zhenzhen remembered clearly that the cafeteria lady had scooped up various pastes, but after being mixed with different flavorings, they acquired all sorts of textures; some were like fatty meat, some like vegetable leaves, and some like fish…

This was a completely different thing from the synthetic food she had eaten in the past.

Bai Zhenzhen said in astonishment, "Has there been a breakthrough in the relevant Immortal Dao technology?"

Zhang Yu sighed from the side, "As expected, these big corporations don't make losing deals. They dare to push this stuff out to compete with pre-prepared meals because they have the confidence to back it up."

"This stuff doesn't taste bad, it's convenient and cheap. In the future, I'm afraid there will be fewer and fewer places selling pre-prepared meals in Songyang City."

Zhao Tianxing sighed, "Doesn't that mean a lot of pre-prepared food factories will go out of business? And a lot of people will lose their jobs again."

The group talked as they ate, and Zhang Yu noticed that Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing seemed to have something on their minds, so he asked.

Qian Shen sighed and told them about how he, Zhao Tianxing, and three other first-year students had been recruited into the competition team.

Qian Shen said with a look of shame, "Sigh, we got into the sports competition team first even though our scores are lower than yours. I feel unworthy."

Zhao Tianxing also looked nervously at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

Among classmates, getting into the competition team or not was another layer of the campus hierarchy, enough to turn the closest of friends against each other.

And if a lower-scoring student snatched a spot from a higher-scoring one, that was the grudge of obstructing one's academic path, enough to trigger a vicious campaign of school bullying that could very well end with one party jumping off a building.

Ever since PE class, Zhao Tianxing had been worried that Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen would hold it against them.

Especially as someone who genuinely cared about what others thought, Zhao Tianxing was very worried that people might mistakenly think he had used some despicable means to steal the competition spot.

But listening to the two of them, Zhang Yu simply smiled, "It's fine. We already know about this. It's just that bunch of rats from the Student Council pulling strings."

He then told them about the competition in one month's time.

Zhang Yu continued, "From here on, let's just focus on our own cultivation. In a month, we'll compare our PE scores and see who gets to go to the competition."

Hearing these words, and knowing that in the end, it would still come down to scores, both Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing felt a great sense of relief.

The two thought to themselves, _As expected, we high school students should let our scores do the talking._

…

After finishing dinner, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen left the school together, preparing to take the subway to White Dragon High School.

On the way, Bai Zhenzhen said, "I've settled it with Song Hailong. We go twice a week, two hours a day. For each two-hour visit, you get 5,000, and I get 2,000."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu's spirits lifted, "5,000 a session, twice a week is 10,000. Isn't that 40,000 a month? Damn it, these rich people are so damn rich."

Bai Zhenzhen added, "But he also made a condition. If on any given day of our combat training with him, we can't win a single match in two hours, then he won't need us anymore."

After saying that, Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu and said, "Yu-boy, are you up for it?"

Although Zhang Yu had defeated Song Hailong in the martial arts competition, that had relied on the out-of-bounds rule.

And if his physical strength couldn't keep up with Song Hailong's, or if the gap between them widened even further, it would be even harder to win.

"Of course I'm up for it," Zhang Yu said. "Little Song just relies on his thick skin and brute strength. Once my physical strength starts to catch up to his, he won't be able to win a single match."

"But what about you, Zhen? Are you up for it?"

Bai Zhenzhen snorted and patted her lower abdomen, "I asked my godmother to lend me a sum of money so I can rent a spiritual root to cultivate with every day. My rate of progress from now on... might just shock you, Yu-boy."

Speaking of renting a spiritual root, Zhang Yu felt a surge of curiosity, "What kind of spiritual root did you rent exactly? When are you going to let me play with it?"

Bai Zhenzhen subconsciously touched her stomach, "Let you play with it?"

Zhang Yu said as if it were the most natural thing in the world, "We're brothers in arms. Can't you let me play with the spiritual root you rented?"

Bai Zhenzhen frowned and said, "Let me think about it."

She thought to herself, _Can I lend my spiritual root to Yu-boy? Can I? It seems… it's not entirely impossible…_

Zhang Yu said from the side, "So stingy. I even let you play with my Talisman Tome, which is worth 100,000, several times."

Bai Zhenzhen said, annoyed, "You have the nerve to bring that up? You only let me touch it each time, you barely let me tap it."

Zhang Yu said helplessly, "I'm afraid you'll accidentally bankrupt me by tapping it. Fine, you can play with it on the way there today."

The two got on the subway, luckily managing to grab two seats this time.

Zhang Yu, still under the urging of the ritual, began to cultivate his heart art, racing against time to improve his Dao heart.

Bai Zhenzhen leaned against his back and curiously began to explore the Talisman Tome.

Half an hour later, the two arrived at White Dragon High School, showed the monthly passes Song Hailong had arranged for them, and headed to the designated training room.

"Yu-boy, look, so many of them are kneeling in class. What are they doing?"

"Who knows? Maybe it's a White Dragon custom."

Opening the door to the designated training room, they saw Song Hailong was already inside doing warm-up exercises.

Upon seeing Zhang Yu arrive, Song Hailong's eyes lit up, and he pointed at the floor, saying, "Lie down."

---

(Chapter End)

# Chapter 83: Part-time Job, Moments

"Lie down."

Hearing Song Hailong's words, Zhang Yu turned to look at Bai Zhenzhen beside him.

"Lie down? Does my job description cover that much? Is this five thousand yuan really that hard to earn?"

Song Hailong cracked his neck and said, "I mean let's hurry up. We'll start with ground combat in a bit. That's where I lost, so of course I'm spending money to win back my pride there."

With that, Song Hailong walked over to a switch on a nearby wall and asked, "What scent do you like?"

Zhang Yu looked at the switch on the wall, assuming it was for the air conditioner, and asked in confusion, "You mean the AC scent? An air freshener?"

Song Hailong was speechless. "I'm talking about the intellect-enhancement agent scent, of course. I'm more used to peach or mint..."

Seeing the blank look on Zhang Yu's face, Song Hailong remembered the other boy was from Songyang High School and said casually, "Never mind, let's go with mint."

As he pressed the switch a few times, Zhang Yu gradually began to smell a minty aroma wafting through the air, while his blood slowly started to race and his mind grew excited.

Song Hailong then pointed to a faucet nearby and said, "The pipe on the right is all energy drinks. If you run low on stamina later, just drink from it directly."

Zhang Yu was already at a loss for words, thinking to himself, _Stimulants in the AC and Red Bull in the water, is that it? Damn... they're too rich._

Seeing Zhang Yu's astonished expression, Song Hailong said with a hint of pride, "You don't need to be so surprised. After all, White Dragon High is known to many outsiders as a place flowing with potions and needles; you can even detect traces of Dao heart buffer in the shower water."

"A few years ago, a group of poor people even snuck into the sewers over here, trying to steal the water our school discharged to drink it, hehe... a bunch of people who failed to get into a high school Immortal Dao program, thinking they could achieve immortality by drinking a little of our wastewater."

"Some people's bodies did improve, but others couldn't handle the potency and died on the spot, which was discovered after the fact."

Zhang Yu felt increasingly speechless.

_Mortals stealing immortal elixirs, is that the deal?_ But he couldn't help asking, "This stolen water was?"

Song Hailong smiled. "Just wastewater from the restrooms, bathhouses, and the like. It often has some residual potion components, which those lawless paupers stole for their own use."

Zhang Yu said, "It's a good thing they were caught. There won't be any more victims in the future, right?"

Song Hailong nodded, smiling faintly. "Yes, the school later decided to sell the gutter water to those poor people themselves. The sewers have never been burgled since."

_Damn it... so in the eyes of White Dragon High, the only victim was White Dragon High itself, huh?_ Zhang Yu was speechless for a moment, then simply started his warm-up.

A short while later, seeing that Zhang Yu had finished warming up, Song Hailong added a few more rules for the training.

As he began to speak on the topic of training, the smile on his face vanished instantly, replaced by a serious expression.

"No need for lethal force in training. As long as you can control me, I lose. If the fight continues until your strength wanes and you're no longer at your peak, and I still haven't controlled you, that also counts as my loss."

"If I can control you, then I win."

"If you fail to win against me even once within these two hours, then this tutoring session is over, and you don't need to come back in the future."

Zhang Yu understood. Little Song wanted to defeat him at his peak in a head-on confrontation.

Next, Song Hailong said to Bai Zhenzhen, "As for you, Bai Zhenzhen, it's as you said: either you fight me, or you stand aside and offer me guidance."

"But if you can't beat me, or if I find your advice useless, then you don't need to come back in the future either."

Then Zhang Yu walked over, and in the blink of an eye, he and Song Hailong were once again locked in ground combat.

Their hands collided and grappled, constantly using the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand to counter and exchange moves, each trying to lock the other's body.

By now, Zhang Yu had already advanced his Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand to level 10.

Even though he didn't reveal it, still maintaining the appearance of a level 2, his understanding of this martial art, of grappling and wrestling, was far beyond anything Song Hailong could compare to.

In particular, Zhang Yu had also tried to integrate the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand into the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi of the Limitless Cloud Hand, using the astral qi to assist in completing various grappling and wrestling techniques.

Song Hailong felt as if his every move had been completely seen through by Zhang Yu. That white astral qi could not only deflect his power but could even execute techniques similar to the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand.

And so... almost as soon as the fight began, Song Hailong was already at a disadvantage, able to rely only on his brute strength and physique to forcibly break his opponent's techniques.

This left Song Hailong utterly astonished.

_This Zhang Yu... his technique is much stronger than yesterday._

_How could he have improved so much in just one day?_

A flash of insight suddenly struck Song Hailong.

_This kid, he must have practiced the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand like crazy after he went back, all for the sake of beating me again right now._

Why would he think that?

Because ever since the match ended yesterday, Song Hailong himself had been finding people to train his Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand relentlessly.

He even had his meals for the day injected directly into his stomach and veins to absorb them, all for the sake of making valiant progress and closing the technical gap with Zhang Yu as quickly as possible.

At this moment, sensing Zhang Yu's improvement, Song Hailong thought to himself, _He thought the same way I did? As expected of the man who barely defeated me._

At this thought, a competitive expression appeared on Song Hailong's face. The vital energy in his body surged, and a torrent of mana endlessly reinforced his physical form, allowing him to continuously erupt with ferocious power as he gritted his teeth and resisted Zhang Yu's assault.

He felt as if he had been plunged into a stormy ocean. Zhang Yu's hands were like a series of undercurrents, and the astral qi was like wave after wave, constantly dragging him down into the depths.

As for Zhang Yu's side... he felt like he was trying to bind a furious dragon. Even when he managed to restrain it with chains time and again, his opponent would always manage to break them with sheer, savage force.

And Song Hailong's technique? To Zhang Yu, it was...

_Was there any improvement? Perhaps it's just too minor compared to mine for me to notice._

Meanwhile, Bai Zhenzhen stood to the side watching the two fight, sighing in her heart. 

_Of these two, one has an absolute physical advantage, and the other has an absolute technical advantage._

_Song Hailong's moves are often countered by Zhang Yu's technique._

_And Zhang Yu's moves are often broken by Song Hailong's superior strength._

She couldn't help but frown.

_There's no martial arts tournament ring or out-of-bounds rule today. Yu-boy can't win with a clever trick._

_I'm afraid this will go on until Yu-boy runs out of stamina._

Just as Bai Zhenzhen had thought, about three minutes later, Song Hailong suddenly stopped. "Your strength has weakened; you're no longer at your peak. I lose this round. Take a rest and prepare for the next one."

While the two rested, Bai Zhenzhen began to analyze their fight, pointing out their respective flaws.

At first, Song Hailong was somewhat dismissive, but he soon began to listen intently, his gaze toward Bai Zhenzhen changing slightly.

_This woman's insight is truly sharp. I originally thought she was just a freebie, but now it seems inviting her wasn't a waste after all._

During the break, Zhang Yu curiously turned on the faucet to his side and took a few sips of the energy drink. He instantly felt a fire ignite in his stomach as his stamina rapidly recovered.

"It works this well?"

Zhang Yu had already made up his mind: the next time he came to White Dragon High, he would definitely bring a basin to fill up.

They continued to fight and rest intermittently. Zhang Yu and Song Hailong grappled repeatedly, but almost every encounter ended with Zhang Yu's stamina giving out. Only once did Zhang Yu win by controlling Song Hailong's joints.

Zhang Yu rubbed his sore hands, thinking, _Although he says he lost, if this were a real fight to the finish, the one losing would be me after my stamina declined, wouldn't it?_

_This Song Hailong is just too tough. Without the out-of-bounds rule of the ring, it's very difficult for me to defeat him before my stamina drops._

_I really do need to increase my physical strength._

At that moment, Zhang Yu felt an even greater urgency to make his physique stronger.

Before leaving White Dragon High, Song Hailong transferred the payment to the two of them, then looked at Zhang Yu and reminded him, "I won't stop improving my physical strength just for the sake of our training."

"In two months, when the sports competition officially begins, my physical strength will be at least level 4.0 or higher."

"So... I hope you can work hard to keep up. Otherwise, if the gap in our physical strength becomes too large, the training will be meaningless."

The moment they stepped out of White Dragon High's gates, Bai Zhenzhen grabbed Zhang Yu and they started running towards the subway station.

Zhang Yu asked in confusion, "Zhen, what's the rush?"

Bai Zhenzhen said, "I drank too much of that energy drink, I need to use the restroom!"

"That trash White Dragon High, they charge ten yuan to use the restroom, making me hold it until now."

...

While Zhang Yu and Song Hailong were wrestling.

In a quiet room at Purple Cloud High School.

Le Mulan slowly dispersed the Purple Saint Heart Art that had been circulating in her mind, doing her best to halt the thought that 'the rich are holy, wise, good, and strong, while the poor are filthy, foolish, evil, and weak'.

Under the effect of the Purple Saint Heart Art, she normally only had to look at her bank balance or the profits on her stocks. The larger the numbers, the smoother the heart art would circulate, the greater the benefit to her Dao heart, and the calmer and more stable her spirit would become.

But in contrast... this also caused her aversion and disgust towards poverty, and even the poor, to grow ever stronger.

However, the former Le Mulan didn't think there was any problem with this. Whether it was poverty or poor people, money could shield her from them.

Until she encountered Zhang Yu in the ring.

Thinking of this, she took a deep breath and opened Zhang Yu's social media feed.

Le Mulan encouraged herself internally, _A poor person's social media feed, here I come._

The first thing that met her eyes was a selfie of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen standing at the gate of White Dragon High School.

The accompanying text read: Back at White Dragon High again. Song Hailong, the number one first-year, invited us for instructional guidance. If any other friends would like some guidance, feel free to get in touch.

"Song Hailong actually paid the poor Zhang Yu for guidance?"

Seeing this, Le Mulan's eyes lit up slightly.

_He didn't want the 400,000, but he's willing to be paid for lessons?_

---

# Chapter 84: Transplant

"In that case, could I also pay some money to have this poor person let me get close to him... to touch him?"

But just the thought of touching him made Le Mulan recall the scenes from the ring, and a wave of revulsion washed over her. The dormant heart art seemed to stir on its own, wanting to activate again to save her from this torment.

If the former Le Mulan could still talk to Zhang Yu normally despite her inner disgust, then ever since the events in the ring, she felt a strong, physiological aversion to any contact with him.

"No, I must change my way of thinking, overcome this weakness."

"How can a rich person be afraid of a poor person?"

With this thought, Le Mulan steeled her resolve and once again suppressed the heart art.

"But I can't start too intensely; it has to be gradual."

"Maybe I can observe their training? No... watching from a close distance is still a bit nauseating. It needs to be even more gradual."

"Or perhaps I should give up on human contact for now and try buying some of Zhang Yu's clothes?

The clothes, covered in his dead skin flakes, oils, scent, sweat, and other filth—the mere thought was too foul for Le Mulan.

"No, that's still disgusting. It needs to be even more gradual."

After mulling it over, Le Mulan decided to download the photos from Zhang Yu's social media feed and start by simply looking at a poor person's picture every day.

"Once looking at his photo doesn't sicken me, maybe I can level up and try making contact with his clothes."

...

On the way back, after receiving the 5,000 yuan, Zhang Yu first bought a new weighted suit, as his original one had been damaged during the martial arts competition.

His savings decreased by 2,000, leaving him with just under 13,000.

After receiving the weighted suit at home, Zhang Yu quickly changed into it and returned to the abandoned building to cultivate.

Late that night, as the 24-hour cooldown period ended, he was finally able to switch the Feathered Tome's specialty to the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

This Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi had only one move, but this single move required the coordination of every muscle and tendon in the body, with every muscle fiber and major tendon stretching or contracting in unison, demanding an extremely high level of physical control from the cultivator.

But for Zhang Yu...

"Difficult?"

"The more difficult, the better. Otherwise, how could it highlight the difference in talent between me and others?"

Zhang Yu stood his ground, his feet shoulder-width apart, arms hanging naturally at his sides. Then, following the instructions in the digital manual, he began to move all the muscles and tendons in his body.

However, on his first attempt, it was impossible for him to achieve this. He felt a scattered mess throughout his body, either missing the muscles in his legs or the tendons in his arms.

Had it been the original Zhang Yu, self-studying this Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi would have likely required training and subduing the muscles of each body part one by one, finally completing the overall integration training, a process that could easily take several months.

But the current Zhang Yu only needed to practice it roughly once before he felt a jolt run through his entire body, as a flood of memories and experiences on how to control every muscle and tendon poured into his mind.

Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, mastered!

At that moment, he felt his control over his body's muscles and tendons reach an unprecedented level.

Inside the abandoned building, as Zhang Yu exerted force again, a loud thud seemed to echo from within his body; it was the sound of all his muscles and tendons stretching in unison.

In that instant, Zhang Yu's entire frame seemed to shoot up by several inches, as if a ball had been inflated with a puff of air, and that air was the force generated by his muscles and tendons.

"Too easy. Again."

Delighted, Zhang Yu exerted force once more. With each contraction of his muscles and tendons, the vital energy in his body grew hotter, and steam began to rise from his body in the cold night.

He knew this was the effect of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi: using the muscles of the entire body to drive the vital energy, and the vital energy to drive the bone marrow, ultimately strengthening the muscles and bones, and increasing physical strength and explosive power.

In a flash, after 10 consecutive exertions, he had raised the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi to level 2.

But Zhang Yu also felt a wave of exhaustion wash over him, as if he had just fought another great battle with Song Hailong.

"Body tempering cultivation techniques are indeed more troublesome to practice than combat techniques."

"Each practice of this body tempering Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi is like a full-power explosion from every bit of flesh and blood in my body. The stamina consumption is immense."

Zhang Yu had no choice but to sit down, focusing on cultivating his heart art to enhance his Dao heart while recovering his stamina as quickly as possible.

More than half an hour later, feeling his strength return, he stood up and once again began to practice the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

In the blink of an eye, a night passed. Although he had to rest for a period after every dozen or so repetitions, Zhang Yu still managed to intermittently raise his Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi to level 6 (43/60).

At this moment, Zhang Yu's body trembled, and the vital energy within him surged, creating a sound like crashing waves.

Zhang Yu let out a long breath, feeling a wave of weakness throughout his body.

"I'm dead tired."

"And starving!"

...

Songyang High School.

The cafeteria.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were wolfing down synthetic food.

As for their former disdain, all they could say now was how delicious it was.

After all, the current synthetic food was not as unpalatable as it used to be, and it was cheap, convenient, and nutritious. For Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, who were now focused on body tempering, it was simply too suitable.

But compared to the heartily eating Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing, who were sitting opposite them, looked gloomy, and even their food didn't taste good.

This was because they had attended the remedial class for the sports competition team after school yesterday, and after signing various confidentiality agreements, they finally learned what the special training program was all about.

At this moment, whenever Zhao Tianxing recalled what he had learned yesterday, he felt a sense of suffocation.

The so-called special training program involved senior students providing muscle fibers, which were then transplanted into junior students using Songyang High School's advanced Immortal Dao technology, fusing with their original muscle fibers.

With the support of this Immortal Dao technology, not only could physical strength be immediately enhanced after fusion, but the fused muscles could also continue to be trained, constantly increasing physical strength.

In other words... muscle fibers from second-year students would be transplanted into Zhao Tianxing and the others, fusing with their original muscle fibers, allowing them to gradually possess a portion of the powerful physique that the second-year seniors had spent an extra year cultivating.

To put it another way... first-years could buy the flesh of poor second-years, and second-years could buy the flesh of poor third-years.

This was the special training program, a plan that Zhao Tianxing found incomparably cruel and brutal.

He felt even more horrified when he saw the price list yesterday.

The names of second-year students, accompanied by the values and prices of different body parts like the trapezius, deltoids, supraspinatus, biceps, were all listed line by line, looking just like a menu at some restaurant.

Zhao Tianxing even saw Shuang Youpeng, the former first-in-grade, on the list.

All of this made Zhao Tianxing feel as if his mental state was on the verge of collapse.

He still remembered his and Qian Shen's conversation with Lan Ling.

Lan Ling, the top athlete in the second year, was also a member of the sports competition team and one of the executors of the special training program.

In comparison, Wang Hai was only responsible for the daily training of the competition team and had no say in the special training program, only holding the title of ace sports teacher thanks to the team's results.

...

Zhao Tianxing: "If we buy their flesh, what happens to them?"

Lan Ling said nonchalantly, "Don't worry, we'll leave them the root. They can eat, exercise, and it will grow back."

Zhao Tianxing's breathing quickened. "Just grow flesh, cut flesh, grow flesh, cut flesh... isn't that just like cattle and sheep?"

Lan Ling smiled. "Humans are still much more expensive than cattle and sheep. They make a good profit at this price."

"This isn't a matter of price." Qian Shen, who was beside him, couldn't help but say, "Buying flesh directly like this, isn't it just buying physical strength? It's equivalent to buying sports points with money, isn't it?"

Lan Ling, however, said as if it were the most natural thing in the world, "Yes, you could indeed say it's buying points with money."

Qian Shen questioned, "How can you buy points with money?"

Lan Ling said flatly, "Of course you can buy points with money."

"Otherwise, where do you think your cultivation came from? The enhancers you've been injected with, the cultivation techniques you've practiced, the knowledge you've learned... where did it all come from?"

"It was bought with money."

"And why do you think you are standing here, and not Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, who have better grades than you?"

"It's only because you are richer than them, because your parents could afford the sponsorship fee."

"Money can indeed get you better grades. It can buy you points."

"Sponsorship fee?" Zhao Tianxing was slightly taken aback. Thinking about his parents' recent talk of selling their house, he instantly understood something.

But Qian Shen still looked as if he couldn't accept it.

He Dayou, who was standing nearby, tried to persuade him, "Come on, Qian Shen, this is just how the world works. Money is the most important thing. If you're afraid of others knowing you bought flesh, you can rest assured. Everyone has signed a confidentiality agreement in the presence of a righteous god; no one will talk."

As the Son of the School Director, who had long been aware of this, He Dayou smiled and said to Lan Ling, "Senior, I've made my choices. After signing the contract, can the transplant surgery begin today?"

To officially begin the special training program and start the muscle transplantation, a contract naturally had to be signed first, which of course included the school and the Student Council's right to decide the signatory's future university and major choices.

He Dayou was, of course, not worried about this.

As the Son of the School Director, he had no restrictions on his choice of university and major.

However...

He subconsciously glanced at Zhao Tianxing next to him, knowing that if the other party wanted to join the competition team and accept the special training program, his university choices would definitely be restricted.

This was simply because his family was not wealthy enough; they had only just barely managed to pay the sponsorship fee.

He Dayou thought to himself, _A minor household, still a long way from the truly wealthy circle of Songyang City._

Hearing He Dayou's question, Lan Ling nodded and said, "From now on, a small part of the transplant will be performed every day. You will feel your physical strength increasing dramatically at all times."

(End of chapter)

---

# Chapter 85: Competing, Advertisement

Inside the cafeteria.

Zhang Yu looked at Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing with confusion, wondering why the two of them looked like they had failed an exam.

"What's wrong with you two?"

Upon hearing Zhang Yu's curious inquiry, neither Qian Shen nor Zhao Tianxing could answer, because they had both signed confidentiality agreements and could not reveal any information about the special training program.

Zhao Tianxing shook his head with a bitter smile and said, "It's nothing, just... the pressure from the competition team is a bit high."

At the same time, a trace of pity flickered in his eyes as he looked at Zhang Yu.

Zhao Tianxing thought to himself, _He Dayou and the others already started their transplant surgeries yesterday. Their physical strength is going to skyrocket, isn't it?_

_Yu-boy and Zhen are talented, but they can't possibly beat the school's Immortal Dao technology._

_So on the path of the Immortal Dao... money really is the most important thing, isn't it?_

...

During physical education class that day.

He Dayou, physical strength level 1.56.

Li Xianglu, physical strength level 1.55.

Wang Wenjie, physical strength level 1.53.

Overnight, after undergoing transplant surgery, the three of them had each made considerable improvements.

Watching the three of them effortlessly handle various equipment, and looking at their physical strength test data, the surrounding students couldn't help but show envy in their eyes.

"The sports competition is truly our Songyang's ace program. He Dayou and the others are improving so fast."

"They've only been there for a day and they're already this strong? Teacher Wang Hai really knows his stuff."

But He Dayou wasn't interested in what these students were saying or seeing. He turned his head to look for Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, only to find that they didn't seem to have come to PE class at all. Even the small room nearby was empty of Zhang Yu's presence.

"Hmph, no matter. There will be plenty of opportunities in the future." He Dayou could already see himself in the coming month, his physical strength skyrocketing daily, eventually trampling both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen under his feet.

"From now on, I will improve faster and faster, until my physical strength approaches the level of a second-year."

"My score will ultimately surpass yours."

...

Where had Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen gone?

Both of them had applied to Wang Hai to be excused from PE class.

Zhang Yu's thought was: _My Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi is improving at a flying pace. It's better to hide and practice on my own, to avoid any traces being seen._

Bai Zhenzhen, on the other hand, thought to herself: _My spiritual root has too many functions. Since I already have the cover of renting out my spiritual root and don't need to worry about attracting attention, I might as well practice alone to avoid any abnormalities being noticed in a crowd._

And so, on the school's rooftop.

Zhang Yu looked at Bai Zhenzhen before him and smiled.

"Zhen, what a coincidence. You're skipping PE class too?"

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu before her and also smiled.

"Yu-boy, what a coincidence. You came to the rooftop to practice too?"

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Zhen must have her cheat active. That's why she doesn't want to be seen and has come to the rooftop to practice alone._

Bai Zhenzhen thought to herself, _Yu-boy must have his cheat active. He wants to train in secret, hide his strength, and then pull off a big reveal in a month. That's why he's on the rooftop._

Zhang Yu smiled. "Then let's practice together on the rooftop."

Bai Zhenzhen also smiled. "Yes, let's practice together."

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _I can still trust Zhen. This time, I'll let her witness my talent and make her completely submit._

Bai Zhenzhen thought to herself, _There are no secrets between a mother and son, especially not cheats. After holding back for over a decade, I can finally show someone my astonishing potential. Hahahaha, I can already see the look of envy, jealousy, and hatred on Yu-boy's face._

And so, the two of them exchanged a smile, each walked to a spot, stood firm, and began to cultivate separately.

Thus, on the rooftop, Zhang Yu began to train diligently in the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

He stood his ground, and as his body vibrated time and again, it gradually emitted a rumbling sound, like waves repeatedly crashing against a reef.

Bai Zhenzhen turned her head and looked at Zhang Yu, whose face and hands were gradually turning red from the surging vital energy, and felt a jolt of shock.

Then, she thought with a face full of jealousy, _Could that be that... Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi? Yu-boy has already mastered it? He's started using this technique for body tempering?_

Suddenly, the spiritual root in her stomach didn't seem so impressive anymore.

She felt her current mood was like being woken up in the middle of the night by a classmate's breathing exercise.

Or seeing a classmate in the morning with the packaging of a potion they had secretly consumed.

Or seeing a few more needle marks on a classmate's arm than usual during PE class.

Bai Zhenzhen quickly released the restraints on her spiritual root, preparing to begin her body tempering.

"A child showing off is nothing compared to a couple showing off together!"

"I'll keep surpassing him! My physical strength next month must continue to be above Yu-boy's!"

With that, she released the restraints on the spiritual root in her body and began body tempering.

After practicing for a dozen or so repetitions, Zhang Yu felt his body grow weak. He intended to sit down and rest for a while, taking out the energy drink he had prepared for a few sips.

"As expected of the energy drink I got from White Dragon High. Free stuff just tastes better."

Just then, sensing an anomaly in the ambient spiritual energy, he turned his head in Bai Zhenzhen's direction.

He saw that Bai Zhenzhen was also cultivating a body tempering technique. Zhang Yu couldn't tell what technique it was, but he could faintly feel wisps of spiritual energy flowing into Bai Zhenzhen's body, seemingly nourishing her flesh and blood.

"That must be the effect of her spiritual root, right? Something like the Muscle-Growth Spiritual Root that can strengthen the body?"

Zhang Yu thought with a face full of jealousy, _Having a spiritual root is so great. I'll definitely have to borrow it from Zhen to play with in the future._

Then Zhang Yu noticed another anomaly.

With his experience of having multiple martial arts at level 10, he could spot subtle differences in others' techniques.

And now, looking at Bai Zhenzhen, Zhang Yu could feel that her body tempering technique was clearly being adjusted with each repetition, making it feel more comfortable and smoother, as if Bai Zhenzhen was naturally... constantly adapting to this set of body tempering techniques.

"Could it be that when Zhen practices martial arts, she makes adjustments and improvements with every repetition?"

It sounded ordinary, but upon deeper thought, Zhang Yu felt how formidable it was.

Zhang Yu was shocked. _Isn't this the same as my Feathered Tome, where techniques can also advance quickly?_

_She wasn't this formidable when she practiced before._

_She's definitely been secretly using her cheat!_

The thought of her secretly using her cheat and working hard where he couldn't see motivated Zhang Yu. After a short rest, he got up and continued to push himself to cultivate the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

And so, for the rest of the time, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen diligently tempered their bodies, primarily for the sake of keeping each other company.

When the bell for the end of class rang, Zhang Yu had already raised his Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi to level 7 (15/70). He felt that as his muscles moved, his internal organs were also engaged, being tempered with each repetition of his cultivation and emitting strange sounds of their movement.

On the other side, Bai Zhenzhen was steaming from head to toe, sweat constantly dripping down her flushed cheeks. She felt the muscles all over her body growing and strengthening under the catalysis of her spiritual root.

As the bell rang, the two looked at each other and smiled.

Zhang Yu smiled. "Amazing, Zhen."

Bai Zhenzhen also smiled faintly. "You're not bad either, Yu-boy."

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _I'm not showering when I get home tonight, just going straight to training! I have to get Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi to level 10._

Bai Zhenzhen secretly vowed, _I'm not even going to take a shit when I get home! I'm gonna work this body! All the way till dawn!_

And so, for the next few days, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen seized every moment, moving between one deserted corner of the campus and another, leaving behind pools of diligent sweat as they madly pushed their bodies to their limits.

During PE class, He Dayou felt excited about his daily increase in physical strength, yet was repeatedly disappointed at not seeing Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

But he endured it all.

He constantly reminded himself, _Isn't this the result I anticipated long ago?_

_Talented poor people are only impressive at the beginning; in the end, they will lose to the rich._

_After completing the transplant, as the newly integrated muscles continue to fuse with my body, my physical strength is now growing rapidly every day._

_The later Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen come to witness my strength, the more despairing the gap they will feel._

With a hint of anticipation, He Dayou continued to train seriously in PE class.

And in the same PE class, not far away, Zhao Tianxing secretly glanced at He Dayou, his gaze always carrying a hint of envy and hesitation.

"Qian Shen has already quit, saying he won't participate in the competition team. Lan Ling has chosen another student to join."

"But... should I quit too?"

"I don't like this way of improving my score, but He Dayou and the others' physical strength is increasing really fast. At this rate... I'll never be able to catch up to them."

But the thought of his parents planning to sell their house for him to get into the competition team and improve his score made Zhao Tianxing hesitate again.

...

In a small grove before school let out for the day.

Zhang Yu sat cross-legged, but his whole body was constantly emitting white steam in the cold wind. He was cultivating the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, which he had already pushed to level 10.

At this moment, his muscles, internal organs, and bone marrow were all engaged in unison, being tempered with each exertion of force.

In addition to this, there was the effect of reaching level 10 in the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

Zhang Yu's physical structure had become more rational and complete. Every muscle in his body fit together perfectly, like intricately constructed parts assembled flawlessly.

This post-level-10 adjustment to his body structure also caused his physical strength to skyrocket on the spot. Coupled with the past few days of arduous training, his physical strength had increased to level 1.67.

Besides that, his digestive ability and metabolic rate had also increased.

Zhang Yu felt that he was hungry all the time now, a feeling of hunger that came from every piece of flesh in his body.

"My daily food expenses have already risen to over 600. This body tempering is really expensive."

But even so, Zhang Yu could feel that his body was still not satisfied.

"I probably need to start taking boosters, right?"

The Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi could be cultivated in conjunction with boosters, but the recommended booster was called the Primordial Pill. Zhang Yu looked it up online; it cost 30,000 per pill.

"Damn it... this Purple Cloud Pharmaceutical Company is robbing people!"

With the sharp increase in food expenses and the need for boosters, Zhang Yu felt an ever-growing shortage of money.

Although he had given Song Hailong another lesson yesterday and received another 5,000 yuan, Zhang Yu still felt that the balance of less than 16,000 in his account was not enough.

Fortunately, another money-making opportunity had arrived today.

As the dismissal bell rang, Bai Zhenzhen finished her exercise and looked at Zhang Yu, saying, "Let's go, Yu-boy. Time to shoot the commercial."

(End of chapter)

# Chapter 86: The Photoshoot and a Lesson for He Dayou

Several days after the martial arts competition had ended, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen finally landed an advertisement—a group commercial featuring several of the contestants.

Walking down the road, Zhang Yu couldn't help but ask, "Did you hear what Song Hailong said yesterday? Why did he, the third-place winner, get a solo ad while we only got a group one?"

Bai Zhenzhen pursed her lips and said, "I asked around, and the general consensus is... it's been half a year since school started, and in another six months, we'll be second-years."

"No one's offering us solo ads because they're afraid our public image will collapse."

Hearing Bai Zhenzhen's answer, Zhang Yu was completely baffled. "Collapse? How could our image possibly collapse? Are they worried we'll mess around with our fans?"

Bai Zhenzhen shot Zhang Yu a sidelong glance, stating the obvious, "What nonsense are you talking about? Messing with fans is nothing. They're worried our grades will plummet once we become second-years. We're the poor kids, after all."

Zhang Yu understood instantly. For a top student in Kunxu, a collapsed image meant falling grades. It made perfect sense.

But then, anger flared within him. "Does being poor automatically mean our grades will collapse in our second year? We're already poor enough, and now it's even harder for us to make money than a rich kid like Song Hailong. He can get a solo ad, but we can't. Speaking of which, why did they ask us to be in the group ad then? Aren't they afraid our images will collapse?"

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu as if he were an idiot. "Are you stupid? In a group ad, if our images collapse, they can just edit us out."

A little over half an hour later, the two arrived at a photography studio and saw that many familiar faces from the three great high schools were already there.

But at that moment, all of them were, intentionally or not, glancing at a certain teenager who was surrounded by a dozen staff members.

Bai Zhenzhen asked, intrigued, "Who's that? He's got quite the entourage."

Zhang Yu was also curious. "Isn't this supposed to be a group ad for the top eight from the martial arts competition? I don't think he was one of them."

Lian Tianji popped up from behind them and said, "That's Yu Xinghan, True Monarch Xinghou's final disciple, whom he found in another city. He's probably transferring to White Dragon High School soon."

Looking at the boy who was the center of everyone's attention, surrounded by assistants, makeup artists, and directors, Bai Zhenzhen's gaze shifted.

"True Monarch Xinghou? You mean that washed-up Golden Core?"

Lian Tianji nodded at her words. "According to True Monarch Xinghou, this Yu Xinghan is to be his final disciple, inheriting his entire legacy and fortune. He's predicted to be Songyang City's future top scorer on the college entrance exams."

"It's because of his title as a Golden Core's disciple, along with such high praise, that the Immortal Resonance Group brought him in for this ad."

"Look at Song Hailong, hehe... his eyes are practically shooting sparks. After all, this Yu Xinghan is transferring to White Dragon High School and will inevitably compete with him for the top spot in their year."

Zhang Yu looked at Song Hailong, who resembled nothing more than a stressed-out calico cat, his back arched and fur on end as he stared daggers at Yu Xinghan.

A thought flickered in Zhang Yu's mind, and he suddenly said, "So this Yu Xinghan will have to participate in the upcoming competitions, right?"

Lian Tianji nodded. "Of course. In the next athletics competition, he'll likely be a strong contender for the championship."

As he looked toward Yu Xinghan, a flicker of challenge ignited in his own eyes.

While Lian Tianji was talking with Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, a pair of eyes was quietly watching the three of them.

The owner of that gaze was none other than Le Mulan from Purple Cloud High School.

Originally, Le Mulan had no interest in this kind of advertisement shoot, but she had come for two reasons. First, the Golden Core's disciple, Yu Xinghan, would be participating, and she was curious about him.

Second... was because of the only two poor students among the contestants, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

As she watched the two, Le Mulan thought to herself, _I've been looking at the photos he posts online every day, and I don't find them as disgusting as I used to. This is a good opportunity to take things a step further._

But the mere thought of approaching Zhang Yu brought back the image of him sitting on top of her, the dirty, hot, reeking blood splashing all over her body, and an involuntary shudder sent goosebumps across her skin.

_Forget it, I'll start with the easiest step first._

_Besides, I'll have to get close to them during the actual shoot anyway._

So Le Mulan silently observed the pair, her gaze continuously drifting in their direction.

...

The commercial they were filming involved the various contestants recommending the Immortal Resonance Group's tutoring agency.

During the shoot, people constantly found opportunities to approach Yu Xinghan to chat and add him as a friend, giving Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen a firsthand taste of how incredibly popular a true Golden Core's disciple was.

As for the central focus of the entire advertisement, that was completely occupied by Yu Xinghan, with the other contestants arranged around him like green leaves encircling a flower.

However, the top three from the martial arts competition—Zhang Yu, Le Mulan, and Song Hailong—were the leaves right beside the flower. Fourth place, Bai Zhenzhen, was like the stem beneath the leaves, and those ranked even lower, like Lian Tianji, were the dirt beneath the flower.

According to the director, the words "Final Disciple of a Golden Core True Monarch" would eventually fill the entire screen; he was the undisputed star.

During the shoot, Zhang Yu felt that Le Mulan, who was standing beside him, was acting strangely. One moment she would take a deep breath, the next she would be trembling slightly. He finally couldn't help but ask, "What are you doing?"

Seeing Zhang Yu turn his head, Le Mulan instinctively took a step back.

"You... I'm fine. Mind your own business."

Zhang Yu cursed her as a psycho in his head and decided to ignore her.

Le Mulan, however, was covering her nose, thinking, _He smells awful... is this what Mom called the 'subway smell' that poor people have?_

_It was definitely the right decision to come today. I can already feel myself slowly getting used to it._

After four hours, the commercial was finally finished. Zhang Yu took his 30,000 yuan and Bai Zhenzhen her 8,000, and they each went home.

But not long after he got home, Zhang Yu's newly acquired 30,000 yuan transformed into a Crimson Marrow Primordial Pill, which he swallowed in one gulp.

Feeling a violent medicinal power coursing through his entire body, Zhang Yu immediately seized the opportunity to begin cultivating the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

As the power of the pill spread through his limbs and organs, Zhang Yu felt every muscle, organ, and even bone in his body, like parched earth receiving sweet rain, begin to frantically absorb the medicinal energy as he circulated the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

A full half-hour passed before the medicinal power slowly dissipated within him.

But Zhang Yu knew it wasn't truly gone; it had been temporarily absorbed into his muscles, organs, and bones.

At that moment, although Zhang Yu didn't feel any increase in his physical strength, he felt vigorous and brimming with inexhaustible energy.

He knew that over the next few days, the medicinal power he had absorbed would continue to take effect, enhancing his cultivation of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi and further increasing his physical strength.

He eagerly continued to cultivate the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

As the entire night passed, with Zhang Yu frantically cultivating the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, he would train until he was completely exhausted, collapse, and the moment the ritual urged him on, he knew he could train again and would get back up to continue.

Under such extreme training, his physical strength level jumped from 1.67 to 1.70.

"What a good booster, a truly good booster. It's expensive for a reason."

...

For the next few days, Zhang Yu seized every second to cultivate the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, trying to increase his physical strength as much as possible before the medicinal power completely faded.

At times, Zhang Yu couldn't help but feel a sense of wonder. "Kunxu, you really turn people into monsters. I'm actually pushing myself this hard now. I haven't heard the ritual's nagging for three straight days."

And during this training process, Zhang Yu could feel his body growing stronger, bit by bit, every single moment.

_After all, fully utilizing a level 10 Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi is something that, by all rights, only a top third-year student should be capable of._

_But now I'm using it to enhance my level 1.7 physical strength. It's like a max-level character returning to the newbie village to level up. The progress is truly astounding._

In just three short days, as the medicinal power was depleted, his physical strength increased continuously, rising from level 1.70 to 1.87.

At this moment, Zhang Yu stood in the classroom, feeling the last of the medicinal power being completely wrung out of him. He sighed inwardly, his craving for money growing ever stronger.

_In Kunxu... you really can't get anywhere without money._

Just as he was thinking this, the voice of the combat instructor, Lei Jun, broke through his reverie.

"Zhang Yu, He Dayou, you two will spar."

Zhang Yu was slightly taken aback. In combat class, he was almost always paired with Bai Zhenzhen. Why was he with He Dayou this time?

A King-tier player versus a Stubborn Bronze? What was Old Lei thinking?

Lei Jun's intention was simple: he hoped Zhang Yu would teach He Dayou a lesson. He Dayou's performance in combat class recently had been far too arrogant.

_He just rampages around with his newly increased physical strength, completely disregarding the combat techniques I've taught._

And so, Lei Jun dispatched his top general, Zhang Yu, intending for him to show He Dayou the importance of combat techniques and martial skills.

He Dayou approached Zhang Yu with a dark expression, thinking, _After this period of implantation and adaptation training, my physical strength should be far superior to Zhang Yu's. But this kid's combat skills are too strong..._

While He Dayou was still scheming, he saw Zhang Yu strike out with his palm.

He subconsciously raised a hand to block, only to find that Zhang Yu had grabbed his hand and was challenging him to a contest of strength.

"What!" He Dayou was first shocked, then overjoyed. "You dare to compete in strength with the me of today?"

He Dayou's other hand shot out to grab his opponent, and their hands locked together. As their mana clashed, they each unleashed the power of their bodies.

With a furious roar, He Dayou intended to lift Zhang Yu up and hurl him out of the designated area.

But in the next moment, He Dayou felt as if his opponent's hands were carved from rock; under his full force, they didn't move an inch.

---

# Chapter 87: Negotiating with the Evil God

Facing He Dayou's burst of power, Zhang Yu smiled faintly, already clear on the situation.

He thought to himself, _The competition team really is impressive. They've improved so much in just these few days. He Dayou's physical strength is even a little bit higher than mine, but..._

Zhang Yu had chosen to compete in raw strength precisely because he wanted to test the results of his recent training.

At this very moment, as Zhang Yu's muscles tensed up all over, his body seemed to twist together like a single rope. Individual muscles pressed and leveraged against each other, ultimately transforming into a terrifying explosive force that was channeled from his entire body into his hands.

Under the enhancement of the level 10 Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, with Zhang Yu's control over his entire musculature, the instantaneous physical power he could unleash... far surpassed that of an opponent with a similar level of physical strength.

With a loud bang, He Dayou felt an irresistible force slam into his body, sending him flying through the air before he crashed onto the ground with a thud.

Again, the familiar disorienting shift in perspective, the hard and cold floor, the pain spreading through his entire body.

He Dayou dazedly pushed himself up.

This feeling was so familiar.

Had he been defeated in an instant again?

Just like his last fight with Zhang Yu, after his physical strength had greatly increased, he had lost again?

He snapped his head up, his widened eyes staring at Zhang Yu in disbelief as his mind still struggled to accept it.

_How can his strength possibly be so much greater than mine? Has his physical strength already surpassed my own?_

Not far away, Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing were also watching, their eyes filled with amazement as they saw He Dayou thrown to the ground.

Qian Shen said, "Has Zhang Yu improved even more than He Dayou?"

Zhao Tianxing thought, _How did he do it? Just how much has Zhang Yu increased his physical strength in such a short time? It's even more effective than the special development program?_

After school that day, He Dayou went to the sports competition team's training ground and told Lan Ling what had happened.

Lan Ling frowned. "His physical strength couldn't possibly be higher than yours."

"The reason he was able to defeat you is likely because his power-generation technique is superior to yours, while you..."

Lan Ling glanced at him, then casually lifted and shook He Dayou, who instantly felt as though he had lost all control over his own muscles.

Placing him back down, Lan Ling said coolly, "Your control over your own muscles, especially the transplanted ones, is too poor. You haven't been able to unleash your true strength at all."

"Continue with the upcoming surgeries and training. Once you have more muscle fibers transplanted and can utilize more of their power, you won't lose to Zhang Yu again."

...

At the same time, after school, Zhang Yu was walking toward his rented apartment, circulating the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi as he went.

But the moment he pushed open the door, he froze at the sight of the tattered rag doll sitting on his bed.

"Evil god?"

It was a raggedy, dilapidated doll. Its two button eyes looked like a pair of dark, empty sockets, and they were staring intently at Zhang Yu as he opened the door. It was none other than the evil god from whom he had made a wish.

As Zhang Yu stood there, momentarily stunned, the rag doll spoke.

"My good servant, kneel before me. This is my wish."

With the ritual's nagging cry echoing in his mind, Zhang Yu had no choice but to drop to one knee with a thud.

The doll on the bed cackled. "Unexpected, truly unexpected."

"In just two or three short months, a pawn I casually placed has actually managed to grow up."

"If I hadn't heard the news that a student from Songyang High School had won first place in the martial arts competition, I would never have imagined you would improve so quickly..."

As she said this, much of the gloom in her heart seemed to vanish.

She had come back to find Zhang Yu partly because of his performance, but also for another reason... she had discovered that she couldn't go back.

She thought of how she had once stood at the apex of all evil gods, having achieved both financial freedom and freedom in her cultivation. Yet, due to a failed investment after her retirement, she had been forced to re-enter the workforce and return to the front lines.

But she hadn't cared at first. If she couldn't stay at the peak, she would simply walk the path again!

With her years of expertise in the scamming industry, she had expected it to be the tale of a supreme evil god's stroll through the mortal world, a story of a max-level character coming to whip the workplace into shape.

Who could have known that the major sects' anti-fraud measures were improving day by day, causing even a treasure of the evil god world like herself to suffer heavy losses? Compounded by betrayal, she was now stranded on the first layer of Kunxu, her power at rock bottom, with no way to turn the tide.

_Dammit... if I'm caught and deported, it's all over... who betrayed me?_

_My power is draining so quickly, and my intelligence feels like it's dropping again. If this continues... I'm really going to become a mindless toy._

And so, at this very moment, she had found Zhang Yu again, intending to use this promising asset to rise once more.

_To win first place in the martial arts competition with the identity of a poor kid, I must have unlocked some incredible potential within him._

_Hehe... I thought it was a losing proposition, but it turns out I managed to buy a rising stock at its lowest point._

And when she thought about the wish Zhang Yu still owed her, the doll's heart swelled with even more excitement.

But in the next moment, she froze. Zhang Yu, who should have been kneeling on the ground after she made her wish... was slowly standing up?

"What are you doing?"

"Are you insane? Get on your knees, now! Or do you want to die from the ritual's backlash?"

Zhang Yu, however, was silently sensing the changes in the ritual's power within his body.

After she had made the wish for him to kneel, the chill from the ritual had indeed dissipated as he knelt.

But just a few seconds after he had knelt, that idiotic ritual had started nagging him again.

Zhang Yu was momentarily stunned, then he understood.

_Is it urging me to cultivate?_

_But the other wish is for me to kneel._

_Is this a conflict between wishes?_

Zhang Yu grew curious. _So... in this situation, which wish takes priority?_

He tried to stand up, and immediately, a voice from the ritual sounded, urging him to kneel down at once.

Zhang Yu could feel the ritual's power splitting into two currents. One was urging him to cultivate immediately, while the other was urging him to kneel at once.

_So it is a conflict._

And when he circulated the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi and entered a state of cultivation, all the nagging cries stopped.

_But in the end, cultivation took precedence over kneeling. Is it because... of the order the wishes were made?_

Seeing Zhang Yu stand up, the doll initially thought he had gone mad and no longer valued his life.
